name: Liliana E. Llamas
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: For over twelve years I have specialize in working with teens & adults struggling with anxiety, depression, burnout, trauma, loss, or life adjustments. I have empowered individuals to overcome a constant sense of uneasiness, overthinking, feeling disconnected, or having physical emotional pain that was affecting their ability to meet their goals. My clients describe me as warm, empathetic, and genuine. I’d love to help you experience peace and find a home there. Together, we will overcome blocks that are preventing you from living the life you want to be living. We will take time to prioritize your own well-being & needs. I use an integrative approach that helps you better understand the ties between thought patterns, past experiences, current stressors, & emotional pain. My strong advocacy for wellness is embraced by understanding how thoughts, beliefs, & emotions affect our overall health. Wellness consist of mind & body, which; alter our perception of the world & function. I want this page to help you decide if we’ll work well together, not just list the things I’ve done (though I will for those interested). I love working with clients with these struggles because I’ve been there. I get it on a level I couldn’t without living through it & know the empowering feeling from consistent effort in embracing life circumstances.

name: Peter Salerno
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about: I am a trauma specialist who utilizes evidence-based approaches to promote healing and self-empowerment. I use EMDR and attachment-guided methods to help “unlock” unresolved experiences that can keep people from living a life free from the pain of their past. Through this process, people find that they are better equipped to prevent the past from repeating itself.  I do not view people as sick, dysfunctional, or disordered; rather, I believe that when our desire to grow outweighs our fear of growth, we become empowered to reach our full potential and to live the life that we truly want to live. Oftentimes, this cannot be accomplished alone. Psychotherapy is an effective resource that can become a meaningful and liberating experience. I work with individuals of all ages, couples, and families. PLEASE LOOK CAREFULLY at my ENTIRE profile before contacting me regarding insurance coverage.
issues: ['Depression', 'Family Conflict', 'Life Transitions', 'Marital and Premarital', 'Relationship Issues', 'Sexual Abuse', 'Spirituality', 'Stress']

name: Sandy Garcia
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Dealing with life, the every day “stuff,” and emotions can be tough.  Don’t be so hard on yourself—healing is a process.  I see therapy as a joint venture where our knowledge and skills are combined to create solutions.  In my practice I bring kindness, humor, and authenticity with the purpose of creating a safe and nonjudgmental space for my clients to experience freedom. When it comes to treatment, no one size fits all.  Because all my clients come from diverse backgrounds with various presenting problems, every therapeutic alliance is unique. For this reason, I tailor therapy to fit your needs, meet your goals, all while utilizing your strengths at the same time. Everyone faces emotional challenges, but no one needs to go through it alone.  When it comes to finding the right therapist that is a good fit for you, my hope is that you pair with someone who makes your feel heard and understood. I would be more than happy to walk the healing journey alongside you. Looking forward to working with you!

name: Jessica Taverniti
title: Psychologist, PSY, BCBA-D, LBA
about: I am a  a Licensed Clinical Psychologist, Board Certified Behavior Analyst, and  Licensed Behavior Analyst. Clinically, I have been working in the field of Neurodiversity and TAY (Transitional Aged Youth Population), and young adults in a diversity of settings for many years. I am passionate about helping individuals and families work through life’s challenges, transition, and personal growth leading to maximizing potential personally and professionally.  I have extensive background working with those impacted by Autism Spectrum Disorder, ranging from infancy through adulthood. I have founded Spectrum Care Alliance, created to empower families and our ASD community. Sports Psychology is also an area of specialty focusing on achieving peak performance, building confidence and addressing sport injury recovery.  Additional areas of specialty include anxiety, depression, career transition, grief and loss, parenting, and relationship issues.  Within my practice I always emphasize meeting individuals based on their specific goals, overcoming barriers, and cultivating the power to heal, all while paving the way for an enriched and more satisfying life.

name: Denisha Forch
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Relationships can bring the greatest joys in our life but they can also be the area that causes us the most stress in our lives. Are you having any challenges communicating your needs, setting boundaries, or find yourself in relationship conflicts?  Are you interested in having healthy relationships and connections? Or maybe you are looking to find that special person in your life. Whatever it may be I am here to help you gain clarity and direction for your life, yourself, and your relationships. If you would like to make some changes and get the outcomes you are looking for I am accepting new telehealth/online therapy clients. I assist you in helping you gain freedom regarding relationship challenges in your life by developing healthy communication, setting boundaries, and managing relationships conflicts. I also assist in helping people you find out more about yourself and the areas that may keep you repeating certain patterns in your relationships that can be frustrating. Through my calm and understanding approach I truly believe sometimes life hits us out of nowhere and we find ourselves trying to cope but still having challenges. I want to help you reach the desired outcome and see the changes in your life you are looking to see.   Please feel free to reach out to me for video/Telehealth counseling!

name: Jenni Allen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Beginning therapy takes courage! When we are hurting, confused, and uncertain, it can be difficult to reach out for help. It's an honor and privledge to work with couples with the goal of helping them live life to the fullest. I look forward to hearing from you, to discover if we are a good fit for one another. Couple therapy is my passion and a majority of my training and experience has been geared towards helping couples navigate life's challenges. I utilize The Gottman Method and CBT in therapy and facilitate groups and seminars using the Prepare-Enrich program. I am a follower of Jesus Christ. I believe in integrating faith into treatment with those who are like minded. I believe it is critical to include our Creator in the process. With my professional, academic, and life experiences, I believe we can work together to get you on track.

name: April Alvarez
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: It is my goal as a therapist to provide my clients with the utmost support during their most trying times. I have worked with children and adults as well as families in crisis. Asking for help should not be seen as a weakness but as a strength; and being strong enough to identify that you need emotional support to better your quality of life is something to be proud of. I thoroughly enjoy building relationships with my clients while supporting them on their journey to become their best self. I started my career in this field after serving as a volunteer within the community providing emotional support to individuals who were nearing end of life. These individuals experienced a range of emotions and I found the work to be extremely profound and rewarding; therefore, pursued a Masters Level Education in Mental Health. I have experience working various populations and severity of illness and have over 8 years of experience in direct practice. I have previously worked in a Hospital setting ranging from the Emergency Department to NICU, ICU, Oncology, Postpartum, as well as outpatient Mental Health Crisis Clinic. Looking forward to working with you!
issues: ['Career Counseling', 'Grief', 'Life Transitions', 'Postpartum Anxiety and Depression', 'Pregnancy, Prenatal, Postpartum', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress']

name: Elite Physiology, Inc.
title: PhD, BCN, BCB
about: At Elite Physiology we like to help you on your journey of achieving your goals. This can be done in a variety of ways, but all stemming back to your own physiology. We use testing to see how your body responds, then cater your training based on your individual body and brain. This can be for peak performance in sports, music, or learning, to help to retrain your brain to stay on task, sleep better, and allow life to be easier.  When someone first comes in, we like to start with doing assessments to see where we are starting. This almost always includes what is called a qEEG, or a brain map. This is a 30-minute session that allows us to see how your brain is communicating with different parts and what is happening on the neural level. From here we can come up with your training.  Let us help you figure out the next step and start on the path to being your optimal self.

name: Jeanne L James
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: As an experienced therapist, my goal is to balance supportive connection with skilled intervention, helping clients create lives that are meaningful and worth living. I am curious, collaborative and compassionate , respecting your unique personality, cultural background and family context. We will create an individualized treatment plan that utilizes your strengths and clarifies your therapy goals. Therapy is a significant investment of time and financial resources, and I will work with you to be effective in targeting and addressing the concerns you bring to therapy.                                  I offer CBT, DBT, Internal Family Systems, and Emotion Focused therapy. My practice focus includes Postpartum Anxiety & Depression, premarital and conflicted couples, and treatment for emotion regulation and impulsive behaviors.  I enjoy working with people navigating life transitions , and integrate mindfulness and inner compassion into my therapy practice. Let's schedule a consultation so that you can share your goals for therapy and we can see if I am a good fit for your needs.  I'm looking forward to meeting you and supporting you on your journey towards increased well-being. Saturday Appointments are available!

name: Melissa McMullin
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Something isn't quite right lately!  Things feel off and it's time for a change.  Whether it's creatively rebooting, overcoming imposter syndrome, feeling more resilient, or navigating a new transition there's a way to change the patterns that aren't working anymore.  When stress hits or we feel stuck we tend to revisit coping that doesn't serve us well.  We may feel motivated to change, but lost as to the next steps.  I work collaboratively with clients who are curious about their struggles and eager to collaboratively problem solve.  We work together to uncover the patterns that aren't working anymore and explore solutions.   Therapy is a space to get your life back on the track you want.  We figure out what's working and what isn't.   Then work through ways to implement change and find balance to help you build resilience and make change.   I also provide assessment for attention, memory, and learning concerns that may be impacting your journey. Get answers, find balance and live your dreams.  Let me help you actualize the change you want.  Visit  my website at www.aspiretherapycenter.com or call me to set up  an appointment and realize your vision.

name: The Well Counseling Center
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, AMFT
about: Our goal is to help you get from where you are, to where you want be.  Asking for help takes courage. We strive to provide a supportive and accepting environment so you feel comfortable. We are here to serve children, teens, individuals, families and couples.  Whether you are trying to rebuild your life  or just cope with an everyday struggles in life, we are here to help. The Well Counseling Center is supporting our community and surrounding areas by providing hope during trying times. We offer professional therapy for children, teens, single adults, couples and families.

name: Nicole L Eckhardt
title: Counselor, LPCC, NCC
about: I enjoy working with people in all stages of life, especially older teens, young adults, and military, veterans, and military family members. I focus on the importance of self-care since it is essential to treating the whole person and managing depression, anxiety, stress, grief, relationships, work, and other common issues. I have experience with and believe in the benefits of integrating faith and counseling, but am also respectful that this is a personal choice. My passion is to help others find peace, healing, and self-acceptance. I also value the human-animal bond and have a therapy dog in training that interacts with clients. I have Military Culture and Military Families specialization. It is my desire to give back to those who serve or have served our country. I also have experience working with young adults from a variety of life experiences dealing with a variety of issues. I have a special place in my heart for those dealing with infertility or pursuing adoption.  I believe my own experiences and knowledge will be beneficial to build a healthy therapeutic relationship. Using an eclectic approach, I provide a safe space and empathetic presence where clients can share whatever is keeping them from living their best life. Together we explore what each client’s unique needs are so they can be the person they want to be.

name: Chiwami Greenberg
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about:
It is my goal to ease clients' pain and suffering, to see results in clients and to increase your level of happiness.  I have effective methods that will help you resolve your issues and lead a better life.
 
I am a caring professional who has excellent rapport with my clients.  Some of my past clients have commented that I am non-threatening and easy to talk with, reducing their concerns about therapy. I use a Cognitive Behavioral approach to therapy.  How you think affects your feelings and behaviors, and focusing on thought patterns will help you understand your issues more clearly.  You then learn to substitute reality-based and more functional thoughts to improve your feelings and behaviors. I do therapy in both Japanese and English and about 10% of my practice is cross cultural counseling.

name: Chloe Amelia Cox
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA
about: If you’ve landed on this page, you might be feeling overwhelmed.  You might be stuck in the vicious cycle of disordered eating.  Maybe you're a college student or recent grad feeling totally lost, maybe asking yourself the question, “Wait…who am I?” You may be realizing that perfectionism that has gotten you so far in life has now become your worst enemy.  Any of this sound familiar? Stress, anxiety, and depression can make you feel like there is no way out. My priority is to make sure you get what you need from therapy. If you're feeling lost, worried, and hopeless, therapy will help you find direction, confidence, and joy again. You will learn tangible skills to manage the overwhelm, depression, and difficult food behaviors. Together we'll begin to understand your emotional pattern and how to manage it. It isn't easy to ask for help, especially if you're used to handling things on your own. As someone who's struggled with perfectionism and disordered eating myself, I approach all my clients with genuine empathy that can only come from personal experience. I want to invite you to put yourself first for once. Call, text, email - let's get started today!

name: Eileen Jandrisevits
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MFT, CADC-I, IATP, SAP
about: Having trouble communicating with the people who matter in your life? I will help you develop better communication skills. Using a brain based methodology, you learn how early experiences in your life may have altered or stunted your ability to be the confident, comfortable person you want to become.  You deserve to be that person and those with whom you interact will be gratified with your heightened confidence , self-esteem and positive energy! Our work together is focus-based and anxiety reducing.  Whether you arrive alone, as a couple, parent, child, family member or employer/employee, mutual respect defines our journey together. Neuropsychological approach with individuals, couples and groups who are having problems in living, have endured trauma, addictions, anger issues, recovery, divorce, school or work issues, or are adjusting to a life transition and need support. As a member of UCLA's Mindsight Institute, active member  of the Neuroleadership Institute, National Brain Tumor Society,  California Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC-I), and International Association of Trauma Professionals, my Interpersonal neurobiological approach offers the extensive resources you need to more effectively develop the calmer, healthier version of you.

name: Vani Hariharan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: I believe that people are resilient and resourceful, capable of overcoming difficulties. Sometimes we get entangled in personal and relational patterns that can overwhelm our resources. I help clients identify these problematic patterns and empower them to break free from patterns that do not serve them well. I focus on my client's interpersonal relationships and relationships with larger social systems. I have experience working with children, teens, families, and couples on several issues, including family and couple distress, trauma, and various presentations of anxiety and depression through a systemic and attachment-based lens. I endeavor to create a therapeutic relationship based on respect, compassion, and authenticity. I address themes of power, privilege, oppression, immigration, and culture as they relate to my clients' difficulties. I use EMDR, mindfulness, CBT, structural family therapy, attachment, EFT, Gottman method, play, sand tray, expressive art therapy modalities. I offer online and in-person sessions in San Mateo and San Jose. As a South Asian immigrant, I want to support people and families who have immigrant experiences. I offer a free initial phone consultation if you would like to explore the possibility of working together. I have a sliding scale so that money need not be a barrier to seeking support.

name: Greg Robert Hutchings
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, BS
about: I have been providing Individual, couples and family Christian Counseling at Creekside Christian Church since 2012. My masters in counseling is from Western Seminary. My goal is a comfortable, discrete environment that leads to increased awareness for you. I aim to make this discovery pleasant & rewarding. My hope is that the circumstances you're facing will motivate you to try my counseling process so it can be an uplifting impactful hour out of your week. I am confident the process will gain you new understandings that will motivate you to explore, understand and intimately improve this challenging season you are facing. I have insight into certain life challenges including grief & loss (my 1st wife passed age 42), addiction, blended family, boundary struggles (both husband/wife & Parent/child/family) & sexual issues to name a few. I'm confident that after one session you will a better understanding of where you are at, why you are there and if I am the right counseling fit Career Counseling is also a strength because of my theology/psychology-based masters training combined with my BS in business from CSUS and 30+ years owning a small business. There are surprising answers to a frustrating unfulfilling career that come from my unique perspective.  I encourage you to make that challenging, but ultimately rewarding first call

name: Shelley Davidescu
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: **VIDEO & IN PERSON SESSIONS AVAILABLE**Tossing and turning, can't sleep, worried all the time and so much change feels uncertain. Though I've never met you, I imagine how uncertain it feels to have so much change happening at once and your relationships under stress. Whether you're in a relationship or just ended one, you probably find yourself overthinking and feeling lonely and disconnected. Sometimes you just need to talk things out in a safe place with zero judgment with a strategy and a direction towards a solution. What therapy looks like: Together we find your existing strengths and map out a strategy to support you in moving forward with your life. We explore your emotional system and find ways to help you harness your emotions. I specialize in anxiety, life transitions, and EMDR. More at anxietytherapysd.com Therapy can be a healing & catalytic experience with the power to transform your confidence & certainty about yourself and the direction of your life. Change is inevitable and at times scary. Sometimes you need someone who is trained and in your corner to support you along the way.

name: Janelle Stepper
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT, MA
about: I believe everyone is doing their best with where they’re at in life. I desire to create a safe, warm, and inclusive space where you are seen and heard. My hope is that through therapy, you can come home to yourself, live more fully alive, and experience transformational healing. I would be honored to hear your story and meet you with acceptance and support. Whether you are hoping to improve your relationships with others or your relationship with yourself, you are worthy of having your experiences validated and understood. I take a client-centered approach to therapy and will create an individualized treatment plan just for you. I am a trauma-informed therapist and am passionate about helping people regulate their nervous systems and heal from trauma, sexual abuse, and PTSD. I also help people experience healing from anxiety, depression, stress, people-pleasing, perfectionism, codependency, unhealthy relationship dynamics, narcissistic abuse, self-esteem, and intimacy concerns. I'm a Certified Brainspotting Practitioner and utilize this powerful body-based modality to help my clients heal from trauma. I deeply value the relationships I form with my clients and getting to empower and support them as they rediscover/reclaim their incredible worth and value. You matter, I'm here for you, and your mental health is worth supporting.

name: Mira Levi Elwell
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am a LCSW with nearly a decade of social work experience in clinic, school, non-profit and community settings. I specialize in working with adults, adolescents and their families, members of the LGBTQI2S+ communities, and with working artists. I have an understanding and dedication to working within a social justice framework, and strive to maintain a practice that is affirming of all identities, experiences and orientations.  I believe that any strong therapeutic relationship is built on collaboration, honesty, and the belief that change is possible. My approach is first and foremost relational, focusing on the mutual participation and engagement in the therapeutic space to better understand and develop the capacity for meaningful connection and engagement with others. I also work psychodynamically, and am trained in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), mindfulness techniques, and trauma-focused intervention. I work to provide an integrated approach to therapy that is best suited to each client or family's individual or collective goals. Reach out for a complimentary phone consultation to determine whether we might be a good match.

name: Deb Gee
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Everything about our lives is centered in relationship; knowing how to effectively initiate and maintain supportive, enjoyable and   mutually satisfying relationships will serve us throughout our lives. But this doesn't happen without many ups and downs, some of which benefit from including a supportive, objective and helpful therapist. If you are wishing to improve your thinking, your skill in dealing with stress, anxiety, depression or trauma, living in past experiences or fearing the future, I would be honored to help. I have been in the field for over 20 years, providing support to adults, couples and families. I use a mix of strategies to connect and collaborate with you. Discussing your concerns and making a plan to address them, taking the steps necessary to improve, practicing new techniques and celebrating a better life is what we will work toward.  While for some, therapy can be frightening, I invite you to consider the possibility of improving your relationships, with yourself and consequently with others. This requires risk and looking at things we may not want to see, in order to learn new, and happier,  ways of being. Please email or call me to begin.

name: Robyn L Posin
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My commitment is to creating safe space in which to help people (re)connect with and honor the wisdom and guidance of their inner knowing selves so that they may live more sanely in this crazy-making, invalidating world. Essential to this process is transforming our inner critics into allies, learning to move only as fast as the slowest part of us feels safe to go, developing the capacity to be tender, gentle and accepting with all the ways that we are (even as we work to change some of those ways) and reclaiming rest as a sacred act. When we can slow down and quiet the noise in our lives, we can begin to listen in to that deep knowing place that will guide us to living a life more in harmony with who we truly are. I'm particularly concerned with antidoting the negative cultural messages about having intense feelings, living in an aging body, taking time to cope with loss, illness or grief and living in alternative lifestyles.
issues: ['Grief', 'Inner critic issues', 'Spirituality']

name: Jaimi Brooks
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFTA
about: I studied at UCLA and Pepperdine and worked in UCLA's Marriage Lab studying what makes great marriages. Early on I counseled both elementary school children and homeless schizophrenic people in New York City. I have special training in grief therapy and sex therapy and enjoy working with matters of both loss and sex. I've spent a lot of time working with creative entrepreneurs, couples, and lots and lots of women. If I had to choose a favorite group...I just couldn't. It's all important and fulfilling to me. Bring whatever struggles you have to therapy...if you feel it or think it, we can work with it. My clients count on me to be honest and real with them and know that I invite the same from them. I love working with driven women and couples as well as hold Motherhood + Identity and Entrepreneurial Women Groups. Sometimes you just need support, understanding, and an additional perspective from someone who doesn't have a vested interested in your choices.  I've spent a lot of time learning about the hard parts of being human and how to make it a little bit easier and I'd love to help you with that.

name: Matt Fleischman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Hi, my name is Matt Fleischman.  I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist in Newport Beach.  I have over 10 years of experience working with children, teens, young adults, families, and couples with a variety of mental heath issues. I specialize in working with children and teens with: Behavior problems, ADHD, Depression, Trauma, and relationship difficulties. I am currently taking new clients. I look forward to working with you! My specialties also include anxiety, self-esteem, poor social skills, adjustment issues, anger management, and issues related to parenting, blended families, divorce and children in foster care. My general approach is to provide healthy emotional support, understanding, and encouragement. I make it a priority to be upfront and honest about my observations and primarily use a goal-oriented, collaborative approach.  To me, there is nothing more important than forming a secure and trusting relationship with my clients.

name: Katie Bates
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, MS, APCC
about: Katie is an Associate Professional Clinical Counselor who works with a wide variety of clients. She has extensive experience in working with athletes (high school, collegiate, Olympic sports), folks experiencing a career or stage-of-life transition, trauma survivors, and teens and adults who are looking to learn more about themselves and how to better cope with life stressors. Using a positive psychology and trauma-informed approach, Katie helps her clients to manage their emotions, develop resiliency, build confidence, and heal past traumas. Katie works to understand her clients' unique lived experiences and asks questions that allows them to examine their experiences in a new and insightful way. She provides a trauma-informed and non-judgmental space to explore what is most meaningful and important to them. Katie is supervised by Dr. Jake Insler, a leading Sport and Performance Psychologist. It can be scary, uncomfortable, and difficult to do this work in therapy and Katie strongly believes that this kind of work can provide opportunity for personal growth, more meaningful relationships, and skills to cope with stress. Please reach out for a free consultation or to book an appointment!

name: Liana Huang
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, ASW
about: When we are exposed to trauma at an early age, it can seriously impact how we feel about ourselves and our relationships with others. Trauma can also profoundly affect whether we feel this is a safe world and can contribute to depression, anxiety, and relational/familial issues. My practice is from a strengths-based, trauma-informed perspective with a non-judgmental framework. I aim to understand clients’ internal responses and to provide more options for emotional regulation and problem-solving. I have had the privilege to work with individuals with generational trauma, grief, ADHD, and relational/familial issues. I am trained in trauma-informed CBT, DBT, and solution-focused therapy to help clients develop a better understanding of any underlying issues and cope with overwhelming feelings. I also specialize in treating clients who struggle with multicultural issues and identity issues. My goal in treatment is to help you gain insight and tools that you use beyond our treatment journey to live an empowered and grounded life. I am bilingual/cultural in Cantonese. Please book your free consultation.

name: Domenique (Nikki) LaBeau
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Does your personality change based on who is around? Does it feel like you're walking on eggshells through life? You find yourself saying “yes” to things, but there is fear or anxiety behind it and you don’t understand why. On the other hand, saying "no" feels bad or wrong; so you really can't win. In romantic relationships, you feel misunderstood, uncomfortable, or lonely. You may have trouble expressing or identifying your needs. You feel unsatisfied with your relationships and you're ready to start living authentically. You can achieve satisfaction through authenticity by understanding and meeting your needs.  I see individual, family, and couples with trauma informed and multiculturally competent care. I have advanced knowledge and training in LGBTQIA care. During our time together, I use a whole body and attachment based approach to help you achieve your goals. I stand with marginalized groups and support BLM. My office is your safe space. Whether you're dealing with a long standing issue or something has just come up, I encourage you to reach out so that you don't have to be on that journey alone. I am multiculturally sensitive and a LGBTQIA+ affirming therapist who will celebrate you.

name: Michelle M. Scheufler
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Life is not meant to be miserable.  Making a commitment to seek therapy is a huge step in what I hope will be the beginning journey to rock your life!  We all go through difficulties in life and at times these difficulties can make us feel stuck.  Whether you are dealing with a difficult relationship, addiction, stress, life transition, family or parenting issues, depression, anxiety, or loss.  I will assist you navigate through these difficulties, gain a new perspective, provide additional insight and give you tangible skills you can utilize moving forward. I have been in the mental health field for over 10 years, utilizing evidence-based practices with an emphasis on mindfulness. I believe in taking a holistic approach, having unconditional positive regard with every individual, and meeting people where they are at. We will collaborate to build on your strengths while finding your most authentic self.  Please feel free to call for me for a free consult and if you are comfortable, we can set up an appointment.  Deciding you want something different is the first step.

name: Ida Lonnerdal
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Hi, My name is Ida Lonnerdal and I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. I believe that everybody is working toward being there highest self. I think that most people need some, encouragement, guidance, processing  and skills to be their best self and I believe that I can help you. Life on life's terms can get in the way of this, and I am an ally for people who want to live their best life. I have experience working with people who have experienced trauma, domestic violence, depression, and anxiety, to name just a few. As a woman of color, I am equipped to hold space for issues of race and identity. I'm a solution-focused, strengths-based, CBT, DBT, and EMDR trained therapist and want to support you in making lasting change. I'm looking forward to meeting you.

name: Kara Fitzpatrick
title: Psychologist, PhD, FAED
about: I am a licensed psychologist working with children, adolescents, adults and families. I have specialty training in working with anxiety, depression and eating disorders. I specialize in CBT, Family Based Treatment of eating disorders (FBT), Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) and Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT). I particularly enjoy working with families and parents. I am committed to providing excellent, empirically-supported treatments as well as providing expert diagnosis and treatment planning for those looking for guidance and wellness. I've worked in academic medicine and bring this expertise, experience and wide-ranging clinical skills in to my practice. I started my career as with specialty training in depression, anxiety and health psychology with a research focus in youth suicide. At Stanford I developed a passion for eating disorders. I am a nationally recognized expert teacher, trainer and clinician focusing on eating disorders and am a Fellow of the Academy of Eating Disorders. I have specialty training in a variety of treatment methods and have published widely on everything from AI to youth suicide to eating disorders and neuroscience

name: Alison Gomez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Getting out of bed is hard to do when the weight of defectiveness sits on your chest. You drag your body to campus to begin the cycle of emptiness: grade papers, attend meetings, be dismissed by colleagues. You share ideas to be met with condescension or stolen by Kristen. As much as she makes you want to scream, you want her acceptance. You bring up the newest episode of Handmaid’s Tale to Kristen and co. only for the conversation to screech to a halt. Interacting with her involves subtle threats that shake your confidence. It’s taxing doing the mental gymnastics of saying things just the right way so you can stay on her good side. You’ve done therapy before, but you yearned for more. You’ve read Brene Brown and watched TikToks and it doesn’t make it easier to exist. You’re ready for therapy beyond worksheets. I’m Alison - quirky, passionate, a bit of a dork - and I’m a therapist. We will be curious about what it’s like to be you and challenge the shit your internal bully feeds you. You’re scared of the risk of trying a new therapist, yet, toughing it out isn’t making a difference. You’re finding yourself creeping deeper into the hole of hopelessness. If you’re ready to be in a space where you do not have to exhaustingly mold yourself to fit something that feels tight and wrong, click on my website to schedule your consultation.

name: Pauldeep Gill
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Do you feel worried, stuck, or overwhelmed much of the time? Perhaps anxiety or other problems keep you from leaving home, interacting with others, or doing activities you enjoy. Many of my clients deal with addiction problems, past trauma, depression, low self-esteem, or related issues. A lack of confidence can make it difficult to feel safe in the world. I help people get to the bottom of what’s going on. Whether you’re struggling with a mental health issue, working through a trauma or loss, or aren’t sure what’s happening, I can help. You can feel more hopeful, less anxious, and more excited about living again. I use multiple approaches depending on what you’re experiencing. You may need support in understanding your life story, where you’re at, or where you’re going. Your struggles may have made it difficult to even see the good in yourself and what you’re capable of. Treatments I provide include CBT, motivational interviewing, psychodynamic therapies, and more. I work with adults and adolescents. As a Registered Associate Marriage and Family Therapist (AMFT), I have completed my Master’s Degree and am acquiring my hours for full licensure. I provide services through my employer BetterPsych, under the supervisor of a Ph.D. Clinical Supervisor, Dr. Cameron Froude (LMFT 97439). My Associate Registration number is AMFT

name: Tamara M Sprigel
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT, CST
about: I work with individuals, couples and adolescents.  I am psychodynamic in philosophy but eclectic in my approach.  Each persons treatment needs are different so therapy is often a combination of insight, cognitive and behavioral.  I am aware of the many stressors that come to bear on our lives and address the problems that arise with family, work, emotions and interpersonal relationships.  I help people cope with and learn from the challenging tasks of living life. I am a trained and certificated sex therapist (AASECT) and couples therapist (AACAST)and sex addiction therapist (IITAP) and work with all sexual issues and disorders with couples and individuals.  I also work extensively with trauma, panic, phobias, depression and anxiety disorders.  I have offices in Encino and Westwood and work some weekends.

name: David Buik
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: My guess is that your most immediate concerns are (1) how do I find the right therapist? and (2) how do I fit therapy into my busy schedule?  I get it.  I have appointments available evenings and Sundays.  I also believe the client has to be confident in the therapist's abilities.  In addition to my educational and licensing credentials, I also bring the experience and added credibility of having served as the Clinical Editorial Chair for The Therapist Magazine. I believe two elements are essential to the therapeutic relationship:  a genuine connection and a judgment-free space for honest exchange.  It's an empathic bond coupled with keen insights that facilitate real change, whether working with couples to learn better communication strategies or with individuals to work through anxiety, depression, or addiction. Short-term goals vary, but ultimately I help clients find the courage to live an authentic life, free of distractions and accumulated baggage.  I want the therapeutic relationship to be a good fit for both of us.  Check it out.  If you choose not to return, I won't bill you for the initial consult.

name: Debra Warner
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Many of my clients are survivors of abuse. The type of abuse varies, but includes mental, emotional, sexual, and physical abuse. Often times these individuals want someone to listen to them without judgement and foe someone to believe them. When clients tell me they have experienced abuse, my response is the same. I thank the individual for sharing their story because I understand how difficult it is. It is especially difficult for my male clients. My clients are looking to understand and process the abuse in the hopes of healing and to have healthier relationships. Dr. Debra is a forensic psychologist that has devoted her professional efforts to helping men and their loved ones confront and conquer the long term effects of trauma on the male psyche. She frequently addresses issues related to the #MenToo movement, challenges masculinity stereotypes, and works to dismantle stigmas related to male trauma. Your experiences matter and you deserve someone who will listen and believe you without judgement. I am here to do that.

name: Cristina Arenales
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MS, AMFT, APCC
about: If you are sick of having the same fight on repeat, staying up all night, alternating between doom-scrolling, online shopping, and planning imaginary trips, and you've run out of people you can turn to (because your religious/conservative/disconnected family is not an option, and you're too shy to keep telling your friends the same sob story) - I'm your therapist! OK, but if you need a therapist who won't flinch, who will go at the pace of the slowest part of you, and will listen and actually believe you: I'm your therapist! AND, if it's important to you that I am a WOC and openly queer...I'm your therapist! Sometimes therapy is an hour of crying and getting stuff off your chest; other times it's admitting truths to yourself or your partner that you may have been avoiding; or it's making a specific plan for the week and then celebrating it all when you come back. I do my best to check with you what you need that day, and then deliver in a way that works for you. I know, the only thing weirder than starting therapy is flipping through a bunch of profiles trying to pick one. But if you've gotten this far, something I've written resonates with you. My advice is: If you trust yourself, then trust yourself!

name: Michelle A Adams
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Are you ready?  Let's do this! I am passionate and ready to go on your journey with you. Let's see where the road leads.  With you as the driver and me as the passenger, we will work together to set goals, gain insight, and make positive and lasting changes. Are you ready to:  explore your life; decrease your depression; decrease your anxiety; live your life to the fullest; get to your higher self?  Or are you just not sure why you feel the way you do? If you answered yes to any of the above statements, then let's work together for your change.  The journey is yours, and I look forward to taking it with you.

name: Lorelei Bonet
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am invested in facilitating lasting and generative growth and self-realization in my clients.  Change is hard and inevitable, and sometimes it is something we choose (divorce, career change, major move), and sometimes it happens to us (loss of a loved one, diagnosis with illness, loss of a job), but no matter the circumstance, together I believe we can work to move through it and emerge feeling healed, whole, and ready to live each day to its fullest.  I am  invested in being the best therapist for you and hope you will contact me so we can discuss how you can live with intention, meaning and purpose. I am accepting new clients. I have worked for over a decade in the field of chronic illness and have witnessed first hand how disruptive unexpected and threatening change can be.  I utilize diverse and patient-centered techniques to help foster a sense of control, build a tolerance for uncertainty, and to re-frame and give meaning to life's challenges. My clients have told me that I am a healer who helps them anchor and see their world with more clarity and help them to move through it with greater intention.  I am excited to talk with you, to learn about your story, and to determine how we can work together to make today look and feel more like the life you want and deserve.

name: Teri L. Virostko
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: We all go through difficult times and it takes courage to reach out for support. You may be wondering how therapy can help you. Perhaps you want support with a challenging issue, to relieve anxiety, recover from trauma or to change patterns that no longer work for you. You may want to improve a relationship or get support with parenting or working through loss.  You can make changes, break patterns, and heal. Therapy is a place to get support, to explore new strategies for coping better with life, and to view things from an expanded perspective. Our challenges present us with opportunities to heal as well as grow. The heart of therapy is the healing that takes place in a trusting relationship. My approach is individualized to your needs and draws from evidence based, effective treatments to work with relationship issues, anxiety, grief and trauma.  I am trained in CBT, EMDR, mindfulness practices and couples and family therapy. I work with adults, teens and couples. Therapy can help you discover and find meaning in your unique life experiences. It is a place to accept and understand yourself while working with someone who supports you to determine how you want to live your life. Therapy can expand awareness of choices opening up new options. I look forward to working with you and supporting you in achieving your goals.

name: Daniel Verdugo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Have you been feeling  "stuck", "numb", "overwhelmed" or just downright "defeated" lately? I want to give you the tools and techniques that help you get back up and keep moving forward in life. I work with individuals, children, couples, and families by helping them maneuver through difficult life challenges; while also guiding them in understanding their emotional needs in regards to their relationships and personal well-being. I want to help you understand your emotional needs, build better relationships, and heal from whatever has been troubling you so that you no longer feel like a victim of your past or current situation.    I have spent over a decade gaining knowledge and acquiring the necessary skills to help clients understand their emotional needs so that they become both personally and relationally satisfied. My empathetic approach to therapy will give you the time and space needed to tell your story without any fear of feeling ashamed or judged. You deserve to be heard!   Call today so that we can get started on finding ways to help you become emotionally healthy and relationally satisfied! Trust me: You are worth it.

name: Tara Makhani
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MMFT
about: What is often left unsaid is your step to a better life, so let's start talking. It's possible you are struggling to find or maintain healthy relationships, or when you do- find yourself unfulfilled, lonely, or involved in a difficult breakup. Suddenly, feelings of sadness and anxiety are keeping you from being you. It’s hard to know where things keep going wrong and how to move forward with feelings of sadness and anxiety- until now. I help people create opportunities for better relationships with themselves, partners, coworkers, friends and family. Our relationships impact our emotions, motivation, crafts and whole well-being. When we take a curious and nonjudgmental approach, we allow ourselves to slow things down and discover patterns or barriers keeping us from where we’d like to be. Whether it be a relationship, job, life transition, or emotion that is getting in the way of your ideal life, I’d like to work with you to create a space in which you can minimize barriers, accomplish your goals, and gather the insight, tools, and resilience to be able to apply to any obstacles that come your way in life. Contact me for a free consultation.

name: Bev Hamowitz
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Life is unpredictable - relationships are complicated - loss hurts. Counseling can help.  My approach to counseling both individuals and couples is warm, direct, and interactive.  In my 36 years of experience, I have learned that engaging clients in the process of identifying a problem and understanding its cause enables them to learn to use the coping skills they need to solve the problem. I have had extensive, ongoing training and experience in treating anxiety, depression, and loss and grief.   I have provided counseling services to couples for pre-marital, relationship maintenance, and divorce/reconciliation issues, including same-sex couples. My clinical experience includes long-term work with Hospice and neo-natal intensive care, assisting families with the complexities of death, dying, and medical crisis.  I have facilitated groups for adolescents who have lost a sibling as well as for Hospice personnel in coping with ongoing stresses of their work.

name: Gianna Volpe
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA, MFA
street: Telehealth sessions only, video or phone.
about: My style as a therapist is warm, engaged, conversational, and collaborative. I use a variety of clinically sound therapeutic techniques that are holistically oriented and effective. I believe it's necessary and important to understand the meaning we make of things and to pay close attention to the stories we tell ourselves. Shifting our perception opens up the solutions and possibilities that may have been there all along, but we were in too much pain to see. When emotional pain is relieved, I believe our capacity for healing grows and we have renewed vitality, a sense of peace, and greater clarity. I have extensive experience and expertise working with depression and anxiety, terminal and chronic illness (for both the patients and caregivers), LGBTQ issues, and significant life transitions such as retirement, midlife crisis, bereavement, marriage, divorce, and career issues. Together we will develop strategies to create coping skills that uniquely address your needs. You can learn to navigate your life's challenges with resiliency and confidence. I encourage you to call for a free phone consultation. I look forward to speaking with you.

name: N. Lette Stockwell
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: Maybe you don't want to be here. But still you take a leap of faith, hoping therapy may offer relief from pain or confusion. I get it. I help trans and other gender non-conforming folks navigate a world that is not always safe and affirming. I also work with people who have experienced trauma - whether a specific traumatic event, or prolonged exposure over a period of time to high stress/low control situations that resulted in trauma. I know how to help you break free of patterns and habits that resulted from those negative experiences. I use evidence-based practices to help people experience less distress and feel more confident. I can teach you how to live in the moment, according to your truth and values. I've been doing this work for over 20 years, you can trust that I have seen it all and know what to do with it! No matter what you are coming in for, healing requires trying new things, pushing into your DIScomfort zone, and trusting the process. Feel free to reach out. We can determine together whether I'm the right therapist for you.

name: Melissa Finaldi
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: We all develop a set of skills to cope and survive when we are young. This is the beauty of our adaptiveness and our innate pursuit of love, safety, and connectedness. However, for most of us, there reaches a point in life where the skills that once allowed us to survive are now preventing us from living the life we imagined. If you are feeling disconnected and discontented with yourself, your life, and/or your relationships, do not lose hope. It is possible to identify and adapt the patterns that you developed to keep yourself safe and attached. The focus of my work as a therapist is to help people identify and change unproductive personal and interpersonal patterns, overcome shame, heal past hurts, and manage anxiety. I utilize my professional and personal experience, humor, and warmth to create a strong collaborative relationship with my clients to cultivate the connections and life they desire.  My passion is found in helping each person I have the honor of sitting with to feel deeply connected to themselves, their loved ones, and to their life. If any of this resonates with you please do not hesitate to contact me or check out my website. www.melissafinalditherapy.com

name: Seema Sharma
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT, APCC, MA, MBA
about: Sometimes we need someone who “sees” us, understands us, and is able to partner with us in our struggles. I work with clients with issues ranging from workplace/career struggles to childhood trauma. The human response to suffering is complex where intertwined systems react - mind, body, and spirit. I help my clients put the pieces together, and recognize how their pain may be manifesting in their life. Many times my clients struggle with not knowing who they are, how they feel, or what they think. I work with my clients on building tools that help them unravel their systems, recognize behavior patterns, and improve their well-being. I specialize in helping clients with depression, anxiety, mid-life transitions, workplace issues, and trauma; Whether you’re navigating a high-pressure career, life transition, depression/anxiety, or just feeling overwhelmed, I can help. The mind and body are interconnected. I specialize in helping you unravel your symptoms to help heal your whole self. It's important to feel comfortable & safe with whomever you work with. Finding a therapist requires a deep alliance & healing hinges on that therapeutic relationship. When you're struggling that relationship becomes even more important. Sometimes it's hard to take the first step and ask for help. I honor you reaching out, taking the 1st step towards healing.

name: Jane Skoyen
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I’m Dr. Jane Skoyen, a licensed psychologist in California and New York. I specialize in the treatment of anxiety disorders, and assist with life transitions, stress reduction, and management of physical illness. I work with intelligent, proactive, and curious people who have found themselves stuck. Most of my clients are juggling many stressors of living in a competitive world and weathering the pandemic. They are looking for ways to reduce challenging symptoms, assert themselves, increase self-care practices, and find more joy in their lives. I use evidence-based methods such as Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy, and Motivational Interviewing to help clients reduce their symptoms, maintain calm and presence, and increase the quality of their experience. I offer a compassionate and non-judgmental space, in which my clients feel supported in exploring their concerns and potential solutions. I derive joy from longer-term work and brief interventions, but my goal is to help my clients master techniques that they will apply outside of the session. For more information, please visit www.skoyen.com.

name: Charles A Flinton
title: Psychologist, PhD, MA
about: A rapidly growing number of men/women lose everything because they fail to make healthy choices about sexual behavior. Most are good people who made poor decisions because they push the limits of acceptable sexual behavior. Our goal is to assist you in developing healthy lifestyles, while at the same time preventing serious consequences to you and others. Sexual behavior does not need to be "normal," but it must be ethical and not harmful. Think about it! BLUE ROCK INSTITUTE (BRI) is equipped to help anyone with compulsive/problematic thoughts, urges, or sexual behaviors.  Please call.  "It's your life: Own it, Create it, Love it.   BRI offers a multi-faceted approach to sexual health. Specialized group and individual therapy is tailored to you specific needs.  We emphasize healthy outlets that may include nutrition, medication management, exercise and the development of activities that promote happiness and satisfaction.  Again, It’s your life: Own it, Create it, Love it.  Many people lose sight of their own strengths and abilities to get their emotional and sexual needs met in healthy ways. Our goal is to help you remember those strengths and  move toward healthy sexuality and resolve feelings of shame and embarrassment that stopped you from getting help.

name: Cindi Rivera
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: I am a bilingual bicultural psychotherapist working primarily with adults, couples and adolescents who are having problems in their relationships and/or who feel badly about themselves or their life situation.  The in-depth work I do focuses on one's feelings and significant relationships - past and present. With compassion and deep personal respect, I help my clients to deal with the painful issues, losses and complex struggles of living.  I work well with anxiety, depression, low self-esteem, parenting issues, inter-racial couples, life transitions, loss, and trauma; toward repairing the relationships that are inevitably affected by these problems. Are you concerned about the relationship you have with your teenager? Are you troubled by arguments you have with your spouse? Do you struggle with loneliness and emptiness? Unhappiness at work? Do you have difficulty communicating your wishes? Or have bad memories of your past?  Do you wake up worried?... I will work intimately with you on your deepest concerns, to facilitate healing, growth, freedom in the most important areas of your life. To receive a FREE E-COURSE using mindfulness, titled "More Calm, Less Worry in Your Busy Life" please check out the page on my website.

name: Akilah Bakeer-Pullum
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am a Licensed Clinical Social Worker with over 14 years of experiencing partnering with people in need of support, or simply looking to improve their quality of life by making meaningful changes. I enjoy creating a warm, supportive, and accepting therapeutic environment often using humor to put my clients at ease. My goal is to provide the highest level of care to my clients by customizing treatment and drawing from a myriad of Evidence Based Practice models including Cognitive Behavior Therapy, Solution Focused Brief Therapy, Managing Adaptive Practice, and relaxation skills. I understand that everyone’s life comes with its own specific set of challenges and my approach to treatment reflects that. It is my goal to build an alliance with my clients that utilizes their strengths while teaching them the additional skills they need to make their lives more manageable and to achieve their optimum level of functioning. I realize that for some the idea of therapy may be daunting and I applaud your for taking this first step. Life is hard for many of us, especially right now and I understand this and won't judge you for the choices you've made to get through this. Now, I invite you to take the next step and begin treatment. Weekend and evening appointments are available.

name: Amanda Newman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Welcome! Since you're reading this, I imagine a part of you wants to change something in yourself or your life. I'm here to support you being successful in achieving your therapy goals! You want therapy that works; that is why I only use evidence-based therapies that provide results you can count on! I specialize in working with adolescents and adults with anxiety, depression, abuse, trauma, identity and relationship issues. You're looking for a therapist that is kind and caring, listens to and respects you. This is who I am and what I offer you. Call or email me now and see if I feel like a good fit for you! I specialize in evidence-based, client-centered therapies--EMDR*, Cognitive Therapy, Mindfulness and Positive Psychology. I ask you what your therapy goals are, then tailor your treatment to what you want and need. Clients often report accelerated healing, learning and wellness with EMDR. I'm a Certified EMDR Therapist. You deserve success with your therapy! You are not alone! The biggest step is this first one. "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom."--Anaïs Nin  Isn't time for you to let yourself flower, to release whatever is holding you back? Pick up the phone and give me a call or email me.  I am here for you!

name: Sam Verzatt
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Hi, thank you for taking a moment to view my page. We all face a world that is so fast paced, full of distraction and demands on our time and attention. I view therapy as a space to take rest from this rush and cultivate mindfulness and a sense of presence.  Therapy is an opportunity to take a moment to hear one's self and identify where am I, where have I been, and most importantly where am I going?  Therapy can be a radical act of self care when we learn to validate what we need to help ourselves move forward and how to let go of what no longer serves us. I am here to help you understand your process. I am here to help you identify the ways that you are thriving and the skills and behaviors that help you shine. I am also here to help you identify the behaviors that cost you and keep you from the life you want to lead and how to let them go. There is space here to reconnect with what is important. Together we can discover what it is that gives your life meaning, passion, purpose, and drive. When you are ready, we can start the process together. Thank you.

name: Anne Levin Marsh
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I provide supportive and compassionate therapy to children, teens, adults, and families. Clients come to me for help with ordinary life challenges, depression, anxiety, grief, divorce, coparenting, relationship problems, parenting struggles, and more. Each person has unique needs, and we will come up with the best plan for you, your child, or your family. I provide play therapy and CBT for young children, "talk therapy" (psychodynamic and CBT) for teens and adults, and a systems approach for families. I am extensively trained in and provide grief counseling for all ages. I provide parent education, as well as assistance with coparenting and support through the divorce process for parents and children. I am warm, nonjudgmental, and supportive. Clients feel safe opening up and sharing their pain and struggles with me. We work together to make life less confusing, painful, or overwhelming. Please reach out by phone or email so we can talk about what you're hoping for in therapy. I will explain how I can help and will answer any questions you may have.

name: Juliann Eva Kauffman
title: Psychologist, EdD
about: I welcome adolescents and adults who are ready to begin or continue their processes of healing and path finding in this challenging and wondrous life. I work with clients in a variety of ways. One of my primary approaches is to address the beliefs that each person has internalized during his or her life. These beliefs direct our choices.  Erroneous beliefs about self, others, and the world at large put limits on us and hold us back from healthy relations and personal empowerment.   My professional commitment includes honoring my clients' diverse world views as they work toward improving their lives. I work to empower my clients through supportive therapy addressing a variety of issues. My primary treatment modalities are cognitive therapy, Jungian-influenced SoulCollage created by Seena Frost, and psychodymamic approaches. I also offer a program called Maximum Potential, which teaches steps toward dream manifestation, self-confidence, achievement, and success. I believe that the best therapists are those who have overcome their own life traumas.  With the help of two remarkable therapists, I have healed myself of past trauma, including learning to walk again following a spinal cord injury, after being told that it was impossible.  The mind is powerful.
issues: ['Behavioral Issues', 'Grief', 'Parenting', 'Relationship Issues', 'School Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Spirituality', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Bridget Bertrand
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA
about: I can help you sort through fear, sadness, and worry.  We can delve into the past or deal with current stressors.  There is no one right way to do therapy,  In sessions, we might move from the present to the past but I trust we will land in a place where you will have more ability to stay present to your life.  I am committed to understanding what you need right now.  I listen, reflect and we create goals together.  Whether you are a parent, a single adult or a teen I might be the right person for you.  Therapy takes work but I can help you navigate the difficult waters.  Creating Calm a group for folx identifying as women.   You can learn to be in the moment with your feelings and not run away from them.  Sitting with those feelings, you can decrease suffering. Group therapy can help you with your relationships. Group has as much benefit based on research as individual therapy does and it's less expensive.  Call today to learn about how group can heal.   Take the time you deserve for yourself by reaching out for your free 20-minute call. There is more information on my website.  I think you will know if I am the right fit within the first 20 minutes of our chat on the phone.

name: Eryn Margaret Lewis
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Many people are wary of the therapeutic process because of fears around being judged or facing the unknown. One of my important roles as your therapist is to remove barriers that feed such fears so that you can begin to authentically express yourself and experience the type of healing and growth that is made possible through the therapeutic relationship. I hope that through collaborative exploration we can find a path that leads you to a future of greater clarity and freedom. Providing a nonjudgmental perspective to both individuals, children and couples from all walks of life with the sensitivity to a variety of issues. I hope to work along side you to help you receive relief from the emotional pain life can bring. Sometimes we need some help navigating our thoughts feelings and experiences. If you connect to any of the above. Please don't hesitate to give me a call and we can continue this conversation.

name: Benjamin Towns
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Dr. Benjamin Towns is a licensed clinical psychologist with extensive experience working with patients experiencing chronic pain, depression, anxiety, ADHD, interpersonal conflicts, school stress, work stress, substance use disorder and addiction. His therapeutic approach is client-centered, compassionate, culturally sensitive, and evidenced-based. He utilizes Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) and Mindfulness-based interventions to promote recovery, wellness, and improve quality of life. Dr. Towns enjoys working with adults and he currently sees patients in La Jolla and via video-medicine across the state of California. Dr. Towns received his doctorate in Psychology from the California School of Professional Psychology, and his master’s and bachelor’s degrees in Psychology from the University of Texas in Arlington.

name: Marion K. Jacobs
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Choosing the right therapist is the first important step in a successful therapy outcome.  You want a person with lots of expertise, but also the right personality, someone you  trust and can talk to openly.   Drawing on my extensive clinical experience, over the years I have been able to help individuals and couples with a wide-ranging set of issues. Whatever stresses are causing you to seek therapy at this time, I welcome  your phone call to judge if I seem like the right choice for you.  I draw on cognitive- behavioral, psychodynamic, client centered  and mindfulness approaches, depending upon the specific needs of each client or couple.  Current research informs my work. Building a strong, trusting bond is always essential. See  www.takechargeliving.com for my more on my qualifications, clinical work, and my book, Take-Charge Living. I taught at UCLA Psychology for 19 years, UC Irvine for 4 years, and have been in private practice for over 30 years.  This blend of teaching, research and clinical practice gives me a thorough grounding in the best ways to meet the specific needs of each individual client.

name: Kim Jones
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: There usually comes a time in life where we feel stuck, lost, anxious, or depressed. You may be struggling in your relationships with family, friends, partner, or work, or feeling anxious about building the life you want. You may have tried various solutions on your own before acknowledging that you could use the support of another person. However you may be feeling, I believe that your symptoms are there to get your attention, and therapy can be a helpful tool. I encourage you to bring yourself where you are at. By working together in a non-judgemental and curious way, we can learn about certain patterns in your way of relating to yourself and others. We can understand your unique self so that you can identify what you are needing and move through the world with more choice and agency. My goal for you in our work together is that you live a more full, balanced, and authentic life- whatever that means for you. If you are interested in working together, I offer a free 20 minute phone consultation to discuss what you are coming in with, and assess if we would be a good match. I look forward to hearing from you.

I work with you to improve the quality of your life.   [1) Post bariatric surgery support: address emotional issues that lead to poor follow-up of new eating practices. I am eclectically trained which means I am able to customize therapy with you for best possible treatment outcomes. I am familiar with Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, CBT, Jungian Therapy, Psychodynamic, Mindfulness practices and more. I offer all new patients a free 20-minute consultation via phone or SKYPE.

name: Marilyn Fahrner
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT, CPCC
about: How can I be of help to you?  What has you looking through these profiles?  If circumstances are overwhelming you, loaded with challenges coming too rapidly, and you're doubting your ability to handle it all, this may be the right time to enlist the dedicated help of a trained and caring therapist.  Depression and anxiety are common reactions when change, loss or discouragement overwhelm you. I work with each client to assist him or her to see their own value and strength as well as the blindspots that can sap your energy and joy. We can work together to clarify your situation, all the while taking the necessary time to honor your feelings and particular way of seeing things.  My approach is gentle and simple as I offer you compassionate, direct feedback aimed to support what is important to you and your life. I've practiced as a therapist for 25 years; I also have training as a life coach and am well versed in helping my clients to move forward. Give me a call to see if we might work well together.

name: The Path Wellness Center: Dr. Kimberly Ciardella
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about: Finding you here, means you are looking for answers, for purpose, for reasons, for meaning.  You feel sadness, you feel rage, you feel fear, AND sometimes you feel NOTHING, you feel emptiness, numbness, you feel a deep void. You're disconnected from everything that brings you life, the things that bring you joy, the people you love, but most of all you are disconnected from your SELF. Whether you are in the throes of anxiety or depression, moving through a traumatic experience, working to repair your relationships or coping with Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD), you are brave for reaching out and we are here to help. No one person’s story is the same as the next and no one path leads to all healing and order. Here you will find a variety of options to move forward with therapy and finding the support you need. Whether you are looking for a one time guide to start you on your journey of healing or an accountability partner to make sure you stay on your path, we can help. It is inevitable that we all endure periods of difficulty at some point in our lives. You're here because you've made a decision that something has to change. Something within is moving you to find your way back to your Self.   Whatever route you took to get here, whatever path you have been traveling on, brought you here for a purpose. Let's find it.

name: Kaitlin Medeiros
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, #96594
about: Welcome! If you're looking for therapy for yourself, your teenager, or a loved one, know that you are taking a brave step towards building a support system for yourself and others. As a Silicon Valley native, I know raising children and living in this area comes with unique challenges. I enjoy working with all ages (11 and up). I also have experience working with young professionals and understand the complexities of navigating careers, relationships, and building a life worth living. I have extensive experience working with adolescents and adults in intensive outpatient treatment programs (IOP) in a hospital setting, in addition to school settings. I am well versed in DBT (dialectical behavior therapy), and in my private practice I offer an approach that includes practical skills as well as deeper processing work. I encourage you to reach out if you or a loved one is struggling and interested in learning coping skills to manage depression/anxiety and/or problematic behaviors. I prefer seeing clients in person (masked) and have limited availability (Wednesday evenings) for in person sessions. Telehealth is an option for working professionals as well.

name: Davidia Benavidez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Welcome! I’m glad you’re here.  I am a licensed marriage and family therapist who has a love and respect for the therapeutic process. There is much good that comes from developing oneself and nurturing our most treasured relationships. Each person has a story, past, present, and future. There are moments in time when things don’t make sense, when relationships are “off”, or when we feel stuck. I am here to create a space for you to move towards a place of healing, wholeness, and flourishing.  I’d be honored to partner with you on your journey.   I specialize in helping people work through issues around anxiety, depression, trauma, and relationship challenges. It's never too early or too late to seek help. Without judgement, I'll help you learn new ways to cope and thrive. You're here because you need support. It's a brave thing to ask for help. If you're ready to make the call, I'm ready to help you get started towards your next chapter.
issues: ['Divorce', 'Family Conflict', 'Stress', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Scott Mersino
title: Associate Professional Clinical Counselor, MA, APCC
about: I can't do this!! Not matter what we try we seem to end up in a fight! I don't know if I can't take this any more! I hear these statements often. We all want relationship with a felt sense of closeness and emotional responsiveness. It seems coded into your very DNA. However, there are times in relationship where you feel isolated and abandoned leaving you feeling anxious or depressed. You may find yourself saying “Where did our love go,” or “I do not know how do we get stuck in the same argument, I don't feel heard or appreciated.” Or maybe you feel like you are failing. Either way you did not realize relationship would be so hard. Even though your realtionship in a rocky spot you sill desire safe, loving, lasting relationship. This is possible when you have a map. Together we will embark on a journey to help you regain the connection you long for. The goal is to explore, identify, and build tools to help you and your partner have the loving and lasting relationship you both long for. My goal is to create a safe and inviting place you need to learn and practice skills to recapture the love you once shared. I have helped couples just like you get unstuck and find the love they once had, a place of connection and trust. NO WAITLIST IN PERSON session. Call now, schedule a free 15 min consultation NOW ACCEPTING PARTNERSHIP HEALTH INSURANCE.

name: Paul J Meyer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Are you struggling with relationship issues? Are your loved ones weighing on your own mental health? Those closest to us can be our greatest asset, but often these relationships can be fraught with pain. I specialize in therapeutic modalities that support positive interpersonal health, and can provide healing and growth that affects the whole relationship. I believe we all have times when we need help journeying through life’s pains, and that through working together these problems are resolved and families restored. I have experience with conflict resolution, marital therapy, family therapy, trauma, biblically-based counseling, adoption, and working with adolescents.  I use evidenced based interventions and therapies whenever possible and have training in cognitive behavioral therapies. I have a passion to bring peace and healing to relationships, in a respectful and caring way. I approach counseling from a collaborative framework, and bring proven interventions to help navigate the journey.  I invite you to call for a free consultation.
