name: Lisa Call
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT-CA, LPCC-CA, MFT-HI
about: Are you experiencing any of the following in your marriage: trust issues, infidelity, feeling more like roommates than romantic partners, trauma/addiction issues, frequent arguments that never get resolved, or just feeling lonely in your relationship? When you try to talk things out, it just makes everything worse and you feel stuck. You know you need help but don't know what to do to get back those feelings of intimacy and closeness that you used to have together. Instead of growing apart, you are longing for help to get your relationship back on track so that you can restore love, passion and trust once again. As an experienced couples therapist with advanced training in Emotionally Focused Therapy, I can help you learn better ways to communicate and to improve your feelings of connection and closeness in your relationship. We can repair broken bonds, re-establish trust, work through past unresolved issues, and strengthen our love with those who matter most. All of us have difficult challenges to work through and we need not walk through them alone.  I would love to work together with you to help with your struggles. In this uncertain and stressful world, I am here to listen to you, empathize with your pain, validate your experiences, and walk beside you as we figure it out together.

name: Sylvia Martinez
title: Associate Professional Clinical Counselor, MA, APCC, PPS
about: Chances are you are looking for the right Therapist because you have finally had enough of the heavy burdens you carry. If you are ready to do the work, I can help you lighten your burdens. Your pain and experiences will be honored by me, and together we will explore & find the roots of the challenges that bind your feet, and we will free you, so you can run. It is a process, and it won't happen overnight, but I can help you find healing, rest and restoration. I won't just listen and say uh-huh. I'll be the therapist that pulls her sleeves back, and digs in to help you find the solutions and peace you may seek. I offer Walk and Talk Therapy in Newport  Beach and in Mission Viejo. Sitting in an office to talk about the hard stuff isn't for everyone. I seek to help my clients where they are & in ways they feel comfortable with.  Canine-Assisted Therapy and Christian Spirituality can be incorporated upon request.  Choosing to give therapy a try can be a tough decision to make, but you will be glad you did. You don't have to brave life's journey alone any more, let me walk with you. If you want to know more, you can email me, or check out my website. Call today for a free 30 minute consultation!

name: Christina Dughman

about: I believe that we are all intrinsically motivated to move towards health--physically, emotionally, and spiritually. Whether I am working with children, teens, or adults, I partner with my clients to better understand them as cultural beings and how their uniqueness is impacted by their experiences in the world. I offer a warm, nurturing, and accepting style and show deep interest in an authentic therapeutic relationship. My goal is to support my clients towards insight and overall balance. I specialize in childhood behavioral/developmental problems and offer supportive parenting consultation in conjunction with therapeutic support for the child. My areas of expertise include trauma, anxiety, depression, child-parent relationship problems, and behavioral problems. Taking your unique culture and parenting style into account, I use attachment theory through a developmental lens and pull from a variety of techniques and tools to support you and your child in strengthening your relationship and supporting you towards your therapeutic goals.

name: Marilyn T Paventy
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I provide counseling services in either English or Spanish. In addition to the rigorous education and training therapists are required to complete, I had an additional three-year training under Joan Rousseau, LCSW, in systems theory family therapy using a strategic problem-solving model. Previously, I enjoyed five years working in the addiction field and six years working in the child welfare field. I have served as an advocate for the Spanish-speaking community since 1985, and my focus in graduate school was on bilingualism-biculturalism-Spanish/Latino. As the mother of three sons, I chose to do focused study on men's issues. I am well-trained and competent to work with families, couples, and individuals. Helping people solve interpersonal conflict, whether it be parent/child, couples, or family therapy is the most rewarding aspect of my career. Helping parents be more effective with their unique child and his or her specific needs is also very fulfilling work. I am a compassionate person. Being a senior, I have my own life-stage experience. I am a parent and a grandparent and understand the challenges of raising children. Like everyone, I have struggled with my own life issues and feel passionate about helping others navigate through the obstacles that can challenge all of us at times.

name: Maria Avila
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, ACSW
about: Accepting New Clients / Aceptando Nuevos Clientes! Your stories, pain and feelings are valid. Not everyone is going to understand the trauma you have experienced or the symptoms that accompany it, that's okay, it doesn't make it any less real. Methods of surviving trauma/abuse become symptoms; anxiety, depression, dissociation, somatic symptoms and hypervigilance, and can become distressing when no longer utilized for survival. They can also manifest as people pleasing, unhealthy relationships, difficulty trusting others, setting boundaries, shame and avoidance. I am here to hold space for you and your healing. I am an Associate Clinical Social Worker, currently training in EMDR. I specialize in working with adults and adolescents impacted by trauma/abuse. At Irimiya, we work closely with Trauma and Complex Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (C-PTSD). Additionally, we specialize in Sexual Trauma (childhood sexual abuse, sexual assault, sexual harassment, etc.) Together in therapy, we will “do the work” and the biggest part of “doing the work” is re-learning self trust, boundaries and self love. I am here to affirm those feelings of wanting to be heard, loved and supported and decrease the feelings of self blame, guilt and shame. I am here to walk with you on this imperfect path.

name: Garry Corgiat
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT
about: Conversational, collaborative dialogue and accelerated progress usually characterize my work with clients as we focus on deep personal patterns of perceiving and relating.  I work well with highly sensitive people (HSP's) to  help them understand, value and cope with their extra emotional sensitivity.  I also work with couples that want to stay together and move forward in their relationship by overcoming patterns of power struggle. My goal is to find the therapeutic balance between compassion and challenge that helps my clients feel cared for, respected, heard and supported in their process of exploration, understanding and change. This style of compassionate challenge works most effectively with people who are receptive to straight forward communication, and have the desire for active change.  Choices that support growth are explored in honest dialogue. We move quickly into deep and difficult issues and personal challenges are explored in a direct, caring and effective way.  Working together you can expect direct communication, humor, respect and caring. I will encourage you to keep the work going outside of the therapy sessions, and we will work together to explore the way you see the world, your relationships and yourself. I am invested in what gives each person more self compassion and a happier life.

name: Penelope Young Andrade
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: My ideal client is a person who doesn't want to give up on him/her/themself and the dream of a  fulfilling life. I support clients to know the truth: they deserve  love and success no matter what wounds they've experienced. I help people uncover the deep wisdom and restorative potential living  within them. I do this gently and safely, in the present moment,  by  reconnecting clients with healing, embodied emotional experience.  This gets  vitality and intuition moving again  I support people to take  responsibility (but not blame) in any life/work/relationship upset because this is what works! Transformation happens when clients are  comfortable in their skins in a warm and respectful relationship.  When emotional/body numbness interferes with being present to both self and others, it's important to thaw out gradually and safely.  I help clients learn how to do this with or without medication. I offer a unique blend of  mindfulness and body based, relational and emotionally focused therapy.  After 40 + years experience, I continue to learn new and effective ways of helping clients quickly and elegantly develop the self love necessary to make the healthy choices required for a fulfilled life.  For reduced fees, ask about the AEDP Research project.

name: Tricia M. Banda
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: You may think that big things have to change in your life in order for you to feel better and experience improvement.  But I've come to believe that a key, gentle shift in perspective can bring about more positive change than many realize.  That is a shift from taking a critical approach with yourself to taking a Kinder Approach.  With this shift in how you approach yourself and your experiences comes greater self-awareness and feelings of confidence, hopefulness, empowerment and knowing your value. You can begin to see and feel new possibilities and choices for your life. As your therapist I have a deep appreciation for your courage to walk through your painful experiences. Using the lens of a kinder inner language, we will unfold the areas that may be causing you anxiety, depression, or just uncertainties that can block your ability to thrive in your life. Through my holistic approach I bring a range of highly effective techniques and modalities, including mind (cognitive behavior), body (somatic) and spirit (transpersonal).  I also encourage daily practices and tools for resourcing and balancing.  I look forward to speaking with you, for more information please visit my website at www.KindnessApproach.com.

name: OC Teen Center- Adolescent and Teen Mental Health
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Dr. Lauren Armstrong is a highly passionate licensed clinical psychologist and Clinical Director with a PsyD from Pepperdine University, and has been working with children and adolescents for the past ten years. She is an expert in working with challenging psychological presentations such as trauma, self harm, mood changes, aggression, and other unsafe or maladaptive coping mechanisms. Dr. Lauren always believes in her patients, even when everyone else has stopped believing in them. She never loses hope, and tirelessly works with patients and their families on improving their relationships, coping skills, and positive change. If your child has depression, anxiety, self harm, suicidal ideation, or trans/identity issues please call us. OC Teen Center has a great track record of dealing with these specific issues. We currently have children enrolled who were suicidal just a few months ago and are now enjoying life while being heavily engaged in college preparation. At OC Teen Center, we offer a tour and information session where you can meet the doctor and see our facility. This informational session is free and we will not bill your insurance. We also offer individual therapy for parents.

name: Daniel Maurio
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Do you feel disconnected from your partner? Are you arguing over little things? Does intimacy feel stale, scary, shaming, or embarrassing? Are you or your loved ones repeating behaviors, relationships, or situations, and wishing you could break the cycle? Sometimes, we're not sure what causes our distress, but we can sense we're not reaching our potential for health, happiness, or success. And even when we know the cause, change can still feel impossible. That's where I come in. Without judgment or bias, my job is to listen, help you understand root causes of your difficulties, and teach you practical tools to help change your life. Together, we can build customized goals and an actionable plan. I'm qualified to help with a variety of challenges; however, I specialize in helping couples address communication, sexuality, boundaries, attachment, jealousy, & intimacy. I also enjoy working with teens, men, and folks in the LGBTQ+, kink/BDSM, & relationship-expansive (ENM, etc.) communities. I currently practice as an AMFT at Caring Connected in Pasadena and have 3+ years of experience across community mental health, non-profit, and private practice settings. I am currently practicing in-person and also offer video sessions. I also offer the ability to make payments and fill out forms in a secure, online Client Portal.

name: Katie Halma
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Accepting online clients on Thursday AMs only.   Welcome.  I'm glad you're here and would be happy to help.  I believe that we all have the innate desire to be accepted, so I aim to provide a warm and caring environment where you will feel safe to be yourself.  I weave validation, insight, empathy and humor in my sessions. Are you struggling in relationships?  Feeling depressed or anxious?  Having a therapist walk alongside you to be a neutral eye in identifying your recurrent thoughts and behaviors can be helpful.  Seeing how your past affects your current relational interactions sheds light on why you respond or react in certain ways. Coping skills and techniques can be applied, and change CAN happen.  If you're willing to put in the work and ready for a change, let's make it happen!  I enjoy and am open to all clients adolescent age and above.  ***PLEASE NOTE:  Sending me an EMAIL is the quickest and most convenient way to get a hold of me.***

name: Jennifer Kendall
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Are you struggling with issues related to trauma, grief, anxiety, relationship conflict or major life changes? There comes a time when help is needed from a certified professional to cope with many of life's challenges. Whether you need support for yourself, your relationship or your teenager, you deserve someone who is there for you every step of the way. I am here to support you on your journey toward healing and self discovery. I’ve been a licensed psychologist for twenty years and have extensive experience working with trauma, depression, anxiety, parenting issues, and relationship therapy. I am a Certified Gottman Therapist and was trained in relationship therapy by Drs. John and Julie Gottman. I also have experience working with adults and adolescents on the autism spectrum.  I believe that we come to know ourselves through our relationships - both early and present. We need someone to understand us in order to understand ourselves. I would love to help you live more comfortably in your own skin and enjoy your relationships. Call me today and let's start your journey together.
issues: ["Asperger's Syndrome", 'Codependency', 'Marital and Premarital', 'Parenting', 'Relationship Issues', 'Suicidal Ideation']

name: Elevation Therapy Center
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT, CEAP, SAP
about: Hello, My name is Hermin Youssefian Phd, LMFT, CEAP, SAP.  I am a LMFT (LIC 45270). I began my training as a psychotherapist in 1994, with a focus on working with couples, children and families, particularly clients with a history of trauma and significant losses. I obtained my Doctorate in Clinical Psychology and my Master's Degree in Marriage Family and Child Therapy in 1998.  Since then I have acquired 25+ years of experience in the field and can say I am truly living out my purpose. I am genuinely passionate and extremely dedicated to helping couples, families and children grow and heal from their pain and live fulfilling lives The focus of my work is on helping my clients find acceptance in themselves in order to listen to their own voices and create a life that is fulfilling and meaningful to them. I believe that each of my clients are the experts in their own lives. In that way, our sessions become a joint process; rather than an "expert/patient" experience. If you were climbing Mt. Everest, would you want your guide to be someone who had climbed the mountain before or somebody who had only read about it? I personally have climbed it! Just like you I am a real person who has gone through many of the same struggles you are experiencing. And am committed to helping others on the road to healing.

I look forward to the opportunity to meet with you and help you on your journey toward wholeness.

name: Ann-Sophie Villarreal
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT, EMDR
about: EMDR w/ specific focus on infants, children & adolescents.                                       Childhoods are often filled with fun and long lasting memories. However, when “Big T” and “Little T” traumas arise, children and adolescents often times need emotional support to not only reprocess the trauma, but conquer and surpass their adverse childhood experiences while building skills of resilience & perseverance. Nothing amazes me more than watching tiny human beings put on their superhero capes to fight the ugly, scary & yucky things in their lives and find their way back to being a thriving and joyful child. Through the use of EMDR, play therapy and many other therapeutic approaches, I would love to help your little one thrive & conquer! Speciality trainings include but are not limited to:  EMDR trained with a focus in infants, children & adolescents, “Incredible Years” Ages 0-6 Parenting Curriculum, Certified Pre Natal Trauma Specialist, PC Cares and TF-CBT

name: Fae Feliciano-Pineda
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am a Licensed Clinical Social Worker with experience in outpatient community mental health, school-based, and private practice setting providing individual/family/group psychotherapy. Obtaining my Master’s in Social Work degree from California State University, Fullerton allowed me to utilize myself as an instrument for healing and practice as a mental health therapist specializing in trauma-informed care, person-centered approach, solution-focused, and advocacy to best serve my clienteles’ individualized needs. I believe in utilizing one’s strengths to find pathway for healing, as I guide you utilizing Socratic questioning, understanding thought patterns, behaviors all while restructuring schemas and meaning of life that best align with you. To request an appointment please visit foresightmentalhealth.com

I embrace a culturally humble stance, and am LBGT welcoming.

name: Caroline Redmon
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Does depression or anxiety prevent you from accomplishing goals you have in your life? Do you focus on your failures so much that you can not recognize your accomplishments? I can help you change your perceptions of how you view yourself, other people, and the world around you. As a psychotherapist, I can help you work through childhood issues such as broken family relationships or bullying, and help you see yourself in a positive way.  In my former years as a pastoral counselor I have become comfortable with helping people explore issues of spirituality, faith, and doubt. We are created to be in relationship and a part of my work is to help people discover their inner trust so that they can create a healthy and honest relationship with themselves and other people.  You don't have to suffer silently alone. The first step of reaching out for help can be the hardest. But it can be the first of many steps to finding contentment and peace in your life. It takes courage to take that step. You just may discover you are stronger than you think.

name: Emma Eulalia Gómez
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MA, LCSW
about: I want to create a space for you to feel, heal, grieve, and increase joy.  My approach values collaboration by helping you establish positive habits, boundaries, and ways of thinking.  By listening, witnessing, and being present I will support you on your journey to self-understanding and self-acceptance.  My work is trauma-informed with a focus on intersectional identity, social justice, and affirmative therapy approaches.  If you are currently navigating crisis, depression, trauma-symptoms, anxiety, or grief that life brings I can be a witness and guide to help validate and manage your feelings and experience.  I have extensive experience serving Queer and BIPOC young adults, individuals, and families.  In my work I will acknowledge any experienced systemic oppression or trauma that had lead to your erasure.    I am therapist with multiple intersecting identities; a fat, Latinx (light skin privilege), queer, cis-woman dedicated to holding sacred space for my clients and developing healing connections. I look forward to finding individualized ways to support you.  It will be an honor to watch you living your truth and finding peace.

name: Alana M Meixner
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Everyone goes through bumps, twists, and turns on the road of life. Sometimes life gets a little harder and you look for something more to help you manage. I can work with you to help you navigate what life throws at you, whether it be stress at work, problems with dating, making and maintaining friendships and relationships, or simply adapting to transitions of life. Working together we can help you find just the right balance in your life. I have extensive trainings in trauma-focused therapies, grief and loss, psychodynamic therapy, interpersonal therapy, and cognitive-behavioral therapy. I have extensive experience working with patients who are depressed, anxious, or have been traumatized or victimized in any way. I specialize in both long-term and short-term treatment and will work collaboratively with you to determine what would be the right fit for your needs.

name: Torria Payton

about: Torria Payton is an Associate Marriage and Family Therapist, AMFT123106 working under the supervision of Yvonne Jackson, LMFT92389. Torria received her Master’s degree in Psychology with an emphasis in Marriage and Family Therapy and Professional Clinical Counseling from Brandman University. Torria earned her Bachelor’s degree in psychology from California State University, San Bernardino.   Torria’s experience stems from working with both adults and children. She is a former Career Coordinator specializing in assisting individuals with disabilities, justice involved, homeless populations, and Veterans along with their families.  Torria can assist you to reduce stress and anxiety with mindfulness tools and techniques. She will assist you in managing difficulties that may seem overwhelming by helping you to set goals and identify your strengths to overcome the challenges of everyday life. You will be encouraged to express your emotions and experiences without judgement for guidance. Don't be afraid to seek support in any life challenges that you may be experiencing. It is alright to need guidance but no one should have to suffer in silence. Reaching out for the support you need shows the strength within you. I can assist you in building resiliency back into your life and I am ready to go on this journey of healing with you.

name: Valesia Ho
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Dr. Valesia Ho is a licensed clinical psychologist with a focus in evidence-based treatments, behavioral medicine and working with individuals and couples coping with sleep disorders and concerns related to sexual health. Her clinical focus is in behavioral medicine working with individuals and couples coping with sleep disorders and concerns related to sexual health. Her approach values and affirms the inherent uniqueness of each person and couple by taking into account biological, psychological and cultural factors that impact emotional and physical health. Dr. Ho emphasizes an active, collaborative and strengths-based approach while building rapport through curiosity, humor and authenticity. In addition, she believes a strong therapeutic alliance and a sense of safety is at the core of any therapeutic relationship and this safety can allow people to access their internal experience without fear of judgment. Dr. Ho has conducted research in the areas of transdiagnostic treatment of depression, anxiety, stress and personality disorders, and has also researched suicide risk in inpatient psychiatric populations.   Dr. Ho enjoys working with adults and couples in the East Bay, San Francisco and Marin, and via telemedicine across the state of California.

name: Michelle May
title: Licensed Educational Psychologist, LEP, MS, MA, PPS
about: California Licensed Educational Psychologist (LEP) with 20+ years experience working with families to advocate for the best interests of school-age children & youth. Extensive experience determining whether children/youth meet special education eligibility criteria for specific learning disability (SLD), other health impairment (OHI), Autism, emotional disturbance (ED), intellectual disability (ID) &/or traumatic brain injury (TBI). Skilled in crafting legally defensible psychoeducational evaluations, functional behavioral assessments (FBAs), individualized education plans (IEPs), IEP goals, testing accommodations, etc. Independent Educational Evaluations (IEEs) for children (ages 4-18): On behalf of families &/or school districts I conduct comprehensive psychoeducational, IQ, cognitive, processing, academic & social-emotional assessments. Note: I do not offer counseling or therapy services. School districts interested in learning more about my services and fees, please reach out for a complimentary 15-minute phone consultation.

name: Maayan Bick
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I am passionate about helping children, teens, parents, and individuals gain strategies on how to cope with existential dread, manage emotions, navigate changing relational roles and identities, and build resiliency during times of uncertainty and grief. My empathetic nature plays a role in my therapeutic style. I collaboratively work with those who experience symptoms related to anxiety, depression, grief, ADHD and Autism, in order to reach relief and feel happier within, and in relationships. As a relational therapist, I specialize in a family systems approach filtered through an attachment-based framework. I am trained in EMDR, art/play therapy, inner-child work, and trauma-based modalities. I offer psychoeducation on how to emotionally regulate, how to understand our unique needs, how to communicate our needs, & how to shift our perspective. My approach to therapy is realistic and provides: (a) compassionate support and understanding, (b) strategies for how to foster self-regulation and heal attachment wounds, (c) help in making transformative changes, and (d) ways to improve communication in your relationships (with your self, child, parent, friend, partner, coworker, boss, etc.).

name: Sandra (Sandi) Bohle
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, MFA, AMFT
about: Personal change and growth come from an encouraging, supportive, safe, compassionate, and empathetic environment where an individual can discover oneself and grow. Are you finding those coping mechanisms which once worked for you no longer are? Do you struggle to find a connection to yourself or others? Are you finding yourself still struggling with things that happened long ago and you don't understand why? Having the courage to work on one’s relationship to self and others can be powerful, deeply healing, and perhaps one of the most loving actions one can do.  I work from a Psychodynamic approach synthesized with Dialectical Behavioral Therapy, Mindfulness, and EMDR while incorporating humor, play, and somatic modalities to help individuals address the various challenges that life and relationships often bring. My goal is to work collaboratively with my clients to help them find healthier ways of being.  As your therapist, I will collaborate with you at your own pace. Together we will discover the thoughts and emotions driving you and learn new ways of coping. We will explore what is underneath those unwanted thoughts, feelings, and behavior and begin the healing process.

name: Bella Stitt Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
title: Counselor, LPCC, LCSW, LMFT
about: Is excessive worry or anxiety limiting your life? Do you want to feel better and live a happier life? Helping our clients overcome social anxiety, public speaking fears, OCD, panic, excessive worry and depression is our primary focus. By using proven therapy methods (We are Cognitive Behavioral Therapy specialists) we will focus on specific problems, solutions, and reachable goals. We provide much more than traditional talk therapy and help you get results to improve your emotions and your life. By doing this we can help rather quickly. Call to schedule a free phone consultation. Our counselors not only provide the support, guidance, and expertise needed for your improvement, but we also use evidenced based techniques and cognitive behavioral therapy to promote rapid change. We will connect you with the best counselor for your situation and put you on the right track from the start. We would be happy to speak with you about your situation during a free phone consultation. We have male and female counselors available who can help you individually, as a family, or as a couple. Call or email us to schedule an appointment.

name: Brooke Belong
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: I provide a safe, supportive and non-judgmental space in which you can build trust and feel confident in working through the difficult situations that have brought you here. The decision to pursue therapy is not an easy one, and takes plenty of courage and strength to reach out- be proud of yourself for taking the first step! My therapeutic style is authentic, collaborative, gentle, and solution focused, utilizing skills from a variety of treatment modalities in order to create a treatment plan that is as individualized as you. My specialty is working with adolescents and young adults who are struggling with anxiety, depression, life transitions, and relationship conflict. I have experience working at an Intensive Outpatient program, where I facilitated group therapy and coordinated client’s care, engaged in risk assessment, led mindfulness groups, CBT and DBT skills groups. My goal is to support you in finding and utilizing your inherent strengths, in order to help you create a life worth living. In these challenging times, we can work together to move toward growth and address the parts of you that are seeking nurturing and healing. I will meet you where you are at, and work with you to getting to where you want to be.

name: Ginger Swanson
title: Psychologist, PhD, CHT
about: I provide a safe and caring relationship. With trust as our foundation, together we explore what is calling for clarity, change, or comfort. I help you to identify and disengage from old destructive patterns, habits, and beliefs. I also help you to find and anchor new ways of being your authentic and joyful self in the world. If we are in harmony with ourselves we are much better equipped to foster healthy relationships with others. I help you get beneath anxiety, sadness, guilt, and shame to feeling honor, respect, and love--starting with yourself. I work with a Jungian lens.  I have studied depth psychology, shamanism, dreamwork, and hypnosis extensively. Exploring the realms of the unconscious is my specialty. I help you bring that which lies buried in the unconsciousness to consciousness, where healing happens. Together we explore the roots of emotions and together we tend and heal your soul. If you would like help in overcoming obstacles that seem insurmountable to handle alone, I am a phone call away and available to help you. My office is located in Santa Barbara, California. I work with clients across the country and abroad, and am available to work with you in person, on the phone, or on-line.  Phone me today!  Dr. Ginger

name: Bret K. Johnson
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My therapeutic approach is geared to address your specific needs based on your strengths, goals, and current concerns, including cultural, family, mental health history, and relevant diagnostic issues. I utilize an empowerment and strength-based approach to help you access your best inner self through: identifying and accomplishing your life goals; achieving a calmer state of mind; improving problem solving and creative potential, no matter how difficult your circumstances. I have extensive training in multiple therapeutic methods including cognitive-behavioral, strength-based, positive psychology, psychodynamic, family system, and Jungian approaches. For further information, I prefer to be contacted by phone. I teach graduate and other seminars on a regular basis regarding the above approaches.  PLEASE NOTE:  I am currently limiting my work primarily to tele-health, teaching and consulting.  Please feel fee to contact me, yet be aware that I might be traveling and away for small blocks of time. I encourage and thoroughly enjoy working with issues and goals aimed at authenticity, diversity, curiosity, trauma recovery and being your absolute, best personal, deep self. Feel free to reach out and discuss your needs, hopes and dreams!

name: Kenneth Rasmussen
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: In your search for a therapist, you will want someone who both understands what you are going through, and who is passionately committed to working with you to figure out where you want to go and how to get there. Therapy is above all a process and journey of self discovery which requires a guide who is patient and supportive, and at the same time encouraging and persistent to help you understand your self and the often hidden patterns of your life and relationships that hold you back. I offer a healing dialogue that is pragmatic and integrative, while providing a trusting environment for growth and change. My experience with a variety of types of patients and disorders, including depression, anxiety, severe mental illness, personality and behavioral disorders, has given me a background for understanding your unique issues. I bring to my work my experience as a teacher, and a caring, empathic approach, that will spark your curiosity about your relational and inner world, and engage you in a trusting, collaborative partnership for self and life transformation.
issues: ['Chronic Pain', 'Depression', 'Parenting', 'Relationship Issues', 'Spirituality']

name: Nina Bratcher
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Are you in the midst of uncertainty and finding yourself feeling on edge, anxious and overwhelmed? Are you in a transitional phase of life and feeling disconnected from yourself or others? Do you feel haunted by ruminating thoughts that you just can't seem to set aside? Are you feeling confused about why you can't seem to leave the past in the past and move forward? Rest assured, you are not alone. There are underlying reasons for your experience. Together we can explore what is happening for you. I will help you shed light on what your emotions are communicating to you and identify tools for navigating life with more ease. My approach to therapy is integrative, trauma informed and humorous when appropriate. I will work with you to explore your thoughts and feelings, identify underlying beliefs that generate  distress and practice tools for coping. My hope is to support you in walking away feeling seen, heard and equipped with the confidence to effectively manage emotions. It is my goal to work collaboratively with you to identify therapy goals in alignment with your individual needs. Together we will establish a trusting, respectful therapeutic relationship so you can learn to navigate life's challenges with increased awareness, greater balance and a sense of clarity. I look forward to connecting with you!

name: Robert H Hopcke
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: For three decades I have been privileged as a marriage and family therapist to make a difference in people's lives.  Though I am most known for being a Jungian-oriented therapist and author, my training in pastoral counseling and spiritual direction, my experience in long-term psychodynamic treatment, and my long-standing interest in all the many forms and expressions of human sexuality, as an "out" gay therapist and activist, are areas of expertise that come together in my work to help clients find a way to be their deepest, healthiest and most authentic selves. In addition, my extensive experience in supervision and consultation in a wide variety of settings has led to my special interest in providing smart, sensitive psychotherapy to other psychotherapists, so they might use the insight into their own depths in service of fulfilling their own vocation as nurturing healer.

name: Leo Teles
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: The way I work, simply put, is all about you. It’s about your goals and what is important for you to achieve. This means I will not only witness your growth process and encourage you; but I will also tell you whenever I feel you are preventing yourself from becoming the person you want to be. I will ask you questions to understand exactly what is happening with you. For example, if you tell me, “Im anxious”, I won't assume what that means based upon my own beliefs, but rather I will be curious, ask questions and I will try to learn more about what that means to you. Let me help you. Congratulations and welcome! You just took the first step for a change and I am happy to help you search for a new path in life. Nobody knows your life better than yourself. Together, we can collaborate and find solutions and changes you want to implement. Originally born in Brazil, but earned my first Master's Degree (Migration Studies) in the UK in 2009.  I moved to the US in 2012 and earned my 2nd Master's Degree at the California Institute of Integral Studies (CIIS). My website is: www.leoteleslmft.com

name: Shannon Wilson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I have over 20 years of experience providing psychological services to individuals and families. I received my Master’s Degree in Clinical Psychology from John F. Kennedy University. I specialize in advocating for children in the divorce process and Parent-Child Interactive Therapy. I am also a motivational wellness speaker and performance enhancement specialist for staff, teams, and individuals. I work with patients who struggle with depression, anxiety, post-traumatic stress, behavior disorders, and ADD/ADHD, as well as people who are dealing with adjusting to major changes in their lives like grief, chronic illness, and divorce. My approach involves techniques like Cognitive-Behavioral, Sand Tray, Play Therapy, Art Therapy, and more. I have spent my life living in an awake and positive perspective. I have a natural pull to a joyful way of being. My spontaneous and authentic style has inspired many to recognize their own personal power and to step beyond their limiting beliefs. I currently live in Fl and am a mother of three.  I personally embrace the challenge of living life fully without regrets and inspire my patients to do the same. I believe that life is about choices and that part of my job as a therapist is to guide you and help you see the balanced, healthy choices you can make in your own lives.

name: Serena Mccormick
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My approach to therapy is to bring awareness and understanding of underlying beliefs and roles that perpetuate anxiety, depression, relational issues, or feeling "stuck". By identifying these, we can work towards healing and shifting the beliefs and roles into something that better serve you as a human being. Many of our beliefs and the role that we assume in life are so ingrained within us that we don't even see how they may be causing us issues, that's were I can help bring light and awareness into play and create a comfortable and safe environment for growth and change. I also love working with couples (Emotionally Focused Couples Therapy trained). My goal in working with couples is to facilitate the process of healing relational bonds and getting partners to a place where they can become each other's safe place, number one person, first priority, most fulfilling source of love, peace and comfort. Looking up a new therapist can feel like the most challenging part of starting therapy. The best next step is to call and get a feel for who I am :) Call or email me for a free 15 minute phone consultation to see if we are a good fit. You can ask questions, tell me about what you’re hoping to get out of therapy etc.

about: I provide a safe place to discuss those issues that may keep you stuck and unable to enjoy your life in the present moment.  I am genuine and compassionate.  I will listen and support you where you are, helping you to find the way that is right for you.  I am not bound by one theory or set of tools. name: Robin Apple
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: As an integrative therapist I combine tools from cognitive-behavioral, psychodynamic, interpersonal, and mood regulation therapies. I treat adults and older adolescents battling mood, anxiety, eating, interpersonal and life transition challenges. I consider treatment options as they relate to a patient's needs given the empirical support available. I find the psychotherapy process to be most effective when done collaboratively. For the past 22 years in addition to maintaining a  private practice, I worked as a Clinical Associate Professor at  Stanford's Department of Psychiatry until July 2015.  I was trained at UCLA (Ph.D) and at Oregon Health Sciences University (post-doctoral fellowship). In addition to providing longer-term psychotherapy, I also have extensive experience helping patients cope with health issues, work challenges and life transitions. In such cases, shorter-term, goal-oriented approaches, such as cognitive-behavioral and supportive therapies can often provide useful frameworks for getting started. Psychotherapy is not always easy; it has both benefits and risks (e.g. in discussing difficult material sometimes individuals feel worse before they feel better). Creating an open, supportive environment in which individuals can feel comfortable talking about most everything - including the therapy process itself - is my goal.

name: Sarah Jennings Wray
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I believe that every person has the potential to change and grow in spite of life's challenges. My background is in trauma and grief, which I view as the primary stressors manifesting in anxiety, depression, and difficulty functioning in day-to-day life. I support my clients in growing beyond their negative life experiences so they can experience confident hope as they move forward in life. I enjoy working with people of all ages, and I maintain specialty training for early childhood (birth - 5) and teens. When working with clients, I utilize a collaborative, strengths-based approach that incorporates cognitive behavior therapy, family systems theory, attachment theory, and solution-focused therapy. In utilizing these approaches, I view our times together as opportunities for learning skills and planting seeds, so you have tools to utilize long term. I want to help you cultivate a certainty in your soul that your life has the ability to change for the better. Together, we will increase your ability to ground yourself when life seems out of control, and cope with the stressors, uncertainty, and change that comes with the human experience. I can't wait to help you on this journey!

name: Mary Kay Buckley
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, ACHP-SW
about: I work with anyone who is dealing with loss or transitions in their life, death or divorce and who are interested in growth and healing. I have extensive experience in helping people deal with acute or chronic illness and end of life issues. I work with people who are struggling with addictions or challenged by a loved ones addiction. I believe in change and helping people find their passion. I work with depression, anxiety and personality disorders. In marital therapy I believe if you loved each other I can help you renew that love. I have extensive experience in crisis intervention and short term therapy. My orientation is cognitive/behavioral. I have worked in oncology and hospice for many years and can help you deal with anticipatory grieving, coping with loss and rebuilding your life. I honor a person's spirituality and help people adjust and deal with change and the resultant stresses. Assist with empty nest syndrome,boomerang kids, the sandwich generation, helping aging parents prepare for end of life and care options and helping people adjust to the change and loss in their lives

name: Lynda Paulson
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I seek to be of service to you as you explore therapy as a path to heal and thrive. Taking this step to engage in therapy can feel like a daunting task and I am here to take that step with you. Throughout my practice I have focused on the importance of identifying all aspects of my clients’ lives that impact their well-being (support systems, cultural, work/ school environment, physical health, life experience, faith/spirituality) to provide treatment through a holistic person-in- environment perspective. I offer myself as a partner to support you on your life journey through building connection, bonding and trust. I treat anxiety, depression, bipolar/mood disorders, addictions, PTSD and complex trauma, adjustment disorders, obsessive/compulsive behaviors and grief and loss. I also have supported many in navigating life transitions, LGBTQ+, self-esteem, women’s issues, workplace stress, relationship and parenting conflicts, and the myriad of life challenges. I am a therapist at Octave, a modern behavioral health practice that supports your emotional well-being through a broad range of services. At Octave, we partner with you to develop a personalized care plan that best suits your needs. Learn more at www.findoctave.com

name: Eva Michelle Belanger
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT, SEP
about: Human beings have an innate capacity towards healing and are unconsciously driven to be better psychologically, even when we think we are at our worst.  In other words, we already have all we need to get better, we just need to access it.  Naturally, our bodies, minds, and hearts seek equilibrium, peace and ultimately joy; a fully embodied human coherence.  Together, in a safe, compassionate, and non judgmental environment we can create positive change for you.  My personal goal is to be a safe container for you to explore your internal self, while ultimately helping you reach the goals you aim to achieve in therapy.  I truly believe in people and their ability to self actualize, heal, and to live life with happiness and satisfaction.     Our innate capacity to heal comes from a heart centered place located in our body.  When we get our bodies grounded our thought processes slow so that we can live and think with more ease.  I work first with your nervous system's capacity and reconnect your system into its own grounding presence.  I'm specialized in trauma for individuals, couples and/or families. Specialties include PTSD, identity issues, depression, anxiety, military, & grief/bereavement.  Somatic Experiencing (SE), Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), and Mindfulness are how I practice and help you attain health. There is a safe place within you and around you to embrace and hold close regardless of what you have experienced or what you are suffering through.  It is as accessible as your fingertips and the methods I use with you can help you achieve your full, integrated self; mind, heart, body and spirit.  I often share with my clients the potential we have in being fully here, realized and embodied.  We are ALL on a journey, but not a single one of us can do it alone.  Im honored to be of help in any way I am able and invite you to connect for a free consultation.

name: Mina Grigoryan
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I view therapy as transformation through relationship - a safe haven where exploration, development and change can take place. Therapy can be utilized whether or not you are experiencing severe distress, have a curiosity about you and your world,  or are finding yourself unsatisfied with your current relationships, or circumstances. I have extensive clinical experience in treating the following mental health issues in children and adults: depression, anxiety, trauma, grief and loss. It is important to take care of yourself and if we are a good fit, we can make sure you get what you need. I specialize in working with moms/dads/partners and babies. We are wired to relate and during the transition to parenthood, women and their loved ones have a high need for support.  Women who are pregnant, transitioning to parenthood, post partum, experiencing a pregnancy loss, NICU parents, can greatly benefit from therapy. You have already taken the first step towards a more fulfilling and authentic life; if we are a good fit, let's take the next step together. Call today for a free 15 minute consultation.

name: Mary Ann Lovegren
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: I have been practicing for over 20 years.  I have an office in Camarillo and Westlake Village.  I focus on couples and individuals to help them achieve and understand their personal goals.  You can expect a warm caring environment which will provide you safety and insight on your journey to better overall health. DIVORCE MEDIATION-  This complete legal process provides you with mediation to resolve issues.  Working with a lawyer and myself you'll complete all necessary legal requirements. Additionally, you will save money and time.  If children are involved their well being is our first priority.  This is a completely voluntary process. Call me for more information. Couples-  I have extensive training in couples therapy.  I have been working with couples for over 15 years and really enjoy it.  I take a very positive approach to help couples connect and resolve their most difficult and intimate issues.  I welcome you to call me to discuss how I can help.

name: Melissa Satram
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Do you ever struggle with feeling like you’re not enough? Do you feel like you have to prove yourself? Do you feel stuck and triggered by childhood trauma? The symptoms of trauma include anxiety, depression, high conflict relationships, occupational impairment, addiction, and much more. I believe therapy can help you develop a more self-awareness and actionable plan to alleviate these symptoms. I specialized in working with people who are willing to explore past, present, and future challenges and to find tools for personal growth. I also specialized in multicultural issues and diversity issues such as identity issues, life transitions, and family issues. Over the years, I have worked with children and adults of all ages. By using CBT, Mindfulness, Psychodynamic, and Humanistic approach, I can help you navigate life's ups and downs and shift patterns, thoughts, and behaviors.  As a therapist, I am willing to go on this healing journey with you and help you to develop insight and new skills to live a fulfilling life. I will allow a safe space to let go of your past trauma and rewrite your story. Let's begin to heal. Please schedule your free consultation.

name: Felicia Matto-Shepard
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MFT
about: It is complicated to chose a therapist from such a long list of possibilities.  It is equally challenging to tell you about my work in a few short paragraphs!  Nevertheless, here I go:  I can help with anxiety,  depression, grief, lack of direction, life transitions - marriage, divorce, life threatening illness, empty nest - as well as early trauma, spiritual crisis and sexuality issues.  I am fairly interactive and I maintain a sense of humor, even in the midst of very difficult situations. I am a Jungian Analyst with specialized training in dreamwork, creativity and the intersection of spirituality and psychology.  Some people come to work with me, not because they are in crisis, but because they long for a more meaningful life.  This journey is rich, often awakening more creativity and aliveness. Along with my private practice, I offer retreats for couples and individuals exploring sexual desire.  Read more at AfterTheHoneymoon.org.  I also teach experiential workshops exploring the unconscious through creativity and embodiment.  Read more at FeliciaMattoShepard.com

name: Heidi Poteet Marini
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, , AMFT, ALPCC
about: Life can be hard but I'm guessing you already knew that.  All the hard stuff can leave us feeling overwhelmed, frustrated, or sad. Sometimes life's challenges become too difficult to overcome alone.  Finding a safe and collaborative place to explore and address what is troubling you is the first step toward healing.  Perhaps you are struggling with anxiety, depression, grief, or challenges within a relationship. While there are no guarantees of what you will experience in therapy, research shows that therapy helps people. It works. Psychotherapy can elevate feelings of self worth, purpose, and improve your overall quality of life. I provide a supportive, nonjudgmental relationship that doesn't lose sight of your strengths. As an integrative psychotherapist, I have knowledge in a wide variety of therapeutic modalities including evidence-based practices like CBT, Somatic Experiencing, Brain-Spotting and EMDR. I incorporate psychodynamic and attachment theory to help you gain awareness of patterns from your past that affect your life in the present. Together we can work on cultivating self-awareness and insights that can foster a more peaceful life.

I am a strength-based therapist who can assist you in recognizing your strengths and use them to your benefit. I am a collaborative therapist, which means we will work as a team. Please give me a call. I will love to see if we are a good fit.

name: Justin Forman
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Many of us reach points in our lives when we feel anxious, overwhelmed, depressed, or just generally unhappy. Making the choice to go to therapy can be a difficult decision.  However, once that choice is made, it sets the healing journey in motion. With this one decision, you will have the opportunity to explore those places within yourself that need tending in a caring, supportive environment.  My practice is guided by the idea we sometimes need support, and by working collaboratively we will find the tools and insight to build a foundation for a more productive and satisfying life.   I work in a way that respects all of the life experiences, beliefs, and personal strengths each individual brings into therapy.  To do so, I draw on multiple therapeutic approaches to embrace that diversity of experience and arrive at a plan and style that is best suited for each client. I enjoy working with adolescents and adults and have experience helping those with depression, anxiety, PTSD/trauma and autism spectrum disorders.   I look forward to hearing from you soon. ****MY PRACTICE IS CURRENTLY FULL. IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE ADDED TO A WAITING LIST PLEASE CONTACT ME***

name: Becca Ferguson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MS, LMFT
about: I enjoy helping individuals and couples from 18 y/o through late adulthood. If you need help improving your life & your relationships, I can give you the tools you need!  My clients tell me I am genuine and easy to talk to, and they feel they leave each session with realistic tools to improve their day to day lives. I like to work with a variety of individuals, couples, and families, on trauma, anxiety, depression and other issues, and I specialize in working with individuals with all types of sexual problems such as porn and sex addiction. I also love working with people with intellectual disabilities and Autism Spectrum Disorder.  I enjoy working with teens, adults and couples to enrich their daily lives so they feel more fulfilled. I work with various addictions, sexual issues, anger management, relationships, anxiety, mood disorders, social skills, and any other issues you face. You can count on me to help you help yourself...and the relationships you would like to preserve. Although my practice does not take payment from insurance companies, I offer a receipt detailing the date, type of treatment, and expense.  Many of my clients are successful in obtaining at least partial reimbursement for the service. You may call your insurance company to find out what percentage they will reimburse to you.

name: Cyla Fisk
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, PMH-C
about: I’m passionate about helping women transform their lives. Supporting them on their path to growth and healing. Being a woman in today’s modern world is hard. There’s pressure to have a healthy relationship, successful career, to be a good parent, and to be physically and emotionally healthy. High expectations of us take a toll on our minds and our bodies. Many women I work with talk about losing themselves and feeling frustratingly stuck. You want to feel grounded and confident. You need time to look inward and heal. You’re ready to develop a pathway forward, one where you feel hopeful and in control. You're in the right place. I provide holistic therapy to women and mothers. My specialties include complex trauma, pregnancy, postpartum, early motherhood, life transitions, depression and anxiety. I am perinatal mental health certified, Attachment Focused EMDR trained, and have extensive training in trauma treatment. My approach is warm, authentic, collaborative and relational. Whether this is your first time seeking therapy or you've been through this process before, I know that beginning therapy can be daunting. If you believe we may be a good fit, contact me and I will answer any questions you may have. I am LGBTQIA+ affirming. I offer a safe space regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, religion, or ability.

name: Jazmin Briseno
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Do you often feel sad, worried or affected by past trauma? Are you struggling with your self-esteem or adjusting to new events in your life? You came to the right person. I am a Licensed Clinical Social Worker and have experience working in the area of Mental Health. With me you will find a safe place to express your feelings and find different avenues to cope with these different emotions. I provide a warm, safe and non-judgmental space through telehealth. I can guide you in developing different strategies to assist in improving your daily functioning whether it be at home, school, work or out in the community. I work with young children, adolescents and young adults in the areas of adjustment, family relationships, life transitions/ managing life stressors, trauma, anxiety and depression.  I utilize art, mindfulness, guided imagery and muscle relaxation techniques to assist in reaching my clients daily tasks and goals. I hope to be of assistance in your journey to your mental wellbeing.  Feel free to contact me for a free 15-minute consultation. I humbly welcome you to my safe space and commend you for taking the first step in your personal growth and development.

name: Richard M Chambers
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Do you believe you are created for relationship and continually asking yourself, "Why can't I make it happen? or Why is it such a struggle?"  Your early connections or attachments will have an impact on how these questions may be answered.  The goal is to journey together in a safe and nonjudgmental therapeutic relationship developing awareness into your self perceptions and how you relate in the world. We will work to uncover the areas of your life where you are emotionally stuck, experiencing painful memories, trauma or unresolved feelings of terror, rage, panic, shame, grief and disgust. Incorporating a neurobiology leading edge therapy, Comprehensive Resouce Model, which provides brain and body safety, and we will uncover the emotional obstacles and facilitate the healing of disrupted attachments, which will release you to engage in healthier thought processes, behaviors and relationships. Ultimately, establishing a new relationship with self.

name: Alison Little
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I enjoy working with a wide range of individuals and have experience working with children, teens, adults and couples.  Areas of particular interest include:  life transitions, relationship issues, self confidence, anxiety and depression.    I enjoy helping clients build a mix of internal resources with mindfulness, emotion regulation skills and ways to feel more relaxed in their bodies.    I also work with clients on integrating additional resources in their healing such as nature, community supports, sports/physical activities, religious/spiritual supports, cultural supports and artistic or creative endeavors. My approach is gentle and direct.  I utilize a mix exploratory techniques, goal setting and treatment planning in my therapy.  I am a "real person" in the room with clients and respond genuinely.  I feel very respectful of the challenge and vulnerability of seeking help and offer a nonjudgmental space for clients. Reach out to me for a free initial 15 minute video consultation to see if we are good fit to work together.

name: Bryce A Malek
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: You already have the power to change your life, although you may not know it yet.  Together we can uncover the issues that keep you from living life to the fullest, and to identify the means and resources necessary to make those changes.  Facing the obstacles we create to keep us from changing can be painful, but not catastrophic, and the result can make it all worthwhile. I believe that whatever your problems may be, relationship issues, feeling stuck in your job or career, suffering from worry or anxiety, depression or fear, you can learn how your thinking affects your emotional state, and how you can change both to reconnect with your life purpose. My background in the arts, television production, psychology and social work gives me a unique perspective to work with individuals of all ages and backgrounds, to help them conquer their personal demons and live the lives they dream about.                                                   Currently, I have openings on Thursday evenings for your convenience.

name: Becky Reno
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, PhD, MSW, MA
about: It is an inevitable part of being a woman (inclusive of any self-identifying woman) that we will go through significant transitions in our lives. It is in these moments we may feel called to live more in alignment with our purpose, and to find greater personal and spiritual fulfillment.  However walking this path can feel isolating, and knowing how to begin the journey can feel overwhelming; stepping into the unknown often is. We are meant to have a traveling companion. I hold the core belief that transformation is not only possible, it's vital for creating a more equitable and joyful life AND world. I am a holistic therapist focused on supporting people through life transitions, by working to uncover our innate ability to align mind, body, and spirit, and to liberate ourselves and each other. Healing begins when we are in relationship to each other; I will bring my whole self so that I might meet you where you are. No matter where you are on your journey, please reach out for a free twenty minute consultation to see if we might walk this path together for a time.

name: Julie A Weaver
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Everyone has a story.  It takes courage to reach out and tell the details of that story in counseling.  It is my privilege to be the listener in the room, and my hope that you will feel safe and comfortable enough to share the concerns that are holding you back.  Depression, anxiety, grief or loss may seem insurmountable, but together, we can set goals and implement new strategies to move you forward, adding a new and positive chapter in your story. I work with adults, young children, teens, couples and families.  I use (CBT), positive psychology, and other theories to help work through a variety of concerns such as, anxiety, depression and difficulties with relationships.  I have a passion for working with families and children facing divorce, co-parenting, re-marriage and blending new families.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, EMDR
about: I offer a safe and supportive environment to help you identify and resolve unhealthy patterns that keep you from moving forward.  You might be feeling stuck due to becoming emotionally disconnected with your partner, experiencing a traumatic event or struggling to perform at your optimal level at work.  You want to rediscover intimacy, purpose and joy.  Let me join you in developing effective coping skills to manage life's daily challenges.   I am experienced in trauma, relational conflicts as well as depression and anxiety. I look forward to meeting and partnering with you.

name: Angela V Fowler
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA
about:
Are you feeling anxious? Are you having a hard time concentrating or enjoying the things you used to. Are you experiencing anxiety attacks, OCD, or depression. If you said yes to any of these, you might be experiencing an Anxiety Disorder or a Depression Disorder.
I've been treating anxiety and depression successfully in private practice since 2001. 
I also specialize in relationship issues. Feel free to call me to make an appointment for yourself. Anxiety and/or depression can be uncomfortable and even get to an intensity that makes it hard to function. How you feel can be difficult to talk about with friends and family, and if you want to talk about it, it can be hard to explain. I'm successful at helping people recover from anxiety and/or depression. Many, with relationship issues, have said that the help I offer is change that's permanent.

name: Michael W. Ridgway
title: LPCC
about: You are probably here because something has happened in life that has lead you to seek out support or guidance from a professional. Life can get complicated and there is no handbook on how to handle things like depression, anxiety, addiction and relationship problems. It is important to know two things: you are not alone and there are always hidden lessons in the most difficult moments of our lives.  I specialize in teaching skills to help individuals or families with teens manage stress and achieve balance in their life together. My work is informed by primarily Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (M-CBT), family systems, motivational interviewing and collaborative brief therapy.  I believe that our previous experiences can affect our current functioning but do not necessarily define who we are or become. Whether you’ve been in therapy before, or this will be your first time; it is important to feel safe and comfortable enough to talk about things that are causing distress to yourself, or to your family.  Allow me to join you on this journey of self-exploration, empowerment and change, as you begin creating new habits on your new wellness journey.

name: Dorothy Geiger LMFT & Associates
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: This past year has brought many of us face to face with ourselves. You may find yourself haunted by the past. Or perhaps with fewer distractions, you have "gotten in your head" and are find that you don't know how to be still with yourself. For many, relationships and finances have been strained beyond their limits. This year has brought extremes. Some people find themselves without a job or purpose and too much time on their hands. Others are being pushed to their limit in multiple roles such as working from home while trying to managing their children's online education. Most everyone is looking for some relief right now. We can help you find the path out of this. There's a lot of value in just having someone to talk to about all the things going on inside you. But therapy was never meant to be a place where you just paid someone to listen to you. What if you could truly feel grounded and find healing - even while the world around you seems out of control? At Dorothy Geiger, LMFT & Associates, all of our practitioners specialize in dealing with "the deep stuff." We don't just put bandaids on deep wounds. We are committed to going to the core issues and helping our clients be who they always knew they could be. COMING SOON - 4 week PTSD Group.

name: Lara Curry
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Hello! People have always talked to me, so becoming a Marriage & Family Therapist was natural for me; and with over 40 years of experience I can work with people who have issues that affect themselves & their families, & help lighten their burdens at the same time. Helping clients resolve issues they find troublesome and seeing them to that moment of hope and change is a core value of my work.  I enjoy helping people with self-defeating or damaging behaviors, or shifting how they interact with others, to eliminate anxiety and depression, alcohol and drug problems, or just learning ways to be happier, calmer, and more at peace. Each client is unique, but the goals I have for them are similar. Helping clients increase their self-esteem, halting negative "triggering", assisting with creating positive expectations and helping them develop the personal skills to generate a more satisfying life are always minute to minute concerns I have for my clients in therapy. I believe most problems can be resolved if viewed from the right perspective, and shifting perspective to understand and explain is a hallmark of my work. Trust is the vehicle on which therapy runs and I deeply hope my clients feel a sense of trust and being respected and understood by the close of the first session. Looking forward to working with you!

name: Sheryl Doering
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, ATR
about: As a survivor of trauma, do you find anxiety and sadness blocking you from your true self and your connection to others? You may be fed up with experiencing the same cycles that pull you away from the life you want to live. I believe in you and your ability to get through the toughest storms life may throw your way. I help you safely process & navigate these storms while working on gaining new insight & tools you can use for a lifetime. If you are ready to take that next step of exploring the quality of life that awaits you, I will be honored to support you on your journey of healing.  You can reclaim your life one step at a time.  As a trauma-informed therapist, I specialize in working with women & teens experiencing anxiety, depression, which are often the result of relational trauma, sexual abuse & sexual assault.  I offer a feedback based, collaborative approach. Sessions consist of a combination of talk therapy, & experiential activities to gain insight & learn new tools.  I honor your courage in seeking support. One of the greatest joys I've had is witnessing clients feel empowered, develop new insights, & begin to thrive. I would be honored to take that first step with you or your loved one today.  Please Email or Call me to set up your FREE 15 minute Phone or Video Consultation TODAY. I would be so HAPPY to hear from you.

name: Regina Famiglietti
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I help people cope with life stress, anxiety, and relationship issues. If you need assistance with a relationship (communicating, intimacy), anxiety, depression, life adjustments, or loss; therapy can help. I provide an open space for clients to express their thoughts and feelings about their lives.  It can be difficult to reach out for assistance, however, I can be reached by phone, email or my website www.counselingwithgina.com for more information on my background or to schedule an free 10 minute consultation to see if we are a good fit for your counseling needs. I take a holistic approach to counseling and consider all aspects of you and your background. I  offer face-to-face in office visits and I also provide video Tele-Health Counseling, which can be done from the safety of your home. I honor the work it takes to be in a relationship, part of family and to connect with others. I am a person who has been married 30+ years and know life can be difficult.  Therapy can help you connect with yourself and other people. Please call or email. I will be glad to assist you.

name: Janine Porter
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Seeking therapy is a brave choice and a valuable step in the healing process. If you are pursing therapy for support through a difficult time or transition, for healing childhood wounds, if you are feeling emotional pain or hurt, having trouble navigating a difficult relationship, and/or seeking deeper self-exploration, betterment and growth, I commend you. This is a courageous first step.  There is no right or wrong way to go through therapy. I believe in the individual, and thus tailer my approach to each client and their unique needs. I will most often utilize a combination of modalities to best suit the client, and specialize in psychodynamic, humanistic, client-centered, creative play-based, and solution-focused approaches.  Finding a therapist you feel comfortable and safe sharing with is invaluable. Therapy is in fact a journey we will enter together, so feeling emotionally secure with your therapist is of the upmost importance. I strive to create a secure and supportive environment that facilitates healing and growth without judgement.

name: Linnea A. Weston, LCSW
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Sometimes in life we come to feel like we have run out of answers and don't know where to turn. Sometimes we just can no longer deal with others, our kids, our work or even ourselves.  If this sounds like you or someone you know, then I can help.  I can provide a safe, supportive and confidential environment that allows us to work together, using your natural strengths to find answers, increase your sense of well-being and life functioning. I have provided therapy services to adults and children in the  Butte County community for 20 years. I provide therapeutic treatments that decrease stress, anxiety, depression, and effects of past and current traumas.  Therapy will also increase positive behaviors, problem-solving skills, self-worth, communication, anger-management and parenting skills . Much of my work focuses on trauma related therapies. I have been EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization Reprocessing) trained since 2009 and EMDR certified since 2014. I am also a US Navy Veteran.

name: Sharon Valentino
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, CHT, LMFT
about: Are you having challenges that rob you of the joy and success you deserve? Are you as happy as you want to be? Is your life working out the way you want & expected it to? We all cope with stressors in different ways. I help people deal with stress more successfully with caring, + the powerful tools that therapy provides, to achieve results & solutions.Therapy isn't only for people with problems, who are depressed or anxious. Your therapy is an important tool to improve your life, happiness, relationships, well being, & self awareness - helping you change habits or establish healthier ones. Stress makes life difficult - it even kills sometimes. I help people deal with it successfully and help find better outcomes with results oriented support  for stress, anxiety, depression, relationships, addiction, coping, panic attacks, low self-esteem, co-occurring disorders, PTSD, grief/loss - & more.                                                             In Sausalito for SF Bay Area people. Many I've helped used substances (food, drugs, alcohol) & become addicted. Others withdraw or have relationship difficulties, anxiety or depression because their stress feels overwhelming without support. I'm solution focused for you.                                                                                Call for my flexible hours, including evenings & some weekends.                                   My web & blogs offer psycho-educational help too.

name: Marcus Flathman
title: Psychologist, PhD
about:
I believe that healthy people seek counseling. Taking time to honestly explore our thoughts and feelings about life is a respected tradition in virtually every culture and faith tradition. Therapy can be pursued not only to handle problems, but also to find more meaning in life, to live with more energy and zest and to increase the joy of being alive. Feel free to visit my website (www.DrFlathman.com) to learn more about me and the services I offer. Building a meaningful therapeutic relationship is at the heart of my approach. A healthy therapy relationship opens our eyes to experience life in new and growthful ways.

The dominant traditions that inform my work are psychodynamic approaches, especially object relations therapy, self psychology, and Jungian therapy.

name: Kenneth McNeill
title: Associate Professional Clinical Counselor
about: Are you tired of struggling with your mental wellness on your own? We all have ups and downs in our lives. But wouldn't it be great to feel a reassuring undercurrent of serenity and resilience, no matter what is happening in your outer world?  What you want is equanimity, and the way to get there is by turning your focus inward, and embodying the courageous leader of your own internal family of mind parts.  Along the way, you will rediscover your innate capacity for awareness, creativity, and compassion. As your therapist, I take the time to research, test, distill, and integrate ancient wisdom with modern neuroscience for treating psychic  and  psycho-physiological imbalances of all types in a sustainable way. Allow me to help you experience the freedom and possibilities of a clear mind.
