name: Misty Barnett
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Misty Barnett, LCSW is a wife and mother who values relationships and building a healthy community. Misty earned her BA in Psychology at Simpson University and her Master’s in Social Work at Chico State University. She is trained in Cognitive Processing Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Motivational Interviewing, Triple P, Triple P Teen, Sexual Assault and Domestic Violence Advocacy, and Child Abuse Prevention.  Misty works with the person within the context of their social environment. Misty works to reduce symptoms of trauma, anxiety, and depression by increasing coping skills and teaching skills to reduce in helping thought patterns. Addressing these patterns will empower children and adults to chase after their goals and focus on their wellness. “I believe that people are their own best expert. They know what may or may not be helpful for them. I provide a safe space to unpack and make sense of stressors in a nonjudgmental environment.”

name: Andrea Nortz
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: As a therapist specializing in supporting children, young adults, adults, and couples, I appreciate that you chose to seek mental health care from me. I offer my clients support, insight, and encouragement using a strength based approach to help them recognize and identify the resources they have already successfully used in the past in order to resolve current conflicts, struggles, obstacles. I will listen closely to you with both empathy as well as compassion. Together we will explore your thoughts and emotions and collaborate in order to create your goals.  How do you want your life to change? I draw from many therapeutic styles, including solution-focused, narrative, mindfulness, and cognitive therapy. I have more than twenty years of experience working with children and their parents as a middle school math teacher and over seven years of experience as a marriage and family therapist. I have worked with people experiencing anxiety, depression, grief, self harm, divorce, low self esteem, school difficulties, academic struggles, conflict resolution, marital issues, parenting and relationship issues.  I look forward to connecting with you.

name: Sabine Starr
title: ACC
about: Do you have free floating anxiety, feel alone and overwhelmed and/or important decisions to make? Do you desire to feel a strong belonging in your life? I can help you gain clarity and live a fulfilling life within your current situation and onward to your goals. Life will start to feel right again, as it should. My specialty is to find and offer what gets you results and empowers you. Many of my clients have been in traditional therapy for decades before coming to me and are happy with my unique approach and results even when they had felt stuck. Some of my clients are new to therapy and make good progress once establishing a good trusting relationship with me and working together. My goal is to achieve much in little time. I offer a unique combination of a profound science background (psychologist), enriched by the Life Fulfillment Coaching Model, Hypnosis, NLP and Energy Psychology methods as a solid basis for my work. As an intuitive Coach I can facilitate the alignment with your inner wisdom.

name: Jacqueline Gonzalez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: My name is Jacqueline, and I am passionate about helping individuals and families facing unique life challenges. I have many years of experience working in the mental health field. My approach in therapy is an interactive, non-judgmental, safe place to help meet your goals. I use psychoeducation, CBT, DBT, solution-focused, and other evidence-based modalities. I assist you in gaining self-awareness and tailor treatment plans around your needs. I believe together; we can create a plan for positive lasting change. I strive to provide a safe therapeutic environment that will allow you to express your authentic self. All human behavior has a purpose and is an attempt to meet a need. It isn't until we discover what that need is and find a "healthier" or more "productive" way of meeting that need that the behavior no longer is necessary.  I  would be honored to walk along the side of you as you begin your personal transformation journey. - Jacqueline “Practicing self-love means learning how to trust ourselves to treat ourselves with respect and be kind and affectionate to ourselves.”- Brené Brown.

name: Judy Ho
title: Psychologist, PhD, ABPP, CFMHE
about: I conduct psychological testing for a variety of purposes, including forensic evaluations and expert witness work, neuropsychological evaluations to assess cognitive functioning and damage from brain injury, and psychoeducational evaluations to examine whether learning disorders exist.These evaluations conclude with detailed written reports use for diagnosis/treatment planning, individualized educational plans (IEP), and criminal and civil courtroom cases including fitness for duty, workers' compensation, harassment issues, ability to parent, and professional board licensing disputes. In all evaluations. I utilize Best Practices and empirically proven instruments, and provide recommendations based on the testing results. A comprehensive evaluation  includes a detailed examination into an individual's emotional functioning, personality structures, cognitive functioning, innate abilities, and current achievement and academic or work performance. Psychological evaluations are a formal, structured, and scientific way of gather objective information about an individual. I specialize in evaluating neurocognitive functioning, attention disorders, deciphering difficult/multiple diagnoses, assessing the effects of traumatic brain injury, evaluating educational strengths/weaknesses, evaluating fitness of duty, workers' compensation, personal, psychological, and physical injury after an accident, and making specific recommendations for each person's unique psychological and mental condition.

name: Amyanne Freeburg
title: Psychologist, PsyD, ABPP
about: Every person and family is unique, with a different set of life  circumstances. There is no one-size-fits-all therapy and the process  of resolving problems has to be individualized to the needs of the person or family. Life stressors can be frustrating, as can be the processing of each person's own life challenges. Whatever the need might be we will work with you, your child, and/or your family.    You are not alone....We are here to help. Dr. Freeburg is a licensed psychologist and board certified with the American Board of Professional Psychology. She has been working in the field of psychology for the past 16 years. Her background includes experience with corrections and inpatient hospitals, as well as community mental health centers and private practice. Who do we treat? Children, adolescents, adults, and families. We utilize individual and family therapy modalities. We also have a series of parenting classes available.  We have experience with depression, anxiety, traumatic exposure, attentional difficulties, post-traumatic stress disorder, psychosis, and personality disorders and patterns, and sexual/physical abuse.

name: Erika Moreira
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: You may've wondered why you couldn't just be happier, more confident, or less anxious. Perhaps you find yourself heartbroken or sense that your relationship is in trouble. You may feel stuck in a career or project with little motivation to move forward. Maybe you're struggling to handle painful emotions or a traumatic past. If left unaddressed, these difficulties may lead to depression, anxiety, or a host of relationship issues that can stop you from creating the life you want. What would your relationships, health or career look like if fear, anxiety or depression were no longer obstacles? In our work together, we'll explore a deeper part of yourself and uncover possible patterns that may be contributing to your current challenges. We’ll develop mindfulness practices to help you handle painful feelings, thoughts and beliefs. I have extensive experience in providing trauma-focused, creative arts therapy and mindfulness-based cognitive therapy to people of diverse culture, education, and economic backgrounds in LA. Visit my website to learn more, and schedule your free consultation today.

name: Jeff Machgan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MDiv, LMFT
about: Life often feels like a roller coaster. Our story is full of ups, downs and surprising turns. Maybe we lose our job or spouse, or face a major life transition. A child may move to a new school, have parents separate. Sometimes we experience a traumatic event. These things impact us, they shape our story.  But we get to set the pace and the direction of where our story will go. Reaching out for therapy is a powerful step in writing the rest of your story, and you are about to take the next brave step in your story by seeking help. My desire is to come alongside people and help them grow in their understanding of themselves and their relationships so they can navigate life to pursue their best story. I use a combination of therapeutic approaches adapted to the needs of the you, the client. However I begin by establishing a safe place and collaborative relationship with my client. The reality is that all of us are facing difficulties and we are trying to grow and adapt the best we can. Sometimes we just need another person in our life that we can feel safe with, to help us face and understand our own thoughts and feelings so we can move forward. I'm passionate about helping people get unstuck and pursue an authentic life.

name: C&C Center For Healing
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Due to current events around COVID 19 I am offering Telehealth sessions. My passion to work with people started when I was placed into foster care at 15. It was during this time I realized how life experiences can change and drive our moods and behaviors. Trauma impacts and influences everyone and can alter the way we perceive and interact with people and the world. I will empower my client's to address their past traumatic events and begin to heal themselves through therapy. I believe that everyone has resilience within them and with the right support, client's are able to take back control of their lives. I have been trained in Trauma Focus Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TFCBT), which is an evidenced based practice. I have worked with many adolescents, young adults and families to empower themselves and make change. My treatment and approach pulls from Psychodynamic, Trauma Focus and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.

name: Don Gershberg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I enjoy working with adults  to help them develop understanding and perspective to deal more effectively with the issues, dilemmas and stressors of modern life including anxiety, depression, chemical dependency, and the unresolved issues of traumas and grief. My experience and expertise include the use a variety of modalities and tools which have helped my clients increase their awareness and coping skills in the areas of chemical dependency/recovery, codependency/recovery, stage of life and relational conflicts, issues of spirituality, issues of sexuality and issues of childhood and adult trauma. My graduate training includes an MA in Counseling Psychology with an emphasis in Depth Psychology from Pacifica Graduate Institute. I am trained and certified in EMDR,  meditation and mindfulness based  practices and other somatic psychotherapies, in conjunction with traditional Psychodynamic and Cognitive approaches.Additionally I am a longtime student in the Ridhwan School/Diamond Approach.

about: If you have struggled to find a therapist who understands the intersection of race/ethnicity, culture, and sexuality and gender can have on your life and your mental health. If you feel like you're looking for a therapist who understands race and sexuality issues. If you're feeling lonely, depressed, and lost and confused about who you are. I am passionate about partnering with you and helping you along your journey towards your greatest self. I also have training in relationship and sex therapy. We can work towards solutions and lasting change. Ready to learn more? Visit me at my website to check out how I can help, or if you're ready to boldly discover you and take the next step forward in life, call me or email me to get started today!

name: Rafael M. Reyes
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Dr. Reyes has years of experience in the field of psychology and has had extensive training in the treatment of child and adolescent issues.  His practice currently focuses on helping children and families overcome issues related to behavior problems, depression, anxiety and anger.  He also sees adults for the treatment of depression and anxiety.  Dr. Reyes has practiced in San Diego for the past ten years and is also affiliated with Sharp Mesa Vista Hospital.  He speaks fluent Spanish and can provide all services in both English and Spanish. Dr. Reyes formulates an individualized treatment plan for each of his clients, understanding that each person is unique.  He typically takes a Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy approach to conceptualization and treatment of psychological disorders but also uses other modalities as appropriate. Dr. Reyes is fluent in Spanish.  He is not only bilingual, but bicultural as well and has had good success establishing rapport with a diverse client population.

name: Lauren Cona
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am a licensed therapist with over 10 years of experience in mental health care. I specialize in working with adults in their 20s and 30s who are experiencing depression, relationship or dating issues, anxiety, trauma, career or academic stress, burnout, socio-political stress, or who are just feeling stuck or lost and wanting to make a change. I view wellness through a holistic, social justice lens and am attentive to issues of race, culture, gender, income, disability, and spirituality. I incorporate empathic listening, curiosity, and humor alongside therapeutic modalities such as compassion-focused therapy, mindfulness, and CBT. I strive to create a safe, judgment-free space where we can work together to process difficult feelings, explore new ways of thinking and coping, and prioritize your self-care. Finding a therapist can feel overwhelming, especially in these times. To bring some ease to this process, I always respond to emails within 24 hours. Please feel free to reach out and we can schedule a quick phone chat to see if we're a good fit.

name: Skylar Martin
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Hello! It is my honor and passion to help bring about meaningful, positive change in your life. My approach synthesizes research-based practices and psychological insight, drawing from attachment, emotion-focused therapy, internal family systems, and somatic psychology. I value collaboration and partnership in the therapeutic process in order to instill a sense of agency and empowerment that you innately possess. As your therapist, I am empathic, compassionate, non-judgmental, patient, and open. My focus is to help you process and heal from life’s challenges and transgressions; you deserve to live a fulfilling, peaceful life. I have experience working with individuals, couples, and families coming from all stages of life facing a variety of issues. My special interests include working with trauma, identity, sexual disorders, and relational challenges. Other issues I have experience working with include depression, anxiety, substance use, infidelity, crisis, and family conflict. Though you are not defined by your past, I hold a special place for recognizing how it has impacted you and compassionately explore how it has shaped the way you respond to events in your life as well as the adaptive strategies/patterns that may have been wired within you. Healing will not always be linear, but I will be there with you every step of the way.

name: Julia Burkes
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Sometimes we can feel stuck. Maybe you find yourself repeating habits that are hurting you and/or others but you can't seem to stop the cycle. Perhaps you have had a painful experience that you are having difficulty healing from.  It may be that you are so anxious or overwhelmed with negative feelings, it feels hard to enjoy life and move forward in a meaningful way.  Or possibly, it's just that you can't seem to shake that critical voice inside that says you aren't good enough. Together, without judgement, we will work to help you process experiences, feelings and behaviors that are getting in your way, and forge a path to well-being and greater freedom. I take an integrative approach to therapeutic work, utilizing evidenced-based treatments such as CBT, mindfulness, and insight-oriented psychotherapy. I provide a safe and supportive environment where you will be able to achieve greater self-understanding, confront fears, and develop new skills in order to live a more joyful and authentic life. Let's work together to help you start living better!

name: Danielle Dunchok
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I am a licensed psychologist interested in helping others heal emotional trauma and live more gracefully. I specialize in treating extensive sadness and anxiety, perfectionism and work conflicts, life transitions, relationship issues, spiritual/existential crises and unresolved grief. Though I provide important psychological tools and practical steps to get better, my work also quarries deep to the heart of the problem, identifying the painful pattern at its root. I believe that by intently listening here to the essential disappointments and losses suffered, we can finally become more ourselves, and life can improve substantially. My style is warm, collaborative, and exploratory.  In session, we reflect together on what life has been feeling like, how you are responding, and the impact this may be having on the rest of your circumstances. I have found that this approach facilitates long-lasting benefits in one's self-awareness and ability to outgrow common relationship struggles. My clinical training is in contemporary psychoanalysis, attachment theory, and mindfulness. In addition, my personal interests in eastern philosophy and the performing arts also inform the way I think and listen. Please call for a free phone consultation to learn more. I look forward to getting started.

name: Brittney Green
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate
about: Life can feel impossible to avoid struggling and we often don't feel we have the skills to cope successfully through. Unfortunately, sometimes we don't have all the resources we need for a given situation. Parts of us take on desperate roles trying to help us to survive. This might look like anxiety, depression, PTSD, addiction, and relationship/family issues. I aim to help you process unresolved issues and feelings and find solutions. I specialize in IFS, DBT, and CBT to help my clients to identify their internal parts and help these parts to discover healthier skills for coping. I can also help you discover new coping skills which include mindfulness, interpersonal skills, and emotional regulation techniques.   I also utilize EMDR to process trauma and reinforce positive self-beliefs. I also help my couples and families to discover their internal parts and help conflicting parts to de-escalate, and utilize new skills to meet one another where they are. Couples and families can improve their relationships by sharing their resources more equitably. I will hold a compassionate space for your healing journey. Please book a free consultation.

name: Lucy Strand
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I specialize in working with young women in their 20s & 30s who are experiencing feelings of anxiety, depression, overwhelm, and/or a general feeling of "stuck-ness". Young adulthood can be filled with transitions, decisions, and expectations--and can also be a time of incredible growth and self-discovery. A portion of my practice is also dedicated to working with teen girls who are experiencing similar feelings of anxiety and depression, and wanting a safe space to address their identity struggles and overall feelings of disconnection. Please visit my website for more information: www.lucystrandtherapy.com Specialized areas include; anxiety, depression, therapeutic coaching, improving self-esteem, relationship issues, life transitions, family conflict, emotional regulation, grief, trauma/PTSD. For the past 5+ years, I've worked in community mental health providing trauma informed therapy with adolescents, adults and families. To me, finding the right therapist is all about the fit! I encourage you to reach out and set up a phone call to start talking about what it is you are looking to get out of therapy and I'm happy to answer any questions that you may have!

about: I help clients find their freedom. I believe that there is hope in every situation and I am skilled in working with client's who have a hard time believing that they can overcome. I have experience working with anxiety, depression, trauma, communication, and relationships. As a  Christian therapist I believe in a holistic approach to treatment and focus on the physical, spiritual, and emotional needs of a client.  I specialize in utilizing Cognitive Behavioral Techniques, Dialectical Behavior Techniques, Narrative techniques to identify problematic thoughts and language which leads to alternative moods and alternative behaviors. If you feel like you just need a little hope or you feel like you can't remain in the state you are in any longer, reach out and call.

name: Pauline Garabet
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Pauline is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist who believes that a safe connection between the client and therapist is essential and the foundation of healing. Pauline’s approach is rooted in cultivating a secure space for you to explore your inner challenges and self-limiting beliefs. She utilizes key methods outlined in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Emotion-Focused Therapy. In addition, Pauline is certified in Reiki and can provide energy healing and chakra balancing through this technique. She believes that each person deserves an individualized plan of action, with these guiding principles at the forefront when co-creating your treatment plan: focusing on self-expression, intrinsic positive attitudes toward self and others, and creating personal goals to build new and healthy habits.  She promises to honor the space that you invite her into, support you and provide you with the encouragement and accountability that your unique process deserves. Although she helps others heal through emotional and relational challenges, Pauline’s own journey leads her passion and commitment to helping others find healing and freedom.

name: Ann M Prieto
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I am an LMFT dedicated to helping my clients reach their goals with a varied clinical background in working with clients of various ages, ethnicities, and presenting issues. My primary experience has been with children and teens who are struggling with the effects of trauma and behavioral difficulties that impact school, home, and social functioning. I also have a passion to help adults with trauma and grief and loss issues. Depression, anxiety, and eating disorders have also been a focus of my training and experience along with several of experience bringing Christian-based approaches to clients and couples who request this. I am trained in Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) and love using this modality to help children, teens, and young adults with trauma/abuse backgrounds heal from PTSD. I also regularly use cognitive behavioral therapy and integrative approaches to help clients struggling with depression, anxiety, family issues, and eating disorders. I understand that taking the first step to make a therapeutic appointment can be very scary. I also hope it will be an empowering experience for you. I look forward to hearing your voice, introducing myself, and seeing if I might be a good fit to help you find hope, healing, and start the process of reaching your goals.

name: Dr. Smita Kapoor
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, DMFT, LMFT
about: Nothing in the world can bother us as much as our minds sometimes; life’s challenges become overwhelming and upset the people around us and us. When these challenges become overwhelming, you don’t have to manage them alone. As a therapist, I recognize it could be challenging to talk or seek help. So, as a therapist, I provide my clients a non-judgmental, safe and caring environment to express, process, and explore their feelings. I work with children, teens, adults, couples, and families. I specialized in treating addiction, anxiety disorder, trauma/PTSD, OCD, relationship issues, low self-esteem, shame/guilt, and depression. I work towards instilling hope and strength in my clients. I have over eight years of experience in the helping profession. I use a holistic approach when working with clients. Over the years, through my education and experience, I have understood that one shoe doesn't fit all. Therefore the approach is individualized based on the client's needs. I am a certified EMDR Therapist; EMDR therapy enables people to heal from the symptoms and emotional distress resulting from disturbing life experiences. Our work together will help you develop a thoughtful acceptance of your life, re-connect you with your inner strengths/values and empower you to cultivate new tools to live a healthy life.

name: Kristine M Chadsey
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Eyes Forward. Heart Open.                                                                                                                      As a holistic and integrative psychotherapist, my passion is towards empowering others to tune into their natural well being and align with the fuller version of themselves. Everyone has the ability to connect and harmonize with their true self, gain greater clarity and understanding of their higher purpose, and move into more joyful and satisfying lives.  I utilize meditation,  mindfulness, visualization, and expressive modalities to access greater self-awareness. My wish is to inspire and guide my clients into letting go of old beliefs, behaviors, and attitudes that interfere with living more satisfying and joyful lives.  I assist my clients in developing a deeper sense of trust and confidence in themselves, their intuition, and their ability to create and manifest their desires.   I welcome adults of all gender, race, religious and ethnic backgrounds and offer in-person, tele-therapy, and/ or consultation sessions. Please contact me if you have any questions or are interested in scheduling a session.

name: Catarina Maria Rodrigues
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MFT
about: Life guarantees all of us ups and downs- but in our highly individualistic culture, it is common to believe that one ought to be able to handle their own difficulties. In reality, stressful life events,transitions and challenges can become much more manageable with consistent support. Through active listening and reflection,I assist clients in accessing their own intuition about what makes their life feel satisfying. Therapy involves a growing self awareness that often uncovers outdated beliefs and patterns. I truly enjoy guiding clients through this discovery process.This often involves a look at how culture and upbringing influence behavior. Supporting people make choices that feel joyful is my life's work. Self esteem enhancement,couples counseling and parenting are specialties.My background includes counseling at the San Francisco Art Institute and teaching Psychology at area colleges. "Think with the whole body" is a Zen saying that captures my view of the innate wisdom of the body/mind. Throughout the years, I have been inspired by how much information is revealed through the body's symptoms.My practice integrates creative expression, bibliotherapy, visualizations and various cultural perspectives.

name: Tynisa D. Snow
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I provide individual, group, and couples therapy for adults.  Clients of all faiths, cultures, ethnic groups, religions, sexual orientations, and gender identities are welcome.  My focus is helping clients process and work through problems involving depression, anxiety, relationship issues, loss, trauma, stress, and life transitions. I utilize Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) and Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT).  In my practice, clients are encouraged to consider treatment interventions involving their thoughts, emotions, physical bodies, and spirituality.  Clients are empowered to reduce emotional pain, develop insight, determine goals, and improve relationships. I am a licensed psychotherapist in the state of California with over 15 years of experience working in mental health clinics and the public sector.  My therapeutic work is based on the belief that some of the most challenging times in life can bring about positive change, growth, and transformation.

name: Silvia San
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: We are living unprecedented times that can contribute to symptoms of depression, anxiety or feeling overwhelmed. Are you feeling sad, anxious, unmotivated, going through a life transition or having difficulty connecting with your loved ones? If that's the case, I'd like to help. You don’t have to go through this alone.  We'll work collaboratively to address emotions, thoughts and behaviors that can be contributing to the way you're feeling. We'll explore possible solutions and consequences to your current challenges. I provide a safe and non-judgmental space for you to share your feelings and discover/remember your inner strengths. My approach is supportive and gentle however, I might challenge you if that offers an opportunity for growth.  I have experience and success treating depression, anxiety, trauma,  substance use, psychosis, and personality disorders.  I utilize evidence-based models and a tailored approach to fit your needs and to help you achieve your therapeutic goals. Making the decision to start therapy and/or choosing a therapist can feel overwhelming and intimidating, I applaud you for taking the first step toward personal growth and living a life that is congruent with your values.  I offer a free phone consultation, do not hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.  Looking forward to meeting you! Estamos viviendo momentos difíciles y desafíos que pueden contribuir a síntomas de depresión, ansiedad, o a sentirte agobiado. Juntos trabajaremos en emociones, pensamientos y conductas que están contribuyendo a la manera en la que te sientes. También exploraremos posibles soluciones y consecuencias a los problemas que estás teniendo. Ofrezco un espacio  seguro que te permita expresar tus sentimientos y recordar/descubrir tus fortalezas interiores. Mi enfoque es suave y empático pero te confrontaré sólo si ésto ofrece una oportunidad de crecimiento. Tengo experiencia y éxito en el tratamiento de depresión, ansiedad, trauma, uso de sustancias, psicosis, y desórdenes de la personalidad. Utilizo modelos terapeúticos basados en la evidencia y un enfoque basado en tus necesidades y objetivos terapeúticos.   Entiendo que el tomar la decisión de empezar terapia y seleccionar a un terapeuta puede ser un tanto intimidante. Por eso aplaudo tu decisión de tomar el primer paso para cuidarte a tí mismo.  Ofrezco una consulta gratis por teléfono. Por favor no dudes en contactarme si tienes alguna pregunta o si quieres hacer una cita. Espero conocerte pronto!

name: Doug Aucoin
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Taking the first steps to make changes and move towards recovery and growth is often not easy but feeling better matters. You may feel as if you’re struggling even if you’re smart, hard-working and motivated, but you can feel better. Clients come to therapy burdened with such things as anxiety/mood concerns, grief/loss issues, low self-esteem, LGBTQ+ issues, men's issues or challenges with life transitions. You want to move forward and make positive changes but are not sure where to start. Have a mature, relational, compassionate and insight- oriented therapeutic partner with you on this journey. If you contact me, I will reach out. Having helped hundreds of clients in San Diego for the last 20 years, I’d enjoy taking this journey with you. I’ve worked in community mental health, hospice, psychiatric hospitals, substance use and seniors’ programs. I utilize proven interventions such as Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Mindfulness-Based, Strength-Based, Motivational Interviewing and more. Come work with a therapist who is skillful, genuine, and warm, who will help you explore difficult issues while feeling safe and supported. To utilize your in-network insurance benefits, follow this link and click the ‘request a consultation’ button: https:/internal.helloalma.com/providers/doug-aucoin/. Let's create a plan together towards change and growth.

name: Mary-Anne Wijting
title: Counselor, LPCC, NCC
about: **SESSIONS ARE CURRENTLY VIA VIDEO OR PHONE ONLY** Hopeless, stressed out, trauma, communication issues? It takes courage to face challenging situations in life and to decide to reach out to a mental health professional for counseling.  I use counseling strategies that aim to alleviate emotional stress that occur in depression, anxiety, and emotional trauma in adults and children. Poor self-image and communication problems are areas that I feel confident to work with. My overall goal is to help alleviate your emotional pain and to help you find useful coping strategies for your personal needs. I utilize evidence-based approaches such as EMDR, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), and Solution Focused Approaches in my counseling practice. These therapy techniques have been shown to deliver results and make a difference in a relatively short amount of time. I enjoy working with adults, adolescents and children. Therapy can feel like hard work and it requires commitment and staying power, but it pays off.  I will be there to encourage you and guide you through the therapy process. I look forward to working with you and helping you reach your goals.

name: Amy Borst
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, ATR-BC, LPCC
about: Self-exploration continues throughout our lives. Our efforts to find peace and self-fulfillment can be accomplished through introspection and processing. I employ a variety of therapy modalities that assist with the exploration process in a manner that feels comfortable and safe, leading to those moments of understanding and acceptance. Art and EMDR Therapy combined can assist with reaching a deeper level of self-awareness in a non-threatening manner, and also allows for reprocessing recent and past traumatic experiences. With a willingness towards self-awareness, both modalities can be utilized to achieve ideal adjustment. I offer a creative combination of Art and EMDR Therapy, in addition to traditional talk therapy. My over-arching approach is to bolster strengths and resources with a focus on increasing self-kindness and acceptance; decreasing self-criticism and blame. At times, I provide take-home exercises that can be utilized outside of session time, or between sessions. Creative problem solving and self exploration, including becoming aware of and working through trauma, can assist in moving us forward in our lives, ultimately overcoming obstacles and towards desired outcomes. The work in therapy adds to the existing foundation in achieving your best self. My approach is client-centered. Available openings for new clients.

name: Brooke A. Foster Psyd
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: My approach as a clinical psychologist has been nonjudgmental and client-centered. I want my clients to feel supported, respected and valuable.  I am deeply passionate about helping others, serving my community and witnessing people grow. My purpose is to walk along the side of my clients, provide guidance and clinical support. I have been providing mental health treatment to individuals for 15 years. I have worked with a variety of clients and embrace diversity. It would be my privilege to work with you.  An area of my clinical strength is working with individuals who have struggled with depression and anxiety. I have worked with adults, couples, adolescents and children. I focus a lot on attachments, thinking errors, feelings and behaviors. I believe when we can learn to address these areas, we can identify the changes needed to have a more fulfilling life.  It is important that individuals feel safe, secure and comfortable when talking with a therapist. My desire is to create a healthy therapeutic relationship with my clients to allow for them to process their thoughts and feelings openly. Thank you for your time and please reach out to make an appointment.

name: Ori Lidor Psy.d.
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: If you've found me here then you must be gearing up to make some changes in your life. Maybe you're worrying too much and happy too little. Maybe you're feeling lost, hopeless, or in a rut. Wherever you are, you've decided you want to feel better and be better, and you've shown the courage to ask for support. What a wonderful thing. My work with you will be collaborative, caring, and non-judgmental. I will help you reconnect to your inner-resources and strengths, to build new coping skills and problem-solving strategies, and to then apply those new ways of "being" in order to live a life that feels fulfilling and joyful to you.   In addition to my diverse training and clinical experience, my specialty is in supporting men of all ages in cultivating courage, conquering anxiety, and living a life that they can be proud of. My other passion is supporting teens and their families in addressing the challenges that may arise during adolescence...as these can be tricky times.      Making the decision to seek therapy is an investment in your future, and I aim to make that investment a valuable one to you. You and I will create a plan tailored specifically to your needs, one that will address your goals and lift you up to where you want to be. You no longer have to deal with this alone. Call for a free phone consultation today!

name: NLP Mastery - Self Mastery Aaron C. Barry
title: MTNLP, NLP, TLT, CLHP, ECBC
about: Intimate partner violence, Sexual Assault is a real problem. (7 out of 10) The shame and torture of the untold story. Crying when no one is looking. Wine, multiple partners, pills, hiding. Time isn’t being friendly. This ever looming weight in the distance. Unwanted outbursts. You can’t sit still unconsciously trying to fill this dark void. Swept under the rug by humiliation, hopeless  and in despair, cold and without reprieve. Less than whole, desperate to know that there is an end that doesn’t end it all. I see you. Let me reach inside and tell the little one it’s going to be okay. Utilizing neuro-linguistics compassion and the pursuit of happiness you can learn how to become completely whole. That brazenly fearless 3 year old who used to strip and run naked down the street. Life is supposed to be fun. It will, together we relearn a new path to peace. Pick up the phone right now and call me. The time is now to reclaim what has been lost to the past. Together we will redefine you with a new passion for life. All incoming calls are screened and you, my client are the most important part of my work. Leave a message so I can respond to your hearts dearest wish. Check my google reviews at  abcnlpmastery

name: Dina M Nelli
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Hi, my name is Dina.  I have been working in mental health now for about 22 years.  I am passionate about my work and really enjoy connecting with anyone who is needing encouragement and support.  Because of my life experiences, I feel I can be helpful with those going through/coming out of divorce, raising children as a single parent or going through other life transitions.  I work well with adolescents and eating disorders too.  It's a privilege to walk beside you on your journey.  You are not alone.  I can provide you with a nonjudgemental environment and direct feedback to assist you to get where you want to be. I have worked with women and men, adolescents, couples and families. I have experience working with adolescents struggling with eating disorders. I am understanding of the struggles that may come with divorce and can help you navigate through these waters.  I enjoy empowering women of all ages helping to strengthen their self-confidence and self esteem! If you feel alone or are tired of burdening friends and family with your issues, feel free to reach out to me for a free 15 minute consultation. At that time, I know you will feel supported and encouraged. Even short-term therapy can make a huge difference for anyone. Take the time to take care of yourself and love yourself! You are an amazing investment!

name: Elizabeth Sullivan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: You want help feeling better or making tough decisions. You may feel anxiety, depression, or just a painful conviction that everyone else is doing better than you at life. I will teach you to create more ease, focus, and meaning in your life. My practice is offered mainly through video meetings which we can schedule at our mutual convenience. Clients say they find me direct, insightful and safe. I see many different kinds of people all over the world, but I especially love helping individual overwhelmed working parents--and seeing therapy create more happiness for the whole family system. I draw on the most effective elements of western psychotherapy, neuroscience research, and eastern centering practices to offer clients a way to live with more focus and grace. My practice is offered through video sessions.

name: Sharon Margaret Friedman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, MFT
about:
I encourage you to get help when you need it despite how difficult it feels. As an experienced, professional psychotherapist, I can work with you in an individual or group setting to help you get through your issues and make changes in your life.
 
You may come see me in my Santa Monica, California office or in my New York City office where I see clients once a month. I can also work with you online using Skype. I have clients as far away as London and Hong Kong. Call me if you would like a consultation. I work with patients, from adolescents to seniors. I offer one-on-one Individual Therapy, Group Therapy for Parenting Men, Women in their 30s-40s, Senior Women, and Gay Men.  I also offer Couples Therapy for those entering into marriage and for married couples who are facing problems together.

name: Kim Thompson
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Are you or your child struggling with organization or planning and think you may/they have ADHD? Are you or your child underperforming at school or work and think you/they might have a learning disorder or need accommodations?  I help you to identify if ADHD or other forms of neurodiversity are the source of the challenges, frustration, or pain you and/or your child may be experiencing and I can coach you to overcome the obstacles you're facing. I use research-validated clinical tools to conduct thorough neuropsychological assessments and make sure you understand the results and the most useful interventions. I specialize in neuropsychological assessment for diagnoses like ADHD, Autism, Learning Disorders, Gifted/Talented/Twice Exceptional (2e).  Although I do not provide therapy services, I do provide advocacy to get relevant accommodations implemented as well as education and coaching focusing on accountability and Executive Functioning. I hear and see you- my goal is for you to feel like you are my only client. I know how challenging it can be to get a timely assessment and how frustrating it can be to work with school systems- that's why I advocate for you & provide assessment and coaching (not therapy) so you can become your best self. Book a free consultation at: eastbayadhd.setmore.com

name: Elliot Ruhland
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Throughout our lives we are faced with many challenges. Sometimes these challenges feel insurmountable and we experience difficulty finding our way out of the rut that we’re stuck in. My aim is to empower you to utilize your inner strength and to create solutions that work for you. I am here to provide support on your journey towards self-improvement. I strive to make the individuals I work with feel welcome, accepted, and understood, regardless of the issues that they are struggling with.  Through my experience as an Associate and now newly Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, I have worked with children, adolescents, families, and adults.  I have worked with teenagers in a residential facility as well as with children and families in the community.  I have also worked with individuals struggling with anxiety, depression, trauma, low self-esteem, attachment difficulties, and phase of life issues. I believe that every individual has the ability to improve their lives, but we sometimes need support in doing so. I hope to be able to empower the individuals I work with to find solutions that work for them.

name: Maria Rodriguez
title: LPC Intern, MAEd, PPS, APCC
about: Many things are easier said than done in life.  Especially, when you are in your process of healing after a loss, suffering from depression, anxiety, trauma, or having relational challenges.  I am passionate about promoting growth, personal insight, and confidence as our inner self is where the core of our strength lies.  As a bicultural and bilingual therapist I practice a holistic approach with the diverse population I serve.   I have over 15 years experience serving at risk children and families in educational settings and community mental health/social service settings.  My expertise is in working with adolescents and caregivers experiencing instability.  I am additionally knowledgeable about public educational systems and strategies in working in partnership with educators. I introduce a variety of approaches in therapy based on the individual needs of each person as I recognize and appreciate that no two people are the same.  Some approaches used: mindfulness, solution focused, self/perspective awareness, and strength based.  My style in working with people is consistently transparent, compassionate, yet straight forward. Muchas cosas son más fáciles de decir que de hacer en la vida. Especialmente, cuando estás en tu proceso de curación después de una pérdida, sufres de depresión, ansiedad, trauma o tienes problemas relacionales. Me apasiona promover el crecimiento, la percepción personal y la confianza, ya que nuestro ser interno es donde se encuentra el núcleo de nuestra fuerza. Como terapeuta bicultural y bilingüe practico un enfoque holístico con la población diversa a la que sirvo.  Tengo más de 15 años de experiencia sirviendo a niños y familias en riesgo en entornos educativos, así como en entornos comunitarios de salud mental / servicio social. Mi experiencia es trabajar con adolescentes y cuidadores que tengan inestabilidad. Además, conozco los sistemas y estrategias de educación pública e como trabajar en asociación con educadores. Introduzco una variedad de enfoques basados en las necesidades de cada persona, ya que reconozco y aprecio que no hay dos personas iguales. Algunos de los enfoques son: enfoque en la solución, desarrollo de habilidades de afrontamiento, autoconciencia y perspectiva. Mi estilo al trabajar con personas es consistentemente transparente, compasivo pero directo.

name: Julie Anne Crist
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MAC, LMFT
about: I am passionate about empowering individuals to thrive in life.  Therapy is essential for uncovering and understanding self-destructive behaviors and working through, not around, loss and grief.  I work with adults and teens,  specializing  in trauma, divorce, anxiety, depression, disordered eating, broken relationships, life transitions  and identity.  Therapy can be overwhelming at first, therefore, I provide a safe and trusting environment to uncover and explore new and healthier approaches to life. I approach therapy from a trauma informed, client centered lense, focused on empathy, compassion, and safety to create long-term, effective change.  I tailor my approach to each individual's needs, often pulling from more than one therapeutic style for any individual. My work and life experiences have prepared me to help individuals in changing their lives and implementing healthy coping skills for long term recovery.  These experiences have taught me the importance of witnessing great pain and great joy.  I believe we can not have one without the other.  Together we will collaborate for your best care.

name: Nick Weathersby
title: Psychologist, PsyD, MA
about: So often we live in the grip of anxiety and depression. Our families pull out our worst, the realities of adulthood drain us, loss of loved ones or our own capacities become existential reality, yet the good news is we can always make changes in ourselves to increase our resilience. The work of psychotherapy is serious business. While humor and levity in the present can help lighten difficult memories, we will dive deep into the past with expert attention to inform movement into a more complete future. While earning my doctorate in clinical psychology from the Wright Institute in Berkeley CA, I trained for 5 years in different mental health clinics around the Bay Area. Prior to graduate training, I worked in residential settings with teens and kids who had severe behavioral needs as well as providing case management at a homeless shelter. I have experience with research-supported and intellectually-based therapy for a wide range of symptoms and issues. While I use several approaches to help, I mainly practice psychodynamic therapy. Cultural awareness and sensitivity are of central importance, and I have been fortunate to have worked with people from many walks of life.

name: Lisa Marie Howe
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Do you feel like there must be more to life? Do you feel stuck, frustrated, detached, or uninspired? Work, caregiving, or other life stressors have you feeling burnout? Somehow, despite the persistent demands on you and your time, you feel bored. You feel drained and exhausted but can’t sleep. You are working so hard but feel increasingly cynical about the impact of your efforts. Maybe you can identify the kinds of things you'd like to do, that next professional step you’d like to take or that healthy habit you know will make you feel better, but are having trouble acting on those desires. As a licensed therapist and leisure coach, I specialize in helping people over come burnout by finding meaning and purpose in their lives. Informed by ecotherapy and mindfulness practices, I help people tap into their innate curiosity, engage more fully with life, prioritize leisure time, and improve health and well-being. All living things, like a fern unfurling, have an innate orientation toward growth. People have all the answers they need within them. My job as a therapist or a coach is to act as a mirror, reflecting your inner wisdom. Allow me to shine light on what is already within. Schedule a free 15 minute consultation to see if we might be fit.

name: Lala Oliveria
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Are you struggling with being yourself lately? Are your worries increasing, and your thoughts less logical? I’m here to work with you and for you. To help get your life back on the course you want it to be on. Rediscover what brings you joy and happiness in your life. I have over 15 years of experience in the behavioral health field, working with clients of various backgrounds and needs. I earned my masters of Clinical Psychology with an emphasis in Marriage Family Therapy and Clinical Counseling from Azusa Pacific University, an active California-Board of Behavioral Sciences Marriage and Family Therapist License. I take a whole person, trauma informed approach and have advanced training in Emotionally Focused Therapy, Solution Focused Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Family Systems and Applied Behavior Analysis. Areas of focus include but not limited to Pre-marital/Marital therapy, Family Conflict, Relational Issues, Anxiety, Depression, Substance Use and etc.. Together, we will work to leave behind the worries and gain life-long coping skills. It is my goal to create a nonjudgmental environment of support and acceptance that help you through your distress to a place of healing and hope. Are you ready to take the next step?

name: Jaime Nakasuji
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Are you feeling stuck or dissatisfied with your life? Do you feel the desire to make some real changes in your life? Therapy can be a place for you and I to work through past hurts, unhealthy coping skills and perspectives so that you can move forward in your life. I have extensive experience working with children, adolescents, couples, families and older adults struggling with depression and anxiety. I am also a certified Prepare/Enrich facilitator and enjoy working with engaged couples as well as married couples who desire to work on strengthening their relationship. I enjoy working with adults and couples who desire to build their self-esteem and communication skills. Having received my MA in Theology,  I find it enriching to bring in elements of faith into the session and will do Christian faith-based counseling if the client so desires. I believe that therapy is a transformative experience for those who commit to process through past hurts, gain healthy coping skills, and move forward in life and in their relationships with a better sense of self. Therapy can be hard work at times, but is well worth the effort and investment.

name: Jocelyne Stancic
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Do you self-sabotage? You work very hard to get ahead, strive for success and accomplish goals that you desire. Meanwhile, another part of you criticizes, punishes and demeans everything you’re working hard for. Is it a constant battle between what you want to accomplish, how you want your life to be and that harsh critical voice inside your head? That voice is a big part of your depression, anxiety and addiction. You are not alone and you are not hopeless and doomed to repeat this cycle over and over. I understand that voice and I want to help you find freedom from it. We will work together to replace it with your greatest cheerleader and biggest support. I have successfully treated various issues such as depression, anxiety, women’s issues, trauma, adoption issues, as well as parenting and relationship problems. My approach to therapy is nonjudgemental, attachment-based, collaborative and interpersonal. I believe you deserve all the good things that you want out of life and I would love to help you achieve them. Give me a call and we can get started today.

name: Alex Frank
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, ASW
about: My life and career experiences have exposed me to diverse stories, challenges, and complex situations that inform my practice. My approach uses storytelling, is trauma informed, and uses an asset-based psychotherapy orientation. The therapy I provide is client centered, direct, solutions oriented, and grounded in a deep sense of care. Together, we’ll co-create a safe therapeutic experience to explore how internal narratives and patterns are shaped by systemic, historical, political, or familial stories. I am particularly interested in interpersonal and structural based trauma, and how it manifests in our bodies. For nearly ten years, I have worked with people to move through every-day stressors as well as major life experiences. My background includes working with corrections staff, military veterans, and formerly incarcerated/ justice system impacted people; people with learning disabilities; and those struggling with anxiety, depression, trauma, and grief. I provide a safe therapeutic space for those who need to vent and heal from racial injustice, and the generational effects of white-body supremacy. I'm a lifelong learner and am deeply committed to the practice of moving at the speed of trust, and with genuine curiosity and patience.

My professional experience also includes instructor of graduate courses in Psychology and supervsion of Psychology Interns. I have office hours in Morro Bay, California. I also provide telehealth treatment for patients in both Missouri and California.

name: Kaitlyn Egan
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Life is hard enough for your teen – then you throw in puberty, a slow-growing prefrontal cortex, social media pressures, academic pressure, family conflict, peer conflict, maybe even a biological tendency to be more emotionally sensitive – and ta-da! The perfect Petri dish for anxiety, depression, and other mental health issues has been created. Or maybe your child hasn’t hit teenagehood yet, but they’re exhibiting problem behaviors and/or emotion dysregulation that you both could use some help managing. My goal is to help you and your child make sense of what's happening and together find ways to improve your quality of life. As a child and adolescent psychologist, I provide cognitive-behavioral, evidence-based interventions that are tailored to fit the individual needs of your child or family. I treat a broad range of issues including depression, anxiety, self-harm, suicidal ideation, emotion dysregulation, eating disorders and concerns, and disruptive behavior disorders.  I offer secure telehealth sessions for those in the Bay Area, and I will be offering in-person sessions for San Diego residents in the future. I am pleased to be part of Peninsula Behavioral Health, a Stanford-affiliated center focused on evidence-based therapy. For additional information or to schedule an appointment with me, please visit www.penbh.com.

name: Jennifer Anderson
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Jennifer has experience working with individuals, couples, families, adolescents, and children presenting with a wide variety of issues. She approaches her clients with a psychodynamic framework to gain understanding and build rapport based on creating a very warm, empathic, collaborative, and safe environment. Additionally, Jennifer integrates several treatment approaches such as CBT, Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction, Solution Focused, and Systems Theory. Jennifer has been a clinical supervisor for the past 15 years and has helped trained a number of therapist interns.  Jennifer was Clinical Director of a non-profit agency focusing on court ordered therapy. There she worked with issues such as anger management, victims of crime, substance use, and parenting. Jennifer's experience initially began in the field of Foster Care and Adoption. Jennifer received her master's in Social Work from USC with honors. Jennifer is a member of the National Association of Social Workers. Jennifer currently supervises Mailee Doan, MA, MFT intern and Jennifer Fard, MA, MFT intern.

name: Elena Felder
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: I work with individuals to create a safe place to explore patterns in your relationships, ways to heal from substance use or other self-destructive behaviors, or areas where you are stuck in fear or depression.  I do both brief and long-term therapy with individuals and couples using a variety of techniques and modalities including deep listening, EMDR, relaxation training, exploring connections between current struggles and past experiences, increasing body awareness, and using creative expression as a part of therapy. Therapy can offer a way to reconnect with our creativity, our compassion, sexuality, spirituality and sense of humor. I use EMDR to help clients experience stories from the past as events that are no longer happening, giving them a more powerful sense of themselves and enabling them to create healthier patterns in relationships and a deeper experience of spirituality. I am an EMDRIA Approved EMDR Consultant.  I offer individual and group consultation to therapists who have been trained by the Parnell Institute in my offices and by phone.  I also co-facilitate an EMDR Practicum group which meets one Sunday a month from 10:30-1.

name: Mindy Marie Kaya
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Diving into the next stage of life can have its challenges. Whether it's building a family, marriage, fertility, pregnancy, or as a new Mother experiencing Postpartum, I am here to support you in finding peace in these stages. I will support you with a feeling of complete warmth, and a sense of Motherly love. You will be nurtured in a sacred space of unconditional love and acceptance as you discover who you are in your deepest core and begin to shift out of your old shell and step into your truest self. The self underneath all those layers of judgment, oppression, and years of stories that are not rooted in truth. I use mindfulness, guided meditation, sound healing, reiki, intuitive energy healing, coaching, Client-centered, and relaxation techniques. I specialize in anxiety, fertility , new mothers, negative thoughts, depression, self-esteem, body image, fatigue, interpersonal relationships.  In using eastern and western modalities we can get to the core issue. I will create a sacred space and loving environment creating a warmth of unconditionally being held and supported.  A space for you to feel safe to come and heal in a way that fits who you are. We will nurture a vision of yourself based on love and encourage you to be confident in who you are without doubt.

name: Andrea Cook
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: We are all feeling the effects of the corona virus. For many of us, that means increased chronic stress and worry, and its associated symptoms of fatigue, appetite and digestive challenges, poor sleep, body aches, irritability, and sadness. All appointments are provided using Telemental Health using HIPAA compliant Zoom, so that you can receive therapy by video conferencing in the comfort of your home or other private space. I work with clients from a mind-body-spirit approach to health. With empathy and humor, we work collaboratively to set goals and make changes in multiple areas (e.g., relationships, nutrition, exercise, and trauma) in order to help you thrive. Using a positive psychology perspective, we focus both on decreasing unproductive patterns and building strengths. My experience working with medical providers and my training as a health coach guide my integrative approach to care. I have persevered through health challenges, and built a balanced life that includes rewarding work, a 25-year marriage, raising four children, and enjoying my hobbies of yoga and riding horses. I would love to help you build your ideal life.
issues: ['Chronic Pain', 'Coping Skills', 'Grief', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Sleep or Insomnia']

name: Cybil Gilbertson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Therapy is not something I "do" to you; it is a collaboration and conversation we have together.  I look forward to being your partner in co-creating a place within that feels more like home. I enjoy working with individuals and couples, specifically women and parents. I also enjoy working with couples who may want to do things in a new way than what they have learned in the past; commit, parent, partner, and break-up. I feel especially akin to nature-lovers, out-of-the-box thinkers, and creatives/artistic types. If you are curious to know the wisdom of your body and soul, I may be the therapist for you. What is your gut saying? I collaborate with individuals and couples utilizing a psychodynamic, Depth and somatic-oriented approach. With an extensive background in the arts, movement, and bodywork I feel comfortable synthesizing clinical skills with creative tools which may awaken a place of deep knowing and the ability to self-heal and self-organize. I believe in you. I draw inspiration from the patterns and rhythms in the natural world to best meet client's needs. I believe each individual is both unique and part of the dynamic collective and I look forward to meeting you. I am committed to meeting you where you are, without judgement, and supporting the authentic expression of your life and journey.

name: Annie Ahn
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: You may have reached a point in your life where your usual way of coping is not working as well. With adversity, I believe is a window of opportunity for you to gain insight into your blindspots, heal from emotional pain, and live with more clarity, intention, and confidence. With over 10 years of clinical experience, I have had the privilege to guide clients through difficult times and witness their positive growth and change. I especially have enjoyed working with culturally and ethnically diverse adults at many university counseling centers providing both individual and couples therapy. My clinical specialties are in healthy intimate relationships, stress, anxiety, depression, mindfulness, self-esteem, identity development, life transitions, and family concerns. I have also led a Relationship support group called “What is Love” for many years and am passionate about improving one's intimacy, communication, and conflict resolution skills. My work style is collaborative, relational, and centered on your strengths, needs and concerns.  I welcome you to contact me for a free 15 minute phone consultation to discuss whether I can be a good match for your therapy needs and goals. I wish you the best in your therapy search.

name: Janelle Stepper
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT, MA
about: I believe everyone is doing their best with where they’re at in life. I desire to create a safe, warm, and inclusive space where you are seen and heard. My hope is that through therapy, you can come home to yourself, live more fully alive, and experience transformational healing. I would be honored to hear your story and meet you with acceptance and support. Whether you are hoping to improve your relationships with others or your relationship with yourself, you are worthy of having your experiences validated and understood. I take a client-centered approach to therapy and will create an individualized treatment plan just for you. I am a trauma-informed therapist and am passionate about helping people regulate their nervous systems and heal from trauma, sexual abuse, and PTSD. I also help people experience healing from anxiety, depression, stress, people-pleasing, perfectionism, codependency, unhealthy relationship dynamics, narcissistic abuse, self-esteem, and intimacy concerns. I'm a Certified Brainspotting Practitioner and utilize this powerful body-based modality to help my clients heal from trauma. I deeply value the relationships I form with my clients and getting to empower and support them as they rediscover/reclaim their incredible worth and value. You matter, I'm here for you, and your mental health is worth supporting.

name: Cindy Vang
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My core philosophy on effective therapy is one that is relationship-driven and collaborative of my client’s views and narratives that guide their life stories. I believe that clients are the expert of their lives and that my role is to be a guide and witness to the stories that my clients bring into treatment. Every session is crucial to the overall health and well-being of my clients, and so I believe in creating a space that will allow for freedom, agency, and safety in expressing and fully showing up as one needs to. I am bilingual and Hmong-speaking. I began practicing in 2012 working with adolescent youth and, since then, have continued to contribute my therapy skills with children, youth, adults, and families. I actively use a trauma-informed, narrative, and attachment-oriented approach to working with my clients. I am trained in multiple modalities and treatment theories including but not limited to play therapy, narrative therapy, Child Parent Psychotherapy, EMDR, attachment focused therapies, and motivational interviewing. In my spare time, I enjoy spending time with my family as well as reading, writing, and engaging in other forms of creative expression.

name: Grounded Roots Mental Health Therapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MSc
about: Hello and Welcome! Beginning therapy means different things to different people, but it is often an action of courage, hope, selfcare, and self-determination.  Grounded Roots MHT was developed by therapists who believe that people deserve the highest quality of care.  Our therapist work with a wide ranges of ages from teens to geriatrics to provide a safe space, that allows you the freedom and privacy to discuss issues that are often painful or difficult to discuss with family and/or friends. We work with an array of issues including but limited to: codependency, PTSD,  depression, anxiety, bipolar, schizophrenia, women's/men's issues, racial/gender inequality and LGBTQ. We offer CBT ( explores your thoughts), DBT (changes behaviors), EMDR (trauma processing) and much more. A trusting and authentic therapeutic relationship can be transformative. Often it can be healing simply to be truly heard and understood. We can offer new perspectives and provide insight moving you towards your personal goals to create a life that you enjoy. Doing the "good work" with the support of a therapist can be healing.

name: Rick McCarthy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT, CCTP
about: I have been in practice in the area for over 40 years, working with a very diverse population, including individual's, adults, adolescents, and couples with a wide variety of concerns and complex life challenges. I taught for 28 years, first as an associate professor of psychology at Marymount College, and have taught graduate courses at Loyola Marymount University and Pepperdine University. Twice, I have been the recipient of the Lampert Award from Pacificare Behavioral Health, which quantifies client outcomes. In effect, my therapeutic effectiveness has been ranked in the top one percent of over 10,000 participating therapists. I have an extensive knowledge and experience with a variety of therapeutic modalities, especially cognitive behavioral, brief/ solution-focused, and trauma therapy.  This allows me to utilize that which will work best for you, thus enabling you to achieve the most efficient and effective results. Having taught for 28 years, as well as consulting with the Board of Behavioral Sciences in designing the California State Board Exams for the MFT license,  helps me stay on the leading edge of theory and technique.  I believe in the importance of an integration  and balance of a healthy mind, body, and spirit.

name: Felicia Megdal
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Taking new clients beginning January 2023. You may be experiencing symptoms and discomfort, but you may not know the origin of those symptoms and that discomfort. It may even be pronounced enough that it's causing disruptions in your daily life. Maybe you're feeling sad, depressed, and anxious. Maybe you're experiencing addiction, relationship concerns, work-life balance struggles, or trauma-related issues. Perhaps you're dealing with some type of loss, grief, or major life change. Maybe you just don't feel like yourself. Something is off, but you can't put a finger on it. Or perhaps you just need some support, someone to talk to. I specialize in solution-focused brief therapy. The focus is on what's working in your life and how to improve those areas while finding workable solutions to seemingly deadlocked issues. We will meet between 10 and 12 sessions (not including the initial intake session, which is 80 minutes). I know life is difficult. I know you’re struggling. I know you’re in pain. You don’t have to suffer alone. My job is to provide a safe, nonjudgmental space to process and explore. You are the expert on you, and I will follow your lead. I am here to assist you in identifying what needs to be addressed and help you come up with answers.

name: Paula-Jo Husack
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, CGP
about: "Ease" is not a keyword for our  "Bay Area"!  My practice is a resource library for  real lives.  Whether you're highly visible, invisible, or both--you want some life change. You want a hands-on, motivated professional.  Stress shouts out.  Anxiety, Depression, Panic, Confusion, Conflict, Addictions/Compulsions come forth.  You want strategies for sustained change.  Or, you want short-term problem-solving for yourself, marriage, family, workteam.  My approaches are eclectic, as we define your needs, goals, and choices.   You're motivated to start; and I'm honored to be on your whole-person team! More reasons to meet: Rebuild relationships, grieve losses, enhance performance, diminish challenging behaviors.reclaim identity, transition, blend cultures; help your children, your partner, your parents,...yourself!  Maybe you just need a tune-up. For many reasons, here is your resource library, as you grow and sustain your leadership. Member:  (1) Womens' Assoc for Addiction Treatment (2) Anxiety & Depression  Assoc America (3) CHADD(/ADHD 4) EMDR certified therapist, (5) Int'l Coach Federation (past); (6) CA Assoc Marriage/Family Therapist (6). Co-Author, Catch Your Star & Published Articles (www.leadlifenow.com),  SEE COVD-19 & ANXIETY TIPS.  Founder LeadLIfeNow programs,

name: Amanda Terronez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I am a licensed marriage and family therapist.  I believe the therapeutic relationship is essential to therapy.  Together we will work to accomplish the goals you have for yourself.  I believe that your core beliefs about yourself will impact the way you behave and feel; therefore, by considering and examining these beliefs, you can gradually alter them and consequently, alter your behaviors and emotions. I am a Cognitive Behavioral Therapist; however, my roots in Client Centered have served me well by giving me the tools needed to build the therapeutic relationship.  I am also skilled in motivational interviewing.  Working on school campuses, I've gained much experience working with teenagers and dealing with school concerns, as well. My belief is that we can all use someone to support us in processing our thoughts and feelings.  It can be difficult finding time, money and energy to find the right therapist.  I provide teletherapy via web-based programs or via phone.  I would love to be of service to you on your journey.

name: Shirley Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA, CYT
about: Carl Jung said, "I would rather be whole than good."                           Very often we put pressure on ourselves to "be" a certain way, so much that life can start to feel like acting versus living. This pressure tends to place stress on individuals and can often lead to anxiety, depression, and stress. I believe that therapy can be a tool to take off the masks we have learned to put on and begin to live from our whole self; finding freedom and our creativity.  I believe that through compassion for all the parts of ourself we step closer to freedom. I primarily work relationally with clients and thinking about psychotherapy through the lens of integral, gestalt, multicultural, psychodynamic, and sex-positive lenses.  I offer a background in anger in women, Black identity, codependency, intergenerational trauma, interracial relationships, multiracial identity, and sexuality and desire in women of color. I have  practiced yoga and meditation, and studied various healing modalities and metaphysics over the last 15 years and have taught yoga for over 10 years.  I enjoy supporting folks who are inquiring into their spirituality and soul.  I also work with psychics and empaths in supporting them with healthy boundaries.

name: Cheryl Baldi
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: You can have a life of abundance, peace, hope and joy and I believe one of the bravest things you can do is to begin to understand your unique story. In these challenging times, it’s natural to feel overwhelmed and need additional support. Maybe you’re having challenges with starting a new relationship, having marital difficulties, raising kids, trauma, losing a loved one, school, career, friends, health, self- esteem, or feeling alone or undervalued.  Whatever your unique experience is, we can work together in a safe and caring environment to rediscover your strengths & identify obstacles that keep you from feeling fulfilled.  My approach is to provide a safe and supportive environment while exploring your challenges and addressing what you need to start the process of healing, growth and lasting change.  I use evidence-based strategies to help you understand how your thoughts, feelings and behavior play a role, and work collaboratively to gain awareness and overcome obstacles.   I have had the honor of working with couples, individuals and families for 10 years and am always excited to see my clients feel empowered to achieve their goals, and create a more meaningful life. It takes courage to take the first step, and through empathy and compassion I look forward to helping you along your journey.  I provide online therapy as well.

name: Dr. Debbie Celli-Francis
title: Psychologist, PsyD, MA, BAR
about: CURRENTLY OFFERING VIDEO SESSIONS             I view psychotherapy as an opportunity to enrich your relationship with yourself and the world. Together, we'll create a safe space where you can explore and understand yourself, your strengths, and your challenges. In therapy, we'll develop effective coping skills to use now and in future situations. Life can be difficult but you don't have to figure it out all alone. I know you're struggling with something painful right now ... you've already taken the first step toward healing.                                                                     . I work  from an integrative approach, drawing primarily from a psychodynamic orientation. A significant piece of my therapeutic style is developing effective coping skills with the belief that everyone does the best they can with the resources they have. This is individual, very personal work and is different for everyone, I am able to work as an out-of-network provider with most PPO plans. I can help you figure out how to maximize your insurance benefits and assist you by preparing a monthly super-bill .
