name: Emily Epstein
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: You may have decided that you need a focused time and a safe place to sort through important issues in your life. How do you know when a therapist is right for you? I believe in trusting your instincts.  I invite you to bring your full range of feelings about starting therapy to an exploratory first session to see if we would be a good match. I work with individuals and couples of all orientations and backgrounds. While my work is informed by  contemporary psychoanalysis, attachment theory, and developmental neurobiology, I believe that theory is the servant and not the master. With compassion, humor and reverance for what makes you unique, we will create a theory about what stands in between you and the life you want. Exploring your relationship to yourself, to important others in your life, and how you relate to me will help us in this process. In general, couples and individuals have found me to be active, warm and committed to their growth.

name: Dr. Kristi Foster
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT
about: Life can be challenging. Sometimes it can even be hard to know what it's like to feel safe or content. Learning how to feel safe enough to truly enjoy life, people, relationships, one's own body, and one's own internal world is what therapy is about. It's from that place of inner safety that we can feel healthy, joyful and bring forth the best parts of ourselves. Are you interested in a cutting edge healing process? To succeed in accessing healing capacities, and to resolve trauma I practice a few different forms of somatic therapy: NeuroAffective Touch, Accelerated Experiential Dynamic Psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, and EMDR. Humans have inborn healing capacities that can be accessed through experiences confirming our worth, and by having our needs lovingly met. These needs are meant to be met through tender loving care early in life: a time when we explore the world with our bodies - not our minds. Somatic therapies can help access early roots of human experience for healing. If you could use confirmation of your worth and respect for your innate needs, somatic therapy may be for you. It offers an opportunity to develop a feeling of safety inside yourself, to sense your place in the world, to develop mastery in calming yourself.

name: Miryam Saidian
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: At times, we may face challenges which can leave us feeling overwhelmed, confused, and alone. I will meet you where you are and highlight your strengths as we work together to identify patterns or behaviors that are not serving you. I understand that everyone’s therapeutic journey is different and offer personalized care and coaching as you pursue the changes that you want to see in your life. I work well with individuals and couples who seek to alleviate symptoms of anxiety and depression and learn healthy coping mechanisms in aiming to foster personal growth, as well as developing healthier interpersonal relationships. I believe the most important relationship we have is with ourselves and I work from an integrated approach including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Narrative Therapy, and Attachment theory to explore the client’s core beliefs and rewrite harmful narratives that have formed in childhood or adulthood to facilitate increased self-esteem and confidence. Therapy is an investment in yourself and your future, and I support and honor my client’s goals. I believe in having a collaborative therapeutic relationship in order to create a safe and nurturing environment where my client’s needs are understood and met effectively and empathically.

name: Amanda Flores
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Have you ever asked yourself, "Will I ever be happy again?" I'm here to tell you that the answer is YES! You can feel happy again and you don't have to work through these difficult feelings alone. Struggling with feelings of depression, anxiety, and chronic stress can be debilitating and leave us feeling overwhelmed, isolated, and hopeless. My goal is to provide a safe and compassionate space to work with you on your journey of healing, growth, and happiness. I will meet you exactly where you are in your process and provide treatment that is tailored specifically to your needs. I specialize in maternal mental health, working with women experiencing perinatal and postpartum mood disorders, and have completed necessary trainings to hone my skills in working with this special population. As many as 1 in 5-7 mothers suffer from a perinatal mood disorder. If you are struggling, you are not alone! I am also passionate about working with adolescents and young adults who are suffering from anxiety, depression, relationship issues, and life transitions. It takes courage to address negative feelings, and I commend you for taking the first step in seeking support. I am here to help! I offer 15 minute phone consultations. I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Kimberely Bassett
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MS, AMFT
about: My goal as a therapist is to create a safe, non-judgmental, and affirming space to explore life issues, help you process difficult past experiences, and to provide you with the support and guidance to help you to not just survive the day-to-day, but to heal and thrive. As a therapist, I utilize an integrative, eclectic approach based on each client’s needs. I have experience with Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT), Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), Solution-focused techniques, humanistic approaches, and some somatic approaches. I am passionate about exploring the biological and physiological bases/responses of anxiety, trauma, depression, and emotional dysregulation to help you better understand what is happening in your brain and body when you experience symptoms. In my spare time, I love to hike, travel new places, spend time my dog and cat, draw, and listen to live music!

name: Joni Dickson Garcia
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Do you ever feel that somewhere along the parenting path you lost yourself? Maybe your relationship has suffered? Or you find yourself feeling resentful, short tempered, distant or just plain tired?! I help parents reclaim their identity and their relationship while raising children in an authentic way. You have probably read countless parenting books, blogs, or magazines. You have tried successfully, or unsuccessfully to get your partner on board with your attempts to be the perfect parent. You do all of this because you love your children with more passion you thought possible. But in the process you’ve lost a part of yourself.  In many homes the environment is filled with tension, bickering, distrust, and lack of cooperation. Family members end up isolating themselves in various rooms or they pop in ear buds and immerse themselves in their phones.  I help families increase healthy communication and develop empathy towards one another.

name: Kay Peterson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA
about: Together we can build on your unique strengths to create the conditions with which you can meet life's challenges and feel a sense of genuine contentment. I work with individuals, couples and families struggling with depression, anxiety, relationship dissatisfaction, trauma, compulsive behaviors, sexual expression and orientation, chronic pain, or grief or loss.  Whether you're simply feeling stuck and wanting to feel more of a sense of purpose in life or dealing with debilitating trauma, I will support you in the process of uncovering your inherent wisdom for healing and growth. Call today for a free 15-minute consultation. Through specific humanistic, mindfulness-based cognitive, and body-centered therapies, you will be supported in cultivating greater awareness and a deeper understanding of yourself.  From this empowered place, you will find yourself better able to engage in more meaningful relationships in your life and make clearer, more thoughtful choices in each moment. I bring over 29 years of in and outpatient therapy experience to private practice. As a trained wilderness guide, I also currently lead contemplative outdoor retreats. Ask me about the Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) courses that I also teach throughout the Bay Area.

name: PCIT Institute of Southern California
title: Psychologist
about: Is your child controlling your household with their demands, tantrums and power struggles? Are you feeling exhausted, out of control and defeated? Are you embarrassed in public and afraid that people see your child's behavior as your failure? Are you tired of fighting, struggling, and trying so hard, but getting nowhere? The PCIT Institute specializes in families with children 2-8 with difficulties such as: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD), Reactive Attachment Disorder (RAD), Autism Spectrum disorders, anxiety and difficult divorce reactions. By giving equal attention to the parent-child relationship and to parents' behavior management skills, The PCIT Institute of SoCal enhances parent-child interactions, improves children's behavior, and empowers parents to use consistent, predictable, effective parenting strategies that work.  This cutting-edge, short-term therapy approach has been proven to improve child behavior and enhance parent-child relationships with long-term results.  Visit the PCIT Institute's website today and take our online questionnaire to get insight into your child's behavior and find out if PCIT is right for you and your family! Over 30 published studies have documented the superiority of PCIT over other methods.   Outcome studies have demonstrated important changes in parent-child interactional patterns and have repeatedly shown significant changes with children's behavior problems. After PCIT, children demonstrate significant improvements in compliance and reductions in other disruptive behaviors, such as whining. The effects of PCIT have been shown to generalize to untreated siblings.   Following PCIT, parent study's show an increase in closeness where there are more frequent "positive talks" with their child. Outcome studies have also demonstrated significant changes on parents' mood, as they are often no longer down, distressed, and feel that they are in control. PCIT success is largely maintained at least 6 years after treatment completion with no other treatment.

name: Katherine D Czesak
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My approach is to understand you deeply and individualize our work by finding what is most effective for you. All people are unique and their life circumstances are particular to who they are. Through collaboration, we figure out what is what is most beneficial for your wellbeing and also what is realistic for your lifestyle. I look forward to meeting you and exploring what you wish to change through an initial free half hour phone consultation. My two offices, downtown San Francisco and on Piedmont Avenue in Oakland, are accessible by public transportation. I have assisted clients with a broad spectrum of issues: life-style changes (smoking cessation, alleviating compulsions, addictions, eating habits), improving quality of life  (relationship problems, life-transition difficulties, work related stress, self-esteem struggles, anxiety, and depression), and emotional healing (past and current trauma, sexual abuse), As needed, I incorporate the following techniques as we work together: EMDR, Dr. Robert Miller's Addictions Protocol and Pain/Terror Release Therapy, harm reduction through motivational interviewing, imagery, mindfulness, cognitive-behavioral interventions and positive psychology practices.

name: Paulina Ospina-Mallarino
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, MPH
about: I enjoy supporting you through difficult periods in your life, my practice centers on facilitating a path where you can find your own voice and discover your ability to face challenges, heal from trauma, grow beyond the obstacles and develop empowering narratives from your experience. I have worked extensively with clients who have experienced issues related to "toxic" relationships and past trauma resulting in depression and anxiety. I can help you cope with life-transitions and choices that are demanding and stressful.  I strongly believe that each of us comes into the world with the ability to heal and grow. As a therapist I strive to create an environment of trust, openness and confidence I use tools from solution-focused and cognitive behavioral therapy approaches, family systems, social skills training and creative arts healing. I am bicultural and bilingual; I speak Spanish fluently. I am a Certified Clinical Trauma Professional. I think that reaching out to a psychotherapist is one of the most important steps you can take and one that takes courage and willingness to explore difficult areas of life. I am aware of the delicate nature of the work that mental heath professionals do and will do what I can to help you find answers to your quest for health and joy.

name: Pamela E Butler
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I have worked for the past thirty-five years to help people change the self-defeating habits that interfere with good relationships, health, success and happiness.  Since so many of these problems stem from early traumas and neglect in childhood, I help an individual to identify these psychological traps and change them.  By learning to speak to yourself in a positive manner and by eliminating old reactions of fear and shame, I help you to live a more creative life. I like a client to form a partnership with me to eliminate negative behaviors and build new ways of being. I use Cognitive Behavior Therapy to change the self talk that controls how we live our daily lives.  The tool of EMDR is very effective in reducing anxiety, depression and other negative feelings.  I also use this tool to eliminate headaches and to alter addictive and compulsive habits. I use a variety of skills to tailor my therapy to each individual.  I am the author of two books: Self Assertion for Women and Talking to Yourself: How Cognitive Behavior Therapy Can Change Your Life. I look forward to your phoning to see if there is a good fit.

name: Ali Gunsberg
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, MA
about:
One of the most difficult aspects of being a parent is seeing your child in pain and feeling like there is nothing that you can do to help.  Whether they feel the pain of depression, anxiety, loss, trauma, divorce or social and academic pressure, my expertise is in helping children connect with their inner strength and confidence.  I support families in developing the communication skills necessary to allow children to grow and move forward in healthy ways.  I believe all children are unique, and my goal is to help bring out the best in your child. I specialize in providing play therapy, psychodynamic therapy, behavioral modification and/or cognitive behavioral therapy for children, teens and families.  
Utilizing my extensive training and 10+ years of experience, I work with kids and teens exclusively. I believe children and teens deserve every chance to experience optimal emotional and behavioral health while maximizing all of their potential. My approach is authentic, warm, and interactive. I offer affordable fees with reduced fee slots for those who qualify.  I look forward to meeting you and your family.

name: Basia Leaffer
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: For many years I've worked with individuals, families and couples,   many dealing with the challenge of adjusting to transition following divorce and separation, loss of a loved one, health changes and immigration. I help my clients deal with emotional and behavioral issues, including anxiety and depression, relationship problems, loss and grief, confronting a new country and a new culture. In addition to English, I speak fluent French, Russian, Polish and Hebrew.  You may be able to explore what is troubling you in your own language. During therapy, we will be exploring these challenges by noting thought patterns and behaviors that are hindering your well-being. I will help you overcome past traumas and relational difficulties within a very safe, supportive, collaborative, and warm environment. I'm happy to work with adults coping with issues of newly found adulthood as well as those who are dealing with challenges and losses due to aging. I welcome you to move beyond patterns that keep you "stuck" and trying new, fresh ways of approaching your daily life and relationships

I use a collaborative approach, taking the time to understand your needs, working towards you living an authentic life. In a non-judgmental environment, with empathy and a sense of humor, I work with Couples, Adults and Teens promoting wellness and positive life change. My specialities include:                                                                               Supporting Individuals and Couples in times of distress. Working with Couples to enhance trust and intimacy. Helping Young Adults transition to independent living. Working with Teens and Adults to develop self-worth. Supporting Adults, Teens, and Couples through Grief and Life Change. Developing strategies to overcome Anxiety and Depression. Developing plans for difficult life's challenges. Supporting Family members of the Mentally Ill. And much more. I offer a $140 Consultation Session. Please feel free to call or email me today.

name: Sunny Choi
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Are you feeling stuck? Are you struggling with relationships or work fulfillment? Do you want to feel joyful, satisfied, and less anxious? I care about your well-being and helping you find happiness and balance is my passion. My approach is non-judgmental and collaborative. I can help you understand and change the negative patterns that contribute to your emotional distress. I’ll teach you innovative techniques to enhance your mood, improve your relationships, and live a happier, more meaningful life. As a former corporate high-tech employee, an Asian immigrant, and an LGBTQ person of color, I can relate to many of your struggles. My approach to therapy over the last decade has been holistic. I learned Cognitive Behavioral Therapy from Dr. David Burns. I am a team lead at his weekly Stanford class. For 20+ years, I’ve taught mindfulness meditation. I was a Dale Carnegie career coach. I collaborate with primary care physicians to create integrated treatments for teens and adults. I received a B.Sc in Engineering from UCLA and an MS in Management from Stanford. I spent many years at tech companies, where I observed colleagues struggling emotionally with work, discrimination and relationship challenges. All of my career experiences have contributed to the pursuit of my passion: helping people make the changes they seek in their lives.

name: Wendy Cheng
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Are you and your family having a “few” disagreements ?  Despite the extra time you have at home lately, do your chores and to-do lists keep growing?  The pandemic has stirred up pervasive stress and anxiety and is changing how we work, live, and socialize. For many, this is also a time when old wounds from the past are triggered. I specialize in helping kids, teens, and adults who are struggling with depression, anxiety, and stress related to their school, family, friendship and career. You want to be more productive, eat well, exercise, and get along with your family. I hope to help you work toward these goals. Together, we can process and find solutions to alleviate the stress and anxiety from family conflicts, working from home, and the social isolation. I provide therapy either via video or outdoor.  I will meet with you and/or your family to evaluate the problem and discuss the best approach to treatment.  I am a bilingual (Mandarin/English) psychologist and have provided therapy in both languages for 20 years in the US and Singapore. Reach out today for your free consultation. 您和家人最近是否經常有摩擦? 雖然大部分時間都在家，永遠擔心有做不完的事, 擔心事做不好, 擔心自己對不起家人, 猛鑽牛角尖焦慮緊張。 最近許多人在家感覺情緒低落, 焦躁易怒, 睡眠障礙。  各位可以自我評估一下，是否有上述這些問題持續2週以上? 如果有的話, 建議尋求心理專業諮商。 不過心情不好不至於要找心理師?  建議不用將心理諮商當成「心理有病」的方式看待，拿掉疾病的概念，換成減壓、壓力管理、提升生活品質的角度看待。 我專門治療兒童，青少年，成人和家庭。我將與您，您的孩子或整個家庭見面，以評估問題並討論最佳治療方法。

name: Jack Brennan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA
about: What brings you here is something important. It could be a problem, pattern, question, or thought; or it could stand for something more difficult to resemble with words. Our work may be long or short-term depending on the nature of this dilemma. We might focus on anxiety, depression, trauma, identity, relationships, or something else. Whatever the cause, the techniques I utilize for listening and hearing prompt you to speak on a register that leads to change. Psychotherapy becomes a creative space for opportunity and growth, as well as a time for you to focus and reflect inward, in order to bring forward something new or renewed. Informed by experience and training in psychodynamic and analytic therapies, my approach invites the full participation of the conscious and unconscious mind. Welcoming dreams and somatic experiences with careful and attuned listening, a window into the unconscious opens. Within the safety and privacy of the therapeutic relationship, one may freely speak. Recognizing and drawing out unique inner strengths that facilitate healing is fundamental to my approach, and my experience includes extensive work with immigrant and LGBTQ communities. If you are curious, seeking to make long-term changes in patterns of thinking and relating to self/others, or embarking on a life transition, I encourage you to reach out.

name: Dr. Robert Puff
title: Psychologist, BA, MA, MDiv, PhD
about: Author of 13 books, Dr. Robert Puff’s “Finding Our Happiness Flow” and “Anger Work: How to Express Your Anger and Still be Kind” have made it on the bestseller list at Amazon.com.  “How to Live a Positive Life,” was a #1 bestseller at iTunes books in the “Self-Improvement” category.   He hosts and creates the “Happiness Podcast,” a podcast focusing on ways for all of us to find happiness, which has been downloaded over 9 million times around the world since its inception. For years, Dr. Puff has been a regular blogger for “Psychology Today.”  For over 30 years, Dr. Puff has been successfully helping clients find happiness in their lives and relationships by using a therapy that addresses the holistic approach to wellness.   He co-hosted the weekly TV program, “The Holistic Success Show,” which was featured on the “Discovery Channel’s Fit TV” for six months.  For several years, Dr. Puff was the number one ranked individual on Google search engines in the U.S. for the term "clinical psychologist." He is regularly sought by the media for his expertise on a variety of mental health issues and has been quoted in the media over 1000 times.

name: Patrick Montgomery
title: Registered Psychological Assistant, MA
about: I work with you using a few key assumptions: you have what it takes to make your life better, others cannot do this for you, you know yourself better than I know you, and that I can direct you toward using your strengths in the directions that are important to you. How? We will start with compassion. I will show you dignity, respect, and compassion toward the important therapeutic milestone of understanding how you want to feel about your life and I will expect you to work toward showing yourself compassion in the process. You deserve it.

name: Karen J McCrary
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I am a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT 123208, for the state of California. I worked for over a decade as a teacher and decided to go back to school and continue my education, to enable me to work with families, couples and individuals in a therapeutic setting.  My focus is on family, marriage and couples counseling. In addition, I have experience working with couples, teens, groups and kids of all ages. I have worked with the school district as a mental health counselor, as well as conducted group therapy.  •Couples Counseling •Specialization in Gottman Method  •Individual Adult, Child & Teen Counseling •Anger Management •Co-parenting Counseling •Family Counseling, ADHD, & ADD, & Group Counseling I believe that each individual has a purpose and that sometimes we need assistance in finding our purpose. Let me help you find your own purpose, or regain focus on your life's path to feeling satisfied in the life you are living.

name: Glenn Allan Alexander
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: What part of your life is most impacting you?  If you answered sexuality, then let's talk!  I specialize in issues regarding sex and sexuality- there can be issues of shame, abuse, discrimination, judgment, confusion, and secrecy- and I would love to help you define what your vision of sexual health looks like and feels like for you, your partner, and your family. Therapy for sex and sexuality is a recognized specialization within psychotherapy.  Too often these areas of a person's life is not treated with the openness and respect it deserves.  I bring decades of lived experience as a member of the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as clinical training and experience to complement my whole-person approach to therapy. I approach sex and sexuality with curiosity in a judgement-free space.  I am passionate about helping my clients find and explore their authentic selves!  I am sex-positive, kink, poly and BDSM friendly!  Please reach out if you are distraught, suffering, or confused.  Health, Healing and Hope are within reach for all sexualities, and you are deserving!

name: Allison Konefal
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Have you found yourself feeling stressed and overwhelmed in life and not sure how to navigate through these uncertain times? Have you found yourself isolating, withdrawing, and feeling more sad than usual? You are not alone in this! We live in a world today that is full of twist and turns and we constantly don't know what will happen next.                                              Therapy is a place where you can process your inner struggles in a supportive environment and gain the insight and growth that you may be searching for.  I am here to guide and support you through this journey! I have over 13 years specializing in working with a variety of  individuals and presenting issues. Whether it is working with children, adolescents, couples or individual therapy, I work with all individuals. I would love the opportunity to join you on your journey of discovery and healing. I encourage you to call me if you would like to work together.  Take my hand, as I lead you out of the darkness and into the light.

name: Jermaine L Dictado
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I work with adults (18+) who are having difficulties with negative self-talk, emotion regulation, and conflicts in relationships. These difficulties can often look like depression, anxiety, intense stress, anger, poor self-esteem, self-harm, suicidal thoughts and more. I am here to support you with these challenges. Looking for a therapist can especially be difficult in addition to facing current struggles in our life. Feel free to call for a free 15-minute consultation to see how I may be able to help. I have specialized training in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavior Therapy, Cognitive Processing Therapy for trauma, and Gottman Method Couples Therapy. I can help you with coping skills that increase awareness of your experiences (mindfulness), improve interpersonal skills, tolerate distressing moments, and regulate intense emotions. It can be overwhelming to live life day-to-day with all its challenges. We can work through those challenges with me supporting you along the way. Let's work together to reach your goals and get you the kind of life you want.

name: Gabriela Gomes Costardi
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Have you found yourself not knowing how to navigate a situation and suffering because of that? Have you tried "everything," but are still feeling trapped and immersed in psych suffering, which can manifest itself as isolation, self-criticism, hopelessness, worry, fear, dissatisfaction, interpersonal conflicts, mood changes, dissociation from reality, a sense of being persecuted, and so on?  Have you wondered whether some of the issues you have dealt with - for instance, being incapable of doing things or repeatedly making bad choices - might tell something about your subjective dilemmas? This is the moment to make analysis. My practice is oriented by the psychoanalysis of Jacques Lacan, who took the steps of Freud. Speaking or playing in the case of children are not only ways of communicating but mostly ways of acting. You say much more than you think, for instance, through dreams and symptoms, and listening to it creates a type of knowledge that mobilizes affects and the body. Throughout this process, you make things happen rather than keep waiting for life to move to accommodate your needs. That happens as you become oriented by your desire, which drives you into action and calls you to take responsibility for those actions. As a result, you will recover the freedom once stolen by the psychic suffering and find new ways of living Você tem tido dificuldade com alguma situação e sofre com isso? Já tentou “tudo”, mas continua se sentindo sem saída e imerso em sofrimento psíquico, o qual pode se manifestar como isolamento, auto-crítica, desesperança, preocupação, medo, insatisfação, conflitos interpessoais, mudanças de humor, dissociação da realidade, sensação de perseguição, etc? Você tem se perguntado se algumas das dificuldades que você tem enfrentado - como, ser incapaz de agir ou repetidamente fazer escolhas erradas - podem dizer algo sobre seus dilemas subjetivos? Essa é a hora de fazer análise.  Minha prática clínica é orientada pela psicanálise de Jacques Lacan, que seguiu os passos de Freud. Falar e brincar no caso das crianças não são apenas modos de se comunicar, mas principalmente modos de agir. Você fala muito mais do que supõe, por exemplo, através de sonhos e sintomas, e escutar isso cria um tipo de saber que mobiliza os afetos e o corpo.   Neste processo, você passa a agir em vez de continuar esperando que as coisas mudem na direção desejada. Isso acontece porque você passa a se orientar pelo seu desejo, o qual te dirige a agir e te chama a assumir a responsabilidade por essas ações. Como resultado, você vai recuperar a liberdade roubada pelo sofrimento psíquico e criar novos modos de viver.

name: Cecille Basila
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My intention is to empower you with tools for healing, change, and personal fulfillment. I provide a holistic approach that combines ancient traditions with evidenced based practices and modern knowledge. I believe everyone has the wisdom with in themselves to know what is needed for healing and transformation. Courageously accepting an invitation to explore your unique path in this human experience can expand your view in seeing all the different ways you can show up for life. On this journey, we will explore what is important to you and examine where change is desired.  Some topics may include relationships with our habits and fears, increasing understanding of the guidance system of our emotions, and accessing our innate wisdom. This integrative style of practice is conducted in an environment that is safe, nurturing, compassionate, peaceful, non-judgmental, and non-shaming.  I am currently offering telehealth sessions remotely.  I welcome you to engage in a complimentary 15 minute phone consultation to explore if this is a good fit for your journey.

name: Abide Bay Area Therapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Making the decision to come to therapy can be difficult, and I understand that sometimes it takes a moment for your mind and your heart to catch up with each other. With this in mind, I work alongside clients to help them find their strengths, mine for resources they may not realize they have, and carve out measurable and attainable goals within their timeline and with their cooperation. I enjoy working compassionately alongside individuals with anxiety and depression. I believe we treat entire individuals, emotionally and spiritually, and therefore am adept and comfortable at counseling spiritual issues. I employ a supportive and compassionate environment where the client has the freedom to work toward emotional, spiritual, and relational health. I enjoy working with clients from different cultural backgrounds and various faith traditions. There are scores of amazing therapists, and I want to congratulate you for taking the first step by researching to find the right one for you. I also want to thank you for reading this and finding out more about who I am and who I enjoy working with. Please do not hesitate to contact me and ask any questions. I would love to see if I can be helpful to you!

name: Amanda Hale Feinberg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, ATR
about: Life is challenging and difficult to navigate, especially without support. During the therapeutic process, I look at how our environment, life experience, and current relationships have an impact on the decisions we make. I work with adults, young adults and adolescents who experience anxiety, depression, addiction, low self-esteem, career transitions and relationship issues. I strongly believe in empowering and supporting clients with transparency and honest communication. I offer a warm, direct, and empathetic environment that facilitates personal growth and provides support while clients make meaningful changes in their lives. Every individual needs a different therapeutic approach, I am able to provide art therapy, DBT, CBT, and EMDR. Please feel free to contact me for a free phone consultation.

name: Elizabeth Kovacevich
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MS, MFT
about: For over 30 years I have been helping my clients to discover new ways to deal with their problems and to begin thriving rather than merely surviving in their lives. My greatest strength is moving people from crisis to change. My openness and forthright style with clients provide them the opportunity     for understanding, personal growth, and change. I view therapy as an educational as well as therapeutic experience. My style is primarily interactive. I am supportive, caring and process oriented. I have extensive experience with mental health, hospitals and schools. I love working with people in all stages and ages of their lives!  I support my clients in developing long lasting and practical solutions to the  personal, relationship and professional problems in their lives. As we work together to identify the issues and underlying patterns, we also create effective strategies for positive and permanent change.  My broad experience and clinical expertise can serve to meet your needs!  I love my work and most especially helping people get their own lives and relationships back on track and thriving! The most common feedback I receive from my clients deals with my positivity and authenticity along with my unique ability to help clients rapidly identify and change dysfunctional patterns of thought and behavior. Welcome to my practice!

name: Jessica Lauren Meister
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: The decision to begin therapy is a courageous one. You may be coming to therapy because of a variety of reasons such as emotional distress, relationship issues, challenging life transitions, or feeling alone in navigating personal struggles. I believe the most important element of effective psychotherapy is the genuine relationship between the patient and therapist. My goal as a therapist is to provide a safe and supportive space where you can feel free to express your thoughts and feelings. Our goal together will be to work toward alleviating the stress, struggle or pain you may be going through. I will work with you to focus on the following: 1) expression of emotion; 2) exploration of attempts to avoid distressing thoughts and feelings; 3) Identification of recurring themes and patterns in your life; 4) discuss past experience across your development; 5) focus on your relationships; 6) focus on our therapeutic relationship.  I also utilize EMDR I am a licensed clinical social worker with advanced clinical training in psychodynamic psychotherapy, and end-of-life/bereavement. I am currently pursuing further advanced training at a PhD program and am EMDR trained. Having worked in both crisis work at hospitals and clinics as well as in long-term psychotherapy, my experience is extensive, and diverse.

name: María Romero Jackson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Everyone goes through challenging situations in life, and while you may have successfully navigated through other difficulties you've faced, there's nothing wrong with seeking out extra support when you need it.  My approach is to be warm and deeply interested in both your struggles and your strengths.  I work with clients who wish to understand and shift their anxiety, depression, self-criticism, and relationship difficulties.  I particularly enjoy working with clients who carry marginalized identities including women, queer, trans, and POC clients.  Central to my approach is the belief that cultural and environmental factors deeply play a role in our development. I believe in a strength-based perspective and also the mind/body connection.  I incorporate mindfulness into treatment as a way of grounding and relaxation, and to strengthening coping skills. I also believe that throughout the lifespan, human beings grow through and toward connection. We need connections to flourish and isolation, is a major source of suffering for people, at both a personal and cultural level. I believe in doing therapy that emphasizes movement out of isolation because the need for connection in which growth is a priority is the core motivation in people's lives.

name: Sue Matthiessen
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: If you are reading this personal statement, that means you are currently searching for someone to help you make some form of change in your life.  Let me describe how I work and you can see if you feel we might be a good team.  I have been a licensed clinical social worker since 1996, and have worked with children, families and adults. The primary way I attempt to help is through an understanding of attachment theory.  I work with my clients to identify and understand patterns of relating that may be interfering with their ability to feel their lives are satisfying and successful. I am certified in infant/toddler mental health, as well as Perinatal Mood and Anxiety Disorders.  I am trained in hypnosis and EMDR, and have utilized these techniques to help others get relief from issues of depression, trauma and conflict.

name: Barry Cardiner
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about:
I offer individual and couples couseling with a sliding scale available.  I also take most insurance. 
In the years of working with clients, the approach I take is one of understanding, non-judgement and issue focused.  I use a combination of self psychology, humanistic, object relations and cognitive behavioral approach to working with the clients to help heal current or past issues. My goal is to help you discover your inner voice to provide the answers to your own truths. The ultimate goal in therapy is to heal the wounds that keep the individual from achieving their personal happiness. The techniques that I have developed over the years heal child wounds, abuse issues, anger, lack of self love, and create healthy self esteem and boundaries in one's life.  
Depression, addiction issues, anxiety, relationship issues, illness, grief, hiv, gay/lesbian issues, aging, career issues, and communication skills.            Understanding healthy versus unhealthy relationships. As a therapist, I have an innate ability to understand the issues presented. The client feels understood, safe and hopeful. It is because of this unique ability, that the connection to the process starts immediately.  
Specializing in drama filled relationships,the client understands why, how, and what the options are.

name: iCLASS Treatment Center
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Personal victories no matter how small they are continue to be victories.  Hi, you have reached the iCLASS Treatment Center "personal victory unit".  Life can be challenging with the responsibility of children, relationships, and career.  When you have family that are dysfunctional or friends / partners that are unfaithful, the weight maybe robbing you of hope.  We have worked with clients so emotionally drained little to no value is put on life. That cycle for you ends with a phone call or email to iCLASS Treatment Center.  We have experienced Spanish speaking therapist ready to partner with you on your "tour to victory". We specialize in working with clients dealing with depression, anxiety, dysfunctional communication patterns, and phase of life issues.  Our desire is to be part of the journey that improves the quality of life for the clients we serve. This means acknowledging the small victories, and waiting to see where the big victories take us. We look forward to hearing from you. Las victorias personales por pequeñas que sean siguen siendo victorias. Hola, se ha comunicado con la "unidad de victoria personal" del Centro de Tratamiento iCLASS. La vida puede ser desafiante con la responsabilidad de los niños, las relaciones y una carrera. Cuando tienes familiares que son disfuncionales o amigos/parejas que son infieles, el peso puede robarte la esperanza. Hemos trabajado con clientes tan agotados emocionalmente que  tenian poco o ningún valor a la vida. Ese ciclo para usted termina con una llamada telefónica o un correo electrónico a iCLASS Treatment Center. Contamos con un terapeuta que habla español y está lista para acompañarlo en su "gira hacia la victoria". Nos especializamos en trabajar con clientes que lidian con depresión, ansiedad, patrones de comunicación disfuncionales y problemas de fases de la vida. Nuestro deseo es ser parte del viaje que mejora la calidad de vida de los clientes que servimos. Esto significa reconocer las pequeñas victorias y esperar a ver adónde nos llevan las grandes victorias. Esperamos con entusiasmo escuchar de usted.

name: Sol Compass Therapy & Consulting (Nicole M. Ward)
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, JD, MA, LMFT
about: *My practice is currently full.*  My practice is based on the philosophy that wellness is an ongoing process of growth that includes learning to cope with life challenges, while also recognizing life triumphs.  The therapeutic process is an excellent tool for increasing coping skills during life transitions as well as in your overall wellness regimen. I view my role as a therapist as a guide to assist during these times. I have over fourteen years of experience working with individuals and couples on a variety of concerns including: building better relationships, anxiety, depression, family conflict and trauma. I work with individuals and couples.  I also enjoy working with other helping professionals and healers to facilitate professional growth and address vicarious trauma and compassion fatigue.  My theoretical orientation is influenced by Family/Relational Systems, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Existential Psychology. Taking a proactive approach to your wellness has benefits that are realized for years to come. I look forward to working together to develop a plan that best suits your needs.

name: Nina Akin
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Struggling with life transitions, addiction, depression, anxiety, hoarding or PTSD? With over 25 years experience helping people find their way to wellness-- my goal is to help you identify and solve the problems that are holding you back.   Quality therapy is an option that can make all the difference. I'd like to help you sort things out. I will partner with you to facilitate change.  I focus on treatments that work.    My goal is to help you reach your personal goals.         A Mindfulness approach informs my work, with emphasis on tools to support self-compassion, and self-care.  I use a variety of treatment approaches including CBT and EMDR therapy for trauma and other issues. Clients tell me that they feel safe and supported in our work together. Change and personal growth are possible. Claim your right to feel better, ask for support, and start living the life you desire and deserve.  I look forward to speaking with you!

name: Valerie D Rausch
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Most of us do not escape life without some degree of suffering.  Whatever the cause of our suffering, seeking help at a time we feel most vulnerable can be scary and uncomfortable.  It takes courage to open oneself to feelings of vulnerability and fear in order to grow. I have immense respect for anyone who seeks professional help in the face of this discomfort.  A state of curiosity and self-compassion about one's suffering can lead to increased self-awareness and receptivity to learning and growing through any challenge.  A quest for a life worth living opens us to asking beautiful questions that turn challenges into opportunities I am a compassionate observer of your life narrative and actively listen to provide support where indicated and prod where there are opportunities for change and growth.  Trust is the building block of any relationship and I quickly establish rapport by actively engaging with empathy, knowledge, and sound, diverse clinical skills applied to your unique needs You are a unique individual and can expect to have your thoughts and feelings heard and received with understanding and compassion by a person trained and willing to serve as a co-partner in your healing journey.  I am eager to greet you and will meet you where you are on your path and together we can forge a clearing to hope, insight, acceptance and peace.

name: Michal Ruth Sadoff
title: LMFT
about: Are you looking for help to sort out sad, hopeless, angry or confused feelings?  Perhaps you have struggled for a long time, or perhaps a crisis in your life has overwhelmed your usual ability to cope.  Each person needs something different from therapy, such as support in rocky times, new ideas about unsatisfactory relationships, exploration and clarification of difficult life situations, or encouragement to reach for joy and purpose in life.  My approach to our work together will be custom-fit to your hopes, your concerns, your goals, your life. I work with adults who are at a turning point:  a death, a divorce, job loss, illness.  I help adolescents and young adults find their way into the next stage of life.  I help people think about life in new ways, find relief from painful feelings, and solutions to problems. I grew up here and saw Santa Clara Valley evolve from the Valley of the Heart's Delight into Silicon Valley.  In this transition, the beauty and energy of this area remains, but the additional complexity and demands can become overwhelming.  I help individuals and families struggling with the unique challenges of living here.

name: Self Discovery Jungian Psychotherapy
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I think therapy is always a good idea. Crisis, however, is often what leads us into therapy, and I believe that it is a call and an opportunity to look deeply, not only into our "problems" but, into ourselves. My approach is non-pathologizing, relational, and grounded in Jungian theory. I work with a variety of concerns with a special interest in spirituality, identity discovery, developmental and transitional adjustments, grief, loss, depression, chronic and palliative illness. I believe that every person has an innate capacity for healing and I am interested in helping people find theirs. I emphasize the importance of spirituality and psychology. My goal is to help people understand themselves, their purpose and how to discover the meaning in experience. My approach is Jungian and as such I work with people's dreams and other elements of the unconscious in order to help increase consciousness.

name: Peter M Schumacher
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: There is no precedent in recent history for what is happening right now in our communities, and in our world.  The COVID-19 pandemic is necessitating limited social contact with strict guidelines for personal health.  We are all anxious and worried about ourselves, our families and friends, and the whole social nexus that we are immersed in.  More than anything else, we need to be both accepting and flexible in order to successfully manage the complications we are now faced with.  I have 40+ years experience helping people gain strength, focus, and the confidence to overcome obstacles that impede success. My style is warm and engaging, and my approach is direct. I listen, get to know you, emphasize your strengths and resources, and help you find the best way to address the concerns you came in with. You define the therapeutic goals, with your success as the ultimate goal. The heart and soul of my work is creating a safe space for you -- allowing you to be more present, to see yourself more clearly, and gain the confidence and presence of mind to progress toward meaningful growth in your life. Please contact me if you have questions about what I can do for you.

name: Julie Trosin, LMFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Growth and healing are a journey, but always possible and worth the effort because they can transform the quality of the rest of your life! With over a decade of experience in the mental health field, I enjoy helping others discover and maximize their potential for healing and work towards having deeper, more meaningful  and empowering thought patterns, attitudes, behaviors & relationships. Call to see if the Healing Connections and Wounded Heart Therapy Groups are accepting new clients! Both groups are intended and best suited for women who no longer have active crisis/safety concerns but are ready and wanting to process and heal! My areas of special interest include childhood abuse recovery, trauma/PTSD, boundaries/communication, depression/anxiety, life transitions & codependency issues. I often use cognitive behavioral, emotion-focused & attachment therapy techniques. I'm also trained in Brainspotting & EMDR for treating trauma & am a Prepare-Enrich marital/premarital facilitator. My approach, in all of my counseling work, is systemic (this means we would examine issues/concerns in the context of the "bigger picture," which includes mind, body, soul, and social factors) as well as DBT, trauma and attachment-informed. I place a large emphasis on the importance of balanced self-care, developing awareness and personal accountability.

name: Michelle Broehm
title: Registered Psychotherapist, LCSW
about: Anxiety, depressive feelings, afraid of where the future may lead, or trying to figure out how to get over initial humps are common, but may also feel emotionally and physically draining. Therapy should be thoughtful, supportive, and provide a sense of safety for you to be yourself. This is the environment I look to create so that you can gain a deeper sense of self, and explore old thinking patterns and behaviors that may be preventing you from moving forward. I can offer a fresh perspective to help you re-frame those negative thoughts in a more productive direction.   My approach to therapy is based out of Psychodynamic and Social Learning theories as well as evidence-based approaches. CBT and Solution Focused therapies are my most commonly used approaches along with motivational interviewing techniques to help guide you towards how to live more in the present in order to thrive and have a more successful future.    I am passionate about helping others to succeed and make it my priority to provide as much education, support, and patience needed in order to maintain stability.  If you don’t mind a few movie references, humor, and honesty, I welcome you to contact me for a free consult so we can explore your needs and you can start the process of living your best life.

name: Ivonne Melgar
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I believe the highest knowledge of the self comes from within and our life experiences have the power to shape how we relate to ourselves, others and the world around us. Sometimes our experiences have brought pain or other emotions that have caused us to disconnect. I believe we have learned ways to protect ourselves from unbearable pain by denying our true desires, wants, and needs. When we deny parts of ourselves, we suffer, feel lost, stuck, broken, and hopeless. Let’s try something different by dismantling old stories that are not ours to hold, dive into your truth and rewrite the script. With over 10 years of experience, I offer a warm, relatable, direct and often humorous approach. I draw from an eclectic array of therapeutic modalities and my approach will vary depending on your specific needs. I focus on treating root causes, not just symptoms. I am a therapist at Octave, a modern behavioral health practice that supports your emotional well-being through a broad range of services. At Octave, we partner with you to develop a personalized care plan that best suits your needs. Learn more at www.findoctave.com
issues: ['Burnout', 'Life Transitions', 'Stress']

name: Deborah Ronay
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Taking this first step of looking for a therapist might feel difficult and overwhelming, yet it is crucial in order to begin to feel better. Fostering your healing will come from our ability to work together and as my client I want you to be an empowered consumer of psychotherapy. I value transparency, honesty and a real dialogue about how effective our work is. I will strive to both support and challenge you as we strengthen your capacity for mindfulness, insight and greater joy in your life. We will collaborate to discover ways in which you are already being resilient against difficulties, challenges and problems.  My style is a direct, solution-focused and strength-based approach. Healing not only comes from making changes but also from affirming what you're already doing right. Often, psychotherapy can provide a safe place to discern which is which. Furthermore, I often provide clients with therapy homework to maximize the work that can be done between sessions.  I provide psychotherapy to adults, adolescents, children, young children 0-5 and families. My work with families includes transitions, trauma, parenting, divorce and adoption. I do EMDR, a treatment for trauma that is highly effective and brief with children, teens and adults. I am a bilingual/bicultural Latina psychologist fluent in Spanish.

name: Your Best Life Therapy
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: How many times have you felt as if you've lost sight of your identity or look back and wonder how you've been managing all this time? Are you living a narrative that doesn't feel like yours, and do you yearn to live a more authentic life? Everything around us gives us narratives about who we should be, how we should feel, and how we should interact with the world from the moment we are born. These narratives shape our expectations of ourselves, especially if we are part of marginalized communities, and can force us to live a story that doesn't feel like it fits, leaving us feeling isolated and lonely. My goal is to help you re-write the narratives and external messages shaping your identity and to find your true self so you can live your best life. I'm passionate and knowledgeable in working with women's issues, LGBTQIA+ issues, infertility, motherhood, grief and support to those who have lost a loved one to suicide. I will provide you with support, facilitate your awareness, help you build self confidence and create individual change in an empowering and non-judgmental space utilizing therapeutic approaches tailored to you either virtually or in person. Book your free phone consultation with me today by visiting my website. I can't wait to meet you.

name: Timothy K. Wong
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Get relief from pain and find meaning! I grew up in Los Angeles participating in teams sports and musical groups, which made me curious about relationships. This curiosity about relationships continues to inform my approach to psychotherapy. I believe that much emotional pain stems from difficulties in developing or maintaining fulfilling relationships. Therefore, I examine one's relational dynamics, ways of relating, and impact on others.  I openly explore clients' feelings toward me, encouraging individuals to experience authenticity with others, and ultimately, with themselves. I specialize in working with individuals with a history of trauma. This work involves grieving what is lost, fostering interpersonal safety, and reclaiming one's life through reconnecting to that which provides meaning. I am also passionate about the impact of culture and spirituality and how they shape the psyche. I provide adult, adolescent, couple, and premarital psychotherapy.  Cost-effective, sliding scale, services are available through associates at my office. Please contact me to see if we might be a good fit!

name: Jennie Teixeira
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MS
about: There are times in our life when difficulties lead to thoughts and feelings inside of us that we are uncomfortable with. Ignoring those feelings doesn’t exactly make them go away often leaving us frustrated and feeling stuck. So what can you do? Well, I can tell you that counseling is a helpful way to find relief and healing for those struggling with mental and emotional suffering, relationship conflicts, daily stress, and unhealthy behavior patterns.  I offer sessions for couples, families, and individuals including children, teens, and adults. My services include professional counseling for relationships, single parent and co-parenting issues, trauma restoration, and identity development.  I also provide care for those dealing with depression,anxiety, PTSD, bipolar disorder, codependency, and addiction.  I understand, asking for help isn't easy, it takes courage. Chances are, you'll be glad you did. When you're ready, I'm ready. Please feel free to contact me with questions or to schedule a session.

name: Growth Rings Relationship & Family Therapy, Inc.
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT
about: Are you ready to change your life for the better? No matter what you are going through, remember: you are not your problem! Life is both complicated and stressful, and we are not born with "how-to" instructions or "live-life-this-way" manuals. We are all in a process of trying to find personal security while feeling our way through life. I invite you to work with me to untangle and understand your life, increase personal  security and life satisfaction, and resolve issues and symptoms that are holding you back from becoming the person you really want to be. I enjoy working with teens, adults, and older adults who are struggling with symptoms, want to be understood, and are trying to work out problems to be happier.  I have many years of experience and can work with many types of issues. Specialties include trauma resolution/PTSD; couples; and LGBT, I have worked in community mental health over 30 years, private practice for several years, and have experience with many situations. My goal is to help you feel more empowered as you build a better life and resolve your symptoms, issues, and distress. Let's work on it together!

name: Lindsay Garcia
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Often, this journey begins when we bravely step into our stories and allow ourselves to show up and be seen, despite the possible fear and messiness that can come with it. I believe you are here because you are courageously taking a step to discover what it feels like to show up for yourself, to allow someone to walk alongside you in your humanity and to begin the process of healing. I work with women who are searching for more wholeness in their life. Women who are feeling consumed or distracted with doubt, fear, overwhelm, anxiety and sadness - in their work life, within themselves or in their relationships.  Through a holistic approach and incorporating mind and body work as necessary, I want to support you in rediscovering your value, how to manage the unique challenges you may be experiencing, how to safely come back to yourself and how to show up authentically as yourself, creating space for more joy and more connectedness.   I am also a human being that feels privileged to hold space for you and your story. Our stories are vast and unique and deserve to be held with the utmost compassion. I am here to help you navigate what it means for you to move toward healing and believe each and every one of us has the capacity to heal.

name: Aimée V Sanchez
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Dr. Sanchez is an experienced Neuropsychologist who provides evaluation for children and adults. Her expertise is also in evaluating TBI, forensic,  psychiatric, and pediatric neuropsychological evaluations. We provide comprehensive assessment services to help you achieve peace of mind, enhance brain-behavior functioning, and live a fulfilling life! We treat clients remotely via telehealth/teleneuropsychology. If you’re concerned about you or, a loved one's learning, attention or, behavior, we can help verify diagnosis to ensure you get the best results possible. Contact our office for a no-cost consult today! I have over 20 years treating anxiety, depression, trauma/PTSD, Alzheimers/Dementia, ADHD, Autism, learning and other neurodevelopmental disorders. I provide psychological/neuropsychological testing and diagnosis to reduce the effects of neurobehavioral and neurological conditions. I also offer forensic evaluations and treat individuals with brain injury. I am an engaged & dedicated evaluator who will recommend effective treatment interventions that match your needs. I'm passionate about what I do & can help you resolve the challenges keeping you from thriving. I also  provide executive  life coaching for professionals and high achievers (i.e. CEOs, executives, professionals, business owners, etc.).

name: Sara Bazan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Greetings! I believe that everyone has within them the resources they need to live a fulfilling and rewarding life. As a therapist, I am here to help you access your strengths and to utilize them to the fullest. I have a gift of getting quickly to the heart of the challenges and I have many tools that make lasting shifts. I have been in private practice since I was licensed in 2009 and have also worked in the non-profit sector for 15 years working to help people overcome the effects of trauma. I am certified in Trauma Focused CBT, Emotional Transformation Therapy and Parent Child Interactive Therapy. I speak Spanish and English. I have worked with depression, anxiety, trauma, and relationship challenges. I work with adults and children. I would be honored to support you in cultivating hope, joy, and achieving the transformation you desire. I want you to feel empowered, learn to manage the ups and downs of life effectively and to ultimately be the designer and driver of your life. Being Human is not easy. I am here to offer my years of experience, my skills, and my emotional support. We have an incredible potential for joy, peace and fulfillment and at the same time hold the capacity to feel intense sadness, grief, frustration and overwhelm. I am here to help you manage your emotions so they don't take control of your life.

name: VCAT Treatment Center for Mental Health/Addiction
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: The world of psychology and mental health is constantly changing. The future of mental health now focuses more into an objective way of assessing and treating psychological disorders and addiction. It is more about how brain functioning system including neurons, neurotransmitters, and certain brain waves working together to enable an overall balance within brain's functioning system. VCATTRC uses Visual Concentration Attention Therapy (VCAT), the most effective neuropathway treatment methodology, non-invasive Cranial Magnetic Therapy (CMT) and real time brain mapping in addressing psychological disorders and drug addiction. VCATTRC provides detox, sober living, IOP/ PHP, and after care treatment. Recovery in mental health/drug addiction starts with recovering brain's natural homeostasis. VCAT/CMT, the absolute power in regulating neural network dysfunction and brain's chemical imbalance caused by disease, substance abuse, or traumatic brain injuries. VCATTRC is the center for psychological assessment, evaluation, and treatment.  It is also one of the most recognized centers for real time brain mapping.  Real time brain mapping helps us to understand the relationship between structure and function of the brain in order to be able to treat psychological and psychiatric disorders including drug addiction.

name: Debbie Timm

about: I help individuals, couples, and families adjust through difficult transitional times in life. Emotional pain such as the task of grieving, relational distress and conflict, environmental adjustments, depression and anxiety can overwhelm us at times and give us feelings of desperation, loneliness, frustration, hurt, and confusion. These situations can become disruptive to our personal ideals of feeling good. I care about people that are in these states and enjoy helping them find a way out of their pain. Through my experiences, schooling, and practice, I have learned to assist others to feel supported, equipped, and helped.  Let’s talk a bit to see if we are a good fit in your next step toward well-being.

name: Psychotherapy of San Diego, Dr Silbert RN,CNS,PHD
title: Psychologist, RN, CNS, PhD, FACCS
about: Dr Silbert promotes healing and strengthening of the capable inner self. The individual is enhanced positively by a belief in the ability to cope with the human condition and the emotional upheaval exacerbated by the winding road of life's journey. From the initial consultation with Dr. Silbert she remains an active verbal participant in your treatment. She most emphatically "listens" and "sees" you in a genuine attempt to validate the importance and significance of what you say and how you are feeling. Evaluation of the problems and strategies for effective intervention are discussed with the individual from the first consult until completion of treatment. Therapy allows the individual in a confidential, trustworthy atmosphere to discuss personal thoughts, feelings and behaviors. The "experiential" nature of this therapy, i.e., allowing for one's "self" to "experience" saying, hearing, and feeling often one's most private thoughts in a non-judgmental environment opens avenues to self awareness. The therapeutic process with Dr. Silbert is a genuine encounter focused on helping you heal and learn more constructive ways of dealing with emotional conflict created by the perceived problems in your life. A therapeutic relationship develops  to treat emotional distress, depression, infidelity, sex addiction and sex problems.

name: Palomar Family Counseling Services
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, EdD, MS, PCCI
about: How do you feel when you enter the psychotherapist office? Do you feel clincally disturbed? Does your mental cognition or emotional regulation feel dysfunctional? Are you feeling distressed or socially impaired? How are you functioning in your daily living activities? Are your familial relationship and marital relations in disarray? Too be sure, you want help and need the services of therapist. I can assist you through these tough times. In some cases pathological symptoms are not present. However, in many cases what is present is a discordant environment, whereby life throws you a curve. Because of the comorbidity of the illness or unique problems revealed, I will use a theoretical application and evidenced based counseling to help the client begin to understand what is occurring in her or his life. What I need from you is to trust the process. Reality is always in flux, and in contradictions. I focus on the quality of life behaviors. 1.) Exposition: Conflict. 2.) Rising Action: Events before climax. 3.) Climax: Painful turning point. 4.) Falling Action: Events that occur after climax. 5.) Resolution: Reconciliation, rehabilitation and resolve.

name: Lynne Virgil
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Let's find the life you were meant to live. If you are struggling with relationship issues, self-esteem, feeling out of control and dealing with anxiety, I am here to help you feel grounded, safe and to give you the support and even the coaching you need to find your potential. Let's challenge existing patterns that are no longer working for you. We can work together to identify and explore new ways to increase your self-awareness, confidence, and personal empowerment. If you have spiritual questions and yearnings, I can help you find your unique path in integrating authentic spirituality into your life. I have firsthand experience with marriage, motherhood, and immersion in diverse cultures.  I bring decades of life experience as well as former careers in the sports and cosmetics industries. I align with LGBT and gender affirming therapy.  I individualize treatment based on each person's unique history, personality and cultural background. I offer a judgment-free zone where I am committed to providing you with a safe and welcoming environment during our time together. I believe in a collaborative approach. Together we will identify your strengths as well as areas where you need support. The feedback I receive from clients is that they find me to be knowledgeable, caring, intuitive, and honest.

name: Dr. Colleen Long
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: You are in therapy but not sure if it's "working." Maybe you've tried a number of different therapists and have come to the idea that therapy is bunk science or bogus. You feel that there is something you or your child are struggling with in every day functioning or interactions - but can't put your finger on it. You want help, but don't yet know what you should be seeking help for... I provide diagnostic clarification for people who feel stuck in therapy or have felt that therapy didn't "work" in the past. Sometimes therapy can be like exploratory surgery, where the therapist sort of pokes around until they find something that hurts. Testing can be thought of as the x-ray. With diagnostic testing, we can get closer to the issue. If you are struggling in life and feel like you've just been grasping at straws or barely skating by- maybe its time to get diagnostic testing to understand the exact nature of your issues and what to do about them. Testing Location in Orange County, but testing can be performed remotely,

name: Valerie Witherspoon
title: Psychologist, PhD, MN, RN, CNS
about: I have had training and experience in several types of therapy; psychodynamic, dream work, cognitive-behavioral, and mindfulness-based psychotherapy which uses meditation as a complement. Most of my clients are experiencing depression, anxiety or going through a life crisis/transition. I enjoy using books and readings to concretely extend the therapy to life outside the sessions. A special interest is working with writers to faciliate their creative process. And I find humor is very important in therapy as in life. I am very excited about having completed a nine-month training in comtemplative relational psychotherapy three years ago. Each trainee commited to 30 minutes daily meditation, in addition to studying the writings of Buddhist scholars and psychotherapists. When the therapist has a meditation practice, this can benefit the therapy.

name: Elisabeth T. White
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I have worked with a great array of clients throughout my career. I work with anyone who is suffering. Suffering can show up in all sorts of ways: Depression, Anxiety, Addiction, Relational Issues, and Family Conflict, to name a few. People are always trying to do their very best to feel better, even if the attempts are maladaptive. I believe people want to feel content and find a life of purpose. I received my undergraduate degree from Vanderbilt University in May 2002. I went on to complete my masters degree from the California Institute of Integral Studies in 2013. My focus today is working with trauma and shame, harm reduction, and the negative self narratives that fuel our unskillful behaviors. It takes great courage to reach out for support. At one point or another, all of us must learn to ask for help and practice vulnerability. I applaud you for taking this first step . I look forward to connecting with you.

name: Randy Herman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Anger getting the best of you?  Worry?  Despair?  Not doing what you were born to do?  Having the same ol' fight again and again?  Not feeling heard?  Finding that romance and sexual intimacy are a distant memory?   Collaborating on issues like these with someone who continually works to "get" you can bring you a sense of relief and provide lasting solutions.  In fact, it can save your life and the lives of your relationships. Being yourself can seem risky.  "If I say what I really think, people will leave!"  But if you don't live in a way that truly suits you, something inside leaves, all of your relationships suffer and, in a way, you die . . . until you learn what lights your eyes and find ways to achieve it. My sessions highlight collaboration and finding "you."  Without the real you, nothing else matters.  My San Diego office is convenient to Carmel Valley, Del Mar, Solana Beach, Cardiff, Encinitas and Carlsbad.  Currently, however, I see clients virtually -- by phone or online -- only.

name: Atwater Village Therapy
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Our clients are smart, capable people struggling despite their best efforts. They have held themselves together just well enough for years, but then they reach a tipping point and know they need the help of an expert. Through individual therapy, couples therapy, group therapy, or ADHD assessments, we help them better understand themselves and how to get what they need out of life. We provide meaningful, effective therapy to help you overcome emotional pain and live a life that matches your hopes and values. Our practice is LGBTQIA affirming, and welcomes people of all races, ethnicities, relationship structures, sizes, and religious backgrounds. Visit our website to learn more about us and schedule a free consultation call. We are here to guide you through this process and get you where you need to go.

name: Niko Whitmire
title: Psychologist, PsyD, MFA
about: Creativity can be foundational to positive and longstanding change. We come into the world with an innate skill to solve the many problems that arise during development. Sometimes these solutions bring up new challenges or get in the way of our relationships and our ability to enjoy life. I work with children, adults, elders, and couples who are struggling to adapt to a stressful world. By developing a trusting relationship where exploration is welcomed and analyzed, we are able to find new ways of functioning, new solutions to our interpersonal conflicts, and improve our ability to flexibly adapt to our changing world. My specialty is in providing psychotherapy for individuals across the lifespan who've struggled with the symptoms of anxiety, depression, grief/loss, psychosis, and ADHD. I use a neurodevelopmental and psychoanalytic perspective that is informed by the impacts of society and culture.  I draw upon playful and artistic expressions to help us find the metaphors that work for your symptoms and difficulties. Both children and adults may benefit from a reconnection with the playful elements that sustain us in times of stress. My hope is that we may find a way to rekindle the childlike enthusiasm for experimentation we were all born with.

name: Robert Gastelum
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: For those of us who cannot find the right answers, it is usually because we make decisions that lead us to predictable outcomes rather than creative solutions.  I assist clients who are interested in exploration of how the patterns of our lives limit our development of options.  My idea of a successful outcome will show itself as a spontaneous and original experience that challenges the status quo, while encouraging the growth of supportive relationships.  An exploration of family experiences can offer an effective recognition of patterns limiting the development of options, and the promotion of living in the moment. Among the primary accomplishments of effective therapy is the achievement of balance.  I welcome an active examination of those life experiences that challenge the need for limits that paralyze one's trust of self, and the trust of others.  The shaping of supportive relationships is the key to sustained success. As one who comes from a bi-cultural family history, I believe that it is vital to explore the values and prohibitions of family beliefs and practices.  Frequently, we live our lives and define our decisions by these values, limiting our exposure to new ideas and original concepts.

name: Madison Maynes
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: Using humor, authenticity, and unwavering compassion, I approach healing and recovery from a place of empowered vulnerability. I acknowledge the multitude of complexities that come with the human condition and the various systemic barriers, developmental traumas, and life stressors that can impact an individual and perpetuate suffering. Rooted in advocacy and social justice, I collaborate with clients and creatively explore ways for us to fully embody their strengths and apply them harmoniously to heal emotional wounds that have kept them from fully participating in their lives. In my clinical work, I incorporate my lived experience and personal recovery journey to assist clients in appreciating and honoring their power of choice, community, and vigorous honesty. I amplify opportune moments to delve deeper into self-exploration and wholehearted personal development by providing a comprehensive, fluid approach for each person. Using truth without judgment, I cultivate a safe space for clients to diligently foster an inner knowing that speaking their truth while allowing themselves to be fully seen can be a paramount component in their work to gain and maintain an authentic and sustainable connection to self and others.
