name: Brynn Spiegel, MFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Do you  get frustrated when you just can't let go of things that happened in the past? Are you realizing that the "stories" you keep telling yourself are getting in the way of finding happiness in your life? Are you stuck in a relationship that is just not working? Or are you a couple who is looking for help to break through long-standing blocks that have challenged the love you felt for each other when you first got together? Working with a compassionate therapist who understands how to help you let go of the past can dramatically change your life. I use a variety of therapeutic techniques that can assist you in breaking through old patterns and replacing them with new, positive ways to relate to yourself and others. In an environment of support, your capacity to love and grow as a person or as a couple can blossom. I use an integrative approach that incorporates cognitive and somatic models to help clients change core beliefs that influence their ability to function. I have specialized training in dealing with trauma, abuse and PTSD, including Lifespan Integration. I am also trained in Mindfulness-based Psychotherapy, a powerful stress-reducing tool.

name: Lauren Mellone
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Hi there! Finding a therapist can be a daunting task. Perhaps you're seeking extra support during a hard time, wanting to enhance your relationship(s), or feeling ready to explore some shadowy areas in your self. Maybe you are facing some existential or spiritual questions, and seeking personal transformation. All of these are vulnerable pursuits, and you want to find a therapist that feels comfortable for you! I'd love to talk with you and see if our connection feels right for the special work ahead of you. I welcome all people, including LGBT+, POC, and all ethnicities and religions. My approach is collaborative and client-centered, meaning we will explore together to discover your particular needs, and create a flexible plan for achieving the transformation you seek. Life is always changing, so I encourage openness and curiosity throughout the therapeutic process. I adapt an integrative, holistic approach, just for you.  I draw wisdom from a range of theories, trainings, and life-experience, and I often incorporate mindfulness, meditation and breathing techniques. This work feels sacred to me, and I bring to it a belief in our interconnectedness, and an abiding love for human beings (you!)

name: Nicole Skeele

My practice aims to help individuals and families relieve pain and nurture joy and optimism. With a warm approach, I seek to provide assessments, clinical treatment, and set realistic goals as soon as possible. I integrate mindfulness, and solution-focused techniques in session. Oftentimes, what happens early in life is overwhelming, or confusing. As each person is unique, I aim to tailor treatment to each person’s unique circumstances. I provide clinical services to individuals who may be managing feelings of overwhelm, isolation, or confusion. I use a trauma-informed lens to help members mitigate feelings of anxiousness, helplessness, and stress. I hope to help others process the past, and the world around them, and in turn understand themselves and their values better. I have six years of direct experience working with individuals and families in social services. To request an appointment please visit foresightmentalhealth.com

name: Ken Goodman
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am passionate about helping adults, teens, and children conquer their anxiety, OCD, fears, phobias, panic attacks, compulsions, worry, trauma, and depression.  In my 30 plus years working with patients, I have been a part of the most amazing transformations. Check out the success stories at KenGoodmanTherapy.com as well as the free self-help audios, articles, webinars, and videos.  Don't put off getting help.  You can get better.  There's no reason to suffer. Along with compassion, encouragement, and my dog Charlie, I have a huge toolbox of strategies to help you find the freedom you desire. I utilize cognitive behavioral therapy, ERP, mindfulness, EMDR, and hypnosis. In my spare time I work as a board member for the Anxiety and Depression Association of America and produce educational material for their website. I also create self-help material. I produced a 12-hour step-by-step audio program entitled, "The Anxiety Solution Series," a relaxation CD called "Stress Free," and a coloring self-help book, titled "Break Free from Anxiety." Feel free to reach out. I'm happy to speak with you.

name: Sunny Hills Behavioral Health & Sunny Hills TMS
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: I practice a style of therapy that is both strengths based and solution focused. It is my belief that people have within themselves and the environment the ability and resources to heal and lead meaningful lives. Traumatic life events have the potential to keep individuals feeling stuck. It can prevent us from realizing our full potential and maintaining a healthy self -esteem. During the course of treatment EMDR therapy may be utilized to resolve those issues and facilitate solutions that work best for you based on your own life experience, beliefs and personal strengths. I am a certified EMDR therapist and have a specialty in dealing with trauma and PTSD. I also have experience working on a wide range of issues that challenge clients. I use an eclectic therapeutic approach to treatment that is tailored to meet the individual needs of my clients. Beginning treatment can be a courageous decision and is often the catalyst to positive change. My goal is to work collaboratively with my clients in order to create that change. I provide a warm, open and supportive environment to work through your challenges and start the process of healing and ultimately reaching your full potential.

name: Marni Reinhardt
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Being part of a couple can be challenging. Do you need to improve your communication with your partner? Do you wish for a better emotional and physical connection? Perhaps you are hurting from a betrayal? Parenting styles too different? Or maybe you feel anxious or depressed about something in your life or relationship. HI. My name is Marni Reinhardt. With a direct, dynamic, and compassionate approach, I work with couples to find hope and healing. My first goal with couples is to reduce conflict. Then we work on the couples' goals: improve communication, intimacy, motivation, and hopefulness. We work together to create that positive, lifetime relationship everyone longs for Life is short. Divorce is expensive. Let's work together to avoid divorce and create habits and understandings to help you stay together and be happier. Please call me today at 949-393-8662. Or you can schedule an appointment via our online calendar on the website. I look forward to hearing your story.

name: Karen S Gould
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My psychotherapy practice is for adults of all ages, couples, and families. I can  help you discover the tools you need to develop and sustain satisfying relationships, respond positively to your environment, cope with stress, trust in yourself, actualize your dreams, and live your life with purpose, hope and integrity.  Whether you are adjusting to one of life's transitions (new baby, mid-life, new job, divorce, loss, marriage), struggling with anxiety/depression/anger/self-doubt, or attempting to conquer your fears or past trauma, I can provide a safe and trusting environment to help you discover healthy and productive ways of moving through life. I've been a licensed MFT since 1988. I treat individuals, couples, and families using a Family Systems orientation. That is, I believe the best way to understand an individual is not in isolation, but in relation to his/her family. Seeking therapy is big decision, and I honor your commitment to making this step. As an adjunct to my practice, I teach classes on Keeping Your Marriage Strong, Raising Your Daughter With A Healthy Body Image, The Six Facets of a Balanced Life, and Raising Your Child with Emotional Intelligence.

name: Sandy Peace
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: If you are ready for change in your life therapy is a great catalyst! I am an integrative therapist  utilizing a variety of modalities tailored to individuals', partners', and groups' needs: mindfulness, somatic, CBT, DBT, EMDR, brief psychodynamic, existential, humanistic, and relational. I work with a wide range of presenting concerns such as: identity development, life transitions, relationship enhancement, empowered communication, family issues, anxiety, depression, trauma, bipolar, personality disorders, addiction, sexuality, sexual orientation, gender identity, polyamory/open relationships. I am a multiculturally competent therapist, sex educator, and speaker. I have particular expertise working with young adult, gifted, LGBTQIA, and polyamorous people. I enjoy working with professionals "who have it all" yet are not happy, as well as people who feel constricted by societal roles and are seeking alternatives. I hold a holistic view of people and health and refer to physicians, psychiatrists, acupuncturists, massage therapists, etc. to support your mental/physical health. Societal factors, learning, genetics, and chemistry all shape us and are examined in therapy. Humor, love, acceptance, consciousness, and compassion are integral in our work together.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I think we all can relate to moments or events in our lives that forever change the course of our journey and throw us off of our path.  It is in these moments that we often feel anxious, stuck, or depressed.  I am committed to working with my clients to overcome their biggest challenges and fears by exploring what holds them back in these difficult times.  I work with my clients utilizing a holistic approach that is motivational, supportive, and empowering. I will help provide you with the tools to support you to live life as your best self.  When we allow ourselves to look within and break our negative thought patterns and limiting beliefs we are able to push past our fears and explore other pieces of ourselves. I am also trained in EMDR, mindfulness, and ketamine assisted psychotherapy. I am passionate about the work I do and committed to helping you in a way that best suits your needs.  In addition to being available in person, I now offer teletherapy, email, and phone sessions.  Contact me for a free phone consultation.  I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Jennifer L McMains
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, LPCC
about: If your relationships or life circumstances have you feeling stuck, anxious, or depressed, I can help you by providing a safe environment and some guided exploration of your strengths, options, challenges, and needs. I'm very good at helping you determine what is under your power to change and what is something to accept, grieve, and learn to live with.  Whether it's a failing relationship, children with disability, or your adolescent has pushed you to the end of your rope, I bring hope, humor and comfort as I walk along side you as you find solutions, peace, and direction. Relationships and Trauma are my specialities.  I help restore relationships that are stuck in negative cycles and renew parent-teen relationships that are struggling.  Helping families through divorce and restructuring is something else I do particularly well.  I use EMDR therapy for all ages, with a commitment to help especially children and veterans resolve trauma. I integrate spirituality, Christian theology, and psychology - not a task without ambiguities and mess.  I bring solid Biblical knowledge and prayer for those who want it, and solid wisdom for those who aren't religious.  I work with all faith orientations and with people who have no particular faith orientation.

name: Nicole Gibson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Therapy is collaborative. I believe that the mind/body/soul (or essence of you) needs to be aligned for a peak level of wellness. I know that therapy is only one of many strategies to find this alignment, and I will work with you to integrate the toolkit that you have already developed with new skills. Together we will identify the strengths that you already have and work towards your goals. I am dedicated to serving the Black and POC community as well as the LGBTQIA+, and other marginalized communities.  I have been very fortunate to have over twenty years of experience working in mental health serving a diverse clientele. Some of my specialties include working with substance and behavioral addictions, parenting a child with special needs, maternal mental health, and dealing with how culture and social justice intersect with interracial relationships. In particular, I have developed expertise in providing support for Black moms. I tend to use a solution-focused therapeutic approach and work to create a safe space, free of judgment where we can explore how culture and identity influences your concerns.  I am passionate about helping others to empower themselves and find confidence in their ability to heal and grow.

name: Carrie M. Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: You're the one everyone counts on. At work, you have a reputation for being reliable and getting the job done right. At home, your family leans on you for support. You're the one that carries everyone else's burdens, and you rarely ask for help. You enjoy being the one people can count on, but recently it feels like too much and you're struggling to juggle too many things. You don't want to let anyone down, but it feels like you're drowning and you don't know what to do. I have worked with countless clients who have experienced feeling like this. I love helping a client find much-needed balance in their life. Clients appreciate my welcoming personality as well as my balance of attuned listening and positive feedback to guide them toward the life they long for. I offer day, evening, and weekend appointments to accommodate busy schedules. I have 2 offices including: Mission Viejo and Newport Beach. If your schedule doesn't allow you to meet at one of my offices in person, I offer sessions wherever you are via video chat.

name: Rebecca Ching
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, CDWF+C, CEDS+S
about: I work with motivated individuals who are making a big impact in their work, home, community, and world. Established professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, business owners, ministry leaders, and mom's in midlife receive specialized support so you can achieve your desired changes in life personally + professionally. Perfectionism, overwhelm, fear of failure, frustrations and shame around recurring struggle keep getting in the way of you feeling connected to what matters most - your work, your family, your health. It can get loud btw your ears, especially after failed attempts of trying to figure things out on your own. I help you redefine your view of resistance (I call it protection), frustration around recurring struggles, failures, shame+fears through a lens of compassion, curiosity, and courage. I am a Certified Internal Family Systems Therapist, Certified Daring Way™ Facilitator+Consultant, Certified EMDR Therapist, Certified Eating Disorder Specialist+Supervisor. Sustained change comes with faithfully showing up, being seen+doing the brave work to change. Finding support that allows you brain, your body, and your heart to heal is self-care in action. Struggles+failures are the 'brutifal' part of living a bold life so difficult work and life experiences - big or small - need not be minimized but addressed + respected.

name: Christina Harrison
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: My primary goal in working in mental health is to put myself out of a job. Given that each of us intrinsically know what we need to heal and grow, my approach to psychotherapy is to couple your expertise of being you – your reality and lived experiences – with my skillset, in order to collaboratively work towards achieving your goals. Through a culturally-affirming and healing-centered stance, I utilize evidence-based treatments to facilitate our work. My primary therapeutic approach is Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), which centers mindfulness; ACT allows us to foster compassion and commitment to self in the service of living an enriched life, in spite of the discomfort and challenges which arise while trying to live it. I also utilize DBT, CPT, PE, and I am a certified CBT therapist. I am dedicated to working with communities who have been pushed into the margins: our BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, Persons of Color) family, LGBTQIA+ & GNC (gender non-conforming)  family, poly family, and disabled family. Despite the predominant narrative, our existence is synonymous with liberation, transformation, and love - let's actualize that together.

name: Tina R. Armstrong Therapy+ Adhd. Gifted. Learning Disability Testing
title: Psychologist, PhD, MA, EdM
about: Are you ready for change but not sure how to get there? Has COVID-19, social injustice, or life events caused you to rethink your current circumstances? Are you experiencing challenges in managing your multiple roles, in your personal relationships, at school, at work, or in your community? Do you want things to be different but you are not sure where to start?  Call me. I am a licensed clinical psychologist who provides ADHD, gifted and learning disability testing and specializes in providing therapy to Black women.  I approach treatment from a holistic perspective, recognizing the importance of engaging the mind, body and spirit. The fact that you are reading this means you are one step closer to discovering your solution.  You deserve to have someone walk with you on your journey to thriving. Someone who is able to empower you to achieve your goals by understanding your unique challenges and utilizing your strengths to create a healthy and fulfilled life. Today is your day! I am committed to enhancing your quality of life, alleviating distress and clarifying diagnosis.  My concurrent roles as a professor, researcher and trainer influences my work. At the end of the day what matters most is that you leave our time feeling understood and with tools that move you closer to your personal flourishing. You deserve it! You matter!

name: Natasha Clarke
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I have experience working with children, individuals, couples and families on a wide range of concerns including depression, anxiety, mood disorders, parenting challenges, family and relationship issues, and various life changes and adjustment issues. I identify as Afro-Latina.  I enjoy working with clients of all backgrounds, cultures and life experiences.  My therapeutic approach is an integrative one where I pull from various therapy models and tailor to meet your unique needs and my style is open, genuine, welcoming and interactive.   My approach to therapy tends to draw from a humanistic, person-centered approach in that I believe you are the “expert” in the room and my role is to provide you a safe, open and judgment free space to bring out the answers that already lie within you. I believe in creating a space where you can come as you are.  Therapy can be a process that if properly utilized can assist you in your process of self-discovery, explore, understand and resolve some of your challenges and learn or unlearn whatever is needed to lead the healthiest life possible. Contact me so we can discuss further and thank you for considering me to work with you on your journey.

name: Ruby Phun
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Starting therapy is difficult and scary; however, you do not have to do it yourself. I understand it is also vulnerable to share your stories with a stranger. Therapy is a space where you can feel safe being yourself. With sincerity, I strive to build that safe environment for you and work collaboratively to find yourself.  I also understand being in a relationship and, or keeping a relationship might be difficult and tiring. I can work together with your partner to help you both understand each other in a deeper connection and learn to communicate better. I came from an Asian American immigrant background. I have a passion for individual who struggles to find their place in family, community, relationship, boundaries, and sense of self. I want to empower you to find a healthy balance for yourself and the people you care about. Therapy with me will be tailored to your needs by utilizing strengths-based and client-centered. I can also speak Cantonese and Vietnamese! I offer a free 15-minutes phone consultation to explore your needs and answer any questions you might have about therapy with me.

name: Bruce Chernack
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Pandemic issues are causing problems! Need help with your son? Are you a young man who needs help with ongoing anxiety, depression, or substance abuse issues. I have been working with adolescent boys and young men for over 25 years.  Anger, depression, socialization, isolation, substance use/abuse, separation, realtionships, or just plain growing up are some of the issues. As a parent, or a young man yourself, you want to do your best to help you  and your family navigate through our complicated and ever changing culture. I connect with my clients through humor, knowledge of a young person’s culture, and a confidential relationship. I strongly believe in cognitive-behavioral techniques. We all, especially teens and young men, have automatic thoughts and beliefs, many that may be negative and harmful, that will strongly influence how we feel and how we act. If those automatic thoughts can be recognized and adjusted, change for the better will likely occur.

name: Edward Justin Horsley
title: MDiv
about: Who am I? Why am I here? Where am I going? These are a few of the questions that most people ask when they are in a time of struggle or change. We find ourselves searching for concrete answers but often find ourselves in shifting sand. We internalize this and feel like there is something wrong with us. We all encounter times of grief whether from the loss of a loved one, the loss of a job, loss of faith, etc. You deserve to talk with someone who can help you find your strengths as you navigate what may feel like an entirely new world. You don't have to do this alone. My non-anxious presence will bring you comfort as we explore you, the wound that brought you here and the strengths that will help you move forward. With over 10 years of full time hospice experience both in Spiritual Care and Grief Support, I have supported both adults and children of multiple faiths as well as those with no defined faith. If you are on this website looking for support for yourself or a loved one, I want to applaud you for taking the first step toward finding the support that you or your loved one needs. If you think that I might be a good fit, I encourage you to reach out. I look forward to supporting you and those you love.

about: I am passionate about providing the best possible therapy and assessment services for children.My focus is to help children learn skills tailored to their needs in order to feel successful and reach their fullest potential by helping them take control of their emotions, feel less stressed and more connected to their world.  If you are a parent who is concerned about your child’s well-being, I am here to help. Providing therapy services to kids has the potential to influence the entire course of a child's life.  I have more that a decade of experience working with children of all ages, from preschool to college, guiding them to access their fullest potential in learning.  With the use of various treatment modalities, I am able to guide each child through life’s challenges providing them with valuable life skills while making it fun!    Careful consideration in choosing the right path for your child's success is my priority. name: Linda A Dorsey
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: We all embark on the journey of life at the same starting point.  We all travel down the road before us; trying to carve out a path that will lead us to the kind of life that will bring us joy, peace, and happiness.  However, there are times when the path leads us off the course of happiness and fulfillment, and into some dark corners where we become stuck. Whether you're stuck in the woods of depression, anxiety or any other less-than-ideal detour, it is possible to get out of the dark places and back into the bright light of life.  I work with individuals, families, and couples to overcome obstacles that they encounter on the path of life. I look forward to working with you to assist you in geting back on the path that leads to the life you want and deserve.  Please call me today to schedule an appointment.

name: Olivia Jane Parker
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, ASW, MSW
about: I naturally feel empathetic towards others. I am fascinated by people, what they have been through and the resiliency that they have developed as a result. I relate the strengths that I see in my clients to my clients, helping build up their self-esteem and confidence. One of the most gratifying aspects about therapy is helping people identify what they like about themselves and observing their self-confidence blossom.  Our relationships with ourselves can be complicated. Together, let’s better understand how your life circumstances have gotten you to where you are today. What is working for you? What is not working for you? How is your relationship with yourself affecting your relationships with others?  In the midst of the pandemic, you might have moved back home to live with your family and are navigating that transition. Or maybe you are adapting to living on your own. Are you a student, struggling to adapt to doing school online? Perhaps you are non-partnered and are dealing with social isolation. Let’s talk about whatever is coming up for you right now.

name: Bonnie Ring
title: Psychologist
about:
As a caring & experienced psychotherapist, I listen carefully & respond honestly in person or by phone, FaceTime,  zoom, Skype.  Parental neglect or abuse leaves us with low self esteem, unresolved hurts & insufficient coping skills. Self criticism leads to painful and negative beliefs that cause depression and anxiety. We begin with the formative events in your life & your current issues. By drawing on family systems & psychodynamic principles, I use the latest interpersonal, cognitive & behavioral techniques with an informal and collaborative therapeutic approach that leads you toward greater self understanding & positive steps. Individuals who have placed themselves second to their spouses and families thrive when they are encouraged to know and care for themselves, discover their gifts and develop fruitful lives.

Men and women whose careers have had primacy value the new experience of understanding and listening to themselves. Over 45 years, I've companioned every kind of psychological issue and concern and seen enormous growth and change in my clients. During the corona virus pandemic, you can reach me by phone, zoom, FaceTime or Skyoe and get the help you need.

name: NS Licensed Marriage Family Therapist Inc.
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: If you are trying to understand why things keep happening, how to break a vicious cycle in your life, or you are just feeling stuck and need to feel heard and help with moving forward- we can help. We help many people who struggle with trauma, depression, anxiety, stress, family issues, and career/ work related issues move forward and find relief from their symptoms through therapy. Here we provide processing, guidance and direction that lead to your growth and healing as we work with adults, teens and couples. I help people understand where these stressors, emotions, and sensations might be coming from and use an evidence based practice, EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization Reprocessing) and solid therapeutic work to help alleviate these symptoms, and change the way we think about things, feel about things and react to things to make life easier and better.  We know how daunting it can be to talk to someone about some of the most vulnerable and difficult things in our lives, but we can help you through this and you do not have to do this on your own. In our office, we provide safety, warmth, and compassion as we walk with you on your journey of growth. (By appointment only, varies by clinician)

name: Liane Lester
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I am a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist who graduated from Azusa Pacific University (APU) and received a Masters in Psychology with an emphasis on marriage and family development. I also have a Bachelor of Science in Communications from Boston University. I am a BBS-certified MFT listed under my legal name Liane Christine Lester (Rasila is a nickname). I have worked in several Psychiatric facilities and various drug and alcohol detox facilities. I have had experience with multiple nationalities, socioeconomic levels, and geographical and educational mentalities. I have led groups that discuss life skills, goal setting, coping skills, symptom management, etc. I have also taught Cognitive Behavioral Anger Management and a Relapse Prevention class. Studying and working in psychology, I learned the skills necessary to connect with and counsel people to help them attempt to find solutions to difficulties they may be experiencing. Finally, I have personal experience working with traumatic and reached brain-injured students.  I am enthusiastic about this opportunity and eager to speak with you.

name: Kari Wendt
title: Counselor, MA, APCC
about: We all have days when we feel competent to take on the world, and then there are days when getting out of bed and brushing our teeth feels like an insurmountable task. If you are feeling overwhelmed, confused, or just not sure what to do and where to go next, let me be the first to say: "You are not alone!" Being human is difficult, particularly when we are trying to navigate our own needs in between the needs of our families, work, and the world. In my work as a therapist, I pull from many theoretical approaches and will work with you to develop effective tools. I have a strong belief that we are all created by our lived experiences - good, bad, or neutral - and that by identifying and saying them out loud, we can remove some of the power they have that is keeping us from reaching our goals. It is my duty to create a safe space for you to explore your past and present experiences in such a way that you will feel empowered and confident to step into your future. I will come to each session ready to meet you where you are - without judgment. I will hold space for your fears, tears, anger, and laughter. I'm here for you when you're ready to call.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: It is my hope that my clients learn to notice and understand that therapy is a place for growth, change and healing during life's challenges. I utilize an integrative approach to therapy combining EMDR, cognitive and behavioral strategies. My clinical approach can help you find new ways of experiencing yourself approaching life challenges. I help clients create practical solutions and new patterns to assist in achieve their goals, improving their relationship and balancing their lives. I am highly committed to the evidenced based practice of EMDR  & attachment theory practicing clinically for 10 years. I offer relationally-focused EMDR along with advanced psychotherapy methods (complex developmental trauma, attachment theory, ego states), to alleviate anxiety, depression, relationship challenges and trauma symptoms. I specialize in psychotherapy with individuals, family and couples in private practice.  My approach is direct, honest and down to earth. I approach couples, understanding that people vary in their need for intimacy & closeness and that these differences create challenges. I create a safe & welcoming space where couples learn to deal with conflict that ensures a successful & healthy union. Please visit me at rosejunietherapy.com for more information regarding my therapy practice and specialty.

name: Ross Crothers
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: When it comes to my work as a therapist, I am passionate about providing a space in which my clients feel heard, understood, and appreciated. While I have worked with a variety of clients including children, adolescents, couples, families, and individuals, I feel truly privileged to provide support to each of my clients in a time of need. I believe that everyone has the capability to evoke change in their life, sometimes we just need some help figuring out how to get started. To best support you, I utilize practices from mindfulness, Emotion-Focused Therapy (EFT), and trauma-informed care. I believe that maintaining a focus on a person's attachment and previous traumatic experiences help us to understand the development of behavior, and can often explain why we find ourselves in a repetitive pattern. What sets me apart from other therapists is that I strive to create a collaborative therapeutic environment. I believe that ultimately, you are the expert of your own emotional experiences and by working collaboratively, I can help you navigate struggles while we work to establish solutions. If you're ready for change, reach out and let's get started!

name: Amanda Rivera
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: There are many factors that contribute to the decision to pursue therapy. Finding someone who can assist you at this significant time in your life is an important choice.  As a licensed clinical psychologist, I collaborate with you to understand areas to focus on within therapy and best approaches that are both helpful and supportive. I highly value treating others with respect, empathy, and acceptance. Working with me you will find my style is warm, open, and interactive. My experiences in multiple settings, (community mental health, university counseling, private practice) have provided me with a wealth of knowledge/skills to work with people from diverse backgrounds. I enjoy working with young adults/adults seeking therapy for a wide range of reasons, such as depression, anxiety, life transitions, trauma, or grief and loss. Please contact me by email at amanda@riveratherapy.com or by phone at (925) 523-8834 if you have any questions or would like more information. I also encourage you to take a look at my website to find more information about my practice and me.

name: Mauri-Lynne Heller
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about:
A psychoanalyst and Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, in addition to my general adult practice, I specialize in adolescents/young adults on the spectrum and their families; phase of life/human development issues, character disorders, and psychotic disorders.  I also specialize in the treatment of specific developmental and emotional concerns of adolescents and young adults.  Psychoanalytic therapy addresses your very specific needs and problems. The therapeutic relationship we develop will allow us to work collaboratively  to find solutions and answers together.  The more committed you are, the more change you will experience. Unlike brief quick "cure" therapies focusing on single problems or symptoms, psychoanalysis considers you a whole person, slowly integrating all aspects of your mind/brain/body.  Linking your inner and outer worlds, your dreams, wishes, desires, fears, losses, past and present, your life begins to change gently and meaningfully. People often begin psychoanalytic therapy after feeling disappointed by other forms of treatment that attempt to control thoughts and behaviors. 

Psychoanalysis safely explores unconscious emotional patterns - "maps" driving your thoughts, beliefs and behaviors - by bringing into awareness these echoes from infancy before thinking matured. Psychodynamic therapy actually alters brain patterning, opening up many new possibilities.

name: Caroline Ewan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Life moves fast and sometime we can’t keep up. Sometimes we don’t feel like we can talk to others for fear of judgment. Do you feel overwhelmed? Do you withdraw and shut down when you are struggling? Do you have thoughts come at you a mile a minute? Do those same thoughts take off into uncharted territory? It’s not uncommon, and you don’t have to feel that way forever. You might not have the tools to sort out or process these emotions. Maybe you know some skills, and are unsure how to or when to use them. These are just a few reasons why people seek therapy and I provide a supportive, non-judgmental and encouraging environment. I work with a wide range of topics such as stress management, couples issues, anxiety and depression. I also have a passion to work with mothers suffering from prenatal and postpartum anxiety and/or depression, and those have or are currently experiencing grief and loss. My approach is solution focused and examining negative thoughts and behaviors. Life can be hectic and sometimes we cannot manage that alone. While it feels overwhelming and scary to ask for help, I will provide you a safe space to talk about what it weighing you down. It is a journey and I will be there for you every step of the way.  I would love to be supportive ears and eyes for you.
issues: ['Coping Skills', 'Relationship Issues', "Women's Issues"]

name: Cindy Robertson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Life can feel overwhelming, confusing and difficult. Relationships can be challenging. Change and loss can lead to uncertainty. All of this can lead to feelings of anxiety and depression. I help people make sense of their experience, navigate through difficult times and increase their self-awareness to achieve a greater sense of purpose, freedom, and choice in their lives. The therapeutic relationship is a collaborative space where you can work to understand and resolve your feelings, explore thoughts and behaviors that may have you feeling “stuck” in your life and identify relationship patterns that interfere with your well-being. My background is in depth psychology, which means that in addition to helping clients contain symptoms, I help them to explore what is behind those symptoms. As uncomfortable as some emotional experiences can be, what we call “symptoms” often contain valuable information about what we want and need and the state of our-selves.  My approach is non-pathologizing and client-centered, with an emphasis on relationship building and Jungian psychology. Reaching out to a therapist is a courageous act and though therapy may be challenging, it can also lead to a more authentic life in relationship to ourselves and others. I invite you to call for a free 15 minute consultation.
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Codependency', 'Depression', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Spirituality', 'Substance Use', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Kasey Lafferty
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MSc, LMFT
about: Are you ready to make changes in your life and relationships? I work with individuals, couples and families in order to help them lead more fulfilling lives. Clients of mine are often looking for support in developing effective coping skills to manage difficult emotions/urges, strategies for improving communication/connection and ways to reduce conflict/turmoil in their lives. Given that our lives are complex, my approach is tailored to you and your needs. I draw from a variety of therapy models, providing an environment where you feel safe, heard and supported in making positive change. As your therapist, I view my role as being a tool in helping you to reach your goals. We will work collaboratively to find helpful solutions. Therapy offers the opportunity to achieve a deeper understanding of our innermost wants and needs; as well as increase our capacity to get our wants/needs met in healthy ways. It is an honor to join you on your journey of change and transformation.

name: Erim Sarbuland
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Hi, I’m Erim a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist born and raised in Southern California. I am passionate about normalizing therapy and believe whole heartedly in creating time and space for healing. Facing challenges and difficult circumstances is a part of life and it is ok to reach out for help when you need it. I have a down to earth and approachable style to therapy.   I have treated those dealing with anxiety, depression, faith issues, cultural duality, life transitions, grief,  and more. I truly seek to be your advocate and cheerleader in this journey of therapy. I combine using both CBT, client centered, and solution focused modalities. I believe in empowering and educating my clients in order to help them reach their goals. I will utilize session for processing and reflection, as well as introducing practical tools and techniques to face and work to overcome the challenges you are facing. It is a privilege for me to come along side you and share in your story. I commend you for taking this step and truly believe it takes courage. I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Daniel R. Blaess
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I have worked in mental health for over 30 years, in a wide variety of professional settings. My professional training has been extensive, and includes degrees from Harvard University and the California School of Professional Psychology, as well as post-doctoral studies at the San Diego Psychoanalytic Center. I'm an adjunct faculty member at the Center for Creative Leadership, the UCSD Department of Psychiatry, as well as with the Naval Medical Center Psychiatry Residency Program. I have also taught at several colleges as an adjunct faculty member. I pride myself on making the process of getting help and understanding problems as easy as possible. The point of getting help is to have more of the life that you want for yourself. I work collaboratively with clients to better understand themselves and the difficulties they are experiencing. I try to be responsive to client needs, and offer some flexibility in fees and appointment times, including evenings and weekends.  Call me... I'm happy to discuss your concerns and potentially arrange for an initial consultation.  Learn more at my website!  I'm at www.drblaess.com.

name: Roger Karlsson
title: Psychologist, PhD, ABPP, QME
about: I am trained as a psychologist and psychotherapist in both California and Sweden. I am an appointed Adjunct Clinical Associate Professor of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences at Stanford University School of Medicine, and I have over 30-years of experience in providing mental health treatment. I am a board certified specialist (ABPP) in both forensic psychology and psychoanalysis and a certified Qualified Medical Evaluator (QME). I provide treatment as well as psychological and forensic evaluations. I know how to help you effectively without judgement or blame. You have the right to feel better about yourself and your life. I am trained in a broad range of treatment methods, such as mentalization based treatment, psychodynamic psychotherapy, psychoanalysis, cognitive-behavioral therapy, family and couples therapy. I provide treatment as well as psychological and forensic evaluations. My approach is based on psychotherapy and attachment research and follows the premise that the key to effective treatment centers on the quality of the relationship between you and your therapist; that you feel heard, respected, supported, and that we are mutually engaged in trying to understand your challenges.

name: Kimberly Stewart
title: Drug & Alcohol Counselor, CADCIIl, SAP, MA
about: Addiction is a confusing, overwhelming, & powerful force. It is all- encompassing, taking over slowly or quickly in every area of one's life. Before long you don't know which way is up and are just struggling to get through the day...or hour. Together we uncover patterns of behavior that no longer serve you, understand why you developed these patterns, and discover new ways of living. I support individuals in rediscovering who they are and what they are passionate about. Addiction does not stand alone.  We drink or use to alter an undesirable state of mind. It is crucial to address addiction at its roots. I have specialty areas within the many struggles that lead to/result from substance use such as: Domestic Violence, Emotional Abuse, Sexual Assault, low self- worth, Codependency, and PTSD to name a few close to my heart. Congratulations on taking the first step towards your recovery. Looking for help is a big deal! I'm an Internationally Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor and Domestic Violence Specialist with extensive professional and personal experience. I'd love to provide a free consultation to discuss any questions you may have and get you started on your path!

about: My goal is to create a safe and open space for you to explore your story and deepen your self understanding, putting you on a path to healing. I work with you to identify areas of frustration and concern, as well as areas of strength. name: Beachfront Anxiety Specialists
title: PhD
about: You feel like you are on the verge of losing your mind. No matter how hard you try, you can’t seem to quiet your worrying thoughts. On the inside, you probably feel dread in the pit of your  stomach as a constant reminder that something bad could happen at a moment's notice. This makes it very hard to concentrate or to let your guard down. Constant worry or intrusive thoughts leave you feeling exhausted and irritable. An unspoken consequence of your anxiety is a defeating sense of shame, leading you to feel weak or small. You long for a state of peace and comfort that you may not have known for years, or maybe since you were a small child. You want to experience what its like to have better control over your mind and body. You want somebody who really gets how painful anxiety is and can give you actionable steps to feel better. We can help you with this. We are a group of highly trained psychologists and therapists who have devoted our professional careers to helping our clients overcome anxiety disorders and OCD.  Many of our clients have been in therapy for years, working with non-specialists who just couldn't offer them the tools they needed to get better. We pride ourselves on being able to skillfully tailor cutting-edge psychological interventions to your unique needs, background, and treatment goals. We strive to enable a safe, authentic, and collaborative relationship with our clients, to help you feel fully understood and to have a clear idea of your journey towards healing. We invite you to check out our website and schedule a free phone consultation today.

name: Bridgette Atallah
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Beginning therapy is a deeply personal, courageous decision. Whether it is your first time seeking treatment, or you are looking for a change, I am here to work with you to create a happier, more fulfilling life. I believe building a strong therapeutic relationship is a critical foundation for future change. As such, I strive to provide warmth and empathy while utilizing an open, non-judgmental style. I also believe therapy should be a collaborative process, and will work with together with you as a partner in your treatment journey. I use this collaborative style with everyone I work with, from young children and teens to adults. I hope to provide you with a safe, supportive space, allowing you to grow and heal. I utilize Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT) and specialize in anxiety disorders, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), school refusal, panic, depression, and stress management. I will help you identify goals, develop coping skills, establish hope, and feel empowered. I also have other doctors at my practice who each provide excellent CBT for children, teens, and adults, in the event that my schedule is full, to ensure you receive quality care. Please visit our website for more information. I truly commend you for taking the first steps toward a better future. It would be my privilege to assist you in your journey.

name: Cori Pansarasa
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Would you like to feel more present in life and more secure in relationships?  I have helped many to move past difficult experiences to reconnect with the beauty of life. My treatment focus is helping people to effect change through making different life choices, and on therapy as a working partnership. Trained in both traditional and holistic understandings of mind-body-spirit, my experience includes private practice; crisis work; directorships at mental health agencies; supervision of student therapists; and consultation for providers and organizations. I also integrate spiritual and energy healing perspectives when appropriate. I have extensive experience working with trauma, anxiety and mood disorders, childhood physical/sexual abuse and neglect, and aging issues. My training and experience include Internal Family Systems/IFS, brainspotting/somatic techniques, relational work, and helping those with creative gifts. I also have a sub-specialty working with women with Asperger's. I believe that there should be a good fit between therapist and client. Feel free to call me so that we can talk and find our common ground. I provide a relaxed and welcoming office atmosphere so that clients can feel at home and have a safe, comfortable sanctuary to work on their issues. Please note, my office is not wheelchair accessible.

name: Randall B. Davis
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I'm glad that you have taken a minute to look at my listing. I am a Marriage and Family Therapist with a Telehealth practice based in Irvine. I am able to see clients statewide. I began practicing in 1982, first as an Intern and fully licensed (LMFT 19383) since July 1984. My emphasis is on marital and family issues, plus I have a special interest and extensive experience with High Functioning Autism / Asperger's Disorder. I have often found that when we make the relationship our primary focus, the relationship often gets worse. When each of us focuses on becoming who we were designed to be, often the relationship gets better. Most of us have tried many different ways to deal with our difficulties in life. Some of our coping skills have been very creative, but "coping" skills always come at a cost. Coping is often just surviving, not thriving. My goal is to help you move beyond "coping" to thriving. None of us are what we were intended to be. We are all broken, and fallen. There is no shame in this. Our goal is to grow into the person we were originally designed to be. My hope, my passion, is to be able to help you toward this goal.

name: Sharon Ellenbogen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I have been in private practice for over 20 years in Los Angeles, California.  I specialize in helping you with communication issues, relationship problems, life transitions, financial and career stress..  My approach to therapy is a collaborative effort using cognitive behavioral methods to empower you to develop and take responsibility for yourself.  Together we build the awareness between thoughts, feelings and actions to align with your integrity and best intentions.  I want you to become a better communicator of your needs and to be able to resource yourself effectively. I encourage both individual adults and couples to become more compassionate and understanding of themselves and others. You will develop the clarity, ease and grace to be able to seek and give the support that is needed in your interpersonal relationships.   I am influenced by concepts of neuroscience and cognitive behavioral therapy that make difficult ideas relatable and life long tools of self-care accessible.  For couples I am certified in the Relational Life Therapy (RLT) model.  For more information go to my website www.SharonEllenbogen.com.

name: Michelle C. Branch

about:
Overwhelmed, feeling like your life is out of control? Do you lie in bed at night unable to stop the racing thoughts? In a relationship that's causing distress because you continue to argue over the same things without ever coming to a resolution? Tired of not being heard or listened to? 

Going through a divorce or dealing with loss? Why continue the struggle alone? I provide a safe, nonjudgmental environment and assist you in learning how to slow things down and to focus on what is truly causing you distress in your life. We will work together on developing a plan that will allow you to reach your ultimate goals.

name: Paul Carbajal
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Connection is at the core of who we are, what we’re passionate about, and the most meaningful relationships we have.  And yet so many things can interfere with our ability to connect: anxiety, depression, grief, traumatic experiences...how we cope with these things may inhibit our ability to build intimacy with those around us.  I work with students and young adults, as well as those in mid-life and beyond, who experience anxiety, depression, relationship issues, or life transitions, that interfere with living fully you, fully now. Through a combination of strengths-based, solutions-focused, and interpersonal therapeutic style, I help people build awareness around painful emotions, insight around current needs, and clarify the values that drive action.  I am passionate about helping you overcome past hurts, current discomforts, and future fears, to build a life worth living. Tuesday Evenings (In Person/Virtual); Wednesday Evenings (Virtual Only)

name: EMDR Collective, Founder Dawn Delgado, CEDS, EMDR
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, CEDS-S, EMDR
about: I believe in your ability to create a fabulous, adventurous, and fulfilling life. If fear, anxiety, depression, past traumas or blocks are in the way, we can help. My name is Dawn Delgado and I founded EMDR Collective after 20+ years of developing treatment centers, teaching, training, presenting, and advocating for optimal mental health.  I am a Certified Eating Disorder Specialist, and an EMDR Certified Trauma Specialist who is well equipped to manage high profile cases.  I have hand picked the EMDR Collective therapists and a dietary consultant to provide compassionate, effective wellness services to you and your loved ones. Our EMDR Collective specialties are working with eating disorders, anxiety and depression, PTSD and trauma, body image, as well as peak performance and career counseling.  We provide optional nutrition consultation and meal planning to support your optimal mental health, including tackling gut issues, disordered eating and dietary accountability support. This is a step towards realizing or rediscovering your best self. You may feel as if something is holding you back in life. The EMDR Collective team intends to create a safe place for you to discover and to let go of what has been blocking your happiness, success, and joy.  You will be matched with a Therapist and Dietitian that fits your wellness goals.

name: Uplift Family Services
title: Psychologist
about: WHAT WE DO:  Uplift Family Services specializes in providing comprehensive diagnostic evaluations for individuals suspected of having autism and other related disorders. Through the use of gold standard evidence-based evaluation tools, the assessment team is able to provide a thorough evaluation of social, emotional, language, adaptive, behavior, cognitive, and developmental functioning and provide comprehensive treatment strategies and recommendations. HOW WE HELP:  Accurate diagnostic assessment is essential to identify the best treatment options and make critical decisions in an individual's life care. Early Intervention has proven beneficial outcomes, though a diagnosis and treatment for adults is just as important. Uplift provides comprehensive Autism evaluations for children, adolescents, and adults. OUR MISSION:  Uplift Family Services is a private nonprofit agency which has evolved over 150 years. As one of the largest, most comprehensive behavioral health treatment programs in California, our mission is to ensure individuals with autism are able to access evaluation and treatment and get support they need.

name: Jennifer Robins
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: In my practice, we integrate the mind, body and soul to reach the highest level of healing. I practice from an intuitive, experiential and clinically trained, holistic approach to meet the needs that present themselves throughout our work together. I have a diverse social work background from working with at-risk youth to sitting with those experiencing life’s most profound pain: the death of a loved one. I would also like to share: I am a military veteran and would be honored to support fellow service members and first responders. I am accepting new clients and am able to work with anyone residing in the state of California, as my practice is 100% remote Teletherapy. If you think I may be a good fit to walk beside you through this challenging time, I welcome your call.

name: Karen Duran
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: It is my belief that anyone can experience an inner light of peace and embody love regardless of the many possibilities: past or present traumas, mood instability, depression, anxiety, shame, daily stress, circumstances, infidelity, relationship status, break-ups, financial strain, divorce, failure, faith crisis, unmet needs, and all the things in between.  One must first be willing to claim the growth and change desired by first believing that it is possible to obtain and are worthy of receiving it. If this is you, then I believe I am a right fit for you - I am willing to believe with you. The processes I will introduce you to includes utilizing a combination of psychodynamic modalities, meditation, and spiritual work. Utilizing important principles and your most profound breakthroughs to reveal your inner wisdom. I do not believe one model fits all so I draw from different modalities for a personalized approach/assessment. My passion rest in Spiritual healing. I see the value of ones faith in God and the integration of mind, body, and soul connection. I have a keen ability to empower people by bringing out their best self and desiring to live and walk in their faith. Inner light and love are something you choose!

name: Kooshay Malek
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Asking someone for help can feel very uncomfortable and maybe even a bit scary. These feelings are very human. We are not meant to be alone and to do things alone and that is why healthy connections can raise our resilience.  In therapy you need to feel safe and connected to your therapist for the healing to begin. Once you feel grounded in the therapeutic relationship, the exploration and learning will start. Painful past experiences may have you believing that you are incapable of picking a desirable and loving partner.  Therapy can aid in getting to know yourself and understand your wants and needs and to learn to create and sustain healthy relationships that will make you feel valued and loved. I work with a variety of adults and couples and have specific training in the following areas: relationship/communication issues, grief and loss, life transitions, alcohol/drug issues, Al-anon/codependency issues, trauma, and LGBTQ issues.

name: Hazzel Angulo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT, EMDR
about: Trauma, anxiety, and addiction can make you feel stuck. The most important step towards healing is to address the unresolved emotion inside you. Healing requires feelings. Acceptance slowly dissolves pain. When we function from the fear and scarring of our trauma, the cycles continue until we learn how to transmute that energy into love. I apply a Holistic approach that integrates physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual forms of well-being, addressing the “whole” self. Through a holistic framework tailored to your unique needs, the goal is to support you develop a deeper understanding of the self on all these levels. I am trained in EMDR therapy, which is designed to reduce the emotional intensity attached to the disturbing memories through the use of eye movements or tapping, resulting in a reduction of symptomology. I also assist in your healing process by utilizing CBT, mindfulness, and Solution Focused Therapy. Healing is POSSIBLE. I'm committed to providing actionable tools to help you take charge of your inner well-being, address unresolved emotions, improve relationships, and enrich your strengths to create a sense of empowerment. I also provide therapy in Spanish. Please book your free consultation.

name: Chris Restivo - Ketamine-Assisted Psychotherapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: We are all inherently whole- we've just forgotten... Underneath the tumult and overwhelming flood of uncomfortable emotions is a core unscathed by the stress and trauma.  My role is to help you find your way back to your center where life again feels manageable, satisfying, and vibrant. Ultimately you're the expert; yet each step of the way I will be there with you to collaborate and support your efforts. Most of my clinical work has been spent treating individuals with mood disorders (major depression, bipolar disorder, etc.) and psychosis. However, I've also worked with a range of individuals with a variety of life experiences around issues such as life transitions, trauma, anxiety, grief, as well as gender and sexual identity. Our work together will combine interventions based on Evidence-Based Practices (EBP's), such as Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT), and CBASP. Yet, my background in Buddhist Psychology, Mindfulness, and Somatic Psychotherapy (body-based), will help to integrate the changes you are making on all levels of your being.

name: Rebecca Berg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Do you live in constant fear?  Are you overwhelmed by grief?  Do you find yourself feeling sad, withdrawn, irritable, and lonely?  Are you struggling to communicate with your teen?  Do you often wonder why they behave in certain ways?  If so, I would like to help.  We all would like to think we are strong enough to overcome these issues on our own, but there comes a time when we need to reach out for additional help.  I specialize in treating trauma (specifically sexually abuse), mood disorders, and grief.  I also have worked extensively with teens and their families, so I know the problems that are unique to teens.  In addition to treating those who have experienced trauma in their lives, I also specialize in working with grief.  Unresolved trauma and grief can have a tremendous impact upon your relationships and your ability to live your life in the way in which you desire.  By resolving this trauma, you can be free of the negative patterns in your life. Through our work together, I will listen nonjudgmentally and help heal the deep wounds of your past.  We will form a partnership to creatively help you reclaim your life.  There will be room for hopes and dreams and life will not be simply about surviving.  Please do not hesitate to contact me to see if we are a good fit.

name: Samuel Shapiro
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Thank you for taking the time to visit my profile! My practice is largely geared toward supporting individuals, couples and families in navigating difficulties and transitions (relationship dynamics, grief, stress, anxiety, and disconnection) as well as those seeking a deeper connection with themself or others. I have a special interest in supporting male identified folks, emerging adults (16 and up), as well as those who feel firmly, or not so firmly, planted in the adulting world. I also specialize in supporting caregivers of children of any age. I offer a warm, inviting, consistent space to focus on whatever it is that is bringing you to therapy. I do this in part by supporting you to name and reflect on your experiences/relationships and consider how they are working for you; and where you can feel more agency within or around them. These conversations are guided by YOUR hopes, values, and dreams. If you think this approach might help you, or you are just wondering what this might look like in your specific case, please consider giving me a call so that we can discuss what you are looking for and if we might be a good fit.

name: Daniela Yanet Alvarado
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Daniela Yanet Alvarado is a licensed Clinical Social Worker based in Huntington Park, California. Known for her inclusive and community-focused therapy approaches, Daniela blends evidence-based practices with culturally compassionate therapies that serve people of color. Her unique approach as a therapist — mixing evidence-based practices with eclectic therapies encompassing spirituality, culture  and religion — has allowed her to better equip her clients with the tools to develop and strengthen their abilities to solve life’s problems and challenges. Daniela’s unique approach to therapy is inclusive and empathetic — she explains: “As your therapist, I believe that you are the expert of your life. I am here to guide you in the areas of your life that might be preventing you from being the best version of yourself.” Daniela Yanet Alvarado, fundadora de la práctica privada Latine Therapy, es Licenciada Trabajadora Social Clínico con sede en Huntington Park, California. Conocida por su inclusión y enfoques de terapia centrados en la comunidad, Daniela combina la evidencia basada en la evidencia prácticas con terapias culturalmente compasivas que sirven a las personas de color.Nacido de padres inmigrantes de Guanajuato, México, y criado en Los Ángeles. Daniela creció con un fuerte sentido de la justicia y una comprensión instintiva de las realidades sociales, históricas y políticas que impactan a su comunidad. Daniela fundó su práctica privada Latine Therapy en respuesta a la alta local demanda de terapeutas de color. Su enfoque único como terapeuta : mezcla prácticas basadas en la evidencia con terapias eclécticas que abarcan la espiritualidad y la cultura y la religión — le ha permitido equipar mejor a sus clientes con las herramientas necesarias. "Estoy aquí para guiar tú en las áreas de tu vida que podrían estar impidiendo que seas el mejor versión de ti mismo/a. Las prácticas basadas en la evidencia no siempre cumplen con la salud mental necesidades de las comunidades Indígenas Latinas, Afroamericanas, Asiáticas y Nativas Americanos, así que crear mi enfoque único me ha permitido ayudar al cliente.

name: Karen Kerschmann
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Life can get hard.  If you are struggling with anxiety or panic, cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) can help you get back on track. From the first session, you can expect to develop real, long-term solutions so that you can feel better, be more productive, and find yourself again.  Backed by decades of research, treating anxiety and panic through cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is one of the most effective agents of change in the mental health field. By breaking down your maladaptive patterns, you can draw from your existing strengths and develop new coping techniques to overcome negative thoughts and emotions.   Things can get better.  To find out how I can help, please contact me for a 15-minute complimentary consultation.

name: Rachel Kaplan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Are you struggling with the pressures of the moment? Looking for skills in staying balanced, resourced and engaged? Are you longing for community to share and hold your powerful feelings? Dream of extricating yourself from business as usual & finding your purposeful response to this time? EcoSomatic Action supports your embodied intelligence & tunes your deep listening to what is being asked of you at this time. In the circle of community, we offer earth and body-centered practices that affirm your commitments to what you love. I offer deep somatic interventions & practices that help you stay balanced, resourced & on purpose. My ecological perspective supports the changes you seek, reaching more broadly than the psychological paradigm can. Our group work provides support for your deep feelings in collaboration with others who feel the same way. You feel the pressure of the moment & wonder how to survive and thrive through it. You are  not built to grieve all of this on your own - you need & long for community at this time of cultural shift. You sense how rare this moment is and want to show up with your highest and best self. EcoSomaticAction is here to support all of your potential for change.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Hello, and welcome! I know firsthand that making the initial contact for therapy can often be the hardest part- I'm here for you. I take an open minded, curious, down to earth approach creating a warm and safe environment. We will go at your pace, digging deep when you are ready or scratching the surface of what is on your mind and in your heart.  Whether you have pervasive anxiety, unresolved trauma, fears, an unexpected transition, or even desire a mental and emotional 'tune up' I am here. Let's get started! (Video and House call appointments available depending on availability.)  This work is my passion. I honor holding a confidential, safe space for you to gain insight while exploring triggers, thoughts, and emotions- ultimately resulting in your personal growth.  I firmly believe you are the expert on you. I can expertly help tap into your strengths removing the 'stuck spots'. Let's go on this journey together! You may book online:  stephanie-fletcher.clientsecure.me or if you prefer, call for a free 15 minute phone or in person consult.  This could help us get a feel of how we may work together.

name: Jean Hamilton
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MFT
about: I tend to see individual adults and couples in my practice who want to develop more self awareness, insight, and understanding as to why they are facing the difficulties or challenges which bring them into work with me. My hope is to help them see where their early childhood experiences impact and affect their functioning as adults. One goal for them is to become more flexible in their thinking and behavior so that they can enjoy their lives more fully. I see my role as an assistant to them in this process, trusting them, their thinking and ability to change. My belief is that humans have an innate capacity to heal from their hurts, but that this process of healing has been interfered with by well-meaning adults and by an oppressive society. My role is to help clients relearn this natural healing process and be able to use it. A large part of my work with clients is to get them "feeling their feelings." This means encouraging the emotional release work (crying, laughing, shaking, as well as talking) which are the outward indicators that healing and transformation are taking place. This process is what helps them become more human.

name: Sabrina Norton
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Do you want to clarify your goals, and find the necessary steps to reach them?  It's important to have the right environment in which gives you the freedom to work toward your goals comfortably.  My approach: using simple, proven integrative mental health/wellness tools with elements of cognitive behavioral therapy. You will be able to take away tangible, easy to use ways to deal with whatever you feel is hindering you from reaching goals to be your best self. These last couple years have presented many challenges to our overall perspective. I know through perseverance, determination and faith I have been able to persist and grow. These experiences help me to know how to help you.

name: Breanne Schellenbach
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Sometimes when we are struggling, what we really need is someone to be present while we experience parts of our selves and share thoughts and memories that we fear. And if that someone can show love and illuminate what we struggle to make sense of, then the work is unfolding. The healing is happening. I hope that I can be a part of that healing for you.  I believe in the power of the therapeutic relationship. Connecting weekly with a therapist can model healthier relationships and healthy attachment and transform your life in powerful ways. I work with my client to develop a deeper understanding of his/her life and “symptoms” or “problems”, which helps lead to healing in a holistic manner. My work blends dialectical behavior therapy with depth psychotherapy. Learning how to manage emotions, live mindfully, improve relationships, and cope with difficult life moments is important. I also work with my client to find ways to bring soul back into ones life and to help create meaning and deeper understanding.

name: Yekaterina (Katia) Kaplun

about: You are curious, creative and sensitive. You may be an artist or a writer, or working hard finding balance between your personal needs and those of others depending on you. name: Alberto Flores Hernandez
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: It takes courage to reach out and seek help, and for many people, the idea of opening up to a complete stranger is scary and anxiety-provoking. But I believe in therapy, and one of the most important aspects in therapy is that you feel heard, respected and understood. My first task is to welcome you as a unique individual, with your own strengths and values. A good therapeutic relationship is built on trust, caring, and collaborative work. My approach to treatment focuses primarily on the belief that people are doing the best they can under their current circumstances. I have a wealth of experience working with people suffering from depression, anxiety, trauma, phase-of-life problems and grief. I'm passionate about helping people, and my role as a therapist is to meet you where you are and guide you to where you want to be, and in the process, help you achieve your goals of a better, healthier life by reducing suffering and increasing inner peace and wellness.
issues: ['Divorce', 'Family Conflict', 'Grief', 'Life Coaching', 'Life Transitions', 'Racial Identity', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Mar Chung
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: In my clinical work, I focus on the development of the therapeutic relationship, first and foremost. This can look like: learning about you, prioritizing what you bring to session, and gently encouraging you to work toward your identified goals. I use what comes up in the therapy space as opportunities for relational skill-building, such as focusing on strengths, building self-compassion, learning to identify wants/needs, regulating emotions, and working through conflict. I interweave understandings of sociocultural context to contextualize your experience, and to move the foci of change from what isn't in your control to what is. I specialize working with queer and trans BIPOC folks. Having worked in university counseling for seven+ years, I also have extensive experience working with: life transitions, career, procrastination, emotion regulation, codependency, perfectionism, identity development, privilege and power, and relationships (friends, partner(s), family, coworkers, etc.). If you're struggling with being hard on yourself and others, like you're hitting a wall with trying to change something about yourself or your relationships, I have a wild hunch that, perhaps, there are reasons. And through this growth process, I hope we can learn to understand, accept, and shift what's in your control and allow for what isn't.

name: Carrie R King
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I am a clinical psychologist who works with children and adolescents in individual and group psychotherapy, and I conduct neuropsychological and educational evaluations. I am interested in working with individuals on developing healthy relationships with self, family, peers, and school. I consider each person a component of a family system and each family system as a part of school and community systems. Therefore, I value the insights of parents and teachers and understand healthy communication feeds emotional well-being, relationship success, and academic achievement. I believe that strong people are built on the shoulders of the people who surround them. In general, I see children  to work on issues the child or parent identifies as  important for change. My approach stems from training in systems, cognitive-behavioral, psychodynamic, and interpersonal psychotherapy. This simply means that I  am flexible and can adjust to individual personalities and goals. I also offer groups that teach core relationship-building skills, such as listening, displaying empathy, providing and accepting feedback, identifying nonverbal cues, and controlling impulses. The children learn to pinpoint behaviors, incidents, or thoughts that precede emotions and, in turn, to understand how their emotions lead to certain behaviors.

name: Dr. Marci Flores
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Creating a safe, supportive and non-judgmental space for all who are interested in reconnecting to a sense of empowerment, fulfillment and inner peace. We'll work together to make meaningful changes to the underlying thoughts, feelings and behaviors getting in the way of the life you want to live. Sessions are uniquely designed to you based on an expertise in evidence based therapies such as Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, Prolonged Exposure, Interpersonal Therapy, and Cognitive Processing Therapy. Results include feeling calmer, in control, and re-energized. Specialties & Areas of Focus:  Anxiety (Panic Attacks, Phobias, OCD, General Anxiety, Stress), Trauma, Grief/Loss, Life Transitions, and General Mental & Emotional Wellness. Schedule a free consult through my website! I'm accepting new referrals for Teletherapy only. Please note that insurance is not accepted, but I can provide monthly SuperBills by request if you'd like to submit to your insurance provider for reimbursement. I am also quick to respond to emails and phone calls if you have any questions and would like to reach out. I look forward to working with you!
