name: Stephen R Snyder
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Mine is an eclectic orientation. I have been deeply influenced by several years of practice in body oriented physio and psychotherapy. I have training and experience in Ericksonian Therapy, Narrative Therapy, Mindfulness and Relaxation Therapies, Brief Therapies (Problem and Solution Focused), Trauma Informed (Trauma Focused Cognitive Behavioral) Therapy, CBT,  Neo-Jungian Therapy and Neuro-Linguistic Programming. I have worked in private practice, County Mental Health, and Non-Profit Mental Health settings. I prefer to work with adults,18 and older, to aid and assist in healing, personal growth, and self awareness. I view therapy as a collaborative process wherein the therapist supports and guides the client to self awareness, self efficacy, and self reliance. I believe that most clients possess, or can learn, the tools and resources they need to address the challenges they face in the moment, to find contentment. "We're just walking each other home" Ram Dass.

name: Lizabeth Jo Schroeder
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: On a daily basis I am given the distinct opportunity to work with people as a vehicle to help them to find their own truth and happiness.  Based on our life's path we attach ourselves to people, places and things as a way to connect to the most basic part of ourselves, deserving and capable human beings. Sometimes these attachments result in being pushed further from our genuine selves and create patterns that leave us feeling lost and searching.  I believe in the basic premise that at birth people are purely lovable and worthy and have a natural right to be seen and heard. My work with you is formed from this basic belief. I work carefully to provide a safe, therapeutic environment for clients to take a closer look at their lives and patterns. Addiction is an epidemic that has dramatically increased in the last 10 years. For 20+ years I have been assisting clients and others to recover from many addictions, as well as their underlying losses and co-occurring disorders.  This might sound too "touchy feely" but I would love to meet you and provide the environment for you to begin the process of healing. You deserve to be happy, joyous and free. Whatever you are bringing in to session with you is worth our time together, no matter how seemingly large or small. I am here to help you find your way again.

name: Gita Seshadri
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT
about: Frustrated? Unhappy? Want some insight and change? I offer an encouraging approach to help you explore your world in a therapeutic environment. I believe that everyone is the expert of their own experience; you have lived your life longer than I have known you. I often use the metaphor of being a flashlight in a dark cave, shedding light on different things, however, you, as the client are in the driver's seat; I am in the passenger seat, as a co-driver. Together, we will explore your personal meanings and experiences while making larger connections to your goals.  I invite you to our journey together in creating new meaning. I offer psychotherapy & a relational view regarding anxiety, grief/loss, body image/self esteem/ weight issues, intimacy problems, divorce, pre-marital, LGBT issues, and military related issues. I also have experience working with couple related issues as well. Please also check out my website for further information ("services" tab).  I also have a specialization with cultural and racial issues, and have an interest in working with interracial and intercultural couples and families. I also have experience working with clients regarding parenting/co-parenting, sibling/coworker/relationships. In addition, addiction/substance, trauma, and domestic violence.

name: Julianne Guinasso
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Feeling unfulfilled and stressed out? Perhaps you excel in your work but notice that you've been feeling exhausted, depleted, or sad lately. You might even be feeling disconnected in your relationship with yourself. Although you are proud of your accomplishments, there is a lot of pressure and expectations in your life, and you're feeling burned out. Perhaps you've even gone through a recent life transition that has impacted your well-being. Do you want to feel grounded, at peace, and experience joy again but are unsure how? As your therapist,  I can provide you with a holistic approach through psycho-education, mindfulness practices, and clinical insights. We work together to bring greater awareness to the present moment by clarifying your beliefs, values, and hopes. As your guide and confidant, we cultivate healing and safety in your relationship with yourself and others. Let's connect you back to joy and restful fulfillment. If this resonates, call or email me to set up a free 15-minute consultation to see if we are a good fit.  All adult individuals, ethnicities, cultural backgrounds, and sexual/gender identities are welcomed.
issues: ['Burnout']

name: Dr. Shadi Souferian
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I am a licensed clinical psychologist and certified Life Coach. I believe that prioritizing our mental well-being is essential for leading a happy and fulfilling life. I utilize integrative and evidence-based treatments to empower clients to overcome life’s most difficult challenges and reach their highest potential. My approach is personalized, non-judgmental and compassionate. If you are feeling overwhelmed and stuck in a dark place, or simply want to take your life to the next level, let me help take you on an illuminated path towards lasting joy, inner peace and freedom. I have advanced training in internal family systems, psychodynamic therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, mindfulness-based treatment, coaching in personal/professional development, parenting and trauma recovery. On the other side of darkness light exists. In fact, sometimes it’s the darkness that leads us to our brightest light. My mission is to help bridge the gap between where you are and where you want to be. Guiding you onto an illuminated path to strength, confidence, vitality and purpose .

I’m passionate about my work and strive to help clients achieve greater peace, satisfaction, and connection in their relationships and lives. My approach to psychotherapy is strength-based, person-centered and rooted in depth psychology. While I consider my therapeutic style to be warm, interactive, and empathetic, I am also not afraid to take a stand for you when necessary. I pride myself in my integrity, authenticity, and perseverance; expect to be treated with care, respect, and non-judgment. Clients and I work on communication & social skills, life/job/relationship/family transitions, how to experience more satisfying connection & intimacy, express emotions more skillfully, create more joy and positivity in life, find meaning and purpose, ignite creativity, reducing anxiety, confidence and empowerment and to feel a positive secure sense of self.

name: Mikaela A Wapman
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, MA, CD DONA
about: My therapeutic approach centers on creating more opportunities for space and reflection. This is an active and transformative process where we learn how to interrupt old patterns of reacting and create room for intentionality in our responses. Many of us operate within the conditions of our early relationships and form ways of relating that we are longing to transmute. I support you as you learn to get to the root of the response, understand it, and to develop tools of self-healing so that you can one day see the well-worn reaction waiting for you, and choose something different. My areas of focus include pregnancy, pregnancy loss, birth trauma, perinatal mental health, infant and child mental health, individuation, life transitions, loss, trauma, depression, anxiety, and relationship dynamics, co-dependency and children of alcoholics.  I work with adults, parents and children from birth through adolescence. I love working with LGBTQ and non-normative families. I offer couples therapy for romantic partnerships of all configurations, including people practicing polyamory, non-monogamy, or open relationships.  Se habla español.

name: Diana Teich
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Clients come to me because they struggle with anxiety, depression, relationship challenges, feeling lost and being stuck in patterns they don't like. Many experienced childhood trauma that has hurt their sense of self. Others come for support during life transitions or because they are grieving. I work with couples and adult family members who have a fear of conflict and tend to give up what they need in their relationships, and also those who fight easily and find conflict escalates quickly. Teens have a special place in my heart. I am a parent and I spent a year working as a school therapist at a local public high school.   I work with clients who feel broken, unlovable, and stuck.  This is often the result of hurtful messages they received growing up that they now believe, and of abuse that has taken away self-confidence and left shame and self-hatred in its place.  I can help you find your strengths, develop self-compassion, and lift yourself out of unhealthy patterns.   I also frequently support clients who feel frustrated with finding a partner and/or are fatigued by trying to create meaningful social connections in SF.   I help you identify what you want in your life, notice and change patterns, establish boundaries and life balance, and strengthen your sense of self.  Please check out my website to get to know me better.

name: Los Angeles DBT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Our goal at Los Angeles DBT is to make DBT (Dialectical Behavioral Therapy) accessible to everyone.  We are psychotherapists who are "Intensively Trained" in DBT and provide DBT skills groups, individual sessions, and coaching.  Dialectical Behavioral Therapy is a skills-based treatment which helps you better regulate your emotions, especially the difficult ones.                       With DBT you will learn how to have more successful relationships with family, friends, & loved ones.  DBT will also provide tools to increase your ability to manage distress, and be more mindful of your thoughts, feelings, and overall environment. DBT began as the premiere treatment for Borderline Personality Disorder and then grew to be successful for treating a multitude of issues, including depression, anxiety, mood swings, and a variety of addictions.  DBT is evidenced based (that means researched intensively and approved by science).  DBT is provided through individual therapy and skills groups. We have been intensely trained by Behavioral Tech Institute (Marsha Linehan and her associates).  These are the experts who originally developed DBT.  Individual sessions can either be on Zoom or in person.  Group sessions are only on Zoom.

name: Yolotli Counseling
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Yolotli Counseling is a mental health practice providing telehealth treatment to 20-45 year old young professionals within the BIPOC and Latinx communities, specifically those that are first generation higher education students or graduates and children of immigrants. Specializing in treating stress and anxiety, mild to moderate depression, codependency (dependent relationship dynamics), phase of life, and professional burnout/compassion fatigue. I help first generation college students/graduates that are children of immigrants struggling with anxiety, depression, and codependence lead guilt free authentic/ wholehearted lives.  For many children of immigrants there's a feeling of being "ni de aqui, ni de alla". At Yolotli Counseling, you will feel like you belong and are accepted. Warmth, acceptance, authenticity and understanding are what I offer to each client.  Many of my clients have shared feeling as though they have finally felt seen when they came to seek services and were connected with me.  I offer that hospitality and a no nonsense approach to each session.

name: Craig Bray
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Seeking help can be difficult. Life’s pace can often catch us off guard. Even when things seem in order we can feel alone or out of sorts with internal worries. Whatever you are dealing with, I will engage with you directly. I will listen with empathy and offer counsel tailored to your individual concerns. Ultimately, we want our lives to matter. I specialize in working with individuals who are impacted by addiction; their own or someone close to them. I have over 20 years of experience working with these issues, including substance abuse, gambling, sex and codependency. I’ve worked in a range of settings helping people with a variety of addiction-related conditions. My approach is multi-dimensional. I will help you explore the roots of what is bothering you. Together we will find solutions that apply to your unique situation. I also work with family and friends who are concerned and effected by these problems. My passion for this work stems from navigating my own journey with some of these issues. I will bring that experience to our therapy sessions. I will work to understand your struggle and help you find direction and meaning in your journey. Together we will find solutions that work for you. I look forward to hearing from you.

about: April Mollner is currently accepting new clients in her private practice and tele-therapy.  As nationally-recognized anti-bullying advocate and keynote speaker at psychological conferences in the country she specializes in trauma, affirmative therapy, addiction & recovery. April is also known for her work with transgender youth in Hollywood & leading therapy in marginalized populations. Life stories are sometimes saturated in trauma, her hope is to help find positive narratives that assist peoples healing through their resilience. Her dedication to 'lived in experiences' bridges new beginnings through a journey of strengths. April has been an advocate for LGBTQ+ equality throughout life and her enthusiasm lies in therapy affirming LGBTQ+ Youth & Adults. Through post-modern modalities and EMDR therapy April helps individuals address trauma and current life issues. With life stories that can be saturated in trauma, her hope is to help people on their journey of the 'true self'. April is extremely pleased to be a part of the affirmative therapy movement through postmodern modalities and EMDR. Her work is continuing in Human Sexuality/Gender Studies & Trauma work in Recovery.

name: West Coast Therapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Hasya has been trained in Psychodynamic Psychotherapy, Hakomi, Depth Hypnosis, EMDR and Brain Spotting. As a Psychotherapist Hasya integrates methodologies and techniques to offer a highly personalized approach to treatment. Along with compassion and understanding, she works in a collaborative partnership to uncover strengths and attain maximum potential for growth. Hasya is passionate about helping clients find their innate strengths, and discover unconscious patterns that are limiting. Hasya is supporting clients every step of the way combining therapeutic approaches with genuine care, humor and wisdom.

name: Michelle Candace Mason
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Sometimes circumstances in life can feel unbearable and we do not know how we are going to get through it.  Experiencing trauma, a pandemic, racism, grief & loss (marriage, death of partner, child, loved one, terminal illness, break ups, loss of job, etc.), pressures of work and/or school are some issues that make us feel anxious, alone, and depressed.  Our need for inner peace and healthy coping is crucial for our mental, spiritual, and physical health!  Overcoming the overwhelming feelings of anxiety, depression, and anger can feel empowering and peaceful which leads to a better quality of life! For 23 years I've enjoyed helping people have a more positive understanding about why they may feel the way they do. I assist in overcoming the dysfunctional beliefs they have about themselves or their circumstance. I use a collaborative approach and meet you where you're at but will encourage you to take steps towards your goals to be your personal best. There is no right or wrong way to feel about what we have experienced because it is just that, our own experience! It's important to acknowledge this and be gentle with ourselves. We each have a story that makes us who we are. So, I invite you to share your story and how you have experienced it. Be patient with the process of healing, it is all growth!

name: Amanda Rogers Coaching
title: CPCC, SEP
about: Are you flat-out stuck? Then it's time to be more decisive and take action. Feeling lost? Then it's time to make goals and create a plan to attain them. Are you in flux? Divorce, career changes and loss are changes not endings. If you're getting in your own way, it's time to put an end to self-destructive habits. How does unwavering support and relentless compassion sound? Maybe you've invested time looking at your past to analyze the original source of your present day challenges. And maybe now you feel ready to say, "The past is the past and it's time to let go of my history and move forward with courage, energy and excitement!" Together, we’re going to reintroduce you to yourself. We’re going to explore parts of you that you’ve forgotten existed. We’re going to identify your values, discover new passions, reignite old ones, make plans, create goals, change habits and never lose sight of what is remarkable about you! It's all in the partnership, me and you. Life Coaching is urgent, inspired, and ambitious. It respects the past but focuses on the here and now. It explores what is possible and actualizes a plan to build the life we want personally and professionally.  I believe in the work that happens between sessions. This is why I include touchpoints throughout the week to share, question, or simply celebrate.

name: Lara J. Duff
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MA, LMFT
about: You made it to the beginning of something life changing and awesome! Hello! I am a California Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, Owner of Eudaimonia Therapy, Llc.  I am compelled to share this journey in self awareness with you. I treat individual adults experiencing a variety of mental health challenges; obsessive compulsive behaviors, anxiety, addiction, mood disorders, aggression, co -dependency issues, trauma, etc.  An area of interest is Women’s Issues, connecting  with our own inner strength, beauty and grace as Women, and embracing our feminine spirit. The cognitive behavioral work we do will focus on the power of our thoughts,  and creating a positive perspective by which to experience life. Our perspective will change how we experience our relationships, job opportunities, our spirituality, sleep, every life domain. Mind, body, spirit balance, mindfulness and self care.  I look forward to beginning this journey with you in self discovery. The relationship shared as client and therapist is the most valued piece of our treatment. Please reach out so we may MANIFEST awesome things for you in 2022!! All sessions Virtual at this time.

name: Shiori Lange
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Hello and Welcome! Thank you very much for visiting my page. I am Shiori Lange, a bilingual (Japanese/English) Licensed Clinical Social Worker (#81730) based in Long Beach, CA. I specialize in helping older adults and their families with caregiver/dementia issues, stress management and overall end of life issues. I have a deep admiration for those who seek to heal and create a meaningful life. My name Shiori in Japanese means "Weave Aspirations and Goals" (it also means bookmark or a guidebook). Life gives us challenges sometimes, maybe more than we want. I hope that my contribution to your life will help you embrace life fully. I have extensive experience and training in the field of geriatric social work in the past 15 years. Beside this private practice, I work full time as a medical social worker in a community setting. I am specialized in Post-Acute, Palliative and Behavioral Health issues for geriatric population and their families. I incorporate Mindfulness in my practice.  Having clear and open space in our mind, we can further act efficiently with compassion and kindness to ourselves and to others. Conducting mindfulness meditation is one of the ways to quiet our mental chatter. My passion is to work with my clients toward their goals by empowering them and providing individual tools to work on their unique challenges.

name: Michael Beavers, MS LMFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about:
Are you struggling with difficult relationships or bad habits? I teach a three-step process for developing a new life plan which will help you get "unstuck". Working with me is about discovering and building on your core strengths. My office is a safe place to dream, question, and grow. The reward IS worth the risk. My all time favorite vision quote:  "Vision is greater than baggage." (Steven R. Covey)     Clients who do especially well in working with me are typically:  motivated, follow through with homework assignments, and maintain integrity with me (that is, they don't lie to me). I specialize in making relationships, attitudes and habits focus like a laser beam on the life goal you're seeking. 

I'm trained by the California Office of Problem Gambling (OPG) to serve clients and families of clients with gambling addiction. (Funding for treatment is provided entirely by OPG). Use my 24/7 online scheduling service to schedule your appointment. 

Luke, the practice's therapy dog, is with me most of the time.  He provides one more reason working with me is a safe and supportive place to create the outcomes you want. (See Luke at MikeBeaversLMFT.com)

name: Jessica L Borelli
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I utilize evidence-based approaches in my work with children, adolescents, adults, and couples/families, drawing upon techniques originating in Cognitive Behavior Therapy (including exposure-based therapies), Emotion-Focused Therapy, and attachment-based approaches to therapy (including those involving mentalization). I specialize in anxiety, trauma, eating/weight, or relationship issues, and adopt an individualized, culturally sensitive approach with each client. I view therapy as an opportunity for the client to share, to learn, and to grow through a close connection. I run Compass Therapy, a small private practice located in Newport Beach. Compass Therapy is a group of mental health professionals specializing in providing high quality, evidence-based, compassionate care who work collaboratively to meet your needs. Visit our website or give us a call to find out more about our philosophy (www.compass-therapy.com).

name: Lilly Hanson, MFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: If you are looking for a therapist for yourself or your child, it is likely that some part of your or your child's life is not going the way you expected or would like it to be.  Some things that seemed they should work perhaps aren't, or not as well as you'd like.  Perhaps your child's feelings are stronger than you had expected, or they are not developing in other ways, and are missing developmental opportunities you know would be healthy for them and want them to have.  Perhaps it seemed they might grow out of some of their difficult behaviors or feelings, yet it is hard to determine if they are on that path of growth.   Some of these questions are best thought through with a professional who can help understand more about what is happening for you or your child, and provide a supportive, reflective environment to guide development in a healthy direction.  The depth of my training at Ann Martin Center and 25 years of child work provide support to create deep, lasting change. When we work together and make use of understanding development, frequently possibilities can emerge that may not have seemed possible for you or your child.  The first step is to call, and start to get a sense if working together might support the growth and change you are looking to see.  I look forward to hearing from you.

name: Patrice A Forte
title: Psychologist, PhD
about:
Do you feel overwhelmed by intense emotions? Have you been told that you're too sensitive, or that you should have "gotten over" a loss? Does anxiety or low self-esteem get in the way of working with colleagues, enjoying your partner, or meeting someone new?  Maybe you procrastinate and make excuses, or relentlessly criticize yourself.

I can help. For more that 25 years, I've been providing psychotherapy to individuals with concerns like yours. My therapeutic approach is compassionate, interactive, and non judgmental.  Together, we can tackle issues that spring from career changes, divorce, or any crisis that has prompted you to consider therapy. We can also address longer-term issues that stand in the way of being the person you'd like to be.

name: Inspiration Psychological Services
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about:
In far too many situations individuals with bipolar disorder, depression, and schizophrenia have internalized messages that there is no hope, that they are simply victims of their mental illness, and unable to reach their life goals. My practice, Inspiration Psychological Services' primary purpose is to provide individuals who struggle with mental illness with the neccessary coping skills that they need to manage symptoms, cope with everyday life challenges, and improve the quality of their lives. 
 
I strongly believe in providing a supportive atmosphere that consists of understanding individual experiences, addressing needs, instilling hope, building on strengths, and recognizing potential. I specialize in providing individual therapy and specialized skills training programs for individuals with bipolar, major depression, anxiety, schizophrenia, and self-injury. Treatment modalities include: CBT, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy, crisis intervention, and animal assisted therapy. I also provide consultation in the areas of suicide, violence reduction, and program development. Apart from my private practice, I was the director of a clinic at Patton State Hospital that provided services to psychiatric patients with dangerous and impulsive behaviors who had failed to respond to treatments provided at the hospital. I have also worked as an adjunct professor of psychology at Pepperdine.

name: Beth Bremer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: My work is grounded in a relational and body-oriented approach to therapy.  I draw on the immense resources of the body-- its rich wisdom to support the cultivation of mindful presence, internal resource, gentle self inquiry/guidance and embodiment.  Creating space for you to listen to your voice and inner experience allows for both depth and breath of understanding, as well as authentic expression and acceptance. I enjoy working with clients who are committed to inquiry, depthful work & contemplative/spiritual practices.  I also work well with those dealing with stress/anxiety & health-related illnesses (particularly, autoimmune disorders) through Mindfulness/contemplative-based practices, as well as issues around aging parents. I am an integrative/mindfulness therapist who includes the body, mind & spirit into the psychological work.  I also offer integrative health support/counseling &  consultation, Mindfulness instruction, as well as support/consultation around aging parents/ partners.

name: Annia Raysberg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I tend to be interactive and collaborative; I provide a warm & supportive environment to help my clients achieve positive changes in their lives.  I am non-judgmental and open minded.  I create an individual treatment plan and approach for each client based on each person's needs and preferences.  I offer phone/video sessions if appropriate.  You're welcome to contact me for a free 15 minute phone consultation and/or e-mail me with questions.  You can learn more about me at www.AnniaRaysberg.com. My specialties include all types of addictions, codependency, anxiety/depression, and relationships.  I use CBT, DBT, and mindfulness when appropriate.  I tend to be tool-oriented and may suggest audio recordings, outside resources, and homework.  I have an extensive collection of workbooks for mental health which can be helpful. I also offer EMDR for trauma I am passionate about mental health and wellness.  I am bicultural & bilingual; I can help my clients with cross-cultural and acculturation difficulties.  I offer support to those involved in (or interested in) 12 step recovery.  I work with individuals and couples 18 and over..  I am currently seeing clients in person at my home office and by video.

name: Savannah Wilson
title: Pre-Licensed Professional
about: Axis Mundi would like to present Savannah Wilson. Savannah is a Marriage and Family Therapist Trainee and is supervised weekly by Elysha Martinez, LMFT #93493. The supervisor works with Savannah to help develop their clinical skills and ensure that they provide quality care to you as the client. Savannah is also currently working towards receiving her Master's in Counseling Psychology-Holistic at John F. Kennedy University. Savannah's preferred gender pronouns are she/her/hers. You can expect personalized conversations that are culturally-affirmative, rooted in strengths/purpose, collaborative, and tailored to the unique situation. She works with teens and adults who are navigating emotional, behavioral, transitional, cultural and family experiences. Specifically with the intersection of multiracial/biracial households. She has a transpersonal approach focusing on connecting/integrating mind, body, and spirit, using modalities like yoga therapy, mindfulness meditation, and nature. Therapy with her is about meeting you where you are, seeing you as the expert, the sum of many parts, and possessing innate strengths to be the author of your own story. Therapy is like opening a new chapter in life for healing. She focuses on hope and guidance as you grow into your best, balanced, joyful, and connected self. Visit her website for more info.

name: Barbara Bachmeier-Levy
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Hi, my name is Barbara Bachmeier-Levy and I am a seasoned licensed clinical psychologist with over 20 years of experience in the field of mental health across all levels of care. I bring years of experience to the telehealth world to offer a solution for time management and logistical issues to many individuals who might otherwise find it difficult to show up to their psychotherapy appointments. Psychological and emotional pain is real, yet it can be managed and we can heal. Helping you move toward a life that you experience as meaningful, value-filled, and purpose-driven is mine to do when you commit to therapy with me. I love my life. Life is a struggle sometimes, but it is supposed to be. That is how we learn and I believe this is Classroom Earth. I love learning. I love spoiling my three dogs. I love the 4 seasons of California and going for long drives with my husband. For me, each day is a new day, a new adventure, and a new beginning. I would love to learn about you. Let’s join each other for walk-through mind mazes and emotional oceans. Let’s engage in a process of identifying and making little changes here and there that can add up to a whole new way of moving, breathing, and experiencing your own being as we map our way through using expert navigation tools and see what lies ahead!
issues: ['Anger Management', 'Chronic Pain', 'Life Transitions', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress']

name: Marianne Ross
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I welcome contact with you.  I am a seasoned psychologist who enjoys helping people walk thru difficult times in their lives.   Right now most of the people I talk with are addressing covid related concerns such as dealing with uncertainty,  new directions, relationship stress, anxiety, and self-care.    Professionally, I have worked in a university setting (including the medical school) and now have the luxury of providing virtual/on-line sessions.  Though I have worked primarily with young adults, I treasure being there for adults of all ages.

name: Pam Mikolajczyk
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT, RN
about: The demands of work, taking care of your children and the increasing needs of an aging parent have drained you. These and other demands of your time now feel overwhelming and you may think about giving up. Without time for self care, you read blogs for ideas and talk with friends but implementing any changes is a struggle.  If you have any free time you can barely remember what it is that you used to like to do. I help women who are overwhelmed, discouraged and frustrated with their stress find breathing room and learn how to prioritize their life to not only meet the demands of others, but to discover what they need most to enjoy the life that they are in.
issues: ['Depression', 'Family Conflict', 'Grief', 'Life Coaching', 'Stress', "Women's Issues"]

name: Sandra @ Mental Wealth Counseling
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: Hello and welcome! I'm Sandra. As a first-generation Chinese immigrant, building confidence around self-expression took decades of career changes, relationship endings, and unlearning old beliefs. I was privileged to work with veterans in a pharmacy setting and experience runway modeling, all of which are humbling experiences that made me a more assertive communicator.  Becoming a therapist forced me to confront the imposter in me that I must hold myself with compassion to build meaningful connections. If you are willing to share your story, I am ready to listen! I am effective with young adults in managing anger and anxiety, strengthening self-esteem, establishing work/life balance, navigating career and relationship changes, and healing through eating disorders. I enjoy working with couples to practice emotional communication, set healthy boundaries, and rebuild trust after infidelity. Want to know more? I encourage you to learn more about me, my therapy style, and my thoughts about treatment outcomes by clicking the 'Website' button at the top of this page. www.mentalwealthcc.com

name: Victoria Keyser
title: Psychologist, PsyD, MSW, RPT
about: Youtherapy Psychological Services was established to assist children, adolescents, parents, and families, in their efforts to lead healthier, happier, and more productive lives. Many families encounter difficult times such as the loss of a loved one, divorce or blended family, academic struggles, mood or anxiety issues, low self-esteem, or interpersonal conflict. We are committed to helping kids and their families navigate these challenges utilizing strategies that are unique and specific to their needs. Parent involvement is crucial to the success of a child's emotional well-being and therefore we provide parent coaching as needed. As director, I am passionate about providing age appropriate, culturally sensitive treatment. I specialize in play therapy and use art and music to help youth with self-expression. I understand parenting fears and challenges and want to commend you for taking this first step to ensure your child's wellness. Our facility has specially designed play rooms to allow children of all ages to use their natural language of play to facilitate healing and growth. Our staff includes licensed therapists and graduate student interns with a wide variety of specializations. We are conveniently located with flexible evening and weekend hours.

name: Jack Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I am a licensed Psychotherapist in California with over thirty-one years of clinical experience helping individuals and families. I have over eleven years' experience as an instructor working at the Associate to Master level coursework at five Universities in the area. I work well with depression, anxiety, relationships, parenting issues, grief/loss, insomnia, addiction, trauma, physical/sexual/emotional abuse, OCD, bipolar, as well as personal growth, adjustment issues, and crisis.  I utilize techniques from person-centered, solution/goal-focused, and cognitive-behavioral approaches in the therapy I deliver. I provide a judgment-free, safe and supportive experience.  This means that I attempt to join with you "where you are at".  I believe that every behavior has a purpose and is an attempt to meet a need. It isn't until we discover what that need is and find a "healthier" or more "productive" way of meeting that need that the behavior no longer is necessary and we find relief. I look forward to working with you...   -Jack

name: Glenn Peters
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I have over 22 years' experience as a licensed psychotherapist. I conduct both long-term and short-term therapy. I help individuals and families learn about and develop hidden strengths and resources, which aids them in resolving problems. For instance, I have helped individuals (adults) to become more assertive, deal effectively with issues of anger and manage stressful situations and conflictual relationships. I use a variety of methods including psychodynamic psychotherapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, anger management techniques, assertion training, role-playing, family therapy and interactive guided imagery.

name: Dr. Jackie Christensen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about: Perhaps you struggle with frequent worrying and feelings of restlessness, which interferes with your daily life and your quality of sleep. Maybe you also live with a chronic pain issue or condition, like chronic migraines, back pain, or something else that causes frequent discomfort. You may deal with negative, perfectionistic, or self-critical thoughts about yourself that you can't seem to shake. These feelings, thoughts and sensations can often seem unbearable, unrelenting and paralyzing. You sometimes may wonder if you are all alone in these feelings. I am here to tell you that you are not alone and there is hope. I work with my clients using techniques that best suit their specific and unique needs, though I tend to draw from CBT, ACT and mindfulness-based perspectives. I use a collaborative, humanistic, and holistic approach to treatment. I do believe that the therapeutic relationship can be a significant force in facilitating positive changes. I want to make sure you feel seen and heard, as the therapy room is a safe and non-judgmental space. I will be present every step of the way, guiding you and providing the necessary tools to reduce pain, both physically and psychologically. I'm currently accepting clients for therapy through video and/or audio, and I would love to connect with you!

name: Dan Offield
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: The therapeutic relationship, ie…how you connect with your therapist, is the most essential element to the success of the therapy you are seeking. I strive to ensure that the relationship between myself and my clients consists of respect for where you are at when you begin your therapy as well a guarantee that the focus will always be on you and whatever needs you have at the moment. This “unconditional positive regard” should always be a given. However, it often is not and leads to a belief by clients that therapy “doesn’t work”.  Therapy does work when you connect with a therapist who listens, challenges and is skillful enough to help you gain the insights you need to create change. Give our office a call to schedule an opportunity for you to move away from whatever issues you are struggling with into a richer more rewarding life.

name: Margaret Denise Brauns
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Our mental fitness is just as important as our physical fitness. Investing in our total health includes learning how to manage challenges, emotions and relationships. I work with adults, teens and couples on issues such as stress, anxiety and depression.  Allowing yourself to receive support during periods of stress or change can create opportunities for growth. Self-awareness and learning coping skills can help with navigating through current and future challenges. Whether you are new to therapy or returning, be confident that investing in mental health is a step toward living the life you imagined. I work with many clients who are struggling with anxiety/depression and challenges with relationships. By reviewing patterns of thinking and behavior, we can identify strategies for problem solving, and expand coping skills for managing emotions and stress. With over 20 years of experience as a clinician, you can expect thoughtful, individualized treatment. Asking for help is a positive, practical step. I will provide a safe, non-judgmental environment for you to receive support and achieve desired change. Selecting the right therapist is directly related to successful outcomes in therapy. Let's connect so I can answer your questions to determine if we will be a good fit in working together.

name: Ashley Boyer
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Hi, I am a San Francisco Bay Area Child Psychologist. I specialize in anxiety and other related concerns such as perfectionism and difficult life adjustments. In my practice, I focus on the relationship and making you and your child feel comfortable through developmentally appropriate interventions. I want to help you work through your worries and achieve your best life. I am a relationally focused therapist and I use evidence-based treatment modalities such as CBT and DBT to help you take control over your life. My interventions are developmentally appropriate and highly individualized. I gravitate towards Mindfulness and Art and play-based interventions.  I understand that anxiety can control our lives and the lives of loved ones. I want to help you take back some control and gain some confidence in your life. Anxiety is pervasive, particularly now with the current COVID-19 pandemic. I want to support you and together we can work through your worries.

name: Animating Principle
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA, MS
about: Your wait is over! We will call you back same day to help you find the right fit. Animating Principle and our second location, Animating Principle's Workshop, are leading the way in modernized therapy and coaching with our boutique services. We offer help on demand. No long waits or impersonal service. We are accessible, and offer a one-of-a-kind experience. Therapy and coaching approaches are completely tailored to each individual. We specialize in working with children, teens, and adults on a variety of mental health and personal growth topics out of two separate locations in Montrose. For more info: www.animating-principle.com Britney Holthouser, LMFT (102221) is founder and CEO of Animating Principle. In addition to working with CEOs & celebs, she is also known for helping people move forward who have struggled to make progress elsewhere. Animating Principle offers boutique therapy & coaching. In order to maintain the highest quality of service, Britney is highly selective & takes on a limited number of clients. As such, she does not offer reduced fee options. Those seeking lower-cost therapy services (individual, group, art) please visit our other location Animating Principle's Workshop.

name: Collaborative Psychology Group

about: We are a diverse group practice and consider it a privilege in being apart of helping you discover how to operate from the best in you. name: Darrin J Kagele
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: With a background in depth and transpersonal psychology, I utilize an integrative approach, drawing upon multiple psychological modalities including psychodynamic and cognitive-behavioral therapy, family systems, mindfulness strategies, Buddhist psychology, and transtheoretical therapy. Utilizing these approaches is an important part of helping my clients grow towards self-understanding, self-reliance and emotional soothing. In addition, clients develop the ability to be more at ease and compassionate with themselves while being less reactive to their negative thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. My therapeutic process involves supporting clients to uncover their natural state of ease and wellbeing. Through my personable, respectful, and caring process, clients are guided through a deeply compassionate and healing experience, freeing them from emotional pain and mental struggles.

name: Mariko Fairly
title: MA, BCBA
about: Does your child have a behavior challenge that you don't know how to handle? Do you need support to deal with your child's tantrums, aggression, defiance, sleep challenges, or toilet training? Would you like guidance to increase your child's communication or self-help skills? I have almost 20 years of experience working with toddlers, preschool- and elementary-aged children and their families to increase appropriate behaviors and reduce or eliminate undesired behaviors. I want to learn about your parenting philosophy and goals for your child so I can design an effective behavior plan and support you throughout the process. I am a Board Certified Behavior Analyst. I aim to be supportive, collaborative and solution-oriented. All of the positive behavior support strategies I recommend are research-based. Through interview and observation, I will define the behavior challenge, determine why it's happening, and identify both preventative strategies and consequences to reduce it. I am dedicated to working with parents to design functional, effective, and easy-to-implement interventions that will work for your child and parenting style. After we collaborate, you will receive a detailed written plan, individualized to your family's needs, so you can implement it with calm and confidence, with my support. Video sessions available.

name: Kate Stoddard @ Wellspace
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Many of us possess a feeling that there is a way to live better and to feel better. It's this feeling that drives the work of therapy and stems from an essential experience of feeling healthy, safe, and loved. Being human, by nature, is a perilous journey where we often get lost and hurt and find ourselves in an experience of emotional and physical pain. Coming to therapy means committing to a relationship with a therapist that is in service of finding your truth and a way to feel better. I believe you are the expert of your own life and that your true gifts can be unlocked through the therapy process. I take significant interest in the unconscious and believe it is a map to finding your true self. Dreams, feelings, and behaviors are landmarks on this map to be noticed and interpreted, and over time you can navigate these places more clearly. The feeling that there is a better way to live is not something to ignore. There is great wisdom in the ways we have tried to heal ourselves that helped us realize we need some help. As your therapist, I will provide you with guidance, safety, and space to hear from yourself. Together, we will find how you can make choices that enhance and sustain your life.

name: Marie Lovdokken
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Are you noticing that life is difficult because of anxiety, and depression or trauma? Maybe you feel overwhelmed at work, finding yourself over-thinking interactions with others or being excessively hard on yourself. Others may see you as successful, but you feel like you can never measure up to your own expectations. Perhaps a recent change has left you feeling that the future you imagined is out of reach. Sometimes painful memories take over. You have tried for a long time to cope on your own, but you are finding it more difficult. Maybe it is time to talk to someone. I am bilingual in English and Norwegian and work with adults and couples. I provide a tailored, collaborative, strength based approach. I believe people are resilient and capable of growth beyond their circumstances. I offer an empathy-focused, judgement-free therapeutic environment where you can feel safe and supported. Whether you are experiencing sadness, anger, or worry, or feel stressed about past or present experiences, therapy is a potentially transformative experience. Research shows that being in therapy is associated with long-term improvements in both physical and mental health and increased life satisfaction. Feel free to book a free 15 minute consultation.

name: Sandra Kagan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
about: I am deeply dedicated to helping individuals and couples understand and resolve their problems in order to live more satisfying, fulfilling lives. As a result of 45 years of experience, coupled with extensive training, I am rapidly able to assess what is at the core of my client's difficulties. I then use a holistic approach that is a combination of education and therapy, which enables clients to apply what they have learned and ultimately become their own therapists. I believe that the problems we encounter in life are always learning opportunities, and that learning is a lifetime process. In my work, I primarily focus on the present; however I believe that an understanding of the past can be useful for adding historical perspective to our current dilemma.  I believe that the problems which we experience can enable us to grow; ultimately transforming us into stronger, wiser, more fulfilled  individuals. Additional certification includes: National Certified Counselor, Hypnosis and a Life Teaching Credential.  I have taught and lectured at universities, medical centers and professional organizations.  In addition to leading seminars, I have appeared on national and public television and radio, and had numerous articles published on a variety of subjects.

name: Andrea Pinkerton
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I am a licensed clinical psychologist practicing in northern Novato. I work with individuals, couples and families. I treat a wide range of issues including depression, anxiety, PTSD, panic attacks and borderline personality disorder. I have considerable experience working with adults with developmental disabilities. My approach is character analytic which often helps clients get in touch with their feelings and increases their sense of aliveness and satisfaction with life. I specialize in working with adopted adults and families formed by adoption. I run groups for adopted teen and tween girls and offer support to adoptive parents. I use attachment-focused treatment to strengthen family bonds and to help parents create a safe and nurturing environment for their children. I am trained in Orgonomy which combines a verbal and somatic approach to therapy. The aim is to overcome defenses that keep clients stuck and out of contact with their deeper feelings. This can bring relief from ongoing symptoms of anxiety and depression and a greater feeling of inner stability.

about: Navigating through life's challenges can be difficult, whether in relationships with others or with yourself. Past events and unresolved hurts sometimes keep us "stuck" in a cycle of suffering, shame, or guilt. Therapy can help. name: Diana Marie Hill
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My goal as a psychologist is to help you live a more meaningful, vital and fulfilling life. I provide compassionate and effective therapy that will help you learn new skills and launch you in the direction you want to be moving in your life. Foundational to my approach is a collaborative partnership, where positive transformations evolve in a warm, safe environment. I have worked extensively with clients who struggle with depression, anxiety, eating concerns and unhealthy habits. I also work well individuals who are going through major life transitions, relationship problems or want to revitalize their lives. I take a holistic approach drawing from my rigorous background in the science of behavior and my training in acceptance, compassion and mindfulness. I am a specialist in Acceptance and Commitment Therapy--an evidence-based therapy that helps you unhook from unhelpful patterns and live in alignment with your values. I offer workshops and clinical supervision to professionals and the community in Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) and I am a certified yoga instructor. Through my extensive training and genuine desire to empower you, we will define your destination and cultivate the skills and perspectives to get you there.

name: Patrick V Faggianelli
title: Psychologist, PhD, MDiv
about:
Therapy, as I see it, is a unique relationship between therapist and client involving an emotional, psychological, and often spiritual journey. The therapist accompanies the client on this journey serving as mentor, guide, translator, coach, and confidant.  I work to assist you in your journey towards wholeness, success, understanding, and relief from suffering.  
My approach to therapy is interactive, supportive, and compassionate.  I endeavor to create a free and protected space so that you may safely explore whatever needs to be focused on while honoring your limits and boundaries. We will work together to access your inner wisdom  which will help you to identify your strengths as well as what is not working in your life so that you can create a richer, more fulfilling and satisfying personal and professional relationships.  My theoretical orientation is diverse and pragmatic. I utilize  Jungian, Existential, Psychodynamic and Family Systems theories.  In addition to my traditional divinity training as a pastoral counselor and minister, I have also practiced Native American ceremonial work, Buddhist meditation and am a third degree black belt in aikido, a martial art devoted to non-violence and the peaceful resolution of conflict.

name: Marriage/Affair Recovery ~Hyland and Associates
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Discovering that your partner has had an affair is a life altering experience. You feel that your   partner is not who you thought they were, your relationship is not what you thought it was; in essence your whole world has been turned upside down.   Learning of a partner's affair often leads us to "rethink" our whole lives.This crisis can serve as a stimulus for stepping back and taking stock of your life, carefully considering the kind of future you want to have with or without your partner. At Hyland and Associates, our therapists specialize in couples counseling using a highly effective method for healing relationships- Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT). Research has shown that couples 70-75% of couples who participate in EFT become closer and more intimate in their relationship, and 90% show significant improvements. Choosing the right therapist, one whom you can feel comfortable with and can trust, is so important. Our therapists do not pick sides, but attempt to understand each individuals emotional experience. We encourage you to click on our website to learn more about EFT.  Then, give me a call for a complimentary 10 minute phone consultation.

name: Kristel S. Grodeska
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: If you are feeling disconnected or wanting to learn how to more deeply connect to yourself or those you are in relationship with, therapy can be a place to learn a different way of relating. I see therapy as a collaborative place for you to grow in the direction that you want and to reset your vitality. I have a strength in working with: couples who want to nurture their bond or need relational resources; people who want more emotional strength and capacity for intimacy; people dealing with the impacts of sexual trauma; people who want to grow relational skills. I believe that recognizing and creating change inherently includes our bodies. I help my clients learn ways to have self-influence through including the experiences that they are having, ie sensation, energy, emotion, and beliefs into the stories that they bring with them. With expanded awareness, new possibilities arise. My approach is warm, engaging and co-created with you depending on your needs. My work is based in Somatic Psychotherapy, utilizes Formative Psychology, is experiential, relational and creative. I utilize EMDR to work through trauma to resolution, (re)build resources, and to offer safety in places that feel difficult.

name: Yea-Ching 'sunny' Wang
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Are you a struggling parent who needs extra support while your teen is in treatment? Are you a young professional who's suffering from Imposter Syndrome with limited skills to cope? Are you looking for a therapist who can validate your reality as an immigrant in US? If so, then I am glad that you've found us. Before Dawn Counseling Center (BDCC) is committed to enhance your growth via DBT-informed treatment that's culturally-competent & community-based. It is my commitment to provide you an authentic therapeutic experience with practical resources to create a life that's worth living. Inspired by my extensive clinical experience with teens & adults suffering from severe mood disorders, BDCC is dedicated to develop alternative treatment for caregivers & young professionals who are not responding well to the traditional therapy. I also specialize in validation, generational conflicts, and DBT skills-building in both English and Mandarin. Making the first step is always the hardest, and it may be one-step away from finding the hope that you've been looking for. It is my personal goal as a therapist to bring you treatment options that are genuine and efficient. Let us help discovering light during your darkest moment. Please contact me via email for a free 15 minute consultation. 您是否感到停滯，孤單，焦慮，力不從心，長期處在複雜又混亂的人際關係中，或是在心理諮詢方面一直找不到能理解您的治療師？如果是因為以上的理由而來到這裡，那麼我很高興您找到了我們。Before Dawn Counseling Center 是灣區唯一的DBT (辯證行為治療) 雙語諮詢中心，能提供您短期的個人心理諮詢, 及技能訓練小組。我們致力於提供您有效，真實，有同理心的治療方案，讓您在人生的黑暗中重新找回自己的曙光。 我是擁有加州執照的婚姻 & 家庭心理治療師，王雅晴。身為一位在美20年的台灣女性，並專注於華人心理健康的治療路上。我能同理矽谷灣區華人的文化挫折，以及心理諮詢上的各種盲點。我有豐富的臨床經驗和資源，能帶您跳脫出現在的困境，或是幫助您和所愛的人找到相處的平衡點。目前BDCC有提供華語的個人，情侶，及家庭諮詢。我們更是唯一的華語DBT技能訓練小組訓練中心，為正在受挫的父母及有焦慮症狀的專業青年提供有效率的支持。以下是我的 link-in資料: www.linkedin.com/in/sunnyw-bdcc 我們都有感到無望的時刻，但您不需要孤獨一人前行。也許只差一步，您就能重啟希望。 促進華人的心理健康是我畢生的願望。我相信只要您願意試試，我們就能一起找到出發的力量及資源。若您對我的服務有興趣，我提供免費的15分鐘諮詢，期待您的來電。

name: Danielle Cornacchio
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Dr. Cornacchio is a clinical psychologist specializing in assessing & treating childhood mental health problems. She has particular expertise in treating childhood anxiety and behavioral disorders. Dr. Cornacchio delivers treatment that is high quality and science-backed. She is a certified Parent Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) therapist, the gold standard treatment for early childhood behavior problems (e.g., ODD). Dr. Cornacchio has a particular expertise in the treatment of childhood selective mutism and OCD, two disorders lacking available expert care.  Dr. Cornacchio also specializes in telehealth for children, delivering treatment via secure videoconferencing. If you are a parent anywhere in the state of California pursuing mental health treatment for your child, contact Dr. Cornacchio for more information.

name: Diane Byster
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, NCC, RYT
about: I am CA state licensed marriage and family therapist, National Certified Counselor and Registered Yoga Teacher.  I maintain a private practice in Palo Alto, Redwood City and Berkeley and see clients for individual, couple psychotherapy and career counseling. I have taught courses for Kaiser Permanente in Behavioral Health and served as a coach/facilitator in Medical Weight Management.  My training includes over 10 years in Intensive Short-Term Dynamic Psychotherapy (ISTDP) and 7 years in Control Mastery, both evidenced based treatment approaches to help clients build their inner resources and motivation to reach their goals.  I offer a client-centered approach to treatment; tailoring interventions and time frame that are specific to each individual and couple. Psychotherapy and career counseling involve an active collaboration between client and therapist to help the client create a more satisfying personal and work life. Being active in treatment is key for a successful result.  My training also includes over 10 years in Intensive Short-Term Dynamic Psychotherapy (ISTDP), as a clinician, clinical supervisor and teacher of psychotherapists. I also have completed level through 2 in Psychobiological Approach to Couples Therapy (P.A.C.T.), which helps couples understand each other's owners manuals and create a more secure bond.

name: Allan Pleaner
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: "Therapy is about becoming unstuck, connecting with a deeper sense of what's important to you, what really matters, what you really want deeply for yourself in your life. Letting go of stale, habitual, suffocating stories which restrict you. And opening to new, gentler, friendlier narratives of possibility, guiding purposeful action in support of what you passionately value and really want for yourself. Life's challenges, loss, grief, relationship difficulties, blocks in creativity, family stressors, work challenges, difficult emotions, loss of purpose and direction... My approach is direct, humourous, warm, compassionate, down-to-earth and gentle. I draw on extensive training in a range of research-based approaches, blending Mindfulness approaches with ACT (Acceptance and commitment therapy), Gottman Marriage therapy, DBT (dialectical behavior therapy), psychodynamic, neuroscience and attachment models. I teach a CouplesToolbox skill-building workshop and an ACT skill building for depression and anxiety. I believe passionately you and your partner can learn new, research-based skills which can be practiced over time and which can transform your Marriages or couples relationships in powerful ways. Please have a look at my website : www.couplestraininginstitute.com  Please call me if you need more information.

name: Kerry English
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: I work with individuals, couples, and teens facing a wide variety of challenges including depression, anxiety, trauma, bipolar, grief/loss, and family conflict. I have years of experience working with male and female survivors of sexual or physical trauma and those suffering from challenging career or relational problems. My approach is to blend psychodynamic and cognitive interventions working collaboratively with you to reveal and resolve inner conflicts that can drive behavior, cause distress in relationships, and intensify everyday challenges. Please visit my website at kerryenglish.com for more information about my services. I also have extensive experience working with people in the entertainment business here in Los Angeles. This often daunting career leaves many people vulnerable to creative blocks and fears of failure or sometimes success. Of course, creativity isn't just for artists, we all need creative solutions for solving problems. I work with many professionals such as lawyers, business people, medical practitioners, and military veterans using insight oriented psychotherapy.  I invite you to call me and inquire as to how this therapeutic relationship may be helpful to you.

name: Cindi Dardin-Box
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Do you have difficulty remembering the last time you felt genuinely happy and at peace in your life? You may sometimes feel an overwhelming sense of sadness, guilt, shame and regret from experiences you have been through. You may feel depressed, anxious, confused and “stuck” in a repeating cycle of negative thoughts and emotions. Our beliefs, thoughts and emotions are influenced by our experiences and how we react to them. Self-limiting beliefs, such as we cannot do anything to improve our situation, can keep us in negative thought patterns and emotions which then can have a direct correlation to our reality. If you have ever thought, “There must be more than this,” then you are right. You have the power within you to manifest the greatest sense of happiness, love and peace than you ever felt possible. It is my mission to help you to identify those areas of life you wish and need to improve to achieve your goals. I will offer you a safe, supportive and positive environment to explore areas of your life that continue to impact you on a daily basis. You don’t have to be alone to navigate the challenges of life. I would be honored to be a part of your journey of healing, acceptance, self-love and building healthy relationships.

name: Radical Counseling & Consultation
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT SAP
about: People select me as a therapist due to my non-judgmental demeanor and 30+ years of experience. I believe it is important to be professional yet not clinically stuffy, humble yet confident and knowledgeable yet still teachable. I love life and people. The mistakes I've made have been my greatest teachers. Nobody's perfect. We all have problems....but we all have room for growth & improvement. It's a crazy world. The goals of being able to keep our feet firmly planted on the ground, in order to fulfill one's responsibilities in life, yet keep one 's 'hand in the sky', in order to experience joy are pragmatic, realistic and attainable. I developed my own form of therapy, 'Mind Construction', which is a form of Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy. It's designed to help people identify their strengths and deficits, w/regards to behavior, thoughts, feelings & core beliefs.  It employs the Bio-Psycho-Social-Spiritual Model and incorporates the importance of culture. My wife and I do 'Radical Progressive Conjoint Couples Counseling'. That's when two therapists simultaneously evaluate and treat a couple. The sessions are 1 1/2 hours long. I'm also a qualified Substance Abuse Professional (SAP), evaluating employees working in 'Safety-Sensitive Duties'.

name: Kathy Campbell
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: I often work with people who grapple with hard questions to which there is no one "right" answer. I offer a non-judegmental atmosphere in which each person can seek his or her own answers.   Therapy is a co-creation. I work with each person to find what "speaks" to him / her. That may include talking, mindfulness practices, or creative arts therapies. Using these methods accesses parts of the brain that can't be reached through words alone, and puts people in the flow of their wisdom and creativity, from which solutions to problems can emerge. I feel especially attuned to issues of grief, trauma, depression, and the spiritual seeking that often follows those experiences. As a family caregiver, I understand the joys and frustrations of being a caregiver. Finally, I am energized by working with people who want to end a cycle of abuse. Prior to moving into private practice, I worked as a clinical supervisor. I have been practicing therapy for over 10 years. I start with the person's strengths, and move at the individual's pace, offering "user friendly" information along the way.

name: Caroline Keystone
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: As a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, I thrive on connecting with clients in a way that provides them with the safety and support needed to achieve desired goals, explore and change problematic behaviors, and process experiences that are proving to be challenging. I work with clients to establish a strong therapeutic alliance that is both genuine and non-judgmental, utilizing humor, warmth, and compassion. I work with individuals, couples, teens, and families. I have an affinity for adolescents and teenagers, and specialize in providing them with a space to feel heard, while also helping parents navigate this challenging time. Other areas of clinical focus are life transitions, anxiety, depression, relationship difficulties, and loss. name: Richard Newman
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I focus on helping a wide range of people---children, adolescents, and adults.  My adult patients typically come to me because of problems involving depression, anxiety, dysfunctional relationships, and parenting.  Kids typically have problems involving motivation, attention, anger, oppositional behavior, and self esteem.  These problems are often related to stress at home (for example, involving divorce) and at school (for example, low achievement).  One of my specialties with youngsters is helping them cope with bullying and harassment. I believe strongly that good therapy is based on scientific evidence of "what works."  In addition to being a therapist, I'm a Professor Emeritus at UC Riverside.  Over 30 years of experience give me a broad perspective on social, emotional, developmental, and educational challenges of children and adolescents as well as issues and problems faced by adults. This perspective---coupled with a warm, empathic personal style---have helped my clients reach their goals in therapy.   I invite you to come in and discuss issues that you'd like to improve in your life.  We can develop a plan to address these issues and give you a healthier and happier life.

name: Innovative Group Psychotherapy, Inc.
title: Psychologist, PsyD, MSW
about: Having a child who is struggling academically, emotionally or socially can be disheartening.  We all want the best for our children.  Finding the right psychologist to evaluate and treat your child is crucial.  I understand a parent's desire to find a warm and caring clinician who can not only help their child feel safe to express themselves, but who can teach them to develop strategies to manage difficult emotions.  I have over 20 years of experience providing therapy and assessment services to children and adolescents. I firmly believe in the importance of working closely with both parent and child in order to achieve success.   IGP offers a unique approach to treatment.  We integrate therapy, the arts and mentorship into our individual and group sessions.  IGP believes when therapy is combined with an activity a child enjoys the results can be dramatic. Whether it is writing a song about pain or creating art that represents hope, IGP focuses on healing and empowerment.  It is not uncommon for children and adolescents to feel unmotivated and resistant to therapy.  IGP offers the opportunity for youth to express themselves in a safe way.  When traditional talk therapy fails, alternative modalities may be necessary. Using professional mentors as part of our treatment team, we look to inspire youth and motivate change.

about: "At any given moment you have the power to say: This is not how the story is going to end." With more than 20 years of experience as a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, I specialize in the treatment of individuals, couples and families to assist with relationship issues, post traumatic stress disorder, grief and loss, trauma and substance abuse. Together we will work to break unhelpful thought and behavior patterns and find new ways to grow and thrive as your own person.  I accept all PPO insurance plans as an Out of Network Provider.

name: Mae McAleavy
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, MSW, ASW
about: I believe each of us carries an inner healing intelligence, and that healing and growth are possible no matter what experiences have you brought to this moment. I provide a warm and compassionate space for you to develop wellbeing, offering acceptance, deep listening, and curiosity. You may be hurt by traumatic events, a difficult upbringing, or feel burdened by past or current relationships and life events. By exploring this burden, and processing stuck emotions and memories, you can gain a sense of safety, hope, inner strength, and serenity. I work with individuals and couples who deal with a range of concerns and diagnoses, including depression, anxiety, traumatic experiences (sexual abuse, war trauma, complex PTSD), relationship dissatisfaction, and chronic illness. I also work with artists and creatives who are dealing with blocks or seeking greater fulfillment in their work. I use a holistic approach to help you create the changes you seek, integrating insights from mindful self compassion, Internal Family Systems (IFS), Gestalt, Hakomi, and Intensive Short Term Dynamic Psychotherapy.  I am trained in EMDR and Brainspotting for the treatment of trauma, and Ketamine Assisted Psychotherapy (KAP) for treatment resistant depression.

name: Gaslighting; Narcissist Abuse; Toxic Bonding
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW, CPD-TS
about: GASLIGHTING; NARCISSIST ABUSE; CODEPENDENCY; TOXIC ATTACHMENT; HI-CONFLICT RELATIONSHIP:  Gaslighting is a form of psychological/emotional abuse where the abuser manipulates situations repeatedly to trick the victim into doubting his/her own memory, perception & sanity. You're accused of doing something that you know you didn't do or say. Often belittled, demeaned, and raged upon. You walk on eggshells & constantly need to watch what you say for fear your partner might blow up.  You often feel confused & now distrust yourself; have trouble making decisions & feel like you lost yourself or don't know the person you used to be. If you feel you're a trauma victim of Narcissist or Borderline personality disorder abuse and need to take steps to heal, you have come to the right place. As a Certified Personality Disorder Specialist and an Interracial Couples Therapist and Coach, I can help with the healing & recovery process which focuses on learning self-love, compassion & connection.  Inner pain can be an opportunity for deep learning & growing bc it serves to expose the real issues that have gone unresolved within yourself and in your relationship/marriage for way too long. I offer an active & direct, no-frills approach to counseling that integrates therapy w/coaching to help you achieve your desired results in a timely way.

name: John Bogardus
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about:
My clients are talented, intelligent, well-educated people who feel they are not living up to their potential in work or relationships. They may feel anxious or depressed, or at a loss about how to resolve a difficulty with a friend or family member. I love working with small business owners and the struggles encountered in making a business successful.

I am a licensed psychotherapist with accessible offices in San Francisco and Sonoma, Ca. I have many years of experience helping individuals and couples discover ways to live authentically and creatively. 

Get back to enjoying your life. When individuals feel anxious, saddened, or confused, it's often useful to receive a fresh perspective. I will understand and help you work to achieve the goals you wish to accomplish. If you don't know what's getting in your way or what you want to accomplish, I can help you determine these factors. I wish to help you live a more satisfying life. I have written articles you can find @ www.johnbogardus.com. I cover many topics such as Mindfulness, Survivor Guilt, and the Fear of Failure. I look at "Conscious Uncoupling" as well as offer Premarital Advice. For fun, I wonder if Benedict Cumberbatch misdiagnosed his Sherlock Holmes character on the PBS series.

name: Jennifer Friend
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: The decision to engage in therapy may be challenging but has proven to be well worth the effort. If you’re here, I believe that you are ready to experience LIFE with FREEDOM and PEACE of MIND. Let’s work together to discover how therapy can open new insights that can provide healing and relief from issues that cause stress, anxiety, depression, and fatigue. Issues related to  experiencing past or present trauma, abuse, or addictions can be debilitating. I respect being able to work with you on your journey towards healing. Therapy is non judgmental and can provide the help necessary that comes from feeling understood and validated. I have been blessed to help my clients gain freedom from addictions, relationship conflicts, self-doubt, anxiety, depression, and trauma. With over 10 years of professional experience and a lifetime of personal experience, my work is to help my clients  overcome complex and problematic emotional issues that get in the way of living life to its fullest.   Whether you're seeking help to work on relationship problems, career related difficulties, family conflict, or personal issues, I offer safe, confidential video/teletherapy sessions. Initial phone conferences are always free. I would appreciate being able to talk with you in order to discover how to help you meet your goals.

name: Sharon B Uy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, ATR, RYT, Coach
about: I help guide creative, motivated, open, and spiritually-minded individuals on their journey to reconnect and reintegrate with their true selves. It can be difficult to manage (or even face) all the feelings that come with depression, anxiety, life transitions, trauma, or cultural identity. Perhaps you're feeling lost right now, but you just know that there's a path and a purpose specific to you. There is a way to feel aligned in all areas of your life, and to live in true fulfillment and joy! I incorporate art therapy, sensorimotor psychotherapy, mindfulness, visualization, and meditation (all optional, of course) in helping you (re)discover the tools that are already within you, so that you can grow, heal, and learn to be okay with yourself and what is. We work together to figure out where you want to be, and find a clearer path to get there. I am committed to providing a truly safe space where you can be yourself in all of the glorious madness and cosmic humor of what it is to be human. There may be tears, and there will definitely be laughter, but there is no right or wrong in how you show up here. I welcome the messiness of self work! It's what makes the ride worthwhile and bitter turn sweet.

name: Cristin Runfola
title: Psychologist, PhD, LP
about: Passionate about helping others, I find it an honor to get to know and influence each client who comes into my life. In addition to my private practice, I hold a Clinical Associate Professorship at Stanford University where I’m able to wear research, teaching, and supervisory hats. My approach to therapy is personalized integrating information about your unique circumstances with my training to deliver evidence-based practice. I provide trauma-informed individual and couple-based therapy for various issues including eating disorders, anxiety and mood disorders, obsessive and compulsive disorder, transitions, & relationship concerns. My Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology and training from an NIH-funded post-doctoral research fellowship, enables me to critically evaluate the latest clinical research, conceptualize complex situations, and build novel prevention & intervention programs inclusive of individuals from all backgrounds. I am compassionate, thoughtful, curious, & active in my approach. I firmly believe we can all change when it’s needed. Building resiliency and hope is an important part of this process. My goal is to create a safe environment for you to process difficult emotions, accept painful circumstances, and build strategies for coping. All of this is in the service of building a more meaningful life. www.cristinrunfolaphd.com
