name: Gene Burns
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: NOW ACCEPTING NEW CLIENTS. I specialize in working with Individuals, Couples , and Teenagers. I believe we all have our personal journey that leads to being at peace in our lives. I offer a warm, open, and straightforward approach to my clients. Therapy is an exceptional way to become unstuck, get back on track and begin moving forward again. I strongly believe that counseling can be a positive experience. One that helps you build momentum with each session on the way to reaching your goals. Evening and Saturday appointments are available. I try and return all calls within 24 hours and I usually respond within a couple of hours.  Couples counseling can help to resolve relationship conflicts and improve communication. Therapy can provide an environment for honest and direct discussion in which each person is able to feel heard and understood. I have extensive training with adolescents, I have worked with hundreds of teenagers while working in the Roseville/Rocklin school districts.  "Others can shake you, surprise you, disappoint you, but they can't prevent you from acting, from taking the situation you're presented with and moving on. No matter where you are in life, or your situation, you always have a choice and that choice can be power." ~ B Lee

name: Carol M. Lazo
title: Associate Professional Clinical Counselor, APCC
about: Life transitions, whether welcomed or unwanted but needed, often seem to be too much to bear on your own. When it comes to college or career adjustment, family role or relationship changes, or grief and loss, you may not feel equipped to navigate the next chapter of your life story — even when you’re writing it for the better.  You may have developed habits, emotional resistance, or long-held beliefs that were effective in getting you through to this stage of life but are now unhelpful or even harmful for where you are going now. That’s where I can help. Using integrated wellness, cognitive behavioral, and solutions-focused approaches that consider your unique cultural background, I support you in connecting to your authentic values, voice, and feelings so you can move toward personal growth. I believe you are the insightful, resilient expert of you.  I am here to help you make the most of your intrinsic strengths and inner wisdom for healing, acceptance, and wellbeing. Look forward to hearing from you.

name: Danielle Neff
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT, APCC
about: The dark moments we all face in our lives can seem insurmountable when faced alone, but you are not alone.  You have found your way here seeking support and I am honored by your courage.  I am passionate about helping others navigate their pain and uncover the means that lead to deeper connections and a sense of well being by tending to, honoring, and understanding the wounds of the soul carried within each of us. Together we will explore core issues, utilize tools to increase resiliency and learn of new ways of being. Even small changes in perspective can lead to us seeing ourselves and the world in new ways. My approach is compassionate, curious, engaged, and active.  Are you feeling lost, overwhelmed, or isolated?  Are you coping with profound grief due to a medical diagnosis or loss of health, family conflict, infertility, or the death of a loved one?  Are you experiencing anxiety or depression from a major life transition or caregiver stress? Adjusting to new realities takes time and support. I offer a free 15 minute phone consultation so that we can decide if we might be a good fit to work together.

name: Sofia Subhan
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Now accepting new clients. For over a decade I have been helping people grow, heal, learn about themselves and shift negative patterns in their life. If you or someone you know is feeling stuck, overwhelmed, having difficulty navigating relationships, or burdened by past traumas, I will work with you to better understand, process and resolve challenges in your life. Dealing with ongoing life stressors at home, school or work can be difficult to navigate and can leave you feeling hopeless at times. Based on my years of experience, I tailor my approach and techniques to best fit your unique hardships and goals. I enjoy working with young adults and women, who are going through depression, trauma, anxiety, and life transitions. Additionally, I have extensive experience working with immigrants and those in the Asian and South Asian population. As a therapist, my purpose is to provide a calm and safe environment to help you to feel supported and find contentment. In our work together, I will provide guidance and help to increase self awareness and shift perspectives about yourself and your past. If you are looking for movement, progress and a new chapter in your life, I can help you to achieve your goals. I like to meet my client where they are in their lives and believe that each person has the capacity to flourish.

As a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, I provide you with the opportunity, the safe space and the quality time needed to attend to your emotional, relational and spiritual needs. name: Cary Ann Rosko
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Therapy is a time and place where we can slow down and take a closer look at the obstacles and difficulties we face in our lives. I strive to create an environment of safety, non-judgment and compassion in order to make room for uncomfortable or overwhelming emotions. I work holistically to help clients understand the sources of their suffering and integrate all aspects of their lives into a harmonious and balanced well-being. My approach emphasizes innate healing impulses and strengths, and I join with clients to determine courses of action that will help them make important life changes. I've helped people with anxiety, depression, trauma and PTSD, grief, mood disorders, relationship conflict and abuse, as well as life transitions and spiritual deepening. Clients feel more able to value themselves, to manage painful feelings, to have successful relationships, and to create the life they want for themselves. I use a variety of therapeutic modalities, including somatically-oriented techniques, mindfulness, & EMDR. I'm experienced in working with the LGBTQ community, and I acknowledge that we are all shaped by our place in society. I'd be honored to help you on your journey towards wholeness, self-possession & empowerment.

name: Lena Allen
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I grew up in Southern California and received my BA from California State University, San Marcos in Sociology and Liberal Arts. I obtained my MSW from the University of Southern California in 2002 and became a Licensed Clinical Social Worker in 2008. I have over 20 years of experience working with children, adolescents, adults, and families in a variety of settings. My experience includes working with individuals, couples, and families. I have a strong foundation in working with depression, anxiety, trauma, personality disorders, and substance use disorders. I have extensive training in trauma-informed treatment, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavioral therapy, as well as Solution-Focused Therapy, and Motivational Interviewing. Over my career, I have worked in adolescent and adult residential treatment centers, forensic settings, behavioral health, and legal and court settings.  I enjoy watching clients as they evolve through therapy as they begin to learn about themselves and begin to become more authentic and wholehearted. In my free time, I enjoy reading, watching Netflix, spending time with family, exploring the outdoors and the beach, working out, traveling, and shopping.

name: Matthew S Goodman
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Thank you for visiting my page! I am a Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY32423) specializing in the treatment of anxiety disorders (e.g., Generalized Anxiety, OCD, Social Anxiety). In combination with traditional cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), I work with people using mindfulness, self-compassion, and other stress-reduction tools (e.g., breathing exercises) to bring the nervous system into greater balance. My goal is to ally with you in taking courageous, yet practical, steps in the direction of your values and goals. We do this step-by-step at your own personal pace. My clients would describe me as warm, nonjudgmental, & patient. Outside of private practice, I serve as Clinical Assistant Professor in the Keck School of Medicine at USC, where I supervise psychiatry residents. I also teach mindfulness meditation & run a class combining improv with mindfulness (and other behavioral science tools) for general wellness! I would be happy to set up a free 15 minute consultation to explore whether we might be a good fit. You can also check out my groups (below). If you have any questions about working with me (or therapy, more broadly), don't hesitate to reach out. I look forward to connecting!

name: Devoney Kodad
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, PPSC
about: Struggling with anxiety, stress, a loud inner critic or feeling burnt out?  Whether you're looking to manage your anxiety and stress, quiet your inner critic, get to know yourself better, really connect with yourself & feel like you can hear your voice & trust yourself, I'd love to support you.  Some areas I love to support clients in are: anxiety, self-esteem, self-confidence, healthy relationships, boundary-setting, communication, creating healthy routines, perfectionism, people pleasing, and burnout. I have a compassionate, growth-centered, and solution-focused approach to therapy.  My eclectic approach includes: ACT, mind-body approaches, mindfulness, self-compassion and self reflection journaling.  My hope is that every session will be a safe place for you to get to know yourself better, feel seen & heard & start creating a life you truly love. I believe that you are the expert on you and that on your journey of healing and growth, having an open, safe space to reflect and share can be incredibly helpful.   Schedule a free 15 Minute Connection Call or send me an email to see if we are a good fit & if working together would be a great next step on your healing and growth journey.  Best wishes!

name: Makeda Abraham

about: My focus as a therapist is always on providing a safe , non-judgmental and collaborative environment for my client to be seen, heard and understood . My practice intersects traditional clinical training as a licensed psychotherapist with mindfulness based interventions and a mind- body-spirit centered approach. I honor the unique path of each client I work with.  Together, we explore the underlying causes for specific emotional patterns while increasing awareness of the inner world/belief systems that create our outer world/external experience. I prioritize cultivating authentic trusting relationships with my clients as I believe that through the development of the therapeutic alliance, deep healing is possible. I do not take for granted the courage it takes to reach out for support and I would be honored to be a part of your path to  radical self-care and self-love.  I look forward to hearing from you and supporting you in your wellness journey.

name: Paige O'Connell
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I aim to be your ally as you face life’s challenges. We are all individuals with our own needs, cultures, beliefs, and experiences. We all face our challenges in unique ways. I approach therapy from a place of cultural humility, with a strong belief that effective therapy is simultaneously flexible and tailored to you. In my private practice, I specialize in working with members of the LGBTQ+ community, people in STEM and tech fields, college and graduate students, and working adults. Together we can address a wide range of issues, from anxiety, depression, and impostor syndrome, to trauma, grief, and experiences of discrimination. My style is warm, non-judgmental, collaborative, and humorous. I utilize an integration of evidence-based approaches with a "talk therapy" relational approach, which allows me to provide you with tools to face your challenges, based on an understanding of your history, needs, and strengths. I hope to empower you to appreciate your resilience and true self. If you are feeling stuck, let's work on it together. If you are ready to make a change and learn more about yourself, I would love to be part of your journey. Change is a process. Luckily, the steps to start that process are simple: getting to know each other, setting goals, and figuring out what works for you.

name: Mental Wealth Counseling
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, AMFT
about: I’m a strong proponent for decreasing the shame surrounding body diversity and addiction. I feel therapy is an opportunity for us to dive deeper into the patterns and obstacles that are blocking us from connecting with our true self and a higher quality of life. Outside of the therapy room, I love finding new trails and going on adventures with my pup, Clio. I have a passion for traveling and learning from the places I visit. And of course, I thrive off of a good belly laugh with some friends (I believe laughter is medicine!) I love working with teens and adults struggling with self esteem, body image, eating disorders or addiction/ addictive behaviors. Those who are looking to climb out of their cocoon of safety and into a warm bubble of transformation – come on in! Those who simply just need a space to be witnessed or heard due to life’s hardships – I can provide that. Want to know more? I encourage you to learn more about me, my therapy style, and my thoughts about treatment outcomes by clicking the 'Website' button at the top of this page. www.mentalwealthcc.com

name: Katherine Tromello, M.S., LMFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Katherine works with clients from a holistic approach, taking into account all aspects of the clients life (social, relational, emotional, mental, physical, cultural and environmental) that may impact overall wellness.  Mindfulness work, attachment based strategies, cognitive behavioral techniques, and regulation strategies are often utilized in sessions. Katherine works with a variety of population but offers therapeutic support to parents, children/adolescents, and athletes working on performance related issues. Katherine has additional credentials in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Attachment theory, and is currently earning her Certified Mental Performance Consultant credential through the Association for Applied Sport Psychology. Katherine has extensive training and experience in working with the developing minds of children and adolescents. Katherine received her Master's in Marriage and Family Therapy from California Lutheran University with a specialization in Attachment Theory. She has experience working with children and families, within the school system (providing mental health support to children with IEPs), athletes with issues related to sports performance, and the foster system.

name: All Rivers Therapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: My practice specializes in mental health, family life, trauma and addiction recovery for teens and adults.  I am experienced in treating co-occurring issues of addiction, depression, anxiety, grief, life transitions and trauma.  I have worked with pervasive mental illness, substance abuse, eating disorders, mood and anxiety disorders as well attachment wounds and early childhood trauma.  I help families and individuals untangle relationship and behavioral patterns and find new ways of relating to self and others, regulate emotions, identify core values and make meaningful and positive life changes. I use a variety of humanistic, relational, cognitive, somatic and trauma-informed approaches, working from a holistic perspective. I treat people who are experiencing anxiety, depression, loss, addiction, trauma and relational problems through an integration of EMDR, DNMS, Motivational Interviewing, DBT, CBT, narrative therapy as well as art and sand tray. My clients describe me as a caring and intuitive therapist that provides them with a place to feel safe, seen and heard. I combine evidence-based psychology with spirituality.  My goal is to help you find new meaning and to transform your life. I provide tele-health video sessions and free consultations. Feel free to call me or check out my website.

name: Valerie Anne Goss
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Just like life,therapy is both an adventure and a risk. As a therapist,I encourage you to focus on the concept of choice. Our lives are constantly filled with the need to make choices. Should you be in a relationship or leave one?  Is your current job the right one for you? Can you learn how to accept and express your needs? Choosing a therapist can be very confusing, but choosing the right therapist can be crucial to living a happy and fulfilling life. I specialize in helping you develop tools for managing depression and anxiety as well strengthen your ability to communicate and experience a more fulfilling life. Self acceptance and forgiveness can be life's greatest challenges. In our work together, you will explore thoughts and feelings about yourself and the people in your life allowing you to either accept and understand these parts of yourself and work toward developing new skills. Connecting with people, helping you to understand and realize your dreams and improve the quality of your relationships and your life has been my lifelong passion. Each therapy session is an opportunity for insight and accomplishment. Please feel free to contact me in order to begin this journey.

name: Eric Pierson
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Therapy can be uncomfortable, and challenging for folks, because it causes them to confront unpleasant emotions or memories.  Therapy can be helpful because those unpleasant things are often making people's lives difficult, and therapy can help create a place to better understand and deal with those uncomfortable things.  I find that I work best with clients that want to address things that make them uncomfortable, but don't know how to do so, or are reluctant to do it alone. As a Licensed Clinical Psychologist, I have found that the relationship with client creates the vehicle for change.  I use a number of orientations, from Gestalt and Narrative Therapy, to Dialectical Behavioral Therapy and Cognitive Behavioral therapy, to build a relationship based on trust, communication, and my knowledge and expertise, to facilitate change Change can be difficult, and sometimes the only way to get to a better place is to face things that we don't want to face and work through them.  I want to help people with that process, and my hope is to make the process more manageable, both by being a companion in the journey, and providing some tools along the way.

about: Being bilingual has allowed me to work with Spanish speaking families.  Being from a first generation immigrant family makes me sensitive to bi cultural issues. My scope of practice has been primarily with young children, foster children, and adolescents. I also work along with parents to provide them with skills to handle problems such as tantrums, sensory issues, parenting/discipline issues, behavioral problems, and traumas. I also work with young adults struggling with family conflicts, bi-cultural issues, career decisions, depression, anxiety, and childhood trauma. I have experience working with children and their parents, doing dyadic work around issues of attachment, bonding, dysregulation, discipline issues, sensory integration issues, and trauma. I would be happy to schedule an intake appointment and facilitate you in your process of better health.

name: Naomi Z Corwin

about: Are you wanting to experience more ease and happiness? I want to congratulate you on taking the first steps towards finding someone to come alongside you during this time.   Maybe you are experiencing a big life change like the end of a relationship, a change in your career, a move, or a recent loss.  Maybe you have often found comfort in spirituality and nature but still have a sense that something is still missing.  Maybe you feel the weight of these last few years of covid. I want you to know that all parts of your identity and sexuality are welcome.  We will find solutions that are especially tailored for your needs. I wish you the very best as you look for a companion on your healing journey.

name: Julie Cooper
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My client is someone trying to manage stress, whether it be a romantic problem, feeling stuck in your career or relationships, coping with grief and loss, or just trying to figure out how to feel better.  Maybe your marriage has hit a rough patch with communication, conflict, trust, or adjusting to parenthood.  You are interested in self-growth and living an authentic and fulfilling life and want to work in collaboration with someone who can help you along that path. My goal is to help clients work through challenging periods of life including relationship problems, intimacy and sexuality issues, and grief and loss. My practice is trauma-informed and I have experience in various evidence-based practices such as CBT, CPT, mindfulness, and others.  Additionally, I have trained in Gottman Method therapy and Sex Therapy. Starting therapy can feel intimidating, especially if you don't know what to expect.  My goal is to provide a safe place for my clients to express their thoughts and feelings without shame and be met with understanding and compassion.  I'm a strong believer in communicating authentically and incorporating humor when it fits.  I look forward to meeting you!

name: Amy Lew
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Have you been looking for someone who understands that your culture is a key component to your healing? Has depression, anxiety, relational issues, or traumatic stress been hindering you from being present and engaged in life? If you are looking for someone to support you and/or your loved ones in finding ways to reengage life and relationships, I can help. If you are a teen or college student looking for help in readjusting to school, sustaining friendships, or in handling the stress of the pandemic, I can be a support for you. Are you a parent seeking out support in this particularly isolating time? I am here for you as well.  In addition to my training in trauma, motivational interviewing, EMDR, and other client-centered modalities, I also have experience working in a racial identity lab and have a deep appreciation for one's ethnic background and culture(s). Starting therapy is often not an easy decision to make but having the right therapist can make a huge difference.  I honor your willingness to look for help and I respect your journey of healing up until this point. If you feel I might be able to further support you, please feel free to reach out to me with no commitment necessary at all. I am available to answer any questions you have about therapy or myself as a therapist. I wish you health and wholeness.

name: Mindful Therapy Practice
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I may be a good fit for you if you find yourself experiencing moments of intense emotion, such as frustration, anger, rage, sadness, emptiness, and overwhelm. You may be misappropriating your intense feelings at your friends/family/significant others and may be at risk of losing important relationships. You might also be struggling to function at work, calling off sick more than you would like. You might also be trying to soothe yourself in ways that ultimately don't fix the problem and might also make you feel worse, guilty, or ashamed. I approach my work through a trauma lens. My training in EMDR helps me take a good history of difficult and traumatic experiences in your life, in an effort to help make sense of the past so that it no longer controls the present. My background in DBT helps me provide practical tools you can use to better manage intense emotion and spiraling thoughts. If my approach resonates with you, please feel free to call me or email me for a free phone consultation. We can discuss what you are looking for and see if we are a good fit. Evening and weekend hours also available.

name: Laurie Schoenberg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MS, IFECMHS
about: I am a licensed Marriage, Family Therapist (MFT), specializing in working with children with developmental, emotional/behavioral issues.  I have completed two graduate degrees (child development and counseling psychology) where my training focused on developmental issues of childhood and child psychopathology issues.  I am also a Graduate Fellow of the UC Davis Infant-Parent Mental Health Program and I have earned the California Infant-Early Childhood Mental Health Specialist Credential.  I am also a lecturer, parent educator and past college professor.   Sometimes adults struggle with their our own emotion regulation and ability to connection emotionally.  My developmental lens works well with adults who are struggling with personal or professional relationships.  I support each family's specific concerns in establishing emotional connections. I encourage children and adults alike to understand how their brain works; so you can truly start to control emotions, increase focus and attention and most importantly to have empathy for those we love and care about.  Once we learn how to exercise the brain; our relationships can improve dramatically!

name: Wendy D Meier
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: To be human is to know trouble and beauty. Much of the time we deal effectively with life's ups and downs. Other times, our resources can be overwhelmed by a major event or loss. Even expected transitions can present a crisis, contributing to depression and anxiety. Lifelong concerns among family members, such as poor communication and/or conflicts, can be improved no matter your stage of life.  As a psychotherapist, I will meet you where you are, providing support during a crisis, and/or working over time on the issues that are uncovered by it. Focuses include health concerns, anger, depression, anxiety, retirement, family relationships, adoption, among others. My practice only accepts Medicare, with a private supplement. Please email drwmeier@outlook.com to discuss availability and options. To locate other psychotherapists in the Central Coast area, try the Central Coast Psychological Association at centralcoastpsych.org

name: Farnoush Termeforoosh
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Life is hard enough -- seeking therapy doesn’t have to be. I provide therapy via Telehealth in the comfort of your own space to address challenges and needs in a safe and supportive environment. You deserve to invest one hour a week into your personal growth and life improvements to help life’s challenges - past, present and future. Together, we can investigate what patterns and behaviors have been causing challenges in your life, and work to create healthy habits and make your life easier.  I’ve been working with clients for the past twenty years, with individuals as well as families. I’ve helped my clients improve their self-esteem, self worth, and communication issues in relationships. I have experience working with clients from the LGBTQIA community, and a variety of backgrounds. I also speak Farsi fluently.  Each client is different, and I match my therapy style to meet your needs.   It is the utmost importance to me to create a safe environment where my clients feel heard and understood as well as providing therapy that is effective and helpful. Reach out to me today, and we can start your journey to healing together.

name: William Gardner
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Are you feeling like things aren't working out the way you want them to?  Do you find that anxiety or depression are stopping you from your goals?  I am a Stanford educated clinical psychologist. I provide brief, solution-focused interventions combined with an interactive and positive style in order to decrease anxiety and fear, improve your mood, and help you to make your life more effective and enjoyable. Incorporating a variety of cognitive behavioral techniques, we will work together to overcome the issues and challenges getting in the way of you living your life and achieving your goals. I specialize in providing individualized care for adults who are experiencing anxiety, panic, depression, phobias, anger or who have been through traumatic experiences.  I use brief, scientifically supported treatments to quickly help you to feel better. I have returned to in person therapy.  If you're thinking you're ready to make some changes please feel free to reach out over email or phone.

name: AAMI Mental Health Services
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Accepting Clients; Telehealth, Private Pay & some Insurances accepted. Life can be difficult and sometimes we just need someone to listen and guide us or offer fresh ideas that could help us reach a level of satisfaction and improve our quality of life. Ideally, someone with motivation, an open mind and eager to invest in their wellbeing and work on themselves to improve their life and experience joy. I understand the difficulties of maintaining a work-life balance so I offer early morning, late evening and weekend appointments.  I accept Aetna, Oxford, Oscar, and United Health Care and Cigna. My approach is client centered and solution focused. I provide tools and skills that can be helpful in improving my client's lives and that can be easily utilized in between sessions to continue to provide support during the healing process. Meeting the client where they are and moving at their pace is important when I practice. I provide a safe virtual space to provide comfort and encourage my clients to feel safe and heard. I am receptive to feedback and always allow the client to lead me in the direction they want to take their treatment as I believe this is where healing begins.

Life's challenges point us toward clues in the sometimes mysterious road to vibrant health... not just getting by, but enjoying the life you deserve.

name: Jolene Guilliams
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I'm a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist who specializes in Somatic Psychotherapy.  Somatic simply means "relating to the body" and in therapy this means that I have been uniquely trained to integrate the wisdom from our biology into treatment. Our bodies relate information that, should we choose to listen, can support our overall mental health. This way of working can have profound effects on anxiety, depression, trauma, addictions, and disordered eating. The clients that receive maximum benefit from my approach have an open mind about how the body influences thoughts, not just how thoughts influence the body.  I work well with clients that are collaborative and have a sincere desire to engage in their own lives, rather than seek to be fixed by another. My approach is heavily informed by my clinical training in Somatic Psychotherapy and is my sincere desire to provide trauma-informed, culturally conscious care.  My goal is to support your liberation. Your body and mind are always in conversation.  Some therapies focus ONLY on the brain informing the body.  In my practice we honor BOTH the power of the mind AND the wisdom of the body.  This approach can yield insight and options that we never knew were available. Together, we can cultivate a safe place to explore new potentials and greater capacities!

name: Madison Bottorff
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, MSW
about: Are you experiencing stress, depression, anxiety, trauma, suicidal thoughts, relationship or personal challenges? Have you had therapy before and it didn't feel as effective as you'd hoped? Are you interested in getting to know yourself better with support from a person who won't judge you? With the use of psychotherapy, I can help you develop deeper self awareness, healthy communication skills and positive coping skills. Together we will increase your emotional intelligence and develop ways to manage stress and other challenging symptoms. We can create the change you want to see in your life.  I specialize in providing individual psychotherapy, couples counseling, family therapy and play therapy to help clients find success, growth and improvement. I also specialize in the age range 0-5 years. I provide a very open and creative approach to therapy which can include art, play, music and writing to uniquely suit your needs in therapy. Finding a good therapist can be hard, with many factors impacting the effectiveness of your treatment- insurance/fees, scheduling, personality, treatment style, individual goals. Working together to explore those factors, in addition to your feelings, through a phone consult and/or intake appt is the 1st step toward finding the therapy that works for you.

name: Malia Sanchez
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I entered the field of psychology with the belief that people can change. I have worked in a variety of settings and with individuals experiencing many different MH issues. I have seen change and growth in so many different ways. My goal is to help clients find the motivation and skills they need to make the positive changes they want to see in their lives. Change can be difficult but when you are willing to put in the work it can open endless possibilities. I offer all my clients a compassionate and safe therapeutic environment to assist in guiding them through the challenges and opportunities that life can present. Many people have experienced some type of trauma which can greatly impact different areas of a person's life. I work with clients to help them better understand trauma and develop ways to cope in their daily lives. I am trained in EMDR therapy and utilize this intervention to assist clients with processing their past traumas in a different and healthier way. The overall focus of my clinical work has always been on providing holistic mental health care while being mindful of various cultural considerations. In my doctoral program I specialized in Multicultural Community Mental Health and continue to be dedicated to providing MH services to individuals in minority and marginalized communities.

name: A. Maya Borgueta
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: What would you do if you had the courage to take risks and get vulnerable in your personal or professional life? Let's find out together. As professional women, we often cope with uncertainty and "impostor syndrome" by trying to perfect ourselves and outperform our peers. And we can struggle with intense guilt and shame when it feels like we're falling short. More often than not, this cycle creates additional barriers to our own success and happiness. Sometimes we double down; other times we end up demoralized or paralyzed. Either way, we get stuck. Perfection is unattainable, but that doesn't mean we can't find healthy ways to strive for excellence instead. As a therapist, I use a variety of practical, research-based tools and techniques to help you move towards your goals. Therapy newbies are especially welcome here! You don't have to choose between success and your mental health. Call or email me today for a free consultation and to learn more about what I can do for you. Women of color and LGBTQ+ women are enthusiastically welcomed to connect!

name: Jackie MacNear
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: As a fat, queer, neurodivergent disruptor of societal norms and systems, I hold a strength-based attachment focused framework that values and celebrates all genders, sexualities, bodies, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, family structures, religions, and socio-economic locations. I see these intersectionalities as a beautiful tapestry of personal empowerments which can become the foundation from which we work collectively to identify, address and dismantle systems of oppression. I believe humans shouldn’t be pathologized in a society designed to keep people sick and stuck. I hold a safe, trauma informed,non-judgemental, inviting space where I will meet you where you are and we will work collaboratively to identify your strengths, values, goals and oppurtunities for growth.  I draw from an eclectic mix of theories (Attachment, Trauma, Critical Race, Queer, Humanistic and Transpersonal) to meet your individual needs and style.

name: Linda Block
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Since so much of personal growth happens in our primary relationships, I have found that relationship counseling creates individual change AND improves relationships simultaneously. I teamed up with a colleague, Katharina Kienböck, to work with couples and families. Couples and families tend to come to us when they feel a strong rift in their relationship, often struggling with anger and blame, conflict and distance. By directing the conversation in a structured way, we create a safe environment that allows for space from these problems and brings strengths and resources to the foreground that may have been eclipsed. Collaboratively, we re-invite understanding, appreciation, and fun, and encourage our clients to re-join as a team and to create a path toward connection, trust, and resilience. We are honored to be part of our couples’ journeys to more fulfilling relationships.

name: Colleen Woodall
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, ASW, PPSC
about: Has your child or teen recently been experiencing issues that leave you feeling down? Possibly anxiety, fear, or depression?  Maybe they are struggling at school academically or with friends?  Have they gone through trauma, grief, separation, or major life changes? Or maybe you feel they could use someone to talk to that values their feelings, opinions, and goals.  I would love to provide a safe space for your child or teen. My therapeutic focus is on kids ages 4-18 and young adults. I utilize a strengths based approach and base treatment on a client's interest.  This may include play therapy, art therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, and dialectical behavioral therapy.  I enjoy building rapport with clients through humor, fun, and providing a safe space for growth. Additionally, as a former school social worker, I have extensive experience and knowledge on Section 504 and IEP plans. I would be happy to work with a family or school to fully support a child/young adult.  Thank you for taking the first step in helping to support your kiddo through counseling. Please reach out to me for a free consultation.

name: Trish Becker
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Hello and welcome! My first priority when working w/ an individual is creating a safe space by helping them feel heard and understood without judgment. Once this environment is established, I focus on supporting a client's feelings, helping them reach new insights and acquire skills so they may be more comfortable and effective in their lives. I strive to guide the client toward solutions and to help them meet the goals they have for the therapy. I have a lot of experience treating individuals who are struggling w/ alcohol & drug addiction as well as depression and anxiety. I also work with clients who have a history of adult or childhood trauma and PTSD. Other client issues include relationship difficulties, loss and times of transition and stress. My approach is warm and friendly and my casual manner puts client's at ease. My communication style is direct but with compassion. I also think humor can be very healing. I love what I do and find the process of psychotherapy fascinating and rewarding. I look forward to meeting you!

name: Burney Therapy Group
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Shay is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, with over a decade of experience treating substance use disorders, obsessive compulsive disorder, trauma, mood disorders, disordered eating, identity issues, and relational difficulties.   She serves as a clinical supervisor for mental health clinics and substance abuse treatment centers, and now has expanded her work to providing care for individuals, couples, and families in private practice. Shay’s passion lies in helping people find peace, happiness, and build a sense of self. Her client-centered, humanistic approach will make you feel at ease during sessions. She utilizes a variety of evidence-based practices including: CBT, Narrative Therapy, ACT, Somatic-Experiencing (SE), Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR), and DBT, tailoring each intervention to meet your specific needs. Shay’s mission is to create an engaging, compassionate, and transparent environment for you and your family to become your/their best selves.  You already struggle on your own; you deserve a committed therapist to help you heal and grow.

title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: My therapeutic services are targeted at individuals who prefer the privacy, convenience and familiarity of meeting in their home or may have challenges that extend beyond a traditional in-office setting. I work with client's who face challenges impacting their functioning at home, school or in the community. I work with issues such as anxiety, depression, or panic and behavioral issues like opposition, aggression, and excessive screen time.  At home, on campus, in the community or even on the road. I provide an intensive goal-oriented and in home-based service to address specific, targeted behaviors where they impact you, your family or your teen the most. name: Julia Raffaini
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, CSTS
about: Have you had a scary or overwhelming experience which left you feeling changed? Perhaps you are finding yourself more on edge, distracted, depressed, or anxious. Or maybe you're experiencing nightmares, intrusive distressing memories, or you are feeling detached from those around you. Anyone can experience trauma and yet, how it is felt can be so unique. However you are feeling today, I’m here to support you. I feel privileged to help individuals striving to be the best version of themselves while navigating life's challenges and I am most passionate about helping people find relief and transformation from trauma. I have a collaborative approach and incorporate techniques from EMDR, DBT, and CBT to meet my client's individual treatment needs. Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) therapy is a well-researched, effective approach to help people heal from trauma and other distressing life experiences. Let's talk! It takes courage to reach out for support and to begin therapy. I want to help you feel comfortable as you take these next steps. Please feel free to contact me to book a free 15 minute phone consultation so that I can answer your questions and we can determine whether I am a good fit to help you reach your goals.
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Coping Skills', 'Depression', 'Life Transitions', 'Shame', 'Stress']

name: Erin Beldner
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Do you feel empty or like something is missing from your life? Do you feel like you're stuck or repeating the same patterns? I utilize a cognitive behavioral and mindfulness based approach to explore faulty thought and behavior patterns and help clients connect to the treasure trove of inner strengths that we each possess. I believe that we have the answers within us, but may need help to unlock what is holding us back and discover what we need to move forward. My training in Attachment Focused EMDR can be a helpful tool in understanding and healing from traumatic events and painful experiences. Today you took the first step in your journey of personal growth. Together we can identify goals and discover the path that is right for you. I am dedicated to helping you achieve balance, a sense of meaning and developing healthy and lasting relationships. I'm a fierce proponent of silencing our inner critic and learning how to develop self-compassion. I will provide you with the coping skills to handle challenges that life throws your way. With the proper tools and support, you'll be unstoppable! Contact me for a brief phone consultation to discuss what type of issue(s) you are experiencing. I look forward to talking with you.

name: Sandy Huynh
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I support human beings who are trying to build a deeper understanding of themselves so that they can make decisions and embrace their lives in a more authentic and fulfilling way. There is no one right way to live life and I believe that a truly deep wisdom resides in all of us. Sometimes we just need support in getting there. Together, we can explore places that feel emotionally scary, breathe space into the places that feel suffocating, and challenge beliefs that trap us into behaviors that hinder growth and healing. I facilitate the exploration of: how unconscious beliefs & behaviors impact decision making, how the past impacts the present, how to implement healthy boundaries, how to cultivate self-esteem, how to safely process and heal from trauma, how to manage intimate and familial relationships, how to regulate anxiety & depression in the body, and much more. I welcome people from all walks of life in addition to those who identify as Asian American, people of color, refugees, and immigrants. I have training in working with inter generational trauma, intimate partner dynamics, and family dynamics. I work with individuals and couples. Email is the best way to reach me.

name: Jennifer Dormer Lee
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I believe a successful therapeutic relationship is rooted in a deep academic understanding of human development, but is most effective when expressed as a pure, honest and simple communication between client and therapist. My approach is to actively engage, creating a supportive and collaborative environment that is equally empathic and challenging. By focusing on both past experiences and present circumstances, I seek to access the client's inner strengths in order to overcome difficult situations, make life changes and break unhealthy patterns. I work with children, adolescents, families and adults; with a focus on issues surrounding children with special needs, women's health/life cycle changes, and problems surrounding pregnancy and birth. In New York City, I earned graduate degrees from Columbia University and Yeshiva University; working alongside renowned psychologists at Columbia University, the New York State Psychiatric Institute and Bellevue Hospital. Thus in experience and philosophy, it is my goal to improve my client's emotional wellbeing in practical life applications.

name: Pritika Sehgal
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I believe seeking therapy is the first and the most courageous step towards healing, especially due to the misguided stigma about mental illness. Having gone through my own mental health journey, I understand the challenges and barriers to a life worth living whether it be anxiety, depression, self-criticism or the unresolved past traumas. I want you to know that you are not alone. I believe through therapeutic healing we can take the next step towards exploring and accepting rejected parts of ourselves and integrating them for a more fulfilled life. I created a non-judgmental and compassionate environment in my practice. I utilize trauma-focused and mindfulness based approach through a combination of DBT and EMDR. I offer a variety of skills such as emotion regulation, distress tolerance and managing interpersonal relationships to help create balance and improve holistic well-being. My goal is  facilitate processing and healing from everyday stressors and past traumas. My roots are from India and being from a different culture I recognize importance of culture sensitivity and diversity. My specialty lies in working with people from different culture and ethnic backgrounds. I have an empathetic, respectful and curious approach for the role that culture plays in our lives. I invite you for a free 20 minute consultation!

I aim to understand how each client's intersecting identities, relationships, and functioning within broader societal systems are impacting their current concerns. name: Abbie Endres
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: You've begun a courageous search.  Take heart, healing is possible.  My work is rooted in the body/mind connection, nourished by the imagination, and anchored in the support of our therapy relationship. My style includes both directing and listening.  I understand that your timing and willingness to explore your concerns are unique and must be navigated with respect.  We work together to take stock, talk about your goals, and gather the tools needed - from your own strengths, the training I bring, and a community of resources - to help you continue your journey of wellbeing. Two guiding intentions support this work: Develop tools, awareness, and self-compassion to transform pain and suffering.  And, discover your innate wisdom and capacity for well being, relationship, and pleasure.  In these ways, it's possible to heal, grow, and thrive in relationship to ourselves, others, and the world. I have special training in somatic/body-oriented therapy, grief and healing in pregnancy and infant loss, harm reduction and abstinence-based addiction work, issues of abuse and trauma, and couple's therapy.  I believe in the benefit of mindfulness and creative practices in therapy and life.

name: Alice E Witt
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: If you have accessed this database, chances are either you or someone you love is hurting. My life's passion is helping people grow through their emotional pain and find solutions for life's problems.  I enjoy working with people of all ages and backgrounds. Problems and difficulties are part of life. No one is exempt. There is no shame in asking for help and I'd like to partner with you as you seek solutions that will work for you. Married 30 yrs with 5 children, we experienced marital conflict, cancer, substance abuse, co-dependency, anger, LD, giftedness, etc.  Clinically I experienced: depression, child abuse, sexual abuse, substance abuse, divorce, loss, mood disorders, childhood illnesses, etc. The combination of life and clinical experiences form the basis of my ability to provide empathetic, compassionate care. My view of the counseling process is that it is actually part of God's plan for sanctification and growth.  Through grace, truth and time in the therapeutic relationship real change occurs. There is always hope.

name: Shayan Rad
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Dr. Shayan Rad, PsyD is a licensed clinical psychologist with 10+ years of experience specializing in the treatment of depression, anxiety, trauma, PTSD, life transitions, self-esteem, relationship-issues, sleep disorders, stress and anger management. Shayan has extensive experience providing psychotherapy for adults of all ages in English and Persian (Farsi) through the use of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy. CBT is an effective, evidenced based and scientifically validated approach to therapy that typically leads to significant and tangible results in a client's life within several months instead of several years. Shayan takes a problem solving approach to treatment that involves helping clients implement new skills to solve different problems in life while treating each client with empathy, respect, and as a unique individual. Shayan strives to create a space where a client feels understood and safe to express all thoughts and feelings without feeling judged while acquiring the tools for lasting positive change. In his free time, Shayan enjoys spending time in nature, camping, swimming, and hiking and spending time with family and pets.

name: Narkesia Swanigan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: The approach I take to therapy is a collaboration with my clients. You are not alone. Many benefit from the empathetic and nonjudgemental support of a trained professional. I provide individual, couples, and family therapy for those seeking to increase self-awareness, insight into one’s patterns both with ourselves and with others. My private practice is devoted to helping you connect to your truth and deeper knowledge of yourself; build stronger relational bonds and improve communication challenges; and overcome crisis- awakening the warrior within you.  While I enjoy working on a wide range of issues such as depression, anxiety, relationship issues- I am particularly focused on helping people process and heal from trauma, performance related issues, invalidation, and abuse. I specialize in Brainspotting, Trauma- Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, and Cognitive Processing Therapy. I provide a complementary phone consultation before setting up our initial session as deciding on a therapist can be difficult for many reasons. I know how important it is to feel safe and supported in order to foster growth in oneself.  My intention as a therapist is to provide a calm, safe and empathetic space to support you on your path to deeper healing.

name: Jamie H Duddy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: My approach to therapy is a very individual one.  Each person begins therapy in a different place and is unique in how they go through their process.  While respecting individuality, I will help you identify the problems, explore patterns of behavior and clarify destructive thought patterns.  I encourage growth and introspection with my clients; however I will continually respect the pace that you need to develop at.  I provide a safe and professional environment as well as a genuine concern for what issues you are addressing.  I also provide custody mediation, co-parent counseling, child custody evaluations and parent coordination. I specialize in insight oriented work to make long term changes, enhance yourself as a person as well as your relationships.  I help couples who are no longer able to stay together, but need to work together to raise their children.  I provide parenting plan development, mediation, custody evaluations and guidance through the divorce process.

name: Sue Kessner
title: Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor, MS, LPCC
about: Welcome to Serenity Psychotherapy. Feeling Stressed? Overwhelmed by Challenges in your Life? Living life on life's terms is not always easy. The stresses of daily living often encroach on our happiness and serenity. Learning to have a solution focused and positive perspective on life's challenges through psychotherapy can change your life. If you're looking for extra support and guidance for you or your children, or you're ready to move in a new direction in your life, I can help you to free up your life! My treatment parameters are broad based.  I specialize in working with children and adolescents, ages 5 to 18, as well as adults.  I am adept at working with many different child behavioral issues, from ADHD to anxiety.  My adult specialties are addiction issues and life transitions. Please call or email me for a free consultation.

name: Stacy Bonds
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I am a licensed clinical psychologist who specializes in delivering evidence-based treatment to individuals throughout all stages of their lives. I have a warm and compassionate approach to therapy, which encourages active collaboration. I have a passion for walking alongside people in the midst of struggle. When you come to therapy, it's like you are trying to climb a mountain. I am not at the top of your mountain but, rather, am on another mountain, offering a different perspective, pointing out potential dangers, and helping you find the most effective path along your journey. I value working with clients facing all kinds of difficulties, but specialize in working with PTSD, anxiety, depression, body acceptance, relationship difficulties, Veterans, sexuality and gender issues. I earned my PhD from the University of North Texas. My work is grounded in Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT), and I have advanced specializations in Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, Cognitive Processing Therapy for PTSD, and Emotionally Focused Couple Therapy.

name: Dell Celestial
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: It is my belief that counseling is not just for the "sick" or "broken" but also for the courageous individuals who are committed to taking the necessary steps to improve their lives mentally, physically, and spiritually. I’m happy to assist and provide guidance on how to navigate through the mental barriers that restrict you from achieving balance and wellness in your life.   As a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), I have 20 years of experience working with individuals with depression, anxiety, PTSD, and addiction/recovering issues. My area of expertise is supporting individuals throughout the stages of life that may cause feelings of imbalance, chaos, and vulnerability. I utilize treatment modalities such as Solution Focus Therapy, Motivational Interviewing, and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy. I have a holistic approach to working with clients and cater to each individual's unique needs. I provide a therapeutic environment that is safe, supportive, and nonjudgemental so people can express themselves and navigate through internal conflict and daily problems. I integrate these tools in order to meet your particular needs and to achieve wellness and balance in your life.  Please feel free to reach out to me. I look forward to working with you.

name: Blanca Monique Sevilla
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Often in our journey through life, we become lost and confused. Not just on our path in life but about who we truly are as well. My goal is to help you explore, understand, and develop your self-identity. I will be your companion through discovering who you are as an individual, including gender and sexual identity. Additionally, I aim to empower you - helping you overcome depression, anxiety, LGBTQIA+ concerns, abuse, grief, crisis, and many other challenges. I  am client-centered, trauma-informed, and strengths based, which means I believe in using one's strengths, interests, and passion to help in their path of self-discovery and achieving their goals. I also draw from Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT), and Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT).  I provide mental health services in English and Spanish. Whether you are seeking help for day-to-day issues or deep rooted emotional issues, I am here to empower and guide you in achieving your goals.

name: Chantal Daley
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, AMFT
about: Do you find yourself having a difficult time coping with anxiety, depression, and trauma? Do you have a hard time communicating and setting boundaries with others? Life is full of obstacles and hardships that may be difficult to overcome without the right tools, resources, and, guidance leading to the manifestation of these symptoms. I specialize in working with adults, couples, and adolescents using a Psychodynamic approach to explore unconscious thoughts and behaviors. In doing this, we are able to collaboratively recognize old ineffective patterns and process unresolved feelings and trauma. I also specialize in ACT and CBT. Changes and transitions can be challenging, causing difficulties with coping. I can assist you with exploring difficult emotions while living in the present moment in an effort to reach your goals. As a result,you will feel empowered and inspired to create your own path. Childhood trauma and tumultuous relationships early in life have the ability to affect your interpersonal relationships as an adult. Understanding these connections and examining toxic relationship patterns is necessary. If you would like to process your trauma and learn to create healthy, stable relationships, please schedule your free consultation.

It first starts with self-growth, development, and to apply the life skills that are right for you. name: Center for Creative Growth
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Feel flawed or different from others? Find yourself in unsatisfying relationships? Judge yourself harshly or fear criticism from others? Sacrifice your own needs to meet the needs of others? Ready to make changes? Plain and simple, I get results. In this 20-Week Group Program, I help you heal the painful legacies of growing up in a family where there was emotional, verbal, physical, or sexual abuse, neglect,  abandonment, or addiction. Based on the internationally acclaimed work of John Bradshaw, this group helps you develop healthy, intimate relationships, restores your self-esteem, and frees your ability to create and achieve. I use powerful techniques proven to heal toxic shame, childhood wounds, and feelings of inadequacy and self-doubt. In this safe group, I guide you to recover your inner child and authentic self. As a result, you create relationships where truth is spoken, feelings are expressed, and trust exists. I help you release painful relationships with parents, partners, and others and teach you to establish healthy boundaries, allowing you to create connection with yourself and intimacy with others. Unblock your creativity and spontaneity and experience your spirituality. See what graduates say about this program: creativegrowth.com/20-week-intensive/

name: Michael Gregory Mann
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I work primarily with men, teens, and their families. Those I work with often feel stuck in some way, whether that is stuck in a job, or in depression, or with anxiety, or negative patterns in relationships. It is a privilege to walk alongside those who come into my office, to learn their stories, their strengths, and their struggles, and to give them a safe place to learn about themselves and move toward growth and thriving. I take the experience I have working with people from a wide range of backgrounds and challenges both in mental health and in education, an awareness of power dynamics and inequalities, my training in CBT, and my current interest in mindfulness to create a safe place where you can feel empowered to both gain insight into yourself and move toward change. The challenges and difficulties of life can be opportunities for growth. Feel free to visit my website and contact me to schedule a free consultation to discover if therapy would be helpful and if I am a good fit for you. I am patient, calm, and I enjoy laughter and a good conversation. I truly enjoy meeting with my clients and look forward to meeting you.

name: Toni Ratzburg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I believe children and teens can learn, grow, and thrive when they have coping skills, feel empowered, and practice self-care. My goal is to encourage youth to learn who they are and how to advocate for their unique needs. I specialize in working with neurodiverse, gifted and twice-exceptional (2e) youth and their families. I encourage youth to use their strengths and interests in order to grow, heal, and cope. Building self-awareness, such as understanding their own sensory processing and asynchronous development, is an important part of my work with youth. I am passionate about supporting families and communities. I have consulted at public and private schools and have been in private practice for over a decade. When possible, I love to use play, sensory based experiences, and art in my work. I believe that therapy is most successful when a trusting relationship has been built between the client and myself. In addition, I feel it is vital that parents can also trust me as we partner together to support their child/teen. I aim to help facilitate healthy communication between children and parents. Please contact me for a free consultation.

name: Lowell Winer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, MBA
about: I’m a therapist, cancer survivor, and former tech industry executive. My practice focuses on adults, couples, and teens. In working with me, you’ll experience a mix of warmth, depth, challenge, and, most of all, dedication to the healing and growth you're seeking. My integrative approach balances relational psychodynamic therapy, solution focus, somatics (Mind-body), and mindfulness. Our work together might include demystifying difficult emotions, processing trauma, improving self-esteem, coping with change, strengthening relationships, increasing motivation, or exploring the many layers of health challenges. My clients are diverse, and I’m an ally to all. Male clients value my comradery in exploring what it means to be both strong & vulnerable. Female clients appreciate the safe, healing connection with a male therapist. I help couples move from conflict towards understanding & intimacy. Teens welcome my authenticity & respect in navigating important choices. The Mind-body aspect of my work helps clients more fully move through emotional difficulty, develop healthier lifestyle, and address the emotional aspect of health challenges ranging from stress-induced chronic pain to cancer... Whatever your struggles are, whether recent or longstanding, I look forward to helping you reach the healing and change you desire.

How about at home and with their family? Has something in their life changed? Maybe they need a little more support at this particular time... Therapy can help.  I work with individuals of all ages, couples, and families. My specialization is working with children & adolescents, which also helps inform the work I do with adults, couples & families.  Many of my clients come in with anxiety, depression, learning, relationship, identity and self-esteem issues, as well as issues around addiction. Certified in EMDR and trained in Brainspotting, AF-EMDR, TRM1 &2 & TF-CBT. I have a MA in Clinical Psychology from Antioch where I specialized in child studies. name: Walter Harold King
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MEd, LMFT
about: Becoming more conscious, more aware of your complexities and psychological barriers provides opportunities for renewal of your life's potentials.   Depth Psychotherapy rests on the premise that there is a natural, self regulating urge of the psyche which seeks its own wholeness. This natural propensity towards wholeness emerges out of the archetypes, universally inherited potentialities that express and maintain all that is uniquely human.    In a Depth Psychotherapy experience, exploration of the unconscious dimensions of one's being promotes access to the creative archetypal potentials which activate authentic healing. My specialty is grounded in a Depth Psychological model of treatment. The Depth therapy process, as an honoring of soul, respects behavior, intellect, body, emotion, dreams, intuition, imagination and fantasy. The therapeutic alliance between client and therapist attends to the spontaneously emerging unconscious energies which enrich the therapeutic process. I have 38 years of clinical experience in private practice. Additional work contributions include: School Psychologist in public schools, drug /alcohol treatment, eating disorders treatment and domestic violence program development. I am presently a Candidate in the Analyst Training Program at the CG Jung Institute of Los Angeles.

name: Andrea D. Schoon
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: When you have tried to resolve issues on your own, and things just aren't changing, it is time to seek professional help. Perhaps your or your significant other's past and unresolved issues are what is creating the distress; an inability to trust, to feel joy and happiness, to pursue dreams. It is important to seek help early on so that things do not worsen. Whether you are seeking marriage counseling, individual therapy, or therapy for your teen, I can help you get on track to a healthier more fulfilling life. SPECIALTIES INCLUDE: *COUPLES COUNSELING *ANXIETY *DEPRESSION *CHILD AND ADOLESCENT ISSUES *SUBSTANCE ABUSE *LOSS/GRIEF *RELATIONSHIP ISSUES *ADJUSTMENT ISSUES *ANGER MANAGEMENT *DIVORCE **I I have spent 22 years providing counseling and psychotherapy in a variety of settings. It is my desire to support individuals, couples, and children, and help them find peace and happiness in their lives. In addition to devoting two decades to the mental health profession, I have a family of my own.

name: Mary Donaldson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MS, AMFT
about: Now accepting new clients - teens, couples, families, and adults. You may know exactly what you want, or you may have no idea what brings you here. All I know is that it feels really good to finally get help, and yet, it can still be hard to accept that you deserve it. Wherever you are in this process, I’ll meet you there. Bring your hopelessness, anger, anxiety, and questions, and we can take a closer look together. With a collaborative and authentic approach, I'll both challenge you and honor your pace. I’m not a fixer, but I will draw from evidence-based and trauma-informed care to help you help yourself. I specialize in relationships - the ones between you and the world, you and others, you and yourself, and even the one between you and me. Research has shown that the best predictor of positive outcomes in therapy is the relationship between therapist and client. With this at the center of our work, my hope is for you to feel safe, supported, and understood. Defining and advocating for your needs in relationships often begins with a conversation, so let's talk! I work with teens, romantic partnerships, families, and adults, and I specialize in relationships and trauma. Schedule a complimentary phone consultation, and I can help you decide if I'm the right therapist for you.

name: Briana Hedman
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: You're ready for a change, but you're not quite sure where to start. What was working before isn't anymore and you don't want to do it alone anymore. You might be seeking counseling because you feel stuck in a relationship, career, or creatively; want to build resiliency and coping; have difficult life changes and transitions; have questions about identity and values; want a better understanding of repeating patterns in your life. You are curious and motivated to understand yourself and you're ready to learn new ways of coping with life's challenges. My approach is based on your concerns, needs, and perspectives. This may include helping you identify and change unhelpful thinking patterns and behaviors, learn coping skills, build awareness about interpersonal relationships, and increase self-acceptance. Maybe you never imagined that you'd be seeking therapy, but we all get stuck or overwhelmed sometimes. Knowing what isn't working often isn't enough to actually make a change. You want someone else to be there with a new perspective, accountability, and support. Let's start a conversation and we can see if I'm the right fit for you.

name: Dr. Edward Ramos

about: Are you feeling sad? distressed? overwhelmed? hurt ? betrayed? You are not alone. Let me help you. It takes courage to reach out for help and you are brave for taking this courageous step. It's certainly not easy, but there is hope. Lets go together to God to find love & healing. True healing begins when the pain is addressed where you can start your healing process. I bring a compassionate, collaborative, non-judgmental, strength based approach to marriage and family counseling to restore your relationships. As a Christian Counselor I utilize the Bible, prayer, effective curriculum, personal and professional experience to help you. My specialties are counseling in the areas of Marriage and family relationship conflict, Infidelity & pre-marital. Licensed Christian Marriage and Family Counselor, Temperament Therapist by the usaccca in Florida. As a minister & Certified Clinical Christian Counselor. I have a doctorate degree in Christian Counseling.(Fluent English, Spanish and Portuguese) I would love to utilize my 15 years of experience helping people just like you to walk with you in your journey towards peace, joy and love within yourself and with your loved ones. Call me today to get a relationship /marriage self assessment at no charge! Let me develop a unique Marriage counseling path tailored to your needs.

name: Cayla Christensen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I’m so glad you’re here! Searching for a therapist who is a good fit for you is the first step on a journey towards growth and self-compassion. I would be honored to support you on this journey. As a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, I work with adults, teens, children, and families. I have experience supporting clients through a variety of challenges, including anxiety, low mood, grief/loss, anger, interpersonal conflicts, major life transitions, and personal growth. My style of therapy is supportive, collaborative, and strengths-based. Using an integrative approach, with an emphasis in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and Solution-Focused Therapy, I can help you explore how your thoughts, emotions, and behaviors interact with each other. Together, we can decide on action plans to help you feel better and move forward. I work for a non-profit organization called HearYou that provides confidential, affordable, and timely access to mental health services. To get started, you can reach out to me directly or visit our website at HearYou.org.

name: Kristine Karaca
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: The decision to pursue therapy is often not an easy one.  However, in working with a therapist, most people find a sense of relief that comes with learning that change is possible. Whether your concerns are long-standing patterns or new adjustments, through collaborative exploration within a therapeutic relationship, new ways of relating and coping can develop. I bring compassion and experience while treating a wide range of issues in individual therapy.  I specialize in working with young adults and college students, parents, individuals in the perinatal period, and those who are experiencing life transitions, or have a history of trauma. I have worked as a mental health counselor in a variety of settings since 1999,  including college counseling centers, outpatient clinics, and school-based programs. name: Mark Santarelli
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about: Feel on the outside? Difficulty connecting? Feeling Isolated? Have problems that keep repeating? Longing for meaningful work? Looking for a relationship? Let's make a safe space - an analytic laboratory - to discover, understand, take risks and grow. Rage is unprocessed sadness waiting to be thought about. You can - talk, understand and move through those rough patches. If it happened outside in the world it can happen in our therapy laboratory too. Our laboratory is the place where you practice trying out some.thing challenging and new Then take your accomplishments on the road! Your creative potential is waiting to be realized! Psychoanalytic therapy is: being curious, listening for deeper meanings, seeing how the past effects the present, taking risks, finding patterns, discovering your true self, making connections, thinking about emotions, exploring your dreams, understand your deeper self. The psyche is like an iceberg 1/10 above in consciousness and 9/10 in the unconscious. We repeat what we don't understand. A thread links the adult back to childhood. Rage is unprocessed sadness. Trauma is an experience we can't learn from. We grow in relationships (not in isolation). Make a safe haven to let down the sword and shield and take risks. Put away the microscope and bring out the mirror! If it's hysterical its historical!

name: Georgette Vojdani
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about:
Traumatic events causes one to develop negative beliefs about oneself or the world. These experiences become fixed in the body-mind in form of negative emotions causing anger, depression, nightmares, intrusive thoughts, panic, anxiety, phobias, shame, low self-esteem which can create difficulties with your relationships at home and  at work. I use EMDR to heal the deep wounds of traumatic childhood events which are the source that one may believe that he/she is not a good enough person, not loveable, does not deserve to be loved or trusted. Negative self beliefs and negative emotions effects our body and mind causing physical and emotional distress. My specialty is Trauma and PTSD. I see clients who are the adult children of dysfunctional families. Clients who experienced neglect, emotional abuse, sexual abuse or other sudden and traumatic events and as adults are suffering from anxiety, depression, phobia, insomnia, anger, drug addiction and relational issues are able to heal by processing these past traumatic events. Psychotherapy coupled with EMDR helps put the past in the past. I help clients  resolve their life traumas
by using traditional psycotherapy coupled with EMDR, guided imagery, and Hypnosis.

about: The first step is always the hardest. But it indicates that you’ve acknowledged your need to change something. The second step is no piece of cake either because change is risky and risk produces anxiety. If you’re determined to take the third step give me a call. I just might be the guide you’re looking for…and I promise I’ll help you through that second step ;)
