name: Berenice D Rosillo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: When things become hard, confusing, or emotionally painful, we can all use some help. I offer that for you and your family. I provide psychotherapy for individuals that have experienced trauma or may benefit from guidance in understanding their feelings, emotions and how they affect their lives. I also provide assistance during life transitions such as breakups, divorce, professional development, pre-marital counseling, and when encountering an overall need to make significant life changes. * I am a trained EMDR Therapist. Our services include: Psychological Evaluations for immigration purposes, certificates/letters for emotional support animals (if eligible) and counseling services for individuals that experience anxiety, depression, trauma, relationship conflict, work-related stress, low self-esteem and other psychological disorders. I firmly believe that we all have the inner strength and ability to cope with life challenges by ourselves. It has been and will always be within us. I also believe that the journey to self-discovery can be easier if shared with someone that understands the process. Allow me to walk this part of your life journey with you. You do not have to do this alone. Cuando las cosas se ponen difíciles, confusas o emocionalmente dolorosas, algo de ayuda siempre es bienvenida. Le ofrecemos eso a usted y a su familia. Proveemos psicoterapia a personas que han sufrido traumas o a aquellos que podrían beneficiarse de obtener ayuda para entender sus sentimientos y emociones y como estas afectan sus vidas. Ofrecemos ayuda durante etapas de transición como rompimientos, divorcio, desarrollo profesional, consejería premarital, y cuando hay una necesidad plena de hacer cambios significativos en la vida. - Ofrezco terapia EMDR (Desensibilización y Reprocesamiento por los Movimientos Oculares). Nuestros servicios incluyen: Evaluaciones psicológicas para asuntos de inmigración, certificados para mascotas de apoyo emocional, para mantener en apartamentos donde no se aceptan mascotas (si es elegible), y psicoterapia para ayudar a disminuir depresión, ansiedad, procesar traumas/abuso del pasado, relaciones conflictivas, baja autoestima, entre otros. Yo creo firmemente que cada ser humano tiene la fortaleza interna y habilidad innata para afrontar retos que trae la vida. Es un poco más fácil redescubrir esa fortaleza con guía y ayuda profesional. Permítame caminar esta parte de su jornada de vida con usted, no tiene que hacerlo solo(a).

name: Lori Yve Sunkin
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: I've been in private practice for over twenty four years. I believe therapy is mostly about the relationship between the therapist and client. I feel change happens when a person finally feels safe enough to express their deepest fears and dreams, their childhood experiences and current struggles. I try to provide a comfortable environment for my clients so that they can be free to be authentic. My practice is very diverse. I see individuals, couples and young adults. My office hours are Monday through Friday 7:30am-4pm. I also run women's groups.  I feel grateful to have a job that I love.

name: Claudia Filler
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MSEd, MFT
about: Welcome to my practice! Whether you are feeling stuck, or anxious, overwhelmed, depressed or in despair: I am a seasoned therapist with a practice designed to help you develop the skills you need to face life's challenges and the resilience and strength to prepare you to embrace a new path. I recognize and respect that it takes courage to make the first move towards changing your life for the better. I shall be with you every step of the way to support and guide you on your personal journey. I have a particular focus in working with those who find life a lonely and scary experience and who find it difficult to form lasting and meaningful relationships. Some people who are challenged in this way have survived a variety of traumatic experiences. To address this, I have training in several areas of trauma therapy. Another area of interest is supporting and guiding caretakers in creating boundaries to avoid burnout and be more effective, with relatives, friends or clients. I work with individuals and couples (straight, LGBTQ). Please call to ask any questions about my approach and how I may be of help to you.

name: Kate Small
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Throughout my experience, I have learned that healing is a process. Thus, I believe in being an engaged therapist who is dedicated to providing growth and healing. I have a true passion and heart for the work that I do and care deeply for all individuals that I work with. I believe in cultivating a safe, open and non-judgmental environment in order for individuals to feel comfortable expressing themselves in order to work through difficult issues. Likewise, I am dedicated to working with children, adolescents, and adults who are experiencing issues like depression, anxiety, relationship issues, childhood abuse, and PTSD. My approach to therapy is collaborative, empathic, and unique. I have been trained in eye movement desensitization reprocessing therapy (EMDR) and implement this tool when needed. When working with children, I utilize play therapy while incorporating other important aspects from different methods of therapy. As well, I am trained in PrepareEnrich. I truly believe that everyone deserves to uncover the parts of self that have been stifled by the various stressors and challenges of life. My desire is to empower my clients to begin to build the life they truly wish for and envision. I am so happy you are here and beginning your journey to healing. Reach out to set up a free phone consultation!
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Behavioral Issues', 'Coping Skills', 'Depression', 'Family Conflict', 'Grief', 'Parenting', 'Peer Relationships', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress', 'Trauma and PTSD', "Women's Issues"]

name: Lisa Menaker Quinn
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Are you struggling in your relationships?  Constantly feeling anxious or depressed? Do you wake up in the middle of the night with a feeling that something is "wrong" or missing in your life? I believe that each of us can live richer, more satisfying lives when we examine how past circumstances and experiences are causing current  difficulties and preventing us from more joyous living. Although problems may have historical roots, I believe in the importance of tending to current pain and struggles with an eye toward  their origin. In today's fast-paced world, I see therapy be a sacred time for discovery and clarity. I am committed to working with clients to discover better ways of thinking and acting so that you can experience a more meaningful and harmonious life and relationships and more inner peace and wellbeing. My fondest wish is for clients to feel a lifting of burdens in order to live better, play better and love better! I work to create a therapeutic environment of warmth, caring, respect and trust. Together, we will explore your emotional, intellectual and spiritual dimensions in an effort to create lasting solutions and relationships. My goal is to make each session a time of further understanding and increased clarity.

name: Peggy D Snyder
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Welcome to my psychotherapy practice. I give my clients the tools to manage stress associated with various life situations: relationships, work, parenting, family issues, illness, personal growth and fulfillment. My client and I form an alliance to identify goals and develop a plan to attain those goals. I am trained in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Clinical Hypnosis, Individual Psychotherapy and Couples Therapy. I specialize in short-term, goal-oriented psychotherapy. I have 35 years of experience providing psychotherapy services to clients of all ages.

name: Quincy L Wilkins
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT, LPCC
about: Life isn't always easy. Whether you're dealing with an existing challenge, a current stressful situation, or you're turning a page to start a new chapter of your life, I believe we all can benefit from someone helping us to manage these changes and transitions. My therapeutic goal is to help you better manage your life's challenges and to provide you with tools and strategies to achieve your personal goals. I use a variety of therapeutic approaches based on what is best for each individual client's situation & work with an awareness & sensitivity toward gender, ethnic/cultural backgrounds & all of those factors that make up your authentic self. Together, we can work towards making your life or situation more manageable. I am also available to provide tele-health (online) therapy to individuals and couples.

name: Angela Sitka
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Today was another day of endless decisions, hard conversations, and feeling like you failed again. Filing for divorce was just the beginning of it. Deep down you are enraged and sad that things are ending, but you are also exhausted from all the years of trying. There is so much to figure out, where to live, how to do holidays, custody issues, and more. You are worried about making the right decisions that will impact both you and your children moving forward. You know you need to do something to change this, so that you don't bring your children down with you. This marriage is ending, but your life isn’t. My name is Angela, a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist in Santa Rosa. I help women navigating divorce who are emotionally exhausted, overwhelmed, and full of self-doubt find a clear vision for their new future. What does that look like? Success in your career, co-parenting like a pro, energized by your passions, and even feeling good in your body again. I help you begin building a new life that you can feel proud of! Even the messy, difficult stuff like co-parenting. We work together to manage your negative self-talk, make decisions about your new life with confidence and what your brain and body needs to function best in your busy and demanding life. Visit my website to book a free phone consult.

This space eventually will lead you and your child to reorganize feelings, thoughts and behaviors. Understanding and awareness will give birth to change.  My background and experience includes several theoretical approaches that I use holistically and flexibly based on my clients’ needs.  I use child centered play therapy with children and families, to welcome parents into the world of their child; and psychotherapy with teenagers. I know that everyone is different, and every relationship is unique. Therefore I adapt myself to my clients’ needs, pace and states.

name: I Can Learn
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, PPS, LMFT
about:
You can learn to take control of yourself, your family, and your life!  Positive communication and interpersonal interactions can be yours!  Having worked with children, teens, and families for over 20 years as a teacher and school counselor, I am familiar with the challenges, frustrations, and unique demands  of trying to managing school, work, and family life. I am absolutely passionate about providing a safe and comfortable place to help you achieve your goals.                                                                  A Certified Personal Trainer works with us!  We have quality flexibility, cardio, & strength training equipment, which makes it ideal for my unique Anger Management  Boot Camps. I am a Registered Play Therapist with the Association for Play Therapy. Regardless of age, I have been trained to use the therapeutic powers of play to connect with and help you.  My office is located behind the Palm Desert Post Office off of Cook Street. In addition, we work with a  behavior specialist who currently is a special education trainer on specialized Target Behavioral Management.                        
You can also choose to combine our TBM program with Anger Management Boot Camp for the most "willful"  children or teens.  Our goal is for your family to have peace.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Accepting new clients for in-person sessions as of: 10/25/22                                              Are you worried about your child? Are they struggling with social-emotional or behavioral difficulties? Reaching out for help is the first step. I have experience working with children in both therapeutic and academic settings. I have a relaxed, easygoing demeanor and quickly build rapport with children, as trust is the first step toward building a strong therapeutic relationship. Ultimately, I believe the relationship is what heals and the child intrinsically knows how to and has the capacity to heal. I utilize a depth-oriented, child-centered approach grounded in family systems theory. I also value a holistic approach that connects mind and body specifically through the use of expressive arts, sand tray and play therapy. I embody a sense of encouragement, exploration, and open-mindedness that contribute to successful therapeutic work. I find it rewarding when a child feels understood and supported as their sense of self begins to strengthen. It is honor for me to support a child on their journey toward healing and wholeness, as I believe there is an innate healing capacity within each child.

name: Brian Brown
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Meaningful relationships are an essential part of fulfillment and happiness. I believe in the unique power of the relationship that develops between therapist and client. Through an exploration of this interaction, we can more wholly understand your past and current relationships and help shape future experiences. I work with people who are struggling in a variety of ways and are ready to dig in and do some difficult and deeply powerful work that will lead to greater choice and freedom. I view my opportunity to join individuals in their journey toward self-understanding as a great privilege and find the work exciting and gratifying. I am committed to working with culturally diverse individuals, couples, and families from every walk of life. While much of my experience has been centered on work within the LGBTQ community, I strive to create an open and affirmative space for all. I am particularly effective working with adults, young adults, and adolescents. Through my training at Stanford University and University of Chicago, I feel uniquely capable in addressing issues surrounding identity, work, and school. I provide individual, couple, and family psychotherapy at my office in Hayes Valley.

name: Margot H Parker
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Dr. van der Kolk writes that "Being able to feel safe with other people is probably the single most important aspect of mental health; safe connections are fundamental to meaningful and satisfying lives." My approach to therapy is grounded in this concept. I believe that healing from emotional suffering takes place when the client feels deeply heard and understood. I believe that effective therapy is a collaborative process between client and therapist and that my job is to hold the space for my clients to explore the fears and anxieties that impede their growth and sense of well being. Human beings are social animals. We want to belong. Our brains are wired to connect with others. Social isolation, dissatisfying relationships, out-of-control emotions that drive others away create intense emotional suffering. I help clients grapple with how their problems interfere with their ability to connect with others. During this pandemic, I wish to support individuals who are suffering from anxiety with free 20-minute sessions. I specialize in life transitions such as adolescent to young adult, single to partnered, empty nesters, work to retirement and loss of many kinds. My passion is collaborating with my clients to create a life of connection, fulfillment and joy.

name: Nanyonjo Camacho Mukungu
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: My framework as a psychotherapist is inspired by black feminist sci-fi writer, Octavia E. Butler who saw the possibility of many more worlds than just our own. I believe that transformative internal healing is critical to envisioning and building these worlds without the presence of imperialism, white supremacy, capitalism and cishet-patriarchy. The tools I use to support the exploration of individual, interpersonal and intergenerational trauma are shaped by abolition that rejects punitive and scarcity mindsets and disability justice which strives to value every body. Specifically, I offer the use of techniques like Hakomi, dialectical behavioral therapy (DBT), attachment theory, creative expressions like art and music, developing mindfulness skills like breathework, somatic awareness and astrology informed tarot & oracle readings. Ultimately, I hope to collaboratively deepen your understanding of self and your relationships with others.

name: Patricia Richmond
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about: I am a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist who uses humor and compassion when providing the support, understanding and empathy necessary to help you with anxiety, depression or grief and loss. You are feeling a loss of control. You may have experienced a sudden transition or life change. COVID-19 has made you uneasy and uncertain. Your fear or anxiety are emotions I can help you master. Our goal together will be to assist you in obtaining the personal insight, strength and skills to find peace. Call me for a free 15 minute phone consultation where I can help you find the next step to the life you really want.  Anxiety, depression, communication concerns or , living with a cancer diagnosis are areas in which I specialize. I use a variety of different treatment methods to best serve each individual situation. My treatment modalities include Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Positive Psychology, Solution Focused Therapy, Narrative, Psychodynamic and Mindfulness.  My clients have described me as warm, empathic, authentic and non-judgemental. My office is a safe and relaxed space for us to engage in conversations of meaning. The goal of counseling is to help you feel that these unexpected life events can be resolved by proactive methods. I think of myself as a supportive guide who can assist you to be your true self.

name: Jackie Mullis
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Therapy can be a place to reclaim your life and sense of self in order to thrive. When life gets difficult it’s easy to end up feeling lost, overwhelmed, anxious, or depressed. In times like this, building our mental health is an important part of reclaiming ourselves and our lives. As a licensed marriage and family therapist, I want to create a collaborative environment that supports your unique path towards personal well-being. I am experienced in a wide variety of therapy models including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, humanistic, strength-based, trauma-informed, and solution-focused styles. name: Lorine Estelle Bay
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT, EXA
about: Are you interested in discovering how you could be using the scientific evidence that is now available that neuroplasticity and creating new neuropathways can make it possible to eliminate mental and even physical chronic disease conditions, allowing you to overcome obstacles like anxiety, depression, low self-esteem and childhood adversity, self-hatred, shame, and trauma?” Reading scientific studies of spontaneous remissions, placebos, epigenetics, quantum physics, and neurotransmitters as well as stories of ascetic masters and yogis able to devote their entire lives to spiritual pursuits often fail to provide a clear answer. Are you interested in discovering how you could be using the scientific evidence that is now available that neuroplasticity and creating new neuropathways can make it possible to eliminate mental and even physical chronic disease conditions, allowing you to overcome obstacles like anxiety, depression, low self-esteem, childhood adversity and self-hatred. You don't have to do it alone! We can use psychotherapy for your self-exploration, to notice and identify where your attention goes throughout your day.   You will determine what feelings, thoughts and behaviors you want to change.  We can use imagination to exit the well-worn neuropathways.  We can use play and sand tray for active imagination work.

name: Nefertiti DeSilva

about: I am a licensed therapist that understands the courage it takes to make the first step towards change. I take pride in supporting individuals on their journey toward wellness through a non-judgmental, compassionate and collaborative approach. I have over ten years of experience working with adolescents and adults. name: Karyn M Jones
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: You may be just starting to think about trying therapy, but you're hesitant. Maybe you're wondering if anyone will  understand you, or if you will feel judged. Whatever your anxieties may be, the important thing is that you are struggling with something. You've tried handling it by yourself, but it's getting harder to keep doing it alone. Probably your work and relationships are affected, just adding to your stress. Asking for help takes enormous courage, and I would consider it a privilege to walk alongside you on your path to healing and growth. While I work with diverse clients, I have special experience and training working with clients who struggle with the long term effects of childhood abuse, sexual assault, and those who are grieving a loss.  These wounds often run deep, and I love to see the freedom that comes from healing. It seems that so much of our pain comes from some of our most significant relationships.   I also believe that we are fundamentally meant for relationship and only find true healing through meaningful connection with another. That is the essence of therapy to me. Healing through connectedness.

It enables individuals to learn how to coexist with everything that makes that individual the best they can be. The key to living a stress-free life is to develop patterns of behavior where each day contains meaningful and enjoyable activities that help you feel fulfilled. Our life guides will help you identify your values and create a plan to build the life you deserve. Our extensive knowledge helps us form this new version of you that can tackle challenges that may come your way. We stand by you and work with what is in front us. The answers to our questions are sometimes right in front of us, not hidden in riddles. It just takes a little nudge to find them.

name: Gayle Henry
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Welcome! Finding the right therapist can be a difficult, but rewarding process. My hope is that you find just the right fit to meet your needs. Appreciating the range of individuality of each person, I start where you are at using a titrated, supportive therapeutic approach. I am an LCSW and Somatic Experiencing® Practitioner. I specialize in the treatment of PTSD, Anxiety, Depression, Addiction Problems, Grief/Loss, Chronic Pain, Self-Esteem, and Relationship Stress. I have over 20 years of experience in a clinical setting. I ran an Opiate Dependent Program, as well as gained experience as the primary therapist in a Chronic Pain program before transitioning to underlying issues of trauma held in the physiology. I have spent the past 5 years working in a PTSD & Trauma Recovery (IOP) Program. After spending a vast amount of time in traditional psychotherapy approaches alone, I moved into an integrative healing approach to the treatment of trauma and addiction. I studied at SETI Institute and obtained my Somatic Experiencing® Practitioner certification in 2018. If you are interested in therapy please reach out to learn more about my approach.
issues: ['Chronic Illness', 'Chronic Pain', 'Depression', 'Grief', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem']

name: Patience Taba
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Are you feeling depressed? Unsure of how to manage your anxiety, or maybe even your child's depression or anxiety? Hello, my name is Patience Taba, and providing therapy and being dedicated to assisting individuals on their journey to mental health wellness has been my life's passion.  I offer therapy in a kind, respectful environment that allows the client to discover their feelings, their passions and the direction of their life.  Through therapy, I hope to assist each client on their journey toward creating the life of their heart's desire. My experience includes individual, couple & group work with children, adults, couples & families with issues related to individual growth, relationships, life transitions, grief/loss, anxiety, depression, trauma, abuse, codependency, anger, infertility, adoption issues and parenting. I want to support each client in identifying & accessing their life given coping skills, gifts & talents they already have within them. I have 10 years in adoptions and in working with adopted children, birth parents,adopting parents and infertility.  I also specialize in Sandplay therapy, dream work and cognitive behavioral family therapy.

name: Bonnie Fagan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: If you are feeling stuck in your relationship, career, family role, or struggling with a life transition and are unsure of how to move forward, I can help. My goal is to provide a safe, non-judgmental environment where we can work together to explore your emotions, experiences, and challenges and help you on your journey toward finding personal fulfillment. I use a person centered approach where I integrate Strengths Based, Mindfulness, and CBT techniques that are tailored to your specific needs. I have experience working with individuals and families from a range of backgrounds having trouble adjusting to challenges. I specialize in helping individuals manage life & relationship challenges, working with trauma survivors to overcome experiences, helping children and teens with emotional struggles, addressing issues related to maternal wellness, anxiety, depression, stress, life transitions, self-esteem, and coaching parents on managing difficult behaviors in children. I also enjoy working with college students and young adults as they navigate their journeys in relationships and finding their place in their careers. I work with children, adolescents, and adults and utilize both in person and online formats in order to best meet your needs.       +LIMITED daytime (11am-2pm) appointment available+

name: Kimberly Resnick Anderson
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, AASECT
about: Everyone has a 'sexual story.' Our culture has a love-hate relationship with sex and sends many mixed messages. I help people explore the legacy of their sexual story and identify the biological, social and psychological barriers to sexual health and satisfaction. I am an AASECT Certified Sex Therapist and Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at UCLA School of Medicine with 30 years of clinical and teaching experience. I developed my own model of talking to clients about sex ("Comfort-Inducing Sexuality Dialogue") that is both comforting and profoundly liberating. I have special interest in the impact of chronic illness on sexual function and satisfaction. I've also treated thousands of individuals with varied sexual lifestyles including LGBT, Polyamory and BDSM clients. I am a long-time champion of depathologizing marginalized sexual populations. Acceptance and tolerance inform my clinical work. I am kink-friendly. I was a featured expert/consultant for TLC's "Strange Sex" series. I am also a Sex Ed Expert/Consultant for PonHub. I enjoy speaking at sexual medicine conferences around the world. I offer online sex coaching and teletherapy to my national and international clientele. I contribute to Cosmo.com, CNN.com, Playboy.com and other national publications.

name: Judit Colbert
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Hi, Judit here! I specialize in treating trauma, substance use, eating disorders and relationship issues. If you are in need of emotional support, please reach out: there is always a new tomorrow - are you ready? Have you ever looked at patterns in you life? Do themes seem to repeat themselves? We can learn a lot about who we are if we look at how we show up in our relationships and how we navigate through important life events. Let's take a look at the different parts of you who make you who you are! I am a Therapist, a Mother, a Partner and an Advocate. I see you and I hear you. When working together, we will follow a pace you are comfortable with. I look forward to hearing from you!

name: Emily Jacobs
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: I offer a nonjudgmental space where you can be both supported and encouraged to lean into the discomfort. I provide space to process feelings and thoughts and practical interventions for lasting positive life changes such as mindfulness, somatic exercises, and cognitive/behavioral interventions. My approach is open, inquisitive and collaborative. I follow my natural curiosity to pose thoughtful questions and empower you to create a strong foundation for growth and change. I take an eclectic approach based on what is best suited for you and your needs. My work is rooted in psychodynamic theory or understanding how our unconscious thoughts are shaping our current behavior, emotions, and conscious thoughts. I pull from DBT, CBT, and narrative therapy when direct, tangible skills are needed. I am a firm believer in the importance of the relational aspect between therapist and client and I look forward to connecting with you. Call or email me to book a free 20 minute consultation and get started today.

name: Justin Leonti
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: You’re fumbling, feeling clunky, lost in transition, and searching for what you know in your BONES is true. You’ve been told you’re too much, too scattered, and too picky, when in reality, other people just can’t keep up with your pursuit toward the truth you know is out there. I can keep up. Together we will explore and unfold acceptance around ALL parts of you, especially the most challenging ones. What you’re searching for is out there. Let's take steps toward the truth that is waiting for you to begin on your journey. My work focuses on transitions, truth seeking, and what is too intense for most. I am young, energetic, weird, music loving, and poly friendly. As spiritual beings having a human experience, I work with myth, image, and specialize in psychedelic integration. As plants naturally turn toward the Sun, your body and psyche will naturally turn toward healing. Together I will support you in uncovering your potential to naturally turn toward healing and growth. We will extend your roots up and down so that you will be grounded from above and below on your journey. The parts of you holding the most intensity have the key, let’s go together where no one else is willing to go with you.

name: Anissa Bell
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: CURRENTLY OFFERING ONLINE THERAPY ONLY:  You want to understand more about yourself and the struggles interfering with having the life you desire. You are feeling overwhelmed by stress and anxiety, looking for guidance to provide relief. You're tired of managing this on your own, or with support that hasn't been quite the right fit for your needs. My goal is to help you understand and manage your anxiety, stress, insomnia, relationship stress, mood changes (or all of these), so that you can thrive. You are here because you are ready! Let's discuss your goals so we can take proactive steps together towards positive change. Maintaining mental health requires conscious effort and investment, similar to maintaining physical health. You may be more reluctant to tend to your mental health needs. Treating both the mind and body is an integral part of overall wellbeing, so give yourself permission to take good care of yourself and seek support through therapy. All sessions are currently online. This means starting therapy right now is very easy and convenient. I invite you to schedule an initial consultation to discuss your goals and find out more about how I can help. I’m excited to connect with you!  Out of network with insurance, but I will provide documentation for possible reimbursement.

name: Rebecca Bernstein
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, ASW
about: You wake up each morning feeling stuck and alone. Perhaps you know what is causing these feelings or maybe it feels like they came out of nowhere.  Either way, these feelings overwhelm you and you’re just not sure what to do about it anymore. You notice that your relationships, work and even your ability to care for yourself are starting to be affected. You make plans to work out or make a positive change, but quickly give up because you just don’t have the energy. You are starting to lose hope that you can get yourself out of this. But the good news is there is hope.  You don’t need to sit with these feelings alone. While you are the expert on your life, it can help to have a supportive therapist to help you put all the pieces back together. I integrate aspects of Brainspotting, ACT, CBT, narrative, psychodynamic, existential and mindfulness to individualize each client's care. Rediscover your value and worth. We will work together to achieve your mental health goals and overcome the struggles you are facing. We will focus on you as a WHOLE person and work towards exploration, empowerment, and actualization. Find peace and begin your journey to the life you desire. Call me today to schedule a free 15-minute consultation.

name: Monika Martynska
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Congratulations for taking a step towards creating change. Finding a therapist can be challenging and it is important to find one who is right for you. I offer a free introductory session which we use to get to know each other. Clients often come into my office feeling hopeless or nervous, but usually leave feeling more hopeful and relaxed. I love to see people grow and thrive with the support of therapy. My style is warm, empathic, and collaborative. In our work together we draw on your strengths and wisdom and my goal is to empower you to create  a more joyful and fulfilling life. I have helped people change negative patterns, heal trauma, anxiety, depression, and repair relationships. I work with individuals, couples, families and groups. In addition to psychotherapy my background includes meditation, nutrition and weight loss. I have ongoing groups focusing on chronic illness, stress reduction, and anxiety. Please ask if interested. Using Attachment-based therapy, Hakomi (mindfulness -based somatic therapy), Gestalt,  Brainspotting, DBT, Non-Violent Communication, Positive Psychology and other techniques, I tailor the session to your specific needs. I am currently not  accepting insurance, but I can offer you a superbill to submit to your insurance company for reimbursement.

name: Healing Arts Center
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: My ideal clients are adult victims of the repercussions of childhood trauma, war veterans, work stress issues,  end of life, relational problems. I work especially well with men in retirement and those caught in the fight/ flight/ freeze response that shuts down their limbic system resulting in physical illness, anger/ dispare, dysfunctional memories, insomnia, dissociation and gross negative thinking. I focus particularly on working with men of all ages. Those  who get caught in male stereotypes hide their pain and hurt resulting in loneliness, addiction especially  men experiencing allenation from families, work in later life. In my practice I bring mind body humanistic  approach to healing emotional trauma and pain. I find that Self Relational Therapy, EMDR and Mindfulness are excellent methods for integrating the mind body split and overcoming trauma. We can  "transend and include " our pain through a skillfully sponsored human presence. I work with individuals, couples and groups. Was first  licienced in 1982. I work with people to embody a unitifed way to receive life's challenges creatively with self other compassion and deeper understanding. A core principle that "the problem is the solution" the key thou is "under proper conditions".

name: Alison Lynn Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Frustrated with your: relationship? sex life? child? I am trained in 2nd level, Gottman Method, a specialty that started with couples. John Gottman, the author of, "7 Principles of Marriage," is known for predicting divorce with 90% accuracy, has been influential over my career. The Gottman Method has transformed my practice to focusing on couples, parenting, and children. If you're looking for guidance through a challenging situation with your children, partner or anyone else, I look forward to working with you to accomplish your goals. I'm a MFT; licensed for 8 years and have been in private practice for 7 years. I have treated adults, at-risk teens and children. I have experience in helping people in inpatient, partial-hospitalization care, residential treatment, private practice and schools for 13 years. I am the proud founder of Insightful Matters FCP; a group practice in OC. At Insightful Matters, we offer a full range of services including telehealth/teletherapy.t. We are also culturally diverse, being fluent in ASL, Arabic, and Korean. Other specializations include EMDR, John Gottman, EFT, DBT, CBT, Art Therapy, LGBTQ, Eating Disorders, Substance Abuse and several others.

name: Joel M Liebowitz
title: Psychologist, PhD
about:
Joel M. Liebowitz is a Ph.D. in clinical psychology specializing in therapy with individuals, couples , teenagers and children and maintains a private practice in Los Angeles, CA.

With over 45 years experience as a therapist, and as a graduate of University of Massachusetts specializing in psychodynamic therapy as well as CBT therapy he is currently serving as a private practitioner working with a broad spectrum of clients. Among his areas of expertise are therapy with children and teenagers, parent counseling as well as therapy with individuals and couples, including pre-marital and marital counseling. In addition to being a prominent relationship therapist, Dr. Liebowitz has also consulted with  corporations dealing with employee dynamics and work relationships.

Dr. Liebowitz is an interactive, solution-focused therapist. His therapeutic approach is to provide support and practical feedback to help clients effectively address personal life challenges. He integrates complementary methodologies and techniques to offer a highly personalized approach tailored to each client. 

Education

Ph.D. in Clinical Psyclology

License, Certifications & Awards 

CA #PSY3093

name: Charletta Erb
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I love working with couples as well as individuals interested in hike or nature-based therapy. From our very first session you will take home practical tools for both communication and relaxation. In moments of stress, you will have less blaming ways to express what you need to keep things from escalating. For those times when you do lose your cool, you will know more about calming yourself down before saying something you regret. I'll help you learn to be kinder to yourself, to be aware of how you talk to yourself. For starters, don't believe everything you think! I'm a spunky woman with playful humor, someone who understands and who has a lot of compassion. As a relationship therapist, I focus on relationship dynamics and systems in daily life. I will show you insights from brain science about conflicted relationships. A unique feature: I offer nature-based visits with my location just minutes from beach or gardens. Now accepting private pay clients on a sliding scale. Medi-Cal providers available at MapleCounseling.org. Also available for video chat sessions. Begin booking online immediately at www.rootedcircle.com

name: Katie McNamee
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Are you needing more support?  As a therapist, I specialize in working with people seeking recovery from eating disorders and other difficulties related to food and body image.  I also help adolescents, adults, and couples to manage and move through anxiety, depression, and grief.    One of the fantastic things about psychotherapy is that it can give you an opportunity to better understand yourself.  That understanding, with the right support, can create openings for change in your life and relationships.  I can help you in this process.   If you think you may want to work together, please call me for a free phone consultation.  I look forward to connecting with you and answering any questions you have.

name: Selina Jordan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MS
about: Now Accepting New Clients! - - How many therapists does it take to change a lightbulb? Just one, but the lightbulb has to WANT to change.   Hi! My name is Selina Jordan & I'm an Associate Marriage & Family Therapist. Life is so stressful & it can feel like the onslaught is unending. Therapy can be a lifeline. I believe that in the same way that physical trainers come alongside individuals to meet fitness goals, therapists function to support individuals toward mental & emotional wellness. As a therapist, my goal is to make you feel seen & heard right where you are at and supportively come alongside you in where you are trying to go. I aim to provide a warm, non-judgmental, & safe space where you can freely and openly share at your own pace & feel empowered to process & create the change you want to see in your life. The relationships I have with clients are deeply rooted in respect & empathy with a healthy dose of humor & relatability. I would be honored to be trusted with your journey. I have experience working with a wide array of mental & emotional struggles including anxiety, depression, grief, marriage, parenting, bipolar, ADHD, & trauma with clients across the lifespan. I enjoy working with adolescents & adults, with a passion for adult clients with ADHD, holistic wellness, & clients interested in faith-integrated therapy.

name: Michelle Renee Palmer
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Everybody goes through difficult times, and everyone could use a little help! Whether you're feeling "down in the dumps" or feeling stressed out and overwhelmed, or maybe it seems like you're having a hard time connecting with the important people in your life, therapy can be a place to explore what might be stopping you from being your best self.  I work with people who might suffer from depressive and anxious symptoms, people who might have difficulty communicating effectively to others, and people who may feel like their emotions "get the best" of them. I also have experience in working with trauma, and with difficulties in adjusting to phases of life. It's never too late to seek help and gain clarity! Contact me today to see how we might be able to work together.

name: Christina P Appleton
title: Psychologist, PhD
about:
Hello, I am a psychologist, in practice for over 30 years.  I enjoy working with people of all ages.
    People often experience times of stress, depression or anxiety. Relationship problems or concern about  children and teenagers are a source of considerable stress.  I can provide support, teach new ways of coping with these problems and help  you learn new ways of understanding and communicating with those you care about. 
   There are many effective ways to reduce anxiety and depression and improve your relationships.  I look forward to meeting with you and helping you get started. I specialize in helping people with relationship issues, anxiety and depression. I also have a lot of experience in helping those with   Attention Deficit Disorder and Obsessive compulsive Disorder  their families. I am part of a group which includes several psychologists. I also affiliate with several  psychiatrists, who can provide medication if needed.  The office is conveniently located near the I-5 La Paz Exit. You can learn more about me at my website www.orangecountypsychologist.net

name: CBT Treatment Center, A Psychological Corporation
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Seeing your child struggle is such a helpless feeling. You wish you could find the right words that would fix it all, but nothing that you say, and no amount of logic that you use seems to help. Perhaps you have even tried therapy before, with little progress or success, and you're not sure if this is even a fixable problem. Your child's struggles have become the focus of the entire family. You just want your happy little boy or girl back and to have normalcy restored at home. At CBT Treatment Center, we specialize in evidence based treatments for children and adults who suffer with anxiety, depression, OCD, trichotillomania, and other disorders. Our licensed psychologists apply their expertise in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy in a way that is specific to what you or your child are going through. Therapy shouldn't last forever. At CBT Treatment Center, we help you or your child find solutions to the problems that you face, backed by treatments that are empirically supported by research. Please call for a free, 15 minute phone consultation, or visit us at www.cbttreatmentcenter.org.

name: Diana Barrera
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: As a Licensed Clinician Social Worker; I have been working in the mental health field for 30 years. I am Bilingual, Spanish speaking. I have great passion and love for the work that I do. I have worked with children, adults, and the elderly. I have worked with people who are chronically mentally ill as well as with people who struggle with their daily lives. I have provided individual therapy, done some group work, and worked with couples. Life is difficult in and of itself, but when we have issues with depression, anxiety, life is just more difficult. Many times, due to multiple stressors, we lose our way. The road of life has many turns, twists, dead ends and we can get lost. I am here for you, to help you get out of life what you want, and help you process your issues, learn new ways to cope or maybe to look at life differently, you will no longer be on your own. Providing emotional support, helping you see things that may be affecting your life negatively, helping you learn to accept yourself because you are truly; despite all these things that are weighing you down, a great human being.
issues: ['Bipolar Disorder', 'Depression', 'Grief']

name: Polina Eidelman
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Trained as a clinical scientist at UC Berkeley, I am dedicated to providing cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) in a compassionate, warm, individualized, flexible, and collaborative manner. Many of my patients are accomplished people who are doing well in their lives, but they struggle with internal difficulties that interfere with their ability to feel fulfilled and successful. If this sounds like you, or if you are experiencing depression, irritability, trouble sleeping, shame, anxiety, difficulties making decisions, a feeling of being overwhelmed and stressed, or trouble managing your emotions, I can help.  I work with each patient to implement an individualized treatment plan that integrates evidence based, change-oriented strategies with awareness of each person's unique goals, values, and strengths. My patients and I work together actively and flexibly to help them implement practical tools and learn new ways of thinking and behaving. I believe that each person has a depth of wisdom and strength. Effective therapy helps you tap into this wisdom and strength so you can challenge yourself to change, learn, and grow. Please see my website for data on my treatment outcomes. I look forward to hearing from you if you're interested in learning more!
issues: ['Bipolar Disorder', 'Coping Skills', 'Emotional Disturbance', 'Life Transitions', 'Obsessive-Compulsive (OCD)', 'Pregnancy, Prenatal, Postpartum', 'Relationship Issues', 'Stress', "Women's Issues"]

name: Hong Jeong
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: We all go through emotional storms where we feel emotionally and physically stuck; we worry too much and lose control of ourselves. Do you find yourself thrown off balance by your childhood trauma? Childhood traumatic experiences such as abandonment, abuse, and neglect lead to social anxiety. My approach is solution-focused and tailored to your needs and goals. I am committed to providing a profound sense of safety and offering compassionate and actionable guidance to all my clients. I specialize in trauma processing and am certified in EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing). EMDR therapy is an evidence based therapy for relieving the effects of trauma such as the fear of rejection or failure and self-consciousness in social situations. I can help you let go of your past hurts and learn how to cope with intense anxiety.  I also specialized in treating anxiety due to multicultural issues (loss of identity, career issues, & dysfunctional family dynamics). These issues can cause lack of clarity, which results in intense anxiety. I can help you find relief from your suffering and move towards your goals. I also provide therapy in Korean. Please schedule your free consultation.

name: Keaujahne (Kay) Polk
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, MSW, ASW
about: Struggling with depression, anxiety, trauma, life transitions, feeling disconnected, burn out, and other life pains can be entirely too tough to manage alone. If you are a person of color, navigating these experiences may feel more isolating when you've never been taught to express them or never connected to resources. Whether you know your exact triggers or are completely unaware of the source of your discomfort we can all benefit from a space to be heard, expand our coping toolbox and experience the warmth of self care. Often times, challenges with mental health and psychological pain create feelings of unsafety in our own mind. As a mental health provider with experience working with a range of diagnoses , treatment modalities, and levels of care I would like to partner with you in learning to trust your own brain and body , facilitating safe spaces for you, and activating a life that you desire. Allow me to support you in being anchored  in meaning , value, and wellness. Taking the first step can be entirely difficult or maybe you've been here before and feeling overwhelmed. Let's overcome this process together in a fifteen minute consultation where I can hear your specific needs and discuss an appropriate plan for treatment for you. I look forward to meeting you just where you are as you are. All of you is welcome here.

name: Morgan Stromberg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Are you dealing with a major life transition, feeling lost or just need someone to help you navigate through day to day difficulties? My experience includes assisting children, adolescents, individuals and families deal with major life challenges and transitions. I believe that we all may need a little more support at times when we are feeling emotionally overwhelmed, stressed, or stuck in unhelpful patterns of behavior and communication. I specialize in anxiety, depression, relationship issues, trauma, family conflict, attention deficit/hyperactivity, social difficulties and behavioral issues.  I work with those who are experiencing conflict, anxiety, depression, and other challenges stemming from experiences of trauma or this thing we call life. I provide support and guidance for families in navigating challenges of childhood and adolescents. I provide a safe environment for all to express their feelings and access strengths. I have worked with children, families, and young adults for over 6 years in various capacities. I pride myself on my ability to make quick connections with people, understand their points of view, and help communicate those feelings to others.

name: Paul E Katz
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT, DrPH
about: My new clients are usually relieved to find therapy to be more comfortable and supportive than they expect.  I strive to keep therapy a safe and nurturing environment for exploring and facing life's challenges.  Thirty years experience has given me a broad perspective. The most common issues bringing people to my office are stress, anxiety, depression, grief and loss and relationships including: marriage and families, step families, dating, and adoption. Stress management is my specialty.  We all cope with multiple issues.  We only become overwhelmed when their combined stress exceeds our coping skills.  I focus on clients' strengths and resources rather than pathology.  I often use a relaxation technique as a versatile tool for coping and regaining balance. My doctorate is in Public Health.  I see this as a way to bring stress management concepts to a larger audience.  The connection is through wellness and health promotion programs which always include a stress management component and integrate that with nutrition and excercise programs.

name: Leonard Szymczak
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: For the past 40 years, I worked in Australia and America as a therapist and educator. I was Director of the Family Therapy Program in Sydney and later worked with the Family Institute at Northwestern University. I help individuals overcome anxiety and depression & help couples improve communication, resolve conflict, and increase love & intimacy. Since I am also a writer, I frame individuals as the main characters in a story, called to face adversity, transform their lives, and achieve personal happiness. I am the author of "The Roadmap Home: Your GPS to Inner Peace" & co-author of "Fighting for Love: Turn Conflict into Intimacy." In essence, I help you rewrite your life story. In counseling, I create a safe space to identify the thoughts, feelings, and behavioral patterns that create pain and suffering and work with you to alter those patterns so you can achieve success and inner peace. One of my specialties is working with men and with couples to improve their relationships. Having grown up in a household with domestic violence and family dysfunction, I became committed to personal and spiritual growth. My personal story and beliefs are contained in my book, "The Roadmap Home," which became an Amazon Bestseller. To view my TEDx talk, "In the Age of Superheroes, Where Are the Fathers?" Google TEDx Szymczak.

I provide psychotherapy to individuals utilizing a holistic approach that incorporates mindfulness-based therapy and is inspired by psychodynamic, somatic, + attachment theories. name: My Serenity Mental Wellness
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: When you have grown up in unsafe & unstable homes, where there was emotional abuse or neglect we can develop unhealthy attachments, anxieties within relationships, patterns of unhappiness in life. I understand you. We can lack confidence & feel stuck in our thoughts. Building awareness is key while attuning to our mind & body for healing through mindfulness. We can learn to be self-compassionate, and from a holistic approach practice helpful tools. Medication can help some people, but I have experienced health without. My specialty is working with Complex Trauma/ Childhood Trauma/Attachment/PTSD & comorbidity of anxiety/depression. I work with individuals, & couples towards improving themselves and with their relationships. I am a certified Trauma Professional and also practice Cognitive Behavioral, & other approaches. I attune to your specific needs & build upon your strengths, explore internal feelings, support our findings & provide helpful tools to assist with meeting your goals. MSMW is a safe Group Practice, a place for you to unload your troubles, cultivate greater happiness in your life by encouraging clients freedom of expression. Let us tell you how we can help, let's set up a Free Consultation & “spoon your way to health.” ¡Bienvenido a la terapia MY SERENITY MENTAL Wellness! Felicitaciones por dar el primer paso hacia una vida más saludable. La esencia de tu bienestar mental comienza contigo, trabajemos juntos para ayudarte a encontrar un mejor estado de ánimo. Los servicios que proporciono se basan en la comodidad de mi cliente. Para comenzar a trabajar hacia una vida mejor, tu serenidad. Encontremos juntos las herramientas que ayudarán a trascender los desafíos que existen. Como tu psicoterapeuta, colaboraré contigo, mi cliente, en la creación de metas adecuadas para ti. Yo creo en el poder de visualizar un destino deseado y sentirte de que puedes  Mis áreas de enfoque en la Salud Metal: • Trauma (pasado o no resuelto) • Estrés • Ansiedad • Depresión • Duelo y pérdida • Problemas de relación entre (Parejas, familia, discordia entre padres e hijos) • Niños con problemas sociales y (Intimidación, ansiedad por separación, etc) Además, puedo ayudar con los desafíos de la vida y problemas de adaptación. Mi misión es ayudarte a reconectarte con esa parte de ti mismo/a que más disfrutabas antes de que la vida pareciera más difícil de manejar. Mi objetivo principal es apoyar y brindar las herramientas para que comiences a enfrentar los desafíos que han existido en tu vida. Es hora que obtengas la ayuda que necesitas. ¿Soy la mejor opción para ti, conectémonos.

Want to feel like you are thriving and not just surviving? Learn more tools for speaking, listening, feeling and experiencing. Feel more calm and increase your sense of connection to yourself, family and friends. Learn how fear can be overcome through strategic action and utilizing growth mindset strategies. name: Michelle S Duenas

about: Staying or being connected to others---Isn't that what we all desire? To have meaningful and healthy relationships with our spouses, children, friends and co-workers. It is our relationships that determine our fulfillment in life. Do you experience depression, anxiety or stress that complicate how you relate with others? Do you find it difficult to get others to take you seriously or listen to what you have to say? Come and explore these issues and more in a professional and caring environment. I enjoy helping people to identify how their current patterns of behavior may be keeping them from the very things they desire the most. I engage people in their current circumstances. name: Janet Woznica
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Successful psychotherapy can have far-reaching benefits, providing a unique opportunity to make lasting changes leading to a richer, more fulfilling life. I am dedicated to helping others overcome obstacles, resolve conflicts, and live their lives to the fullest. I work collaboratively to provide insight and understanding to heal old wounds along with practical strategies to move forward.  I offer hope, perspective, compassion, and practical tools to resolve both current and long-term conflicts and issues. I am a clinical psychologist and psychoanalyst with in-depth experience working successfully with adults, adolescents, children and families. I specialize in treating depression and anxiety, eating disorders, families of high-conflict divorce, trauma, relationship issues, and child and adolescent treatment. I individualize treatment based on each person's unique history, personality, and cultural background. I welcome the opportunity to work with you and look forward to providing you with a rich, rewarding, and life-changing experience.

My goal is to help you improve your coping skills, gain insight and clarity, identify your strengths, take steps forward, and find some inner peace. Change is hard. Sometimes we tell ourselves things are not as bad or it will get better on its own. I know how hard it is to reach out and make your first appointment.  I encourage you to contact me for a brief consultation to see if we would work well together. If you're not ready, I hope you take some time to explore my website to get more information.

name: Evelyn Schmechtig Cochran
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: As a relationship therapist, I am committed to the enhancement and the healing of distressed relationships. I see busy professionals who care about life and relationships and who are seeking greater and deeper emotional connection. It is my goal to help others improve their communication, resolve relationship conflict, and deepen personal intimacy. I see individuals, couples, and families. I am upbeat yet compassionate, patient yet encouraging, book smart and trained, as well as intuitive and experienced.  My primary orientation and training is Emotionally Focused Therapy. It is a relational and attachment based model. I also have training in Life Span Integration and Internal Family Systems. When working with people I aim to create a safe and nurturing environment where one can explore and activate their healing potential.  We know that life can to very busy and tough in the Bay area. Sometimes our relationships with ourselves or others falter as a result. I am here for you to support you in untangling difficulties and creating the secure bonds we all desire. I would love to help you grow and develop.

name: Avigail Lev
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: My approach is behavioral and goal oriented. I focus on identifying new coping strategies and changing behavioral patterns that damage relationships. I assist clients in identifying deeply held values and taking behavioral steps towards getting closer to these values. I utilize Cognitive Behavioral techniques to help clients who struggle with relationship problems, depression, anxiety, OCD, and mood disorders. I help clients identify particular core beliefs that act as barriers to values-based behavior and explore alternative coping behaviors to utilize when one's schemas are triggered in relationships. Particular methods I incorporate in treatment include mindfulness, cognitive defusion, exposure, and Nonviolent communication. I work with individuals and specialize in couples therapy. My therapeutic stance is straightforward, collaborative, and direct. I believe that creating an authentic and genuine therapeutic relationship is imperative to behavioral change and therefore it is essential that the therapist and client are a good fit and are a collaborative team. I have co-authored two books. The first, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for Interpersonal Problems, presents a complete treatment protocol for therapists working with clients who fall into unhealthy relationship patterns and helps them overcome maladaptive interpersonal behavior. The second book, The Interpersonal Problems Workbook, combines research and evidence-based techniques for strengthening relationships.

name: Jazzlyn Marisela Hammett
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT, APCC
about: We often find ourselves in rigid or stuck places. Life can be hard and navigating it alone is even harder. Whether you are having consistent negative thoughts, encountering a big life transition, lacking in your relationships, or struggling to cultivate joy — I would be honored to help you find or return to your meaning and goals in life. Working together we will move you from rigidity to more fluidity where we can explore all the dualities of life: heartbreak + healing, loss + love, grief + gratitude, pain + play, and fear + freedom. Therapy is intimate, therefore I show up authentically to aid and honor this vulnerable therapeutic exchange. I integrate a holistic approach due to the essential mind-body connection in healing. Collaboratively, we will acknowledge and explore the core of your problems while providing you with tools to cope and overcome the difficulties in your day-to-day. I come from a multiracial/minority background, therefore, I prioritize remaining culturally competent and addressing these areas in our work together. If you or a loved one is seeking support, please reach out so we can connect!

about: Fog, Heavy Rain, Snow and Smoke are all elements that can impair ones visibility. Well how about chaos, emotional instability, anxiety, depression, clutter, stress? While it's true heavy rain and dense fog can cloud our physical vision; environmental, behavioral and chemical stressors can cloud our mental visibility. My name is Mabel (May-Bell) and it is my goal and mission for you to become emotionally and mentally healthy while learning effective tools you can apply to every day life’s challenges as you encounter them.  I work with individuals, families and couples experiencing communication breakdowns, depression, anxiety, work-related stress, grief and loss, bipolar, trauma, substance abuse and addiction. ** ASK ME ABOUT BRAINSPOTTING ** I know this isn't easy and I'm here to tell you, IT ISN'T SUPPOSE TO BE. But it is my hope this next step you take will not be just a few therapy sessions, but will be an intentional investment equipping you to embrace life’s changes, transitions and challenges with your eyes open, your mind clear and your MASK ON!! Let's Be Safe during this process!!!

name: Myron Walters
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, SEP, CMP
about: I help adults who have experienced severe childhood trauma (complex PTSD) begin to reclaim the life they were meant to live.  I work well with dissociative clients (dissociative identity disorder).  My focus is on helping clients get back to a stable, fully-functional state where the fear and anxiety is greatly reduced, and the ability to be in relationship is significantly improved.  I believe we all have multiple ego states, and accordingly do "parts-friendly" psychotherapy. I first help you to move toward a secure internal attachment, which supplies a safe haven for doing the trauma resolution work (Somatic Experiencing and Sensorimotor Psychotherapy). This approach almost insures that you will not get overwhelmed or have difficulty functioning in day-to-day life as we move through your work. I at times will work with couples, especially where childhood trauma may be interfering with their ability to relate to each other.

name: Shawnee Cuzzillo
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: You may be suffering from inexplicable sadness or anxiety, or problems focusing. You might feel blocked in achieving your creative or work goals and want to figure out what is getting in your way.  You might be having health problems and need help sorting out how what is truly out of your control or what might be stress related. I have specialized training in psychodynamic psychotherapy which allows me to listen with special attention to unconscious processes. I am also a graduate of the Psychoanalytic Couples Psychotherapy Group and help many couples navigate difficult patches in their relationships. I listen in the present with a trained ear for how the past, whether deeply traumatic, or more ordinary, has shaped your experiences, with an eye towards a more fulfilling future. I view psychotherapy as a special blend of art and science, and have background and experience in both. if you are an artist, a writer, a game designer, or a programmer, the creative process may need special attention in your psychotherapy  I have interest and expertise in the creative process. While I rely on the "talking cure," some clients sometimes find it helpful to work with art materials.

name: Jane Teixeira
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA
about: Hello and welcome! If you'd like to feel more hopeful, connected, and calm I would love to work with you! I specialize in treating depression, trauma, anxiety, stress, self-esteem issues, body image issues, and perfectionism. I use a person-centered approach and mindfulness to help create a safe space for you to reflect on your relationship patterns and goals. I also like to infuse behavioral therapy techniques to help you hone in on concrete steps you can take to make active changes in your life. I hope to help you find more meaning, creativity, and joy in life. I have 10 years of varied experience in mental health, including teaching graduate school classes, writing a workbook on working through anxiety and worry, and supervising other clinicians toward licensure. I am trained in CBT, DBT, IFS, and EFT and certified in Brainspotting, which is similar to EMDR, and often used for trauma work and performance. Ultimately, I believe that the best therapy happens when clients feel valued and connected in the therapy room.  For more information about me and my services please visit my website at: janeteixeira.com. Initial consultations are free so reach out today! I look forward to meeting you!

name: Cheryl Raymond

about: Are you having difficulties in your marriage or other relationships?  Do you struggle with low self esteem, lack of personal direction or have trouble saying no to others? Therapy is hard work but it doesn't have to be scary. We will work together to identify the goals that personally fit your life and start making a plan to achieve greater happiness and life satisfaction. After having worked in an inpatient psychiatric setting for the last 15 years, I understand how difficult it can be to struggle with Depression,  Bipolar Disorder etc.  It is especially challenging for families as they try to navigate the mental health system. I can guide you through these troubled times. I know finding the right therapist can be an overwhelming task. I would like to make the process as easy as possible.  I am happy to offer either a free phone consultation or free, no-obligation first session so that you can be sure you are making the right decision.

name: Harpreet Malla
title: Psychologist, MA, PhD
about: Clients that typically find it rewarding to work with me are people who find themselves tired of trying to "fit" themselves into small spaces that do not truly honor the complexity of who they are spiritually, culturally, or with their sexuality. They want to start living more fully and authentically, and want to free themselves of old relationships and limiting beliefs that keep them stuck in old cycles of habit, obligation, and resentment. They make small changes and build insight over time so they can live more fully, authentically, and intentionally as their embodied selves. I like to develop a close connection with my clients to allow them to share things they usually keep to themselves or hide away in shame. Together, we can explore the cultural, societal, and family influences that may be keeping you trapped, and also identify ways in which some of those influences resonated and what you might like to "keep" from them. The work I do is often as unique as my clients themselves. I want to get to know the quirks, idiosyncrasies, and special facets of a client before going to problem-solving mode. Often, there isn't anything "wrong" with us, but we can get off course by losing ourselves & our values in tough times. I'll help you step out of the whirlwind and back to yourself.

name: Kim Cox Psychotherapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: One's experience with fear, stress, sadness or uncomfortable feelings in general can have major impacts on how we view ourselves and the world. I’ve seen the long term benefits that come from the therapy process both personally and professionally and look forward to working with you!

name: Christal-Joi Whitaker
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Christal-Joi Whitaker is a marriage and family therapist with over 17 years of clinical experience facilitating transformative life changes in adult and child clients of all cultures and beliefs. Her goal is to help her clients realize their authentic selves, walk in harmony with their true nature, and live stable, healthy lives filled with the love of rich and rewarding relationships. Christal-Joi is able to incorporate a biblical perspective in her clinical interventions with those clients who are seeking a therapist who shares their love for Jesus Christ. Christal-Joi utilizes a holistic approach to therapy, offering her clients a safe, open space to allow them to explore the various parts of their lives lacking integration. She believes that habitual patterns of thought and behavior result in chronic anxiety, depression, anger, insomnia, poor self-image, addictions, and a number of other unhealthy impulses. She believes that with mindful awareness, addressing past traumas, and time, we can increase our tolerance level to stimuli and allow ourselves to become more compassionate, actively re-wire our brains, and tap into the wisdom of our spirits, minds, and bodies to identify “knots”, and creatively forge new and exciting paths towards liberation and lightness.

name: Kate Sheehan
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Your life CAN be different.  You can enjoy authentic relationships, clear communications, and a genuine purpose.  If you need short-term support in achieving your goals, please contact me for a free consultation. Long-term, ongoing therapy is also available.  Please contact me to discuss what you need help with at this time. I work with individuals who are lost, confused, stuck, dissatisfied, unfulfilled, or disappointed. I work in person and online with individuals and couples. I help tweens, teens, and adults. My approach is strengths-based -- we look for what is working well, and we limit thoughts and habits that are no longer working.  I have extensive experience helping with anxiety, problem-solving, and communication. I offer nonjudgmental listening, support for your dreams, reflection of who you really are, and creative solutions for breakthroughs and growth.  My approach is eclectic and tailored to each client. I integrate mindfulness and somatic approaches, when appropriate.

name: Evie Shafner
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Imago therapy is an amazing relationship technology that very quickly gets us back to safe communication and experiencing our partner as a source of emotional safety, and passionate friendship.  In my 35 years of working with couples as a specialty, Imago is the best system I have known to get us back to that feeling that we had in the beginning of our relationship.  Its structured communication techniques distinguish it from all other types of couples therapy.  the process itself feels very nonthreatening to both partners. I believe the only part of us that is real, our essence, cannot be harmed and no matter what has happened to us, with compassionate coaching and support, we can take the helm of our own lives and learn to move towards the peace and happiness we long for.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT

I use multiple approaches in order to meet your individual needs. I am here to provide you with guidance in finding tools to help you find stability in your life. I will work collaboratively with you in order for you to grow to become a better you. Please contact me to set up a session and begin your journey.

name: Daniel Moultrie
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Are you feeling stuck, unsatisfied or overwhelmed? Life seems to be moving fast and becoming too much to handle.  You're not quite feeling like your usual self or you just feel "off".  This may be effecting your relationships, career, and personal life. Imagine feeling like you are in control of your thoughts and emotions. Imagine being able to handle life's challenges with confidence.  Counseling gives you the opportunity to change through new thinking patterns, self awareness, and exploring your situation with an caring professional. I believe that everyone, including you, have something to offer this world.  You're not alone and your story matters.  Let's work together to take the first steps to bringing happiness and peace back into your life. I use an integration of counseling modalities tailored to your specific needs and situation. Whether it's anxiety, depression, stress, relationships, or life changes that are holding you back, I focus on the therapeutic relationship to assist with change.  For more info about my services visit my website: www.FresnoFamilyTherapy.com

name: Diana Beth Strimling
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Are you a LGBTQIA+ person living in California? Are you seeking a clinician who understands the the experiences of being a LGBTQ person? Are you seeking to better understand yourself, your identity, and explore the roots of what you are experiencing? Do you feel like you've been trying to fit into a box that wasn't made for you? I use trauma informed modalities to help you become the best version of yourself. I also have experience living in both a larger city and in more rural communities and can support you through a variety of experiences. I approach my work with my clients from a trauma informed lens and am committed to unconditional positive regard to those I work with. I know that your identity should not be pathologized. I support my clients in their choices and beliefs because I believe that there is no one “right” way to live your life. I am level 2 Gottman trained for relational work I am a queer ethically non monogamous therapist from an Ashkenazi background who has been on my own personal journey of healing which allows me to understand the importance of finding the right therapist to accompany you on your own journey. I feel honored that clients let me be a witness to their journey to self fulfillment.

name: Denise Rockwell
title: Psychologist, PhD, BCBA-D
about: My current clinical practice offers psychological and psychoeducational evaluations and treatment for children ages 2-18, with an emphasis on developmental, behavioral, and learning diagnostics and intervention. Parent training and education are central to my practice, as I believe that the most substantial and sustained change in child behavior comes when families are empowered to take strategies learned in therapy sessions and apply them to real life situations. I collaborate closely with medical, educational, and clinical providers both during the assessment and treatment process to ensure that families are fully supported. I specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of developmental and learning disabilities, behavioral disorders, anxiety, depression, and other childhood based disorders. I take an integrative treatment approach, in that I draw from multiple therapeutic orientations based on the needs of child and family.
