name: Dennis Pottenger
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Therapy is a protected space where you can be yourself without fear of judgment or rejection. My role is to help you find your way through inner conflicts and emotional difficulties. In therapy we work together to bring meaning and healing to your experience. Through the therapy process you may experience increased self-esteem and increased clarity about who you are and what's important to you.  If you've experienced abuse or trauma, I'll work to help you regain a sense of physical and emotional safety, and help you create a healthy connection to yourself and others. As someone who has struggled with self-esteem and identity issues, I can help you re-frame self-defeating thoughts, resolve unconscious inner conflicts, and learn to value and trust your own experience.  Therapy can help you feel more authentic, alive, and confident. As a step-parent to adult children of color, I'm especially sensitive to issues related to race, gender, and identity. Our western patriarchal culture injures both men and women.  If you've been hurt deeply, through trauma, or through experiences of marginalization and misogyny, therapy is a protected space for repair and healing.

name: Peggy Farrell
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MEd, MA, LMFT, LPCC
about: My formal name is Margaret but everyone calls me Peggy.  I love to work with clients who are exploring who they are. Perhaps you feel like you have moments of feeling lonely and stuck? Perhaps your life events have made you feel separate and different from others?  Maybe you have trouble focusing and your concentration can be spotty? You wonder how others see you and you want to fit in.   Would you like to feel more relaxed in your body and around others?  Just being able to take that deep breath and know that there is a time carved out just for you to talk and work through the things that have been bothering you.  Would it be nice to just feel that much lighter?  To share your burden with a person who can hold some of that weight for you?  So you’ve found me here on Psychology Today, and you are wondering “What’s next?”  Well, the first thing to do is call my number and leave a message. I will call you back and we can talk about what you are looking for in a free 15-minute consultation. You could also email me if that seems easier and I will get back to you to find a time to talk.

name: Kara Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I believe that everyone is doing the best they can with the skills they have at the time.  If you feel like the ways you are coping aren't working well enough anymore or that difficult emotions are getting in the way, let's talk.  As a therapist, I want to meet you where you are and at the same time empower you to make changes  that will reduce suffering and increase fulfillment. It is important to me to understand your world and help you create a life worth living. I use a balance of compassionate, nonjudgmental support and straightforward feedback, helping you gain more tools to cope with life on life's terms. I'm a DBT-Linehan Board Certified Clinician as well as having extensive training in Exposure and Response Prevention (ExRP) to treat Obsessive Compulsive Disorder.  DBT and ExRP are evidence based treatments that can significantly improve outcomes when other therapies haven't had the desired effect. Please feel free to contact me - I'd love to see if we are a good fit.  If you'd like more information, please go to my website:  www.karajohnsontherapy.com

For over 25 years now, my passion has been helping people rediscover themselves. What you will find is compassion and truth within an engaging counseling  process.  In an inviting setting, I seek to give you relatability, laughter, and acceptance.  I will help you find your freedom from the things that weigh us down like anxiety, people pleasing, and overwhelming emotions/thoughts. All of us feel stuck at times, please know that is normal. name: Mahsan Behnoud
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, EMDR
about: “Pain is inevitable.Suffering is optional.” Would you like to develop sense of agency and being able to take active role in your life?in therapy you become comfortable to explore your uncomfortable emotions, redefine your thoughts, develop coping skills and plant the seeds of positive intentions. By overcoming emotional reactivity, you'll be able to thrive in a highly stressful environment. In your journey, you will get to the heart of your resistance. You'll be able to turn to your fears, solve your problems,work through your goals and be aware of the possible costs of inaction in your life. CBT&DBT is here To help.As we know there is conflicts in working through deep feelings of hurt, anger, and grief associated with early childhood maladaptive memory networks. Resolving these conflicts, when present, requires working on pathogenic memories and to increase capacities for emotional self-soothing, self-validation, and self-worth.This will be gained through EMDR. Eye movement desensitization reprocessing is a modality to reprocess past disturbing memories, work on current triggers and explore underlining reasons of living in high anxiety and panic state. EMDR is an effective modality to work with trauma &abuse.By working together,you'll be able to welcome the best version of you in your life and be grateful about it.

name: Inclusive Psychological Services P.C.
title: Psychologist, MPA, LMFT, PsyD
about: Let's be honest; life is complicated. At some point in our lives, we need help from others who can understand our lived experiences, including myself. I imagine what brought you here is that you are looking to improve your emotional and psychological well-being and relationships with others or with yourself. You probably would welcome practical tools to alleviate the additional stress these layers add to an already difficult situation(s). I understand. I've been there too. For most, short-term cognitive behavioral therapy and a solution-focused approach are effective but require active participation in your healing process. I primarily work with and provide psychotherapy to adults who have experienced trauma(s), including depression and anxiety, acculturation, first-gen college students, gender and sexuality,  stressful life changes, and the LGBTQ+ community.  I also provide immigration psychological evaluations for VAWA only at a very reasonable low fee. Affirmative psychotherapy and trauma-informed approach ensure that our work together is inclusive, non-judgmental, and culturally responsive. Now, if you are looking to work with an action-oriented, compassionately direct psychologist driven by social justice principles, I look forward to working with you!

name: Social Skills Development Center
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, LPCC
about: I am a licensed Marriage & Family therapist, licensed Professional Clinical Counselor, certified PEERS instructor, and credentialed teacher. I have effectively taught social skills privately and in school settings to children, teens, and young adults with Autism, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, Depression, Bipolar, and Schizophrenia for over 20 years.  In addition to social skills groups, I can provide one-on-one therapy to children, teens, and young adults experiencing specific concerns.  I also provide mentoring/therapy services to  parents with  child rearing issues and concerns.   Social Skills Development Center was started in response to the need for a center to teach important social skills to individuals lacking the ability to do so themselves.  My personal experience working with school districts, teachers, and navigating the IEP process comforts the scores of parents who have taken these classes. In order to succeed later in life, students need to acquire the skills necessary to thrive in their own social networks, employment fields, and educational arenas.  Upon completion of the session. we see a huge improvement in our students' whole outlook on life as their self-esteem improves as well as their social life.  Contact us today to join open groups.

name: Emily Kaiser
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
about: Life is hard and beautiful, messy yet hopeful. We need support and healing as we navigate this life. Since 2008, I have worked with families and youth impacted by foster care, adoption and kinship placement. Parenting youth who have experienced trauma can be overwhelming and full of uncertainty. My approach is to get to know you and your specific needs in order to provide unique support. My goal is to come alongside of you, empower you, so that you have the confidence and skills to live your life to the fullest. I would be honored to work with you and hold space for the challenges you've experienced. It would be my privilege to walk with you on your path toward hope and healing. Give me a call or send an email.

name: Erick Godel
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I believe that the key to finding inner strength and balance is within all of us. I specialize in empowering people who suffer from addiction, substance abuse, and mood disorders (anxiety, depression, anger) to take control of their lives. Substance abuse and addiction is a disease that effects the entire family, therefore family counseling and co-dependence therapy is a very important part of my treatment. I have a depth of experience helping people of all ages struggling with anxiety disorders, depression, and family issues. This has also helped to make me very effective in working with people struggling with addiction. Addiction, is a coping skill some people use to cope with issues such as anxiety, depression, trauma, etc. The key to finding happiness is within all of us. I empower people by showing them that happiness depends on their choices and not the choices of others. For more specific information on what I do please refer to my website. I look forward to helping you find your inner strength and balance.

name: Aubrey Studebaker
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I help people learn to become the hero of their own story. Each new transition you face in life is an opportunity to expand and refine your identity... but there are also pitfalls. We get hurt, we lose our way, we get caught up in shame and self-doubt. I work with a lot of grief, loss, and confusion around life changes. I've got a lot of experience with folks who have been adopted or in foster care — and people who find themselves feeling alone after a split from their family, their culture, or their religious faith. I'm passionate about helping people find their way into the next, better chapter of life. I use an integrative, customized approach to helping since no two people are the same. We'll collaborate together to find out what works for you. Some of the tools I use relate to working on thoughts (CBT), feelings (DBT), relationships (IPT), and building insight about the parts of yourself you may not have words for yet (art therapy.) Choosing to begin therapy can be a difficult -and vulnerable- step to take. Whatever difficulty you're facing, it helps to have a non-judgmental space to work through it, and I'm here to provide that space. Call me for a free phone consultation, or click through to my website to schedule an appointment online now.

name: Carolyn Marie Nelson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Are you ready for a change in your life? Are you tired of feeling depressed and anxious? Let me guide you through the healing from your past through a compassionate and nonjudgmental therapy. I offer a safe and supportive environment to foster healing, offer you hope, and help you learn new skills to live a better life.  I have enjoyed working with young adults and individuals  struggling with a variety of challenges including depression, anxiety, relationship difficulties, life transitions, and grief. I have helped many clients through the grief at the the end of a personal relationship, marriage, and death.  It is normal  to struggle with change. Let me help guide you or your teenager to a more successful life through the process of therapy.  Call me and let's talk for a few minutes.

name: Julie Moore
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Though we seem to be sleeping, there is an inner wakefulness that directs the dream, and will eventually startle us back to the truth of who we are. - Rumi I seek to assist each person with whom I work to find their light, that inner spark that makes you feel alive. We explore dreams and symbols that guide us to the deeper parts of the soul that need healing. We learn how to tap into the inner child that is crying out to be heard but can't quite find the words to express herself. Therapy becomes a place of creative and experiential exploration, where old and frozen patterns melt and open the path to new ways of being.

name: Christina Cowger
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Recognizing patterns and applying actionable techniques for change is the cornerstone of our work together. I customize an emotional insight approach, cognitive-behavior structure, and mind-body tools for each client. We can safely explore how trauma and family patterns may have seeded beliefs and feelings that no longer serve the life you are striving to live. My neurobehavioral training informs how I partner with you to shift thinking, feeling, and reactivity, positively impacting self-esteem and relationships. Between sessions, tools are offered for ongoing continuity. As the Clinical Director of a program focused on healthy boundaries, trauma, couples communication, and neurobiological/mind-body interventions paired with years of private practice experience, I have had the honor of supporting hundreds of individuals and couples in creating dynamic and lasting life changes. You may be new to therapy or may have tried it before. Either way, I will meet you where you are at to begin the journey of insight, understanding, self-care, and actions that can move you closer to a life that reflects your deepest desires and aspirations. I honor each individual and recognize that each of us has a unique history, path, and process.

name: Dr. Carla Payne
title: Psychologist
about: What I believe as a psychologist is that insight and change come from understanding our roots. Total Context Therapy is a psychodynamically informed dialogue where we untangle the roots of who you are and how you want to be. In the process, you will practice a new way of thinking through your difficulties, and attain assertiveness skills, along with progressive movement. Total Context is not a years-long process of multiple visits per week. Neither is it uncomfortable, painful rehashing of old mistakes or bad relationships. It's dynamic because it is about you making different connections between your past and present, and taking steps based on what comes of that. Total Context Therapy Group "You are so much more than your diagnosis" Book online here: doctible.com/providers/carla-payne

name: Talia Chanoff
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: I am here to be present with you as you explore and process how the vast injustices in the world may be affecting your internal states. Together we can examine the question: Is there something “wrong” with me as an individual, or do we live in an inequitable society that causes emotional and often generational trauma? Our trauma can lead to behaviors that do not ultimately serve us or align with our core values—but there is room to heal.  Your ancestral roots, intersecting identities, and cultural practices are an honor for me to make space for in our work together. I specialize in working with folks struggling with anxiety, depression, trauma, substance abuse and harm reduction, life transitions, and stress management. I also hold vast experience supporting individuals experiencing PTSD, chronic illness, chronic pain, eating disorders and those struggling with a complicated relationship with food. I invite you to get in touch for a free 15 minute consultation. *I offer the possibility of a sliding scale agreement in the circumstance of financial difficulty.*

name: Matthew (Matt) Ahrens
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
street: Zoom or Phone only right now
about: Psychotherapy is a gift we give to ourselves. That hour per week we set aside to explore our inner worlds - our thoughts, our emotions, and our sensations - and get some relief, heal, integrate, and grow. It is an honor for me to share that hour with you, to accompany you, to witness you, and to discover with you. I work with individuals and couples who are experiencing unresolved trauma, anxiety, depression, stress, addictions, relationship issues, life transitions, and a variety of other psychological concerns. My style is collaborative, curious, and accepting; incorporating a number of different therapeutic approaches so I can adapt to your individual personality, wants, and needs. I received a Masters Degree in Integral Counseling Psychology from the California Institute of Integral Studies. I am also a certified coach, mediator, and Enneagram teacher. Prior to becoming a psychotherapist I earned and MBA and gained professional experience in business, government, and nonprofits. I enjoy working with clients from all walks of life.

name: Samuel Kim
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: You feel like you’ve tried everything to make your relationship work, and nothing seems to change. Try as you might, communication fails, tension builds, and once again you’re cycling back to the painfully familiar arguments that you had been avoiding in the first place. If only your partner stopped pushing your buttons, then you would have no need to retaliate or withdraw, and you would finally feel at peace. Alas, you’re instead finding yourself feeling stuck, lost, and alone. You are so tired of this. This isn’t how you imagined your relationship. Something must change. So, let’s work toward that change! In this safe space, we will explore your underlying relational patterns. You’ll be equipped with the tools to regulate your emotions, respond in relationally connecting ways, and create the change in your relationship that you have been seeking. You can finally experience relief and peace in this relationship. Call me, email me, or submit an inquiry on the contact page of the website below my profile picture to schedule a free 15-minute consultation with me. I’d love to hear about what brings you to therapy and share with you about how we can work together to see if we would be a good fit.

name: Alana Jacobs
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Do you find yourself feeling lonely, sad, scared, depressed, empty, or anxious? And maybe hopeless, alone, and confused about how to feel better?  Whatever you're experiencing, you do not have to face it alone. With the support of a therapist & the trusting, safe space that can be developed you can work through whatever you are experiencing & find light ---- whether that be decreased suffering, inner peace, increased intimacy in your relationships, or more aliveness and authenticity in your connection with yourself and others.  I bring warmth, acceptance, & empathy into my work.  I believe that in our early life or in times of great difficulty or trauma we do what is necessary to survive & while these tactics were once essential for us to cope, they can come to no longer serve us. I help clients uncover how these tactics they once needed to employ may now be blocking their full aliveness, connection to others, &  their emotional experience. I support clients in processing emotions they may never have previously felt safe enough to explore, which allows for the discovery of more nourishing ways of relating to themselves and others.

name: Kimberly Burks
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: If you change nothing, then nothing will change.  Sometimes we get stuck doing the same thing over and over, expecting things to be different or improve in some way.  When they don't change, it leaves us tired, frustrated, and overwhelmed.  Ruts can be unhealthy patterns we place ourselves in whether it be careers or relationships.  If you are contemplating your readiness for change or are ready to express your thoughts and feelings and make different choices for your life, I am ready to start this journey with you. I provide a safe environment for you to be honest, real, and raw on this journey.  I will be a guide to help facilitate change and resolve the problems you are wanting to address.   Therapy is an investment in you, which will benefit your family, your work, and your community.  Let's build on your strengths (yes, you have them) so you can be your best self. I understand therapy can be difficult, but I believe each person has the inner will and drive to face their problems or fears.  I look forward to being on this journey with you and seeing your development transpire.

name: Denise Gretchen-Doorly
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My practice helps people minimize the impact of their illness, get the most from their medical treatment, and manage disruptions to their personal and professional lives. Treatment focuses taking a proactive approach to health including learning goal-setting and problem-solving skills and effectively communicating with treatment providers. My graduate studies were completed at Columbia University and Fordham University in New York City. I received intensive clinical training from two of the nation’s best hospitals: Mount Sinai Hospital in New York and the David Geffen School of Medicine at UCLA. I also have an excellent referral network of the best healthcare providers in the LA area. I am a proactive, organized, and dedicated therapist. I believe every person has a right to treatment that discovers and builds on personal strengths in the face of life's challenges. I help people uncover their unique approaches to meaning making, purpose, and life direction using a variety of evidence-based assessment tools and therapeutic techniques.

name: Ben Morsa
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Therapy is a deeply personal experience and there are as many reasons to seek therapy as there are people who seek it. Perhaps you are struggling with anxiety, depression, grief, or shame. You may have suffered traumas or losses and are wondering how these shape your thoughts, feelings and relationships. Maybe you simply have a sense that aspects of your life are not coming together in the ways you desire. Therapy is a space to explore these curiosities, to develop insight into your self, and, ultimately, to find greater fulfillment in your work, relationships, and play. I have worked with people across the lifespan with a wide range of concerns. I have completed advanced training in work with LGBT folks, immigrants, children, and survivors of trauma. I invite you to visit my website to review my specialties and interests. My pronouns: he / him / his. Therapy and social justice have much in common. I work with people to understand not only their inner life but also the ways that the world impacts them. I practice with empathy, curiosity, and compassion and work collaboratively to help people discover strengths and orient themselves in the world.

name: Ladera Ranch therapy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I believe the area that I am best suited in treating is the addictive mind.  Assisting  in changing the way that you perceive problems and engaging you in the importance and meaning of what you are experiencing. Making meaning of our suffering and losses is most important.  I view most issues presented by my clients as traumatic, accompanied with shock, struggling to make sense of what is happening.  Whether it be a divorce, a death, or a change of circumstance we are required to 'change'. Developing flexabilty, humor and courage for life is my goal in our work. My specialty is enabling you to know yourself better.  "The unexamined life is not worth living." Through the process of knowing your strengh and weaknesses, growth and self satisfaction are supported. My goal is to provide you tools to enhance you throughout your lifetime I believe the special factor that I bring to my practice is my years of experience and my enthusiasm for the process of counseling and psychotherapy.  I have a great sense of humor, and a strong belief that whatever is happening is important. I have great respect for people.

name: Emily Shefer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: If you are experiencing the symptoms of a mood disorder, anxiety, trauma, or relationship distress, it can be hard to imagine getting out from under the pain. Through reflection, exploration and the building of trust, therapy is a space for you to learn how to thrive. Together, we will help you find hope, connection and emotional safety. Drawing on my training in Psychodynamic Therapy and Emotionally Focused Therapy, I work with individuals and couples to help them gain understanding of how early experiences have shaped them, and use this insight to break out of patterns that aren't serving them. I love working with those who are looking to gain a deeper understanding of themselves, their relationships, and their life's meaning. The best way to determine if we are the right fit is to reach out to me for a consultation. I look forward to connecting!

name: Alyson Pancer
title: MSW, BSW, CYT, CHyp, Coach
about: Are you feeling exhausted, stressed, alone? I'm here to help you build a SELF-CARE TOOLBOX to help you maintain BALANCE in your life.  Life is a delicate balancing act – sometimes we need a little guidance and support to maintain it!  The good news is: You are NOT alone.  I completely recognize that each person is unique and I ensure that every individual is empowered and feels comfortable and safe. As our coaching sessions progress, working with your goals is my primary focus. I find great meaning and purpose in working with populations of all ages, including children and adolescents and their families, adults, couples and groups.  In partnership with you, we will explore coping strategies to help you feel better, and embrace positive change,  through evidence-based practices, including: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction, Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy, Mindfulness-Based Eating, Mindfulness-Based Parenting, Mindful Yoga Therapy, and Clinical Hypnotherapy.  “Sometimes the bravest and most important thing you can do is just show up.”    -Brene Brown Yes!...that is the hardest yet most important part of this journey you are on. With over 25 years of therapy and coaching experience, I’m confident I can help you learn to effectively manage the challenges and stressors in your life. Reach out. I’m here for you!

name: Alham Rodriguez (Bilingual)
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT
about: Hello and bienvenidos. I have over 11 years of experience working with children, adolescents, adults, and families. My approach to practice is tailored to the individual needs and style of each client. I enjoy working with people of all ages and backgrounds. My style is authentic, attentive, warm, yet playful and humorous. I strive to provide a safe and non-judgmental atmosphere where you can feel heard and understood. I enjoy working from an integrated approach that is person-centered, mindfulness-based, and rooted in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT). I specialize in working with children. My approach when working with children is play-based, art-based, and toy-based. It is through therapeutic play and art that children are able to express, work through, and play out their experiences, feelings, and thoughts in a developmentally appropriate manner. I have been able to support clients of all ages with anxiety, depression, emotional disturbance, life transitions, grief, behavioral issues, and family conflict. I look forward to the opportunity of supporting you in your healing process and in making your desired changes.

name: Jennifer A Miners
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: Hello, my name is Jennifer Miners. I am a Licensed Clinical Social Worker and I'm passionate about helping my clients deal with anxiety, stress, codependency and life transitions. My practice focuses on finding the best way to deal with the above issues. My approach is talking through issues, providing insights, and providing practical tools to work through these problems, such as how to change negative thinking, mindfulness skills and other tools specific to your needs. I use Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) and Mindfulness Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT). CBT works on our thoughts and how they affect our moods and actions. MBCT works well with CBT to help us stay in the present moment without negatively judging ourselves or our thoughts. I always start where my client is. I let clients direct their sessions with some feedback and insights from me. I find that doing work outside the sessions helps to increase the effectiveness of therapy, if the client is comfortable doing so. Every person is unique so we will tailor your treatment to what works best for you.

name: Mary Ann Franco
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT, EdD, CP
about: Do you feel lost and alone as if no one understands you? Do you feel overwhelmed and unable to see a better future? Are your relationships stressful, energy draining and dissatisfying? Are you caught up in dysfunctional patterns that you would like to break? Are there moments when you feel like giving up? Do you find yourself easily agitated, annoyed and irritable?  You can have a better tomorrow. Make today the start of a happier, healthier tomorrow. I will help you understand the core of your pain. Together we will collaborate on goals and explore ways to achieve them. Therapy is about listening with my heart and soul. I design therapeutic interventions  specific to the client's needs. I have witnessed many individuals, couples and families transform in therapy. Everyone has the innate capacity to heal, feel well and be happy. I am available for ONLINE Teletherapy via Video using a HIPPA approved platform. The journey of healing begins by becoming aware that there is more that you wish to experience in this life. It starts with feeling acceptance and compassion for yourself. In therapy I will provide an atmosphere that is conducive for your wellness and self discovery.

name: Whitney Dicterow
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I believe that most people who are struggling emotionally have the resources and strength to get through those difficult times with the help and support of a mental health professional. I work collaboratively with you in a non-judgmental, supportive environment, to help facilitate emotional and psychological growth. I am dedicated to helping you create a rich, meaningful life, while helping you to more effectively cope with painful emotions and life circumstances. I am primarily a cognitive behavioral therapist. Extensive research and clinical trials have demonstrated that CBT is effective in treating a wide variety of disorders and populations, which is why I am committed to using a CBT framework and specific CBT interventions in my work with clients. I work with adults struggling with anxiety, depression, current or past trauma, perfectionism, procrastination, and low self-esteem. I also specialize in helping people with life transitions/stressors such as pregnancy, Postpartum Depression/Anxiety, relationship and marital problems, undergraduate/graduate school stress, and shifts in career.

name: Tom Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: WAITING LIST.  In our journey through these uncertain times, we encounter confusion, anger, fear, depression. What do we do with these feelings? How do we react? Sometimes we can use some help -- with tools to honor our Authentic Self, to find our joy and move forward. I provide non-judgmental, insightful and gentle guidance suited to your specific needs. I respect who you are now and your courage to engage in counseling. I collaborate with you, honoring your natural strengths and skills. We work to heal old wounds, increase awareness and empower you to consciously create a life that resonates with your Authentic Self. With increased understanding and acceptance of your Authentic Self, you can learn to better trust your decision-making process and internal guidance. Depending on your goals, we can explore in-depth the links between your past and current situation, use a problem-solving focus to address specific issues -- or both. I have more than 15 years' experience providing therapeutic services. I utilize cognitive behavioral therapy, psychodynamic, Internal Family Systems, mindfulness, and forgiveness approaches, depending on your situation.

title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, ACSW
about: I have always had a heart to help others. I have spent my career learning and growing in my profession to be able to reach all those who need help with an open and supportive heart. Through our work together my clients increase their ability to trust, create and maintain healthy relationships, become confident and hopeful for the future. I specialize in child abuse, domestic violence, trauma, depression, and anxiety. I am skilled in working with adults and teenagers and have many years of professional experience with the child welfare system and family conflict.  I use trauma informed and strength-based practice working at my clients pace to ensure healing is accomplished. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about me.  If you feel that we may work well together please contact me at the listed phone number or email.  I look forward to meeting you and working through your concerns with you.

name: Ivan W Foote
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Thank you for viewing my profile. We live in tense and uncertain times and it's easy to get charged up and react in ways that maybe we shouldn't have. Part of my work is to help individuals and couples reduce emotional reactivity that may be causing problems. I often help people examine thoughts and misperceptions that color the way that we see the world and that effect our relationships. Did you grow up during the Cold War era? Are today's occurances in Europe triggering anxieties that you thought were long past and gone for good? You are not alone. I work with individuals, couples and families, with people struggling with a wide variety of issues including mood and anxiety disorders and addiction. A speciality of mine is working with teens and young adults. I am knowledgable about Autism Spectrum Disorder and how it can impact individuals and families and some of the resources that are available. We all face challenges as we walk through life. That is something we all share. Once we work through these challenges, they often become sources of strength, wisdom and resilence which can help us as we move forward into the future. I invite you to call or email me if I can help. I look forward to speaking with you. Thank you!

name: Tanya Gulevich
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT
about: I have a wide experience working with clients who have experienced a major loss and and are grieving, whether the loss is the death of a loved one, the loss of a job, the loss of a relationship, or the losses that can come with chronic illness.  I have also helped numerous people who are in emotionally and verbally abusive relationships, or have been in such relationships with partners, parents, or friends in the past.  In addition, I enjoy helping people suffering from anxiety and depression to release these mood states and adopt a more tranquil state of mind. If you are dealing with any of these conditions you may feel hopeless or be uncertain about what to do.   Begin the healing process by giving me a call.  The best way to discern if I am the right therapist for you is by speaking with me on the phone or scheduling a consult visit. I want to assure you that I will not be looking at you as a bundle of problems, or as a diagnosis.  I view my clients' current troubles in the larger context of their talents, strengths and competencies.  If you should have a disability of any sort, please know that my office is wheelchair accessible.

name: Daphne Rahnama
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Asking for help is not easy, so congratulations on taking the initial step toward self-improvement and fulfillment. Through our partnership, I hope to help you better understand yourself, your relationships and to help you see patterns that may be causing emotional distress. My training as a therapist is rooted in clinical social work, which conceptualizes mental health and healing from various individual, social, and cultural vantage points. Talking about issues in therapy may initially be difficult, but with time you will see yourself in a new light, and you will be able to accomplish positive change.  My goal is to work with you to determine your unique needs so that each session can be an exercise in personal development.  Finding the right therapist can be an overwhelming process. My hope is to help you feel comfortable in therapy by developing a safe, supportive, and trusting relationship.  I believe that we attain personal development through our relationships with others, and that connecting with a therapist can provide a unique opportunity to address your fears, voice your deepest aspirations, and discover unknown parts of yourself.   It is important that you feel we are a good fit, so please take advantage of a free phone consultation.

name: Maryam Jamili
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, EMDR
about: Am I the right therapist for you?  Helping client's is the primary goal of every therapist. What can you do for me that the others can't? That is a valid question. Many healthcare providers provide symptom management rather than treating the main problem. I mainly use Solution Focused Therapy to focus on client's present and future and to find solutions for their problems. The therapy is not about me; its about you. However, in addition to my years of education, I bring a life-time of personal life experience and an extensive personal knowledge to the sessions. I am a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist with additional training in EMDR. I specialize in working with couples, families and many clients suffering from trauma, relationship issues, phobias, anxiety disorder and depression. I offer special cash pricing for clients with no insurance.

name: Ellen Castleman
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about:
I offer a dynamic and caring approach to therapy that actively engages adolescents, young adults and adults in uncovering barriers to enjoying a full and balanced life. 
I provide an environment where clients can learn to manage stress, sadness, loneliness and disappointment in healthy ways, while making concrete behavioral changes and positive choices.
My clients have experienced positive changes that have led to increased happiness and fulfillment with their lives and goals. Relationships with others are improved, and family life becomes more functional and harmonious. I specialize in working with adolescents and young adults grappling with the difficult demands and influences of today's society. I readily establish connections that convey my genuine acceptance of their feelings and perspective. 
This provides a setting that is comfortable and conducive to discussing real feelings and concerns, and allows change to take place. Other areas of focus include depression, anxiety, self esteem, boundaries, parenting, primary and social relationships, recovery (soothing with food, co-dependency, ACA), and bereavement.

I work with individuals and couples, adults and adolescents.

name: Maria Herrera
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Welcome! I am glad that you are here taking a step towards change. I appreciate the opportunity to introduce myself. I am a licensed clinical social worker with almost twenty years of experience. I graduated from the University of Southern California. I have worked in a wide range of areas. I have helped client’s manage and cope with challenging health and emotional issues, as well as life transitions, substance abuse, and relationship problems. As your counselor, I can help you explore, process, and learn ways to cope with life challenges. I have learned that when people feel alone and confused they need a therapist that will actively listen without passing judgment, and give them a space where they feel safe to share their experiences and reflect on them. I have an eclectic approach. My theoretical foundations are psychodynamic, humanistic and cognitive-behavioral. I can teach you techniques to help you cope and work through the feelings that are bringing you to counseling. I am looking forward to the opportunity to work with you. I would like to learn more about you, so I can understand your current situation, work on setting new goals, and work on reaching them. Looking forward to working with you!
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Bipolar Disorder', 'Life Transitions', 'Relationship Issues']

name: Trish Eileen Vernazza
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, ATR-BC
about: Trish Vernazza, M.A. is an experienced, caring professional who can assist you in achieving a fully integrated life by focusing on your strengths and potential.  Achieving a healthy and positive balance in our lives is the key to understanding our own mental, emotional, spiritual, physical health along with personal relationships. My goal is to provide a safe, supportive, confidential environment while assisting you to experience, identify and understand the personal barriers which are getting in your way.  Working with many clients of many ethnic and culture backgrounds and alternative lifestyles I provide a environment that helps develop personal insight. As a Board Certified Art Therapist and Artist, I use my creative talents along with my art and psychological education to enhance your journey of self acceptance and discovery.  Personal healing takes place through self awareness based on psychological insight that I specialize in helping you define. I am an Art Therapist Ambassador, California Marriage Family Therapy Association Media Representation and member of North County African American Women's association. I believe in participating in community awareness by volunteering my services, art and personal time.  I am culturally aware of differences and traveled to many international countries.

name: Michael E Newman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My philosophy of therapy is holistic, meaning that I believe people are made up of many parts: body, soul (mind, emotions, will), and spirit. These parts must function in a balanced relationship in order for us to thrive. How we feel about ourselves and how we view the world affects the quality of our relationships. When we can balance a positive identity with our role in the world while also remaining connected to others, we feel whole. Brokenness can occur if any of these relationships are out of balance. In therapy, I help my clients assess the lack of balance so they can figure out how to get whole again. With nearly three decades of counseling experience, I cater each therapy session to your individual needs and comfort levels. I will encourage you to communicate openly and with ongoing feedback so I know what you expect and what you would like to focus on during sessions.  I am able provide in person or online counseling (online only in California). For the past 27 years, I have counseled families, couples, adults, and teenagers in a variety of settings and circumstances. I come alive when I can step into another person’s shoes and walk around for a while, learning about their stories and perspectives and how I can partner with them to enjoy the wholeness of a vibrant life.

name: Mina Yoon
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: I assist teens and adults who may be battling anxiety, depression, burnout, stress, low self-esteem, or people-pleasing tendencies. My clients seek to be empowered with a sense of agency and autonomy to become the catalyst of change in their lives. I will ensure to create a safe environment that is conducive to growth and healing. Together, we can increase self-awareness and insight, explore repeating patterns, and examine the values that you determine to be important to build a fuller, more meaningful life. I practice from a values-focused and strengths-based approach. I've had the privilege of working with many Asian-American clients as well as teens and young professionals. I prioritize working from a culturally-sensitive and person-centered perspective as each human experience is unique. Psychotherapist Virginia Satir once said, "I believe the greatest gift I can conceive of having from anyone is to be seen by them, heard by them, to be understood and touched by them." You deserve to be seen, heard, and understood! It would be an honor for me to walk alongside you on this part of your journey.

name: Goldie VanHeel
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Are you professionally successful but still struggle from low self esteem? Do you find yourself in friendships and relationships with people who take more than they give? Are you keenly aware of what other people want but not at all what you want? Do you have alcoholic or narcissistic parents or partners? If you're looking for codependency recovery or simply wondering what is codependency look no further! Dr. VanHeel is a Bay Area therapist who specializes in codependency and C-PTSD treatment. The Codependency Clinic is a San Francisco Bay Area psychotherapy practice that is specifically designed for codependency recovery. We treat adults facing codependency, Adult Children of Alcoholics, Adult Children of Narcissists, C-PTSD and couples. We offer Codependency groups, individual therapy and codependency retreats. We offer free 15 min consultations. Call Rachel our Intake coordinator at 858-922-7337 now! We usually respond within an hour.
issues: ['C-PTSD', 'Chronic Illness', 'EMDR']

name: Justine Lockerby
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, ASW
about: Welcome! I'm glad you're here. I would be honored to work alongside you as you seek healing around things like life transitions, relationship challenges, anxiety, depression, and grief. My therapy practice is deeply rooted in feminist and anti-racist frameworks, and is trauma-informed, trans-affirming, queer-affirming, and sex-positive. It is also shaped by my experiences and identities as a queer, white, working-class cis woman. This includes actively examining my own internal biases to support clients with intersecting identities. I hold a master's degree in clinical social work from Boston University. I draw on many modalities including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) and Trauma-Focused Therapy, and primarily use a Humanistic approach. I am trained in California as a Domestic Violence Counselor and have experience working with LGBTQ-identified survivors of domestic violence.

name: Natalie R Cargill
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Has something in your life become too much to bear? If you’re feeling lonely, alienated, confused about your relationships, hurt, angry, or feeling unheard; if you’re finding the stress of parenting overwhelming, or feeling defeated by cycles of conflict, I'd like to help you. I work with individuals, couples and families wounded by their family systems, who have experienced trauma or abuse, have struggled with a narcissistic parent or partner, or have been negatively impacted by relationships with their in-laws. I passionately believe that with the right help, you can move from suffering and uncertainty to clarity and empowerment. I support you with learning to have successful, loving relationships, to develop effective communication, healthy interpersonal boundaries, and meaningful connections. I provide trauma-informed care, using a relational and attachment-based approach, integrating art therapeutic processes when useful. My work includes family groups and I offer parent coaching. It takes courage to reach out for help when you're feeling most vulnerable. In my practice you’ll find gentle, compassionate care that fosters safety and empowerment. I seek to make space for everyone, and am mindful of cultural issues, systemic injustices, and social marginalization. To heal, your experiences need to be heard and validated.

I believe that life is about how we perceive things. I focus on the balance of life and the ways in which we can reframe our negative schemas. I put my all into every session and am elated to watch my clients grow. I invite you to reach out and see if I am the right fit for you. I will guide you to seeing things in ways you may not have seen before. I will walk you through techniques that will empower you.

name: Terri Phillips
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: I offer a variety of treatment options to help you achieve your goals.  One option, is that of Neurofeedback which is a non-invasive way to exercise your brain to resolve issues such as anxiety, autisim spectrum disorders, sleep, depression, focus.  I also have 10 years of experience working with assisting families who are separating and divorcing and helping them do so in a way that is best for their children.  I look forward to talking with you about how I can help you and always offer a FREE 15 min consultation for all services provided.

name: Megha Sundar
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: I know how intimidating vulnerability can be, especially with someone new, so thank you for taking the time to learn more about me. I grew up around a large Indian immigrant population in the Bay Area where I navigated the challenges of being Indian in an American society. We often struggled in learning how to express our emotions, felt overwhelmed by intense academic pressures, and experienced incredible dissonance navigating individualistic and collectivistic values. We also discussed ideas surrounding arranged marriages, interracial relationships, domestic violence, gender roles, queerness, and much more. My role as a therapist is not to provide you with “expert knowledge” but to ask questions in a way that invites deeper reflection on the stories of your life. Sometimes the messages we receive from society affect the stories we tell ourselves and steal the control we have over our lives. My hope is that we can work together to shift these narratives and regain power and agency over these stories. I am currently welcoming appointments via Telehealth. I also encourage you to reach out to me and we can coordinate a quick call to determine if I am the right fit for you. I look forward to working with you.

name: Celeste Birkhofer
title: Psychologist, PhD, PsyD
about: Most people benefit from having a trusted and trained professional to confide in and collaborate with - to make changes, deal with emotional pain, and search for understanding and meaning. Humans are complex beings and life is full of challenges. We all create "protective measures" to help us cope with difficulties we have encountered. Unconscious relational patterns, expectations, and beliefs about ourselves and others develop. Unfortunately, many of these ways of being interfere with creating satisfying lives and relationships. Our habituated patterns can be constricting, or lead to troubling behaviors or symptoms.  Therapy can help free you from what’s not working. You learn to be more curious, compassionate, and honest with yourself. Embracing the complexity of your mind and emotions expands your choices for how to live your life. It opens up more dimensions of yourself, valuable parts that are needed to create a more authentic and meaningful life. Seeking professional help with something as vitally important as your mental and emotional well-being is a courageous and worthwhile endeavor. I welcome the opportunity to talk to you, and see if I can help you on your journey of self discovery, healing and personal growth.

name: Trisha Elise Neimeyer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA
about: It’s most important to me that you feel safe and understood so you can be yourself.  You lead the work and I will be by your side, guiding through humor, somatic awareness, childhood curiosity & mindfulness from a existential/experiential & trauma informed lens. I offer home & ecotherapy  sessions, after consultation and assessment, for an additional fee. Finding a therapist can be a task, especially if you're new to therapy. Call/text/email to set up a free consultation to see if we are a good fit before investing your time & money.

name: Mark Falls
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I have been in the field of psychology since 1985. I am licensed as Marriage Family Therapist (1989)  and Clinical Psychologist (1992).What guides my work is the belief that everyone, no matter their behavior, is doing the very best they can in that moment. Most often, aberrant behavior is the result of beliefs learned in childhood that are brought forward into adulthood which are no longer appropriate or functional. It is my belief that therapy is about learning more adaptive behavior, "the next right action", and then consistently practicing it with enthusiasm and courage. In my relationship therapy work with couples, the focus is teaching couples deep listening skills in an attempt to help partners feel truly "seen" and "known". Informed by the work of Harville Hendrix, it's been my experience that when a person can feel heard in a truly non-defensive interaction, healing can occur.

name: Patti Britton
title: PhD, MPH, ACSE, FAACS, ACS
about: If you are looking to resolve your sexual roadblocks--to overcome your lack of sexual satisfaction, sexual inexperience, sexual or relationship breakdowns, shame, fear or guilt-- or if you just want to learn how to reboot your sex life, you've landed in the right place. I am the pioneer of the new field of sex coaching and a seasoned sexuality expert. I work with individuals and couples seeking the best of sex coaching to help them become their authentic sexual selves and feel the joys of lasting sexual pleasure, alone and with a partner. My unique method is guaranteed! Celebrate your sexual self.  My treatment model (MEBES) integrates mind, emotions, body/behaviors/body image issues, energy and spirit.  My private practice is virtual and in person. I bring my 40+ years as a professional and the privilege of my life experience to serve your needs. This is a talk-only sex coaching route. I am a world recognized leader in sexual health and pleasure. I train sex coaches and sex experts around the world, at SexCoachU.com. My credentials speak for themself. Visit my site to learn more: drpattibritton.com

name: Brad Shore
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MS
about: As a therapist I've learned: "TALKING HELPS"! When you're not feeling your feelings, or you're 'alone' with complicated, confusing feelings, then hopelessness or depression can set in. Are you having difficulties in your relationships or other aspects of your life? "Stuffed away" feelings can lead to many problematic symptoms in one's life---by beginning to feel 'buried' feelings, and learning to "tolerate" these feelings, we begin to have improved relationships with ourself and others. As your therapist, I will be on this journey of exploration and understanding with you. My YouTube channel can be found at YouTube.com/BradShore. I provide client-centered counseling using a psychodynamic therapeutic approach--but most importantly, a caring approach. The process is a collaborative and active relationship between you and me, and we'll explore your feelings and beliefs in a safe and trusting environment. I am a fee-for-service therapist. This means I'm not on health insurance plans and your confidentiality is protected.

name: Kateline Medina
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Have you been feeling stressed, overwhelmed, or lost? Contemplating whether or not therapy can help? Let me be the first to say, this is your moment to do something different in your life. Everyone needs a little help sometimes. We may not choose where we come from but we can choose where we go. You are not alone and are not a burden. Let me be here to support you in your journey. As a therapist, I find it is important to practice self-care, engage in self-love, and establish healthy boundaries. My goal is to help individuals live fulfilling lives and be a part of meaningful relationships. Whether it be the relationship we have with ourselves, friends, partners, or our family members. You exist and you matter in those relationships. The beautiful thing about being human is that we can progress and evolve into a preferred version of ourselves at any point in our lives. It will start with you, and I will be here to help you along the way.

name: Tammy Carter
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, LPCC
about: I enjoy helping others reach their full potential by gaining courage and confidence while learning ways to overcome the obstacles life can bring. Such as a loss of a loved one whether unexpectedly or naturally, issues with marriage or family relationships, divorce, health changes or addictions. My goal is to support my clients through a difficult time, help them to have hope, and tap into their inner resilience. I have experience with complicated grief. My heart is to walk along side those that have been affected by violent or unexpected death during an unbearable time, supporting them toward healing. I enjoy helping my clients gain insight into the important relationships in their lives, and their need for closeness. I help them find any disconnection and how to heal it. I create a safe space for them to explore their inner emotional needs and support them through to healing. I have specialized training to help with Trauma with EMDR. I have specialty with Violent Loss helping families and friends cope with sudden loss or violent loss of a loved one. I am trained to work with individuals, couples and families, adolescents, young adults or adults using Emotional Focused Therapy.

name: Michael James Doyle
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Being a human being is complicated.  As humans, we require a witness to our life experience and emotions.  It is my honor to be that witness for each of my clients.  For an adolescence, it can provide a rare space where they can work through feeling, conflicts and develop more adaptive ways of being.  Our lives are full of change, and it can be the source of stress.  For adults too who are stuck or are struggling with feelings, life, and trauma a safe place offers comfort. Therapy can provide a space for curiosity, discovery, and creation.  A place where meaning and authenticity can be found. I am a therapist who works from an affirmative,  trauma-informed, client-centered, evidence-based lens within talk therapy.  I also incorporate, somatic awareness, mindfulness, attachment strategies. I specialize in issues of sexual orientation, and gender orientation concerns especially among adolescents, trauma, and addiction. It is my personal belief that as human beings we are stronger and more resilient than the problems that bring us into therapy.  “I am passionately curious.  I believe through curiosity and willingness the truth becomes available and the authentic is possible".                                                        I Am Accepting New Clients At This Time.

name: Jordan Davis
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Hello! I am only offering sessions via Telehealth (online video/phone) across the state of California. If you have Medi-Cal, I take CenCal (Santa Barbara County) & Gold Coast (Ventura County). I welcome motivated individuals who are ready to go on a journey of healing, self-discovery, & personal growth. I have a strong passion working with college students, adults, & the older adult/elderly community. Whether you're dealing with anxiety, depression, stress or working on your self-esteem, anger management, or communication skills, I am here to create a safe, comfortable, & non-judgmental environment for you to open up & be vulnerable As a culturally sensitive therapist, I am here to guide and assist you in becoming the person you want to be. I provide healthy coping strategies and skills to help alleviate what you are going through. I specialize in using Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) but also use whatever modality/approach would be most beneficial for my clients' needs. If you feel like you are ready to go on this journey of healing, self-discovery, and personal growth, please reach out. You have the power and control over your life and can choose how you want your future self to be. I offer a free 15 minute phone consult (if you are private pay) to discuss your therapeutic needs and to see if we are a good fit. Thank you.

name: Debra Warner
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Many of my clients are survivors of abuse. The type of abuse varies, but includes mental, emotional, sexual, and physical abuse. Often times these individuals want someone to listen to them without judgement and foe someone to believe them. When clients tell me they have experienced abuse, my response is the same. I thank the individual for sharing their story because I understand how difficult it is. It is especially difficult for my male clients. My clients are looking to understand and process the abuse in the hopes of healing and to have healthier relationships. Dr. Debra is a forensic psychologist that has devoted her professional efforts to helping men and their loved ones confront and conquer the long term effects of trauma on the male psyche. She frequently addresses issues related to the #MenToo movement, challenges masculinity stereotypes, and works to dismantle stigmas related to male trauma. Your experiences matter and you deserve someone who will listen and believe you without judgement. I am here to do that.

name: Ekaterini Constantine LMFT Psychotherapy Services
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Feeling fatigued, burnout, overwhelmed, or even confused are very common issues my clients describe as their chief complaint. These symptoms may have underlying causes that lead to the need to seek healing and the wish to carve one's own path in life in a safe and caring environment.  I have extensive experience working with individuals who want to understand and overcome their issues related to addiction, codependency, trauma, attachment trauma, self-doubt, depression, anxiety, toxic guilt and shame. I use a framework that is insight-oriented that helps the client become more aligned with who they truly are and to create space for autonomy and connection. I am also trained in EMDR, with the EMDR Institute, which is an empirically validated treatment for trauma and an interactive psychotherapy technique used to relieve psychological stress. I’m here to support you on your journey of healing and self-discovery. I am also offering telehealth services during this time. I offer therapy in both English and Greek, in person or via secure TeleHealth (phone or video conferencing).

name: Rick Hobbs
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I choose to work with couples and the transgender community because the work is meaningful and rewarding. I use Gottman Method Couples Therapy because it draws from over 40 years of peer-reviewed and replicated research from over 3,000 real couples.  As a member of the World Professional Association for Transgender Health (WPATH) and an affirming cisgender clinician, I offer gender-nonconforming folks in California an assessment & letter service for gender-affirming care.  My fee is easy to understand: $1.00 a minute. John & Julie Gottmans’ work with over 3,000 couples has identified what creates lasting change in relationships from what simply feels good in the moment. The interventions' effectiveness in increasing friendship, conflict management, and creation of shared meaning is reliable. I also write letters for the transgender community for HRT and surgeries. Teletherapy: Is there a better place to start the process of opening up than the safety & comfort of your own home? You can put on your sweats & click "Join Video Appointment.” I offer a free 15-minute consultation. Click “Website” on the left.

name: Kate Sutton
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Let’s talk about sex and relationships! I am here to help you feel comfortable working through the hard stuff, and sex and relationship issues can be some of the hardest stuff for people to talk about. Together, we’ll create a comfortable, judgment-free space to explore your wants and needs, improve communication with others in your life, and promote intimate, meaningful, and healthy (sexual) relationships. My aim is to help you, and any potentially involved partner(s), to reach your full personal, relationship, and sexual potential in order to lead your happiest and most fulfilling life.   I am passionate about working with sexual & relationship difficulties because they are so important to life satisfaction. I provide a safe and welcoming space to discuss anything from sexual/relationship issues postpartum, to gender dysphoria, making good sex great, erectile problems, pain during sex, kink, or disturbing sexual interests. I've been doing therapy for over a decade with sex and relationship specific issues, as well as general concerns. I am the recipient of multiple awards, and have given many talks & written many publications on the topic of sexuality. You've taken the first hard step by looking for a therapist. I look forward to hearing from you to see if we're a good fit!

name: Luis Resendez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: ACCEPTING REFERRALS FOR VIRTUAL APPOINTMENTS ONLY DUE TO COVID-19 .  You won't read another "Are you feeling stressed or sad?" headline here because chances are you've heard it all before already.  You've clicked on this ad because you're sick and tired of things like anxiety and depression ruining your life.  It's time to take your life back and find the peace and balance you deserve.  Allow me to do the honor to walk with you side by side in the journey to living a healthy and productive life.  I specialize in men's mental health issues and trauma.  I am also trained in Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) therapy as well as Trauma Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.  I take a warm, but direct approach to my work.  I'm not the sweater vest wearing therapist you're used to seeing on TV. Modern problems require modern therapy. I also am offering virtual sessions for clients during this difficult time. Please note that most insurances do not cover couple's therapy sessions and would be covered directly by the clients.

name: Daishea Poole
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: Are anxiety and stress keeping you from living your life to your fullest potential? Are you feeling stress weighing on you internally or causing you to feel exhausted and hopeless? Together we will explore ways to grow, further develop self-acceptance and unearth traumatic experiences and daily stressors that are hindering you from achieving this potential. I will be available to provide an unbiased listening ear and warm spirit as you reimagine the life you want for yourself. In this safe and accepting environment, we will develop an action plan to better manage your unique symptoms and your life.   I specialize in anxiety and depression due to challenges related to relationship difficulties, life transition, existential crises, and/or identity issues. I enjoy working with teenagers providing behavioral therapy to address behavioral and educational concerns. I provide both individual and couples therapy.  I utilize a client-centered approach to fully understand my client’s perspective, values, and beliefs. We will collaboratively work together to achieve your individual and relational goals. Let’s begin your healing journey. Please book your free 20-minute consultation.

name: Sherri Hubbard
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I am accepting adult and children ages 10-17. The world is full of stressors and we can all use a little support. Is there something out of balance in either your life or the life of your child? Have life's daily problems become unmanageable? Are you concerned about changes in mood/behavior?  Are you wondering if a therapist could help? Through video sessions, you can get to the heart of the matter and start getting some relief. You do not have to face things alone, I am here to walk with you on the path towards peace and balance. Changing the way you see yourself and your struggles can change everything. Children and adults need support in healing wounds of the past, learning to love self and others, to calm a busy mind, and how to live a balanced and happy life. I specialize working with children who have anxiety, social anxiety, and emotional distress and supporting  adults who are experiencing difficulty with anxiety and life transitions. Making changes is hard. We crave a magic fix, an instant transformation. The truth is we are all on a journey. Learning to better connect with our own heart, and allowing others to connect with us. Come explore your inner world and increase your sense of peace.  "The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change" Carl Rogers

name: Euriah (Dong E.) Lee
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MSMFT, LMFT
about: We all know life can be stressful and filled with different challenges that overwhelm us. It is only natural that sometimes you may feel lost and helpless when you try to deal with these matters by yourself, including life transitions, work stress, relationship difficulties, cultural/racial problems and so on. I would like to assist you in navigating your path to better understand these issues, find best ways to manage them, and process your emotions in a safe place, so that you can better yourself and achieve your goals through that experience. In our work together, I will help you to live a more meaningful and joyful life. I specialize in stress management, self-esteem/exploration, relationship issues, CBT and EMDR. I utilize and incorporate different therapeutic modalities/interventions, including mindfulness, cognitive behavioral approaches, and strength-based and trauma-informed therapy, to address different issues depending on your needs. I’ve worked in schools, agencies, and clinics where I’ve encountered people from diverse backgrounds and age groups with whom I've been grateful to work. I integrate my experiences with compassion and sensitivity to provide integrative and culturally-informed care in a warm, nonjudgmental space. Reach out, I look forward to speaking with you! 살다보면 인생이란 것이 참으로 힘들고 어려운 문제들로 가득하게 느껴질 때가 많습니다. 그런 순간에 "나만 이렇게 힘들어 하는 건 아닐까? 왜 나는 이렇게 방황하고 있는걸까?" 라는 생각에 더욱 지치고, 힘들고, 외로워 졌던 경험이 있으신가요? 그런 힘들고 외로운 순간들, 오랜시간의 고통 속에 아파했던 시간들 가운데에 저희 Time for Me Therapy가 함께 해드리겠습니다. 삶의 여러가지 상황에서 상처를 받고 있는 많은 분들이 저와의 뜻 깊은 시간을 통해 마음의 치유와 함께 더 나은 자신, 더 행복한 삶을 향해 한 걸음 더 가까이 다가가 실 수 있기를 희망합니다. 공감과 존중의 마음으로 따뜻하게 여러분의 변화와 성장을 위해 함께 노력할 것을 약속 드립니다. 저희 Time for Me Therapy는 내담자 개개인의 문제와 상황, 필요에 맞춰 다양한 상담 기술과 경험에 기반한 개인 맞춤 치료를 제공하고 있습니다. 저희 상담센터의 공동 센터장이자 7년 이상의 경력을 소유한 유리아 (Euriah) 상담사는 우울증, 불안장애, 자기발전/탐구, 가족/부모자녀/부부/연인 관계문제 등을 전문으로 치료하고 있으며 인지 행동 치료 (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) 와 안구 운동 민감소실 및 재처리요법 (EMDR), 긍정적인 자녀교육 프로그램인 Triple P: Positive Parenting의 훈련을 공식적으로 수료하여 상담치료에 반영하고 있습니다. 또한 유리아 상담사는 학교, 비영리 단체, 병원 등 다양한 곳에서 다양한 연령대의 여러 문화권의 사람들을 상담해 왔습니다. 한국에서 태어나고 자란 경험과, 미국에서 성장하여 지금까지 살아가고 있는 경험을 토대로 현재 미국에 거주하고 계신 한국 분들에게 더욱 친밀한 모습과 언어로 편안한 상담 서비스를 제공해 드릴 것을 약속 드립니다. 주저하지 마시고 언제든지 편하게 연락 해주세요. 내담자 분의 연락을 기다리겠습니다. 감사합니다!

name: Lindsay Evans
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Many of the people I work with come to therapy because they feel stuck or overwhelmed, are seeking relief from anxiety or depression, need support as they adjust to a new life circumstance, or want to develop a better understanding of themselves.  During therapy, we will explore unhelpful patterns by looking at the relationship between your thoughts, behaviors and emotions and the ways in which these things are interfering or impacting your quality of life. I can offer tools and concepts that may be helpful for coping with difficult emotions, improving relationships, promoting self-acceptance, and regaining balance in your life. I work with adults who are seeking help for depression, anxiety, relationship issues, stress management, life transitions, and issues at the intersection of physical and emotional health, such as insomnia and chronic pain. I use a flexible, individualized approach and draw from a variety of evidence-based approaches, such as cognitive behavioral therapy.  When you decide to look for a therapist, you may already be feeling overwhelmed. The process of finding a trusting, warm, and well-qualified therapist can be challenging; however, my goal is to try to make it as easy and seamless as possible for you. If you think that I may be of help to you, please contact me to schedule a free 20-minute phone consultation.

name: Jody Mastroianni-Allen
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: We are all born with an innate ability to grow and heal. During difficult times, we may lose our insight into this power and begin to feel lost and overwhelmed. It is important to remember, especially during these times, that we are not alone on this journey. Whether you are feeling overwhelmed by depression, anxiety, interpersonal relationships, work-life balance or parenting, I can help guide you through these challenging situations.  Welcoming you in an open, non-judgmental way, I will help you reconnect with your own inherent strengths, while building healthy coping mechanisms to deal with life's challenges.  I will help guide you through difficult feelings and situations that hinder your ability to fully prosper, while supporting your journey toward balance and well-being.  Reaching out for help is a challenging call to make and you've already started the process by simply visiting this page. I offer a free telephone consultation. Call me and let's begin the process of your healing together.

name: Kristy Kirby
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about:
Are you frustrated with the direction of your life, feeling sad, lonely or anxious? Are you a teen or young adult looking for someone impartial to talk to? Could you and your family benefit from additional support? It can be hard to seek outside help when you or a family member is feeling sad, anxious, angry, or stressed. The first step is recognizing you're ready to make positive changes.  The second step is finding the right therapist to assist you in reaching your goals. I'd like to help. People, especially teenagers, often feel misunderstood and powerless.  I strive to create a safe and supportive environment in which problems can be explored so you can rebuild positive relationships, fulfill your authentic self or give your teen the opportunity to create a sense of self-worth and empower them to make positive choices. If my philosophy and therapeutic approach match what you are looking for, please contact me to discuss your needs. 

You can also view my website for more information at www.kristykirby.com
issues: ['Coping Skills', 'Divorce', 'Domestic Abuse', 'Domestic Violence', 'Grief', 'Parenting', 'Peer Relationships', 'Self Esteem']

name: Brian Loveless
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: I work with kids, teens, adults, romantic partners, and families. My goal is to create a safe, trusting, and uplifting environment for my clients to grow, gain insight and make meaningful change. Through collaboration, I feel that we all have the ability to heal from our pasts and learn and grow in the present. I have a strong passion for working with the LGBTQ community and I specialize in LGBTQ issues including gender identity and body dysmorphia, depression, anxiety, trauma. Before venturing into the world of mental health care, I ran a gymnastics program for children and teens. Here, I spent years building relationships with kids and families from all backgrounds. By creating a physically and emotionally safe environment, kids were able to learn at their own pace and feel more free to communicate their worries, fears, and struggles with self confidence and self esteem. I have also worked in a mentoring and social skills development capacity for families with children who have special needs. These experiences have also impacted my interest and training in child and adolescent psychotherapy. Feel free to reach out if you're interested in possibly working together!

name: Cianna Edge
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: If you are struggling with any troublesome personal or relational issues, I would love to help. My goal as a Therapist is to join with my clients on a personal level to provide emotional support, coupled with useful feedback, and walk along side them through their life journey to achieve change and overcome difficulties. I am honored when allowed to be part of each and every healing process. With empathy and understanding I work toward healing, change, and growth with each client in hopes that they can reach a sense of gratification in their life. I have a gift of being able to understand people and earn their trust, which has aided in my passion to work with minors and individuals struggling with depression and self-harm, as well as with couples and families to increase communication. We all go through life difficulties, many of which consume us, but it is my perspective that each situation can be worked through with the right amount of patience and understanding.

name: Emily Overstreet
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: It takes a great deal of courage to begin therapy, and thus I strive to create a space in which individuals feel truly seen, heard, and deeply understood. I believe that people are intrinsically resilient, and I will work with you to gain a deeper understanding of yourself so that you can make meaningful changes in your life. Together, we will work toward navigating difficult transitions, improving the quality of your relationships, and developing more effective coping skills. My style is warm and collaborative, and I always tailor treatment to individual needs. I work with adults with a wide range of difficulties, from anxiety and depression to struggles in relationships to prenatal and postpartum challenges to concerns around self-esteem and identity. Feeling comfortable with a therapist is crucial to make the most out of sessions. I am happy to offer a free 15-minute phone consultation to see if we might be a good match. I then recommend 2-3 sessions to see if working together feels like a good fit. I look forward to hearing from you!
