name: Sharon D. Dodge
title: Pre-Licensed Professional, MEd, MACP, APCC, AMFT
about: Ideally, I hope for clients who want change, or who are in a huge shift in their lives. The most secret, vulnerable parts of ourselves require a trusted, open sanctuary for healing to begin.  Life can be difficult, cruel at times, but the luminous is real, and contains genuine relief. We always have options. We cannot always see them. A good fit for me is someone who wants a therapist who will really listen, but who brings a lot of lived experience. I have desire to see people thrive and grow, set a new course.  My clients usually find their courage, as we work, slower or faster. Resilience is always there. You have gotten here. Am skilled in relationship and  attachment issues, persons of all ages experiencing anxiety and depression, or who are suffering under intense interpersonal or professional relationship challenges, health crises, and issues related to  care of aging family members.  I have trained in Somatic Psychotherapy and EMDR. I help people talk about difficult things. Am a seasoned, veteran through ALL the life stages. I first worked in my life with special needs learners. No one has ever seemed "odd" to me. Even more of my life has been spent working with artists, in the business end of creativity. My interest and experience of family of origin issues and trauma, informs all my work, with all ages, in many challenges.

name: Natalie Thill
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MA, ASW
about: Do you feel stuck and unable to move froward from past traumas? Are negative thoughts and beliefs about yourself keeping you from reaching your fullest potential? It can feel so overwhelming to begin to address your emotions and thoughts that you may rather want to 'turn them off' altogether. It can be exhausting to confront our traumas and isolating to begin to address these issues. When these traumas occur it affects our ability to self regulate our emotions. This often leads to unhealthy coping skills, negative thoughts, and feeling like we are constantly in a state of fight or flight. Together, we can begin to address some of the problems you have experienced that have led to unhealthy coping skills and distressing symptoms. We can create and strengthen the relationship you have with yourself, and allow you to experience an increase in self love, self respect, and self esteem. In our work together we can create a safe and trusting place for you to explore and strengthen   your relationship with yourself. As an EMDR trained therapist, I am passionate about working with trauma survivors. Through the lens of IFS therapy we can begin to heal these past unpleasant experiences and create a sense of self connectedness and safety.

name: Jessica R. Sardas
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, AMFT
about: Do you ever feel like you have to hide parts of who you are from the rest of the world? Are you stuck in patterns that feel hard to break? I’m here to help you work through these issues. Many people I work with come in for anxiety, difficulties in relationships, boundaries, perfectionism, creative blocks, low self-esteem. You don't have to handle these struggles alone. Being in therapy can help you find new perspectives around old issues that keep coming up. I also work with and celebrate people of all genders and sexualities. I maintain curiosity about your unique identity and find it important to hold space for all of you. Therapy can be exciting, but also challenging. Together we can explore the inner most parts of you, parts that may be hard to see on your own. As you bring your experiences in to therapy we can look at how they are manifesting in your life. You will notice change as you take new perspectives from therapy out into the world. We may discover that there are parts of you working in your best interest and other parts working against what you really want. It’s time to look at what’s in your way. ***Currently not accepting new patients, but if you'd like referrals for therapists who work similarly please don't hesitate to reach out.***

name: Su Fern Khoo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: My work as a therapist is focused on accompanying individuals (14 years+) and couples through their struggles with life transitions, depression, anxiety, relationship issues, and unprocessed trauma or difficult childhood experiences. Improving your quality of life is my goal. I know that feeling heard, seen, understood, and connected to someone you trust in a safe and non-judgmental space is essential for the process of healing, finding new direction and making healthy long-lasting changes. With a warm, person-centered approach, I meet clients where they are. Using a humanistic and attachment oriented lens I collaboratively explore the origins of difficult issues, and offer coping skills toward the healthy management of emotions and life stressors. My aim is for clients to take the change they experience in session out into their daily lives. The thought of opening up to a stranger can feel vulnerable and daunting at times. I hope to provide you with connection, support, insightfulness and reliable coping skills.  Please feel free to reach out to me for a no cost 15 min consultation. Cada persona tiene sus momentos en la vida en los que siente que "algo no está bien". Estos momentos vienen por muchas razones: pérdida, cambio, acumulación de luchas entre nosotros o los demás, patrones de relación que no podemos cambiar aunque lo intentemos, trauma o una infancia difícil, soledad, miedo, sentimientos de tristeza, ansiedad o inquietud, etc. En estos momentos buscamos la claridad, el sentimiento o la nueva dirección que necesitamos, o simplemente una forma de manejar bien nuestras emociones y comportamientos que están impactando nuestra vida y la vida de los demás. Estoy capacitada y experimentada en varias terapias basadas en evidencia, que adapto al viaje personal de cada cliente. Estos incluyen terapia cognitivo-conductual, enfoques psicodinámicos, enfoques psicoanalíticos de Jung, enfoques del sistema familiar, teoría del apego, terapia centrada en las emociones y terapia cognitiva basada en mindfulness. Como terapeuta licenciada, me esfuerzo por combinar mis habilidades, experiencia y calidez hacia la sanación y la plenitud de mis clientes. Sé que sentirse escuchado, comprendido y conectado con quien confía en un espacio sin prejuicios es esencial para procesar y sanar nuestros problemas más profundos. Este es el espacio que proporciono.

name: Jane Reardon
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: If you're having difficulty navigating some of your relationships and feel stuck in certain aspects of your life, let's explore what's holding you back . Through a spontaneous and highly interactive therapeutic relationship, you'll discover correlations between your personal history, any traumatic events and your present reality. Combining EMDR, positive psychology and specific strategies to re-direct your neural pathways,  I'd like to help you separate what was from what is, and where you'd like to be, so you can stop repeating destructive patterns and become available to live the life you love. In a warm and supportive environment, I will help you identify the issues that are diminishing your quality of life. We can focus on events and core beliefs that may be effecting your relationships, your career or your creative process and how you can resolve what's impeding your progress in each of these areas. As your therapist, my goal is to find what is causing you distress and why, expanding your awareness of a true and authentic sense of Self.  With new self-regard, you will increase your resiliency, becoming more  vital in experiencing and managing your feelings, your relationships and your life.

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, CCLS, LMFT

I have an empathetic and collaborative approach when interacting with children, adolescents and families. I am skilled in supporting parents with children at all stages of development. name: Sally Hayman
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: It is my firm belief that people do their best with the situations life hands them. My goal as a therapist is to help people work through their stuck places, let go of old behaviors that helped them survive in the past but are no longer useful, and learn new behaviors that will contribute to greater enjoyment and connection in their lives.  I see myself as an active guide in this process, and I am enriched by seeing people learn to accept themselves and others, and thus live the fullest and most satisfying life possible. I am a licensed clinical social worker and have been in private practice since 1981. I have extensive experience in family systems, cognitive behavioral and psychodynamic therapies.  My clients include adolescent girls, adult men and women, and couples and families. I am comfortable working in a solution-focused, brief treatment model for specific issues, and I also enjoy working longer-term with clients regarding family of origin or other more complex issues.

name: Dustin Kerrone
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Love. Joy. Ecstasy. Awe. In my 16 years of clinical experience, I’ve discovered that we each have far more capacity for these expansive feelings than we often realize. Whether you are struggling to get through the daily grind, or feel ready to fly through the stars, I can work with you collaboratively to shape a life that fulfills your highest dreams, and maybe even soars beyond them! I’m eager to share what I’ve learned about our abilities to break out of old patterns of shame, hurt, and fear into fruitful creativity and communion with the most inspiring aspects of being alive. I find that for most of us, we heal best when we can feel completely accepted without judgment or critique by another, and then learn for ourselves how to value the full range of own emotional experience. By relaxing our self-control and increasing self-compassion, feelings can get unstuck and flow more freely, generating new vitality, action, and wonder. Wherever you are in California, we can establish a safe space on Zoom where I will help you cultivate your own distinctive insight, wisdom, and imagination. I combine many powerful modalities, including Jungian inner work, neuroscience, fitness, career, and spirituality, but I will carefully tailor my approach to honor your unique needs and possibilities.

name: Natalia Boucher

Therapy can help you find the underlying causes of why you feel the way you do and finally move towards relief. I would be honored to work together with you on your journey of self-discovery, healing, and growth.  My therapy style offers a safe, warm and compassionate environment while encouraging my clients to recognize their strengths and weaknesses within themselves. I work from a psychodynamic/psychoanalytic perspective but I offer a personalized approach tailored to each client's needs. My training includes Gottman Method Couples Therapy; Imago Clinical Training;  Sex and Therapy Track, 2016 CAMFT Annual Conference; Saturday Series at the Krevoy Institute for Eating Disorders and EMDR. I am fully bilingual in Spanish and English. I offer evening appointments. I'm available for an introductory free phone consultation. I look forward to hearing from you and answering any questions you may have.

name: Courtney Funk
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
about: Welcome, I'm glad you're here! Finding time for yourself can be a daunting task, especially with the heavy demands of school/work.  My client's are primarily college students or recent graduates, seeking balance in their lives and a space to process life events. I strive to create a genuine, warm, trusting and collaborative space where my clients feel empowered to explore, process and heal. I utilize a trauma informed, cognitive behavioral framework while incorporating mindfulness and if appropriate, EMDR (eye movement desensitization and reprocessing). EMDR can be an effective approach in addressing trauma and many of our long held beliefs that keep an individual feeling ‘stuck’. I believe it is critical to approach therapy through a cultural lens addressing generational and systemic oppressions. My practice is a non-judgmental, antiracist, inclusive space where all individuals are welcome and safe. Most importantly to your healing process is finding a therapist that is right for YOU. Reach out today to see if we'd be a good fit!

name: Karen Schneller
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, CEDS
about: You are living a daily battle in your head about what you can eat, how much you should exercise, if you are worthy of taking up space.  You are consumed by counting calories and by the negative voice inside that tells you, you’ll never be good enough or thin enough, smart enough or pretty enough.  You are fed up with how the society/culture tells you how you should look and feel and behave. Your behaviors have you feeling exhausted and depleted and you wonder how you can go on another day.    Others may think you have it all together on the outside, but the mental torture inside is killing you and feel like your life is shrinking.   The great news is that you can find freedom in your life and heal your relationship with food and your body.  I promise, you can!  As someone who has been helping others heal their relationship with food and their body for the last 17 years, I understand how lonely the road can be.  It often takes expert help to find your way out.  Give yourself this gift!  As a certified eating disorder specialist, I can guide you on your path to healing and recovery.  If you have been scared to reach out, now is the time.  I offer a safe and non-judgmental space to explore these issues.  Please visit my website and email or call me. Take the risk!  It will be worth it.  People do recover and so can you!

name: Nancy Adams Langley
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: If you have made it to this website, you are already on your way to resolving your conflict. My primary work is with adults and couples struggling with relationship and career issues.  I also specialize in mood disorders (anxiety and depression), loss and grief and in decision making. I focus on helping individuals and couples to bring awareness (mindfulness) to their feelings, bodies, moods and dreams to access their insight. I have been a meditator for 20 years (Vipassana) and bring a mindfulness focus to my work as a result. I have 16 years of Hospice experience.  I have an expertise in the area of loss and grief, which is applicable both in cases of bereavement and in losses that occur generally in one's life.

I firmly believe in the goodness, resilience and innate strength of all individuals. My passion for this work is found in developing meaningful, compassionate connections with my clients. The growth borne of relationship is powerful. I would appreciate the opportunity to learn about you and to partner with you in meeting your goals.

name: Anne D Case
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: In everyone's lives there are times of difficulty, life transitions, unwanted change, loss, and fears.  Talking to someone who can assist you in sorting out your thoughts and feelings about these challenges can be very helpful.  If you are feeling trapped in unhealthy patterns that are keeping you stuck or making you feel badly about yourself, I can help you identify them and how to change them to feel more empowered and fulfilled.  If you are experiencing stress, we can work together to identify and address its causes and develop multiple tools to manage and decrease it. Each client is unique, bringing his/her own life experiences, strengths, and outlook to how he/she views things.  My treatment approach reflects this uniqueness and depends on each individual's needs.  I utilize an eclectic approach, pulling from psychodynamic, cognitive behavioral therapy, control mastery, and humanistic theory. I work collaboratively with my clients, utilizing well-developed listening skills and compassion to hear their needs and goals to then help them on their paths of growth and desired change.  Outside of my private practice, I facilitate groups for cancer patients and their caregivers at the Cancer Support Community.

name: Nicole Flowers
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Since 2020, even the most resilient have found themselves facing disorientation, high emotions and internal conflict causing them to seek out therapy for the first time. I have experience helping high achieving, overthinking adults who may feel isolated, lonely, or disconnected to themselves, to others and to life and want change but don't know how or where to start. Clients who need a reflective, highly supportive and direct approach have found value in working with me. We will discuss frequency of sessions with the intended length of therapy to meet your needs and presenting problem. I will ask what you want - what will a successful therapy look like? In a collaborative way, we will tend to the deepest struggles and this can lead to a more fulfilling life. One of the greatest predictors of a successful therapeutic relationship, is goodness of fit. If what you have read resonates, let's set up a 20-minute free phone consultation. We will discuss what brings you to therapy, fees (I offer a sliding scale) and frequency of sessions. You can also select a time on my website. Let's talk!
issues: ['Alcohol Use', 'Codependency', 'Coping Skills', 'Grief', 'Life Coaching', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Spirituality']

name: Brittany Connor
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Are you feeling lost, stuck, or overwhelmed? Our various experiences can have an impact on this; from day to day stressors to trauma, our emotions can become difficult to manage, resulting in difficulty in our lives, including in our relationships, in managing emotions, in our thoughts, in our goals, and in our responsibilities. I specialize in anxiety and depression. Utilizing an integrative and eclectic approach, including CBT, DBT, Solution Focused Therapy, and Narrative Therapy, we can work together to explore and develop tools to effectively manage stressors, process trauma, and develop goals to help you feel more fulfilled and in control of your life. It shows a lot of strength to reach out for support. I am a person-centered therapist who believes you are the expert on your life and I am here to help guide you on your path of healing. I look forward to connecting with you.

name: Behavioral Health Solutions 365, INC.
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, DBH, LCSW, MSW
about: Welcome to Behavioral Health Solutions 365, INC. (BHS 365); we are your bridge to Wellness! At BHS 365, we provide strengths based, holistic, and wellness coaching services. Everyone experiences life challenges where assistance is needed. Asking for help is a Strength! At BHS 365, we'll help you to address issues associated with a career change, significant life events, codependence & boundary setting, interpersonal ralationships and the like.  Our professional coaches will help you to develop sustainable goals and a clear vision for your future. Call today for a free 15 minute consultation! At BHS 365, we specialize in behavioral health! Our team of professional coaches will help you to regain your emotional equilibrium. You'll be able to see how an imbalance anywhere in your life, is an imbalance everywhere. BHS 365 holistic coaching strenghthens your ability to take charge of your life and to show up as your true self. Call today! BHS 365 also specialize in Mediation Services for the courts, private groups, local and government agencies. Call today for our competitive rates!

name: Susie Morgan
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, BCETS
about: I specialize in the treatment of trauma.  My approach moves beyond being an empathetic listener to using state-of-the-art, evidenced-based strategies for creating relief and change.  I have found EMDR Therapy to be a powerful, neurologically-based approach to address memories that have become "stuck".  These frozen memories can be either severe traumas (abuse, rape, or life-threatening injury) or small but significant adverse life events.  EMDR can effectively resolve memories that have made the past feel very much present and have forced current life experiences to be filtered through a negative, distorted lense. To address the complexity of symptoms experienced by my clients, I continually pursue further development of my clinical skills. I am a Certified Therapist, Approved Consultant, and Trainer through the EMDR International Association and have extensive experience and advanced training in using EMDR to treat PTSD, Dissociation, Anxiety, & Mood Disorders. I have completed Bessel van der Kolk’s Certificate Program in Traumatic Stress Studies.  I have substantial training in Cognitive-Behavioral treatments from UC Berkeley and David Burns, MD of Stanford University and the Feeling Good Institute.  I am also fully trained and accredited by the Amen Clinic and Certified by the Institute of Heartmath.

name: Angeline Escobedo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MS, AMFT
about: Life is difficult, but when facing anxiety, body dysmorphia, depression, eating disorders, emotional disturbance, depression, divorce, family conflict, relationship issues, or trauma, it can be overwhelming. I’m here to help you face and overcome these issues in a compassionate, safe, and effective way using evidence-based techniques. I’ll empower you through transformative therapy designed to help you understand yourself, grow, and realize your full potential. I’ll help you tap into your resilience and strength while creating new tools and strategies for success. I work with individuals, couples, families, adults, and adolescents. I provide my services through convenient, safe, and affordable telehealth visits (phone and video sessions). My goal is to provide an accepting, collaborative, unconditional, and emphatic partnership. You can break free from these issues and find your true self starting today! As a Registered Associate Marriage and Family Therapist (AMFT), I have completed my Master’s Degree and am acquiring my hours for full licensure. I provide services through my employer BetterPsych, under the supervisor of a Ph.D. Clinical Supervisor, Dr. Cameron Froude (LMFT 97439). My Associate Registration number is AMFT126740.

name: Holly Wood
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: My name is Holly and I am a Trauma-Informed and Board Certified Clinical Sexologist. I provide sex therapy and coaching to individuals and couples that are struggling with reaching their full potential. As a clinician, I am passionate about helping people achieve their goals and live happy, healthy, rewarding lives. I truly believe that trauma is the source of pathology, and that everyone has within them the capacity to heal. Furthermore, I am dedicated to fostering a safe environment, working with each individual to develop the necessary skills to achieve lifelong change to improve their quality of life. As a therapist, I can’t guarantee that I will be able to fully understand what it is like to walk in your shoes, but I can guarantee that I can help you to sort things out, work through trauma, let go of what does not serve you, and move on to create the life you truly want by using research-proven, trauma-focused treatments such as EMDR and sex therapy.  I offer a judgment-free zone, hold space for healing, and offer straight forward feedback (if that’s what you need). Overall, I offer you the tools and guidance to get past your past and develop the necessary skills to achieve lifelong change for a more pleasurable and connected life.

name: Phil Sayegh
title: Psychologist, PhD, MPH
about: Welcome to Sayegh Psychology (https://sayeghpsychology.com/), a small psychological assessment private practice in Santa Monica, California. Dr. Phil Sayegh offers psychoeducational, neuropsychological, psychological, and personality assessments for adolescents (ages 16+), adults, and older adults. Assessments can help you understand yourself or your child better, identify strengths and weaknesses, and support access to appropriate accommodations at school and on standardized tests (e.g., SAT, ACT, GRE, MCAT, GMAT, LSAT, DAT, and State Bar). All assessments include outside consultation (e.g., speaking to schools and doctors) and completion of paperwork for academic and testing accommodations. Services available on weekends. Superbill can be provided upon request. Dr. Phil Sayegh is an Assistant Adjunct Professor in UCLA's Psychology Department and the Associate Director of the UCLA Psychology Clinic. He coordinates all assessment services and doctoral training in the top-ranked clinical psychology Ph.D. program. He specializes in learning disabilities, ADHD, concussions, giftedness, mood and anxiety disorders, PTSD, and dementia. Dr. Phil Sayegh is a Stanford University graduate, USC-trained Ph.D clinical psychologist, and UCLA-trained neuropsychologist. Dr. Sayegh has an extensive research background in clinical psychology and neuropsychology. Visit his Google Scholar page for a listing of research publications and presentations: https://goo.gl/a2tgYc.

name: M.a. Brauer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Change happens when the unconscious emerges into consciousness.   It is a moment when what was a blind spot is now crystal clear.  There is the realization that it was there all along, but you just could not see it.   I love helping clients to have this experience because I know they are now on the path of changing their lives and will not go back.   I look for the clues, often obscure, microscopic and mysterious like the symbols in your dreams.  I know now how to connect with the unconscious and ask for the information that will provide the openings.  Then the adventure begins. I work with individuals, couples,  families.  I help people see pass the issues that they  keep going round and round with to the real source of where they are stuck.    This is the only way to bring about lasting change whether the person is having trouble with anxiety, depression, relationships, or just about any problem.

name: Caroline Sheridan Wallace
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA
about: I believe that the therapeutic process is about attunement and connection. My style is curious, non-judgemental, and empathetic. I enjoy working with people who are dealing with relationship issues, life transitions, and those who are ready to process experiences of trauma and eco-anxiety. I utilize a psychodynamic perspective which means I like to collaborate with the client in an exploration of their history to better understand themselves. I also work intersubjectively which means that together we will explore how the unconscious plays out within the therapeutic relationship. I strive to create warm, dynamic, and honest interactions in order to promote a greater sense of autonomy, understanding, and connection in my client’s lives. I think of the work we do as holistic because we get to the root of the issue in order to facilitate lasting change. My work is trauma informed and I am an EMDR trained therapist. I am currently accepting new clients via secure telehealth or in person in Echo Park. I also have a limited number of EMDR appointments available both via secure telehealth or in person in Larchmont Village. If you are interested in working together please reach out and we can schedule a 15 minute consultation. I look forward to chatting. Thank you.

name: Kristian Kemtrup
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I see people as having rich, complex human emotions that are not well described with overly simple and often stigmatizing diagnostic labels like depression or generalized anxiety. Each person is entirely unique, with their own history, strengths, and challenges. In therapy, I will work with you to better understand yourself. When we can understand why you might be feeling or thinking or acting in a way that is not best for you, we can work together to change it in a way that is tailored to your needs and your circumstances. I am specialized in treating individual adults facing a wide variety of problems including depression and anxiety, childhood trauma, relationship problems, workplace and school related stress, low self-esteem, difficulty grieving a death or lost relationship, and feelings of meaninglessness or emptiness. My therapeutic work draws on my training at The San Francisco Center for Psychoanalysis, The Wright Institute, Marina Counseling, The Pacific Center, and my background as a philosophy PhD and educator. I have experience treating people from various socioeconomic, cultural, and racial backgrounds, and from across the LGBTQ spectrum.

name: Gabriel Arroyo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS
about: My name is Gabriel Arroyo and I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. My desire to become a therapist began when I was diagnosed with Juvenile Diabetes at the age of 10 and was faced with learning how to cope with this significant change in my life. This experience allowed me to learn coping skills and strategies to overcome struggles that we experience in life and provided me with a passion to provide that same knowledge to others. As a Therapist, my approach is free formed in order to build a respectable comfort between us to work as a team on goals with your existing strengths and skills. I have 10 years of experience working with children and families with various challenges. My specialty is working with children and families with chronic illness and the challenges associated. My approach is to work in a collaborative relationship to build on the strengths that naturally exist and within these strengths we learn additional coping skills. I have worked with a diverse population of children and families focusing treatment on challenges of depression, anxiety, grief and loss, and chronic illness. As a Therapist I like to make my clients feel supported and comfortable to work on anything needed in an efficient manner. With this, I also provide Telehealth services for ease of access to treatment.

name: Cynthia Pinzon Torres
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MFT
about: Psychotherapy is a learning process in which you come to better understand yourself and your relationships so you could promote change in the areas you would like to improve. As a therapist, my role is to help you explore destructive patterns and develop more positive ones in order to address life issues and transform daily experiences. Life is a journey, I meet people where they are at and work collaboratively to create a road map to make life more rewarding. Working from a holistic- integrative approach, I support the client understanding the complexity of the human experience from a metal, physical, environmental and spiritual components.   I assist and support the client to find inner healing resources that will optimize their overall wellness. I am bilingual-bi cultural having a good understanding of people how migrate to the USA. I work collaboratively with individuals, couples and families so they could become the best of who they are.

name: Aaron Wilson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: AUTHENTICITY, ALIVENESS, and CONNECTION are vital ingredients to living a healthy and meaningful life. Unfortunately these qualities do not always receive the proper attention needed to thrive. As a result, we develop coping strategies that often lead us to not getting what we want in life, leaving us feeling stuck, anxious, depressed, and hopeless. Therapy provides a unique opportunity to explore the unconscious patterns that keep us stuck. Therapy can help you make meaningful change to live the life you wish and to create the relationships you long for.  I help individuals, couples, adolescents and families create necessary and meaningful changes in their  lives, relationships, or with family members. Whether you are feeling stuck in your own life, or with your intimate partner/marriage, or navigating challenging dynamics with your family, I can support you to engage authentic and meaningful change.  Each session is customized to support whatever needs arise in each session. I practice integrating a number of evidence based practices with attunement and empathy. I understand everyone has a plethora of different contexts--race, gender, sexuality, class, etc, that shape who we are and how we experience ourself and the world. I hold this with respect.

name: Ariel Rosenbloom
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Navigating modern adulthood can be complicated and stressful. I specialize in helping adults in their 20s and 30s manage a variety of presenting issues including trauma, relationships, identity, anxiety, depression, self-esteem, life transitions, and grief and loss. My approach is LGBTQIA+-affirmative, feminist, sex-positive, and culturally-inclusive.  We'll work together to identify patterns, build upon strengths, and enrich your sense of self. My style is warm, open, and compassionate, and I aim to provide a safe, collaborative space that nurtures the therapeutic relationship and promotes empowerment and inner growth. I work primarily from an Internal Family Systems Therapy (IFS) perspective. IFS is a non-pathologizing approach to therapy that focuses on exploring the many “parts” of ourselves. This work allows us to access and make sense of our inner experience with the goal of alleviating conflict, healing deep emotional wounds, and restoring harmony and peace. In addition to IFS, I also incorporate Attachment, Narrative, Somatic, and Mindfulness-based approaches. A social worker at heart, I strive to highlight and build upon your inner strengths and resources, appreciating all the complexities that make you unique. I offer a free 15-minute phone consultation to assess our fit together.

name: Nancy Muirhead
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: There is nothing more important to a parent than seeing their child succeed at school, make and keep friends, be happy, and find their special place in the sun.  I have worked with children and their parents for over 20 years.  My goals are simple:   I seek to understand your child's unique profile within the context of their family and culture, I highlight your child's talents and strengths, I identify any specific barriers to their success, and develop an effective intervention plan to support your child's current and future progress. Within my practice, we serve children and adolescents with attentional deficits, executive functioning delays, behavioral issues, and learning disabilities.  Our services include comprehensive psychodiagnostic assessment, parent education to improve parent-child interactions, the brain-training program "Cogmed Working Memory Training," and academic coaching in the home. We are looking forward to working with you and your child.  Please contact our office for a free phone consultation so that we can determine how we can help.

name: Jess Nicholas Laird
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, ACSW, MPA
about: If you are wrestling with topics related to your sexuality, gender identity, relationship dynamics, or religious/spiritual trauma, I would love to support you in finding harmony with who you are and how you relate to the world around you. I view clients as the experts of their own experience and seek to come alongside you as a collaborative partner in better understanding yourself and reaching your goals. I will meet you where you are with an approach that is sex/body/kink/poly-positive, culturally humble, empathetic, and compassionate.  My background is in working with individuals, couples and families in clinical and advocacy settings, particularly within the LGBTQ+ community/allies. I was raised in a fundamentalist religious community and can provide support in navigating questions of spirituality and identity, processing shifts in worldview, and healing from religious/spiritual ruptures. As a queer- and transgender-identified therapist, I am continually inspired and motivated by the strength and resiliency of the LGBTQ+ community and those who support them. My hope is that through working together, we can tap into your strengths, truth, and potential to move toward a place of holistic wellness, self-acceptance, and thriving.

name: Amanda (Reider) V. Nemeth
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: My approach to working with clients is holistic, creative, and grounded in the specific story of each client. Through empathy, authenticity, and curiosity I help create a new vision for hope as I journey with my clients on their path toward healing. I have experience working with children, adolescents, individual adults, and couples. I work with a variety of issues including relational challenges (marital, dating, family), anxiety, trauma, spirituality, identity issues, premarital counseling and life transitions.  With all my clients, I seek to bring them hope through identifying their strengths and finding resonating truth which empowers clients as they encounter life's many challenges.
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Career Counseling', 'Child', 'Coping Skills', 'Depression', 'Family Conflict', 'Grief', 'Life Transitions', 'Marital and Premarital', 'Parenting', 'Peer Relationships', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress']

name: Judith Levin
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Whether you are familiar with therapy or considering exploring how a therapist may be able to assist you in meeting the challenges you face with courage and grace,      I am here to help you move ahead. Every person I encounter has a unique and genuine seed at their core. This I will nurture to the best of my ability.  Every person also faces difficulties that encourage growth and transformation. These I will support you to investigate and navigate skillfully. I have worked with many clients whose lives have been impacted by trauma, are experiencing relational difficulties, and people who feel they are not meeting their potential. I am a Somatic Experiencing Advanced Practitioner and have a certificate in Expressive Arts Therapy from Tamalpa Institute. In session I draw from depth, somatic and humanistic psychology, buddhist psychology, and psychological astrology.  My approach is influenced by many of the traditional modalities, but we will collaborate around your needs and goals. Recently I spent over 10 years living in Buddhist monasteries studying traditional practices for the  cultivation of a peaceful mind, an open heart, and the alleviation of suffering. After this period of focused study and reflection I am very happy to work again with clients and would feel privileged to accompany you on a part of your unique journey.
issues: ['Depression', 'Grief', 'Infidelity', 'Life Transitions', 'Marital and Premarital', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Jose Pinal
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Have concerns about sexuality or sexual functioning with your self or in relationships? Experiencing out of control sexual behaviors, such as porn or sex addiction and it creates problems in your relationships? Are you a kinky person who needs a kink affirming therapist to hold a safe space for you? Do you and your partner struggle with sexual communication or unmatched sexual desire? Has misogyny or patriarchy gotten in the way of your relationships with others and now ready for change and unlearning hurtful habits. If so, I believe I can help. As a kink affirming & sex positive therapist, establishing a strong therapeutic alliance with you and creating a safe environment is part of what I offer to support you. Expect to be validated, not told what to do, but also challenged. My approach to therapy is eclectic, practical,  sex positive, and kink friendly. We will work together to facilitate change. Since 2015, I have worked with pre-teens, at risk youth (in juvenile justice system and foster care), individuals, and parents. Therapy is not a quick fix, rather it is a journey. When you are ready, reach out to me to start your journey towards liberation. I'll end with a simple quote: "The longest journey is the journey inward." - Dag Hammarskjold

name: Moet Monroe
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Moet accompanies clients on a journey to unearth and gain mastery over unhelpful patterns in order to live lives of authenticity, meaning, joy, and connection in a non-judgmental way. With clients, she focuses on helping them explore their thoughts and beliefs about themselves and the world so they can make better choices that align with their values. Moet believes everyone has something unique to offer and therapy can help them discover their authentic self while also building on strengths to create healthy boundaries and relationships.  Moet may use a variety of therapy models; however, she primarily uses CBT, Mindfulness, Client-Centered models. Moet challenges clients to step into the unknown and be curious about themselves so they may shift to their highest potential. Her creativity, honesty, curiosity, and humor create a safe environment for clients to share, explore and find healing. Moet believes that mental health and well-being are possible for everyone and that the  relationship between the client and therapist is where healing blooms. Passionate about supporting those with intersectional identities, Moet views mental wellness through a holistic lens. She cultivates a safe and nurturing environment, meeting clients where they are.

name: Priscilla Govea
title: Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor, LPCC
about: I enjoy working with individuals experiencing distress in the following areas including but not limited to: depression, anxiety, transitional life changes, interpersonal & relationship concerns, and cultural/ethnic issues. I work from a range of therapeutic interventions that include cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT), exposure respond prevention (ERP),  motivational interviewing (MI), stress management, increasing self-worth, mindfulness, brief solution focused therapy, strength-based approach, assertiveness training, mood management, anxiety reduction, empowerment and work/life balance. I am a Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor (LPCC) who obtained a master’s degree in Mental Health Counseling from the University of Miami. I believe that therapy is a collaborative process and guides clients to develop insight, decrease symptoms, and exploring interpersonal strengths to have a more meaningful life experience.

name: Rick McCarthy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT, CCTP
about: I have been in practice in the area for over 40 years, working with a very diverse population, including individual's, adults, adolescents, and couples with a wide variety of concerns and complex life challenges. I taught for 28 years, first as an associate professor of psychology at Marymount College, and have taught graduate courses at Loyola Marymount University and Pepperdine University. Twice, I have been the recipient of the Lampert Award from Pacificare Behavioral Health, which quantifies client outcomes. In effect, my therapeutic effectiveness has been ranked in the top one percent of over 10,000 participating therapists.  I have an extensive knowledge and experience with a variety of therapeutic modalities, especially cognitive behavioral, brief/ solution-focused, and trauma therapy. This allows me to utilize that which will work best for you, thus enabling you to achieve the most efficient and effective results. Having taught for 28 years, as well as consulting with the Board of Behavioral Sciences in designing the California State Board Exams for the MFT license, helps me stay on the leading edge of theory and technique. I believe in the importance of an integration and balance of a healthy mind, body, and spirit.

name: Jim Cunningham
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, PT
about: Having worked in the field of somatics for the last 30 years, my approach to psychotherapy is to work with the client's body awareness and with mindfulness. Drawing from the "felt sense" of the body, we can better work with trauma, anxiety, and grief. I see clients not as people with problems, but as travelers on a path toward wholeness. Working with body awareness allows us to get more in touch with our aliveness and clarity as well as our competence in riding through waves of difficult emotions and sensations. I see couples as well as individuals. I have been working with trauma for more than 20 years and in the last five years completed trainings in Hakomi and Sensorimotor psychotherapy. I have worked with Hospice as a bereavement counselor. I have also completed the professional year long training in Couple's counseling with Emotionally Focused Therapy. Having been a physical therapist for 32 years and a somatic therapist for 25 years, I bring a thorough knowledge of working with pain, trauma, and the body. I combine this with my more recent studies about developmental trauma. I have been practicing Buddhist meditation for 30 years.

name: Amy Yockus Hartman
title: Associate Clinical Social Worker, ACSW
about: Have anxious thoughts become overwhelming and led you to doubt yourself and your decisions? Maybe it’s tough to just get out of a bed in the morning, or you just keep pushing and striving, but have a hard time accessing a sense of fulfillment and peace? Maybe you feel like you’re always giving to and pleasing others, but don’t ever feel nourished and “filled up” yourself? I offer supportive, practical, and gentle guidance to help you move through challenging emotions and major life transitions in order to come back to yourself, a felt sense of your body, and your own deep knowing. I work with adults, couples, and children, and would be honored to meet you where you are on your journey. You have a natural blueprint of health, wholeness, and wellness that is always available to you. You also possess an innate capacity to heal, and to go through change and transition with ease. As a therapist, I’m here to help you tap into your natural blueprint of health, your own inner guidance and your core, embodied self to reach your ideal life vision.

about: What is your story? Everyone has a story and I am here to listen and help you build on your strengths.  I provide a safe and supportive space for you to tell me your story. I'm here to help you build your toolbox for those difficult times. Looking forward to learning more about you! I have extensive experience in working with  trauma survivors, individuals going through life transitions, and individuals that work in the entertainment industry. I strive to provide a safe place for you to be seen, heard, and validated. I am here to provide a nonjudgmental space for you to be heard. Sometimes that is all one needs is to just felt heard. I am here to listen and get you through the tough times. Looking forward to hearing your story.

name: Konul Surofchy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Have you been feeling overwhelmed? Stressed? Or trying to make sense of who you really are? I can help. I am here to join and support you through your own process of finding yourself again. I provide the space for you to show up in all shades of human and gain a better understanding of who you are, your beliefs, relationship patterns, behaviors, thoughts and feelings. So that we can collaboratively work together through your challenges, rediscover your strengths, learn to navigate your experiences and ultimately journey to a place of self-acceptance, freedom, and choice. I have worked with a wide range of concerns including loss of self/identity, anxiety, depression, parenting, self-esteem/worth and life transitions. I draw from different modalities including psychodynamic, humanistic, and cognitive-based approaches with a holistic focus. I believe that the therapeutic relationship is one of the leading proponents of change in the work that we do. So I offer a complimentary 15-minute phone consultation for us to determine if we are a good match. I look forward to connecting with you!

name: Jeanne Margarete Wenzke
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Beginning therapy can feel overwhelming, and the first step is often the most difficult. There may be many issues, one primary concern or a feeling you are struggling with and would like to understand. There may be repetitive thoughts, ongoing anxiety, history of trauma, or a depressive perspective that you just can't let go of. We will collaboratively identify goals designed to meet your needs and utilize approaches from psycho- dynamic, art and somatic modalities. I provide culturally sensitive services to clients of all backgrounds, from rural and urban communities, in a respectful and supportive space. I believe my warm, non-judgemental approach will support your work in clarifying goals, gaining insight into their origins and the skills to reach them.

name: Jamie Spitz, LMFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Seeking support for yourself and/or child requires courage and humility. When we experience emotional safety, we begin to understand our ourselves more deeply. I strive to provide each of my clients with a safe, comforting, and non-judgmental environment where we can build a therapeutic alliance based on trust. My style is warm, interpersonal, client-centered, and challenging at times, focused mainly on our relationship in order to promote long-term fulfillment.  My approach to growth and healing involves understanding yourself as a whole- your thoughts, feelings, behaviors, support systems, strengths, and challenges. In a space where you are truly seen and heard, longstanding patterns can begin to transform.  In supporting children, teens, and their families with emotional and behavioral challenges,  I utilize a blend of Play Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, and Parent Coaching interventions. I thoroughly enjoy cultivating a child's emotional development and work collaboratively with parents in understanding their child's emotions and behaviors.

name: Mary Ann Rege
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, TMF
about: You have your share of life stress. There's almost no way to get around it in our fast-paced culture where work is exhausting, relationships and family require attention, and to-do lists are endless. You're going through the daily grind, juggling lots of balls, and trying to keep people satisfied. Meanwhile, you're coming unglued. You start losing your cool with others, become paralyzed with fear, or want to run away from it all. You might be exhausted, edgy, or have trouble concentrating. Maybe you self-soothe in unhealthy ways. You're tired of this but don't know what to do. This is where I come in and our work together begins.  My professional training in Mindfulness, Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction and Mindfulness-Based Relapse Prevention provides you with tools so you can live with peace, ease, and joy. I bring a ton of compassion as we partner together for your well-being and will challenge you when needed to help you meet your goals. Whatever you're going through, you've suffered long enough! Imagine the day, when despite troubled circumstances, you create positive change and have the inner resources to be calm in your mind, body, and spirit. Your better life is waiting. Let's talk.

name: Uri Kugel
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Have you been feeling unhappy, unsatisfied, not good enough, or anxious? Is it hard for you to parent your child or communicate with your partner? Do you feel stuck? I am here to give you the space that you need and help you make a significant and long lasting positive change towards success. Contact me today to get started on a better path for you and your loved ones! I meet with children, adolescents, and adults. I offer individual and family therapy and parental guidance. I am experienced in treating depression, anxiety, PTSD, behavioral issues, grief, adjustment issues, autism spectrum disorder, academic underachievement, ADHD, parenting issues, relationship distress, and improving peoples' career and personal success. My secret sauce incorporates mindfulness and helps my clients develop emotional intelligence. This translates into direct positive and long lasting brain changes that relieve your pain and provide you with the skills you need to succeed in life.

name: Margaret (Peggy) Cryden
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about:
I believe that the key to a successful psychotherapeutic experience starts with the relationship between the therapist and the client. 

I help my clients acquire new coping skills and assist them in finding their own solutions to life's challenges. I use an integrative approach drawing from various theoretical orientations, and customize a treatment plan that meets each client's individual needs. My areas of specialization include: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Depression, Anxiety/Panic Disorder, Stress Management, Relationships, Adjusting to Change/LifeTransitions, and any other issues that may have impact on my clients' interpersonal relationships. My professional experience includes; a private psychotherapy practice, guest lecturing at the high school and university level in the field of human sexuality, speaking at conferences around the country, and presenting workshops to mental health professionals. I authored an award winning book, and have made national television appearances.

name: Cynthia Gonzalez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I have been working in mental health for 7 years and have a passion for helping people of all ages begin their journey of self discovery, transformation and healing to become the best version of themselves. I believe that every person has a story to be told and a story to re-write. It is with learning, patience and understanding of ourselves that we can learn to heal and create change. If you struggle with anger, dissocation, anxiety, depression, trauma (abuse, sexual assault ect..), somatic symptoms, issues with marriage/relationships,  and parenting then please take a minute to reach out for a consultation. The emphasis on B.E. in B.E.ing LLC speaks to the butterfly effect in the Chaos Theory of life; that any small step or change can have a ripple effect in the Universe. Working together we will bring the realization to the mind, body, and spirit connection that allows the full picture of trauma healing and how to write a new story of your life. My approach includes treating the whole person: mind and body are both essential in the healing process. This therapuetic journey will emphasize your mental health as well as your physical and spiritual health. So please take a minute to reach out and see if we are a good match. Thank you

name: Cecilia Rios Rios
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I believe therapy to be an approach that heals the soul. I encourage  a caring and accepting environment in which the therapist-client relationship is a key aspect of the healing process. My ideal client is one who wishes to grow and heal through the process of personal exploration, skill development and commitment to their healing journey.I  have experience treating individuals with emotional challenges such as depression, anxiety, panic, and relational issues through the use of  short-term CBT and (long-term) insight oriented therapy like Existential and Psychodynamic therapy. I also have experience treating individuals struggling with issues related to isolation, family and/or partner relationships, financial anxiety, and work, school or family stress. If you seek a therapeutic relationship that is rooted in genuine interactions and acceptance, please do not hesitate to contact me. My hope for those attending my practice is that they can feel loved and accepted and feel as if they can be their true selves! Mi enfoque en el tratamiento es ofrecer un ambiente de comprensión y aceptación en la que la relación terapeuta-paciente es de suma importancia en el proceso de recuperación. Mi paciente ideal es aquel que está comprometido a crecer y sanar  y que tiene la disponibilidad para mejorar. Yo trabajo con personas que tienen problemas emocionales como depresión, ansiedad (nervios), pánico, estrés (familiar o de trabajo), ansiedad financiera, entre otros. Yo utilizo terapia cognitiva de corto tiempo al igual que  terapia de exploración profunda a largo plazo. Si hoy buscas un terapeuta con el cual te puedas sentir aceptado(a) y entendido(a), por favor no lo pienses dos veces en contactarme. Mi meta es que mis pacientes no solo puedan cumplir sus metas, sino también que en el proceso se sientan queridos y aceptados.

name: Iris Cohen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: My focus is on easing your stress, worries, and challenges that you are facing. Together we will work on finding better ways to communicate at home and at work. I am offering tele-therapy through video and/or phone to all who want to be seen.I enjoy working with couples and individuals. When dealing with negative thoughts,  I work on finding more coping thoughts, while using different approaches, such as CBT (cognitive behavioral therapy), DBT (dialectical behavioral therapy), and family systems. With couples I often use EFT (emotional focus therapy). My therapy style is nurturing and empowering. Your happiness is my first priority! I am bringing years of experience working with different age groups coming from diverse backgrounds. I have many powerful  techniques to help you gain a better awareness of your feelings, your needs, learn ways to de-escalate conflicts, and much more. My work style is empathetic, compassionate, and warm. Coming from another country, I am aware of sensitive issues related to transitions, and culture differences. I incorporate an open-minded approach when working with couples, parents and children's relationship issues, low self esteem, anxiety and depression. I look at each of my client's life story as a unique one.

name: Kelly Burris
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Is it time to heal? I am here to help! I work together with people who have experienced trauma or difficult times. I believe that people have an amazing ability to heal. Everyone does! I often hear people say "I want to stop letting this interfere with my life but I don't know how." Guess what? I do! I am not saying that it will be easy to work towards a better life; but it will be WORTH IT. You deserve to live the best life possible. Let's start working together! I am EMDR certified and help other therapists hone their EMDR skills as an EMDRIA CIT. Currently TELEHEALTH ONLY during COVID-19 including EMDR in most cases. Many people I see have symptoms of PTSD or depression, anxiety, reexperiencing, sleeplessness after a trauma in their life. I treat people who have been the victims of rape, involved in a violent crime, been in war, or had rough experiences in relationships. Often times we do not know the source of symptoms. That's OK. We work to heal and more forward.   We will come up with your treatment plan together! A plan you feel comfortable with. Modalities I use to treat trauma are EMDR, Somatic Interventions, Safe and Sound Protocol (SSP), TF-CBT, narrative work, meditation, and art.  We are on the same team! You can book an appointment online via my website or check out my YouTube channel for more information.

name: Janelle Shepard
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA
about: Hi! I am a self-esteem and body image specialist. I am an Associate Marriage & Family Therapist and work with adult individuals and teens. I specialize in helping individuals struggling with eating disorders, distorted body image, post-partum transitions and/or depression, work on building up their self-esteem, explore intuitive eating, decrease perfectionism and anxiety, and develop healthy relationships. I help my clients to develop a deeper sense of self-worth, examine old behavior patterns and create new patterns, learn boundary setting, and create a better balanced and more fulfilling life. I want to work collaboratively with you to create a life that is meaningful to you. I will help you explore the ways in which your emotional, mental and physical well-being are interconnected.  I am also trained in ART (Accelerated Resolution Therapy) an evidenced based therapy for the treatment of trauma. I am a LGBTQIA+ affirmative, body positive therapist and incorporate intuitive eating principles into my practice. I am committed to creating a safe space for clients of color to explore their identities and experiences. Contact me for a free phone consultation to see if we are a good fit.

name: Melanie Harriss Lmft
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, BSN, MA, LMFT
about: CURRENTLY ACCEPTING CLIENTS...Whether it be anxiety/depression, unprocessed trauma, medical issues/illness, divorce, or chemical dependency just to name a few.  Allow me to help you address the emotional challenges that may be causing you a variety of symptoms -- frustration, sadness, decreased motivation or anger -- as this is often how the issues we are struggling with surface in our lives. Helping you discover and understand the root cause of your issues is the goal to help you live a more empowered and fulfilling life. I've worked in various clinical settings from psychiatric hospitals, to county jail. My approach is truly collaborative, I utilize EMDR, CBT, motivational interviewing, etc.  We are all individuals and there is no “one size fits all” type of therapy. We will develop a treatment plan that addresses your needs, with an approach you can relate to. Prior to becoming a therapist, I was a Registered Nurse for over 15yrs. I understand the interplay between our mental and physical health, and how one effects the other. Let’s work together to address the challenges in your life. Finding a therapist that fits your needs is essential, if I am not the therapist for you, I'll help you find one who is.

name: Darcy Lubbers
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, MFT, ATR-BC
about: My work as a marriage and family therapist, clinical art therapist and somatic psychotherapist is integrative, interactive, and holistic. Drawing from over 30 years of experience in private practice, residential and outpatient treatment, I offer pathways to healing and well-being within the context of a safe and supportive environment.  In my work with individuals, couples and families, treatment specialties include the healing of communication and relationship issues, depression, anxiety, trauma, family and personal illness, grief and loss. In my work with clients, I draw on a variety of theoretical perspectives, with a focus on wellness through mind/body/spirit integration, and with training in art therapy, clinical hypnosis, guided imagery, imago therapy, focusing-oriented therapy, somatic experiencing, meditation, yoga, and mind body medicine. I also supervise MFT and art therapy interns.   Publishing credits include *Adult Art Psychotherapy: Issues and Applications, articles for the Depression and Bipolar Support Alliance, B'Sherit Integrative Oncology Services and the American Holistic Nurses Association's. Please give my office a call to set up an appointment if it feels like my background and training are a good fit for you.

name: Molly Williams
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, PPS, LMFT
about: Living with anxiety can be overwhelming and scary. Anxiety can often take over our lives and infiltrate our relationships, our ability to do our work, our self-esteem...leaving us feeling exhausted and alone. I want to help you take the power back and live the life that you want.                                                                                                              I am a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist specializing in anxiety and relationship issues. ﻿I use a mix of proven effective, evidence-based interventions, including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Solution-Focused, and Person-Centered Therapy. This means that together we will explore the ways your thoughts, feelings, and behaviors all influence each other. We will work to create more positive ways of thinking and being in the world. We will tap into your strengths and figure out what works for you and what doesn’t. I have a straightforward and friendly approach to therapy, and my clients appreciate my humor and warmth. If you are interested in working together, please reach out via phone or email!

name: Michelle Feldman
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Whether you’re looking to gain insight, strengthen your relationships, or identify harmful patterns of behavior - I'm here to help. One of the key aspects of successful and quality therapy is the therapist/client relationship. I understand the courage and vulnerability it takes to seek therapy and use warmth, humor, and curiosity to build strong relationships with my clients. Through a collaborative, nonjudgemental, and empowering style, I strive to create a safe space for openness and exploration to help clients develop healthier coping strategies, decrease negative symptoms, and foster personal growth.  My treatment style is a blend of psychoanalytic, relational, and emotion-focused therapy. I enjoy working with adults and specialize in anxiety, stress, depression, trauma, identity development, and relationship/interpersonal issues. I've also done extensive research on work-related stress and lead workshops on leadership development and burnout. I know that asking for helping isn’t always easy, and seeking therapy can often be a daunting and intimidating experience. Please feel free to reach out for a free initial phone consultation - I am more than happy to answer any questions you may have, discuss what to expect from therapy, and hope to have some fun along the way.

name: Joe Racklin
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Anxiety and depression can make life very difficult. These symptoms only worsen if you hide them out of fear that others won’t understand or will be judgmental. It is important to know that there are specific treatment approaches that have been shown to be particularly effective. I use Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, Exposure with Response Prevention, and other Cognitive Behavioral approaches to help see thoughts and beliefs differently, and to act more in line with how we want to be. My approach also emphasizes a more accepting, compassionate relationship with one’s self to help therapy be most effective. I have over 20 years of experience specializing in the treatment of anxiety including OCD, worry, panic, social anxiety, phobias and hoarding. I also treat Body-Focused Repetitive Behaviors, such as hair pulling and skin picking. My experience has included substance abuse recovery issues, codependency and relationship issues, and spirituality challenges. With the right approach, anxiety is very treatable. I strive to offer a positive, healing relationship where you can feel understood, transform your symptoms and struggles, and work toward a more meaningful life. I am happy to speak with you to see how I may be helpful.

At Bridges of the Mind we care about helping individuals and families within our community. We are here to help patients find clarity and to address their personal goals.

name: Michelle Smith
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I'm a versatile therapist focused on creating a supportive environment and providing compassionate and helpful feedback. I began my career more than 15 years ago working with adults and children who've experienced trauma. I specialize in treating individuals with depression, stress and anxiety and provide couple and family counseling to improve relationships and parenting. I have two primary goals as a therapist - create a therapeutic relationship that feels safe and supportive to clients and provide therapy that's effective in relieving suffering and improving people's lives. I'm here to help you reach your goals. Therapy is part talking, part listening and part doing. I use evidence-based techniques (see Types of Therapy below) to help you understand yourself better, cope with life's challenges, shift unhelpful patterns, confront fears and adopt healthier habits. We'll work with what's happening in your life right now to mend unresolved wounds and grow. Finding the right "fit" with your therapist is important! Feel free to contact me to discuss what's leading you to therapy and share any questions you might have. I see individuals, couples and families in-person in Mission Valley and throughout California by video. I accept most insurance as an out-of-network provider.

name: Nathan Hale

I work from an integrative style based in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), using mindfulness and problem-solving techniques. name: Roger Schwarz, JD, LMFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, JD, LMFT
about: See my website rogerschwarz.com, including the video, about who I treat and how I work.  I welcome you if you're at that point where you just don't want to continue feeling the same lousy way so much of the time. Usually that's caused by not being able to stop getting triggered no matter how much willpower you muster. It's hard to stay positive when the triggering constantly leads to predictable behavior that leads to predictable, hurtful results. My general practice includes counseling where finances are a significant trigger for self criticism or conflict in a relationship; also in families where either silence/withdrawal on the one hand or conflict on the other eat away at the fiber of the household or family business. Combining training and experience in the worlds of business and psychology has fostered a unique ability to get to the heart of the matter in a powerful, caring way. As a result, clients quickly sense hope that at last their commitment to therapy or coaching can produce lasting results .

name: Julia Cushing
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, MA
about: I’ve been working with children across the developmental spectrum for 15 years now through my various roles in schools, childcare, and now as a therapist. I strongly believe each child’s needs are unique. What works for one child or family, doesn't necessarily work for the next. Some children’s behaviors are more difficult to understand. Some children feel deeply in ways that their peers do not. I’m here to offer you a non-judgmental space to explore the current dynamics of your family and explore which changes can help create a more harmonious and enjoyable household.   Play is the avenue through which children learn. I use play activities to facilitate new experiences of connection and understanding between you and your child. Through play, we will explore what techniques help your child feel emotionally regulated. I will also offer support to you in managing the inevitable stress of being a parent. While I enjoy working with children of all ages, I specialize in working with young children (3-7) and their parents. I strongly believe that when something doesn't feel right, early on is the most powerful time to intervene. It’s never too early to start building a strong foundation for your family! Reach out for your free consultation today!

about: Throughout my service in various clinical settings, I have been struck by the importance of creating a safe space for those seeking mental health care and working towards personal growth. I work through an empowerment-based, trauma-focused, and relational framework; consider how intersecting identities contribute to unique life experiences; and collaborate alongside my clients in the room.

name: Kate Westengard
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Looking to figure out who you are? Why you do what you do? Have you been feeling sad, anxious, flat and/or overwhelmed? Are you looking for someone to talk to about how to cope with life? You are not alone and I would like to help.  I like connecting with my clients and meeting them where they are.  Together, we will work hard to improve your life in a safe, nurturing environment.  I use insight along with EMDR and humanistic approaches in order to help people find their hidden potential and to heal.  I will accompany you on your journey to self-discovery.   I am respectful of all cultures, belief systems, and traditions, and am affirming to all genders and sexual orientations.  I actively think about and incorporate the impact of marginalization and oppression on people's health and well being. I am HAES (Health at Every Size) informed and certified in EMDR to address trauma and nervous system regulation.   I would like to work collaboratively with you to help you in reaching your goals and finding your authentic self. Healing happens in our relationships and therapy is a way to experience this.

name: Jessica Mariglio
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: It can be hard sometimes, navagating this human life.  When we become stressed, painful experiences from our past can impact our present, interfering with our self-talk, perceptions, and relationships with others. We might even notice ourselves falling into unhelpful patterns of thought and behavior, which can leave us feeling isolated, stuck, and perhaps a little lost. It makes sense: how can we connect with the world around us when we feel so disconnected from our selves? I believe that healing occurs in connection with others, and so my approach to therapy is first and foremost relational and collaborative. I integrate EMDR therapy with mindfulness, narrative, and strengths-based techniques to tap into your unique skills and get you back to living life, grounded in your authentic self. It is possible to find a way back to yourself and a sense of ease in the present moment. You do not have to do this alone. Please contact me for a FREE 15 minute phone consultation to see if we might be a good fit for working together.

name: MG Loar, MFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: How would your life change if you didn't have your current struggles and challenges? For over 27 years, I have been helping individuals who are experiencing life transitions, seeking life transformation, career changes, starting over, overcoming fear; experiencing marital separation or divorce, single parenting, life crisis, spiritual misalignment, stress, job loss, empty nest, women's issues, substance abuse, codependency, grief/loss, and gay/lesbian issues. After a free phone consultation, we can determine if we will be a good fit.  Email me as well. I take on a holistic,respectful and unique way to support people to maximize their self-awareness, increase their wellness  so that they feel seen, heard, and appreciated for their gifts, life dreams, and infinite potential. My therapeutic approach is eclectic, but its core essence is cognitive behavioral and solution focus therapy. I am a California licensed psychotherapist, life design coach, mentor and public speaker. My commitment is to help you empower yourself. I am passionate about guiding individuals into deepening their connection with themselves and fostering the ability to live with embodied courage, vulnerability, integrity, and grace.

name: Sideline Sports Psychology
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Jourdan Johnson, LMFT 136468 is the director and founder of Sideline Sport Psychology, based in Sacramento, CA. He is a experienced professional who specializes in High-Performance Psychology and Leadership. Over the last 10 years, he’s had the opportunity to work with the best of the best in sport, sport psychology, and in business. He’s helped countless professional and collegiate athletes gain an advantage in their mindset and mental preparation.  “Our biggest opponent is often ourselves. Having your mind work for you, rather than against you, is the key to any elite performance.” Sideline Sport Psychology is currently contracted by several professional organizations where Jourdan does psychological profiling for MLS drafts, as well as individual and team development work to improve performance and wellness. In addition. Prior to opening Sideline Sport Psychology, he was employed by several organizations as a Mental Performance Coach. Please note that Jourdan is currently working with a number of organizations and athletes.  To maintain high-quality sport psychology services to those he’s working with, he may have very limited or no availability for new clients.  Please reach out to learn more and/or to find another Sideline Sport Psychology provider that can help you attain your goals.
