name: Debra Horsley
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Do you feel sad or overwhelmed? Is anxiety preventing you from achieving your goals? Are you dissatisfied with your relationships or feel unable to change your life? Do you have difficulty sleeping? I can help you change your life and become the person you want to be. I believe the most important aspect of therapy is the bond between a client and the therapist, and I make every effort to achieve this bond from the first session. My goal is to have you leave each session with a sense of peace, hope and empowerment. I have been a licensed therapist since 1990. My specialties include treatment of depression, anxiety and addictive disorders. I work with adults and adolescents, and have extensive experience working with children. My philosophy is primarily based on the cognitive behavioral approach. However, my method of treatment varies according to the needs of each individual client. I would be happy to schedule a free telephone consultation with you to address any questions or concerns you may have. Please don't hesitate to call.
issues: ['Addiction', 'Divorce', 'Eating Disorders', 'Grief', 'Parenting', 'Relationship Issues', 'Substance Use', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Winifred M Reilly
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about:
By the time most couples come to my office, they're frustrated, discouraged, and tired of going in circles. Many think their problems are insurmountable, that they're beyond help. Very few couples are beyond help. If your relationship is in trouble, don't wait.  And don't give up. 
I have been in practice for nearly 30 years, specializing in psychotherapy with couples. I bring extensive training in relationship dynamics, marital systems, and sex therapy.  I use a collaborative, positive approach that makes sense of what's hard and offers tools and encouragement to even the most troubled relationship. My work is based on the premise that relationships work better when partners become less reactive to each other and can develop the clarity, stamina and anxiety-management skills they need to talk and listen openly about issues that have seemed unapproachable and, therefore, remained irresolvable. Regardless of your past, or your parents, or the challenging person you picked, with the right kind of work and the right kind of effort, you can get to a place where your relationship is more sane and more fun, and the two of you can be close and caring.
issues: ['Addiction', 'Adoption', 'Anxiety', 'Depression', 'Divorce', 'Grief', 'Infertility', 'Substance Use', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: Samantha Romerogreen
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: “You deserve to live a life that leaves you excited to wake up every morning.”                  Seeking help is one of the bravest thing someone can do. Therapy is a journey about healing and growth. Allow me to walk alongside you on your journey.                        Don’t let depression, anxiety or trauma stop you from living your best life. I want to help you achieve whatever changes and solutions you are searching for. Live your life fully and peacefully. I served 20 years in the U.S. Navy and have over 10 years of experience supporting and guiding clients in a variety of areas such as substance abuse, mental health, health care and family services.

name: Jeri W Johnson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: My clients come to therapy when they feel overwhelmed with difficulties  they encounter in their lives.  At times, some of them experience difficulties with:               * A breakdown in communication.                                                                            * Mistrust in a marriage or in a significant relationship.                                                                                                           * The ongoing challenges of raising children or blending families.                                       * Finding a balance in their personal lives.                                                                * Feeling out of touch, angry, anxious, confused or depressed. I pay close attention to how you feel and think about your difficulties. How we feel and think affects every aspect of our lives, from our relationships with our loved ones, to our attitude about work, to how we feel and what we think about ourselves. We will collaborate to discover what is important to you. With your personal goals in mind, we will work together to discover the best positive solutions to the challenges you are facing. Therapy often helps clients to uncover potential that may have been overlooked in the past.

name: Hope for Healers
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I have successfully coached healthcare workers through burn out by creating space for healing through acknowledgement and release of the stress and trauma stored in their body. Letting go of these negative experiences, strengthens their connection to others and brings clarity to their passion and purpose. I have also led trainings on topics such as emotion regulation, conflict resolution and effective communication. I created and led various support groups and trainings related to grief, chronic pain, imposter syndrome and burnout. I offer a specialized treatment for trauma reprocessing, that helps the brain store the memory in an adaptive way so that it does not interfere with everyday life. I use practical coping skills for clients who are stuck on the roller coaster of ups and downs in life. I practice therapy with a humanistic approach, allowing you to feel seen and accepted.  I aim to provide a safe environment to support the mind, body and spirit in restoring healthcare workers to a connected and meaningful life. Life is hard and we all need a safe place to share our stories without fear of judgment or shame. I honor the courage it takes to reach out for help and I would be grateful to be a part of your healing journey.

name: Fatime Zehra Bucak
title: CHT
about: I am Clinical Hypnotherapist and Licensed Neuro Linguistic Programmer. I teach people how to control their emotions and how to use their own mind for the life they want. I help people who have OCD, relationship problems, fear/phobias and changing beliefs and more. Emotions are the reasons for behaviors.Instead of changing behavior, I teach people how to control their emotions and create the emotions they want to have at the time and place they want .Then, we see the long lasting change in external behaviors, like OCD,phobic reactions. I work with unconscious mind. I use all the tools and techniques related to power of the human mind. I believe that anyone can do anything with the power of the mind. I use the power of mind to create change for the rest of their life.

name: Matthew Booth
title: Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor, LPCC
about: I primarily utilize CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) to help clients identify the connection between thoughts, feelings, and behavior. I also implement ACT (Acceptance/Commitment Therapy) in therapy to instruct clients in developing mindfulness skills to help individuals learn how to relax and face their fears on their own free from judgment in order to cultivate self-compassion and acceptance. I have experience working with individuals struggling with mood disorders (Depression/Anxiety), relationship issues, as well as individuals struggling with substance abuse/addiction. I recognize that being vulnerable is quite scary and often very uncomfortable, especially with a stranger but with the right guidance, empathy, and support we will be able to identify and reach your goals as a team. My Christian faith is also very important to me and I am willing to provide faith-based counseling for those who are interested. I am a therapist at Octave, a modern behavioral health practice that supports your emotional well-being through a broad range of services. At Octave, we partner with you to develop a personalized care plan that best suits your needs. Learn more at www.findoctave.com

name: Ashley Robin Jimenez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I believe that with patience, time, insight, awareness and understanding; progress and healing can be achieved. From my 15 years experience working with children, teens and adults -I have gained a strong passion to help individuals whom struggle with self-esteem issues, trauma, anxiety and depression. I also have a strong passion and extensive experience working with children and their behaviors, along with providing parenting support. As a mother of two small children, I understand the impact of juggling it all and the importance of support and practicing self-care. I’m here to provide insight, understanding and coping skills. I apply a variety of theories and modalities, such as; Cognitice Behavioral Therapy, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy and TF-CBT, and mindfulness. I adhere my approach to each individual client and believe it is important for me to approach to their specific needs. I utilize talk therapy, play therapy and art therapy in sessions. I also provide Telehealth. Teens, adults and families can expect a unique environment to be welcomed into; where I adhere to clients needs and am an active participant through your therapy process.  I am an interactive part of sessions and believe that I am truly there to guide you through your process. I also provide Telehealth therapy (if needed) & adhere to all CDC recommendations.

name: Veronica Waters
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Do you feel like past wounds are preventing you from moving forward? Perhaps you have a difficult time understanding why you continue to repeat unhealthy behaviors or feel ashamed for not living up to your own or others' expectations.  You probably feel a mixture of emotions: motivated to change, but afraid of feeling uncomfortable and vulnerable. Maybe you doubt your ability to change or question if talking about painful issues can actually help you feel better.  Having these thoughts and feelings is a normal part of the growth process. In therapy, it is my goal to provide a safe, nurturing environment for my clients to work through challenges and gain skills to enhance their lives. I have over fifteen years of experience working with the following: self-defeating behavior, unhealthy relationship patterns, addiction,  difficulty with setting boundaries, body image issues, trauma and grief. There is HOPE for you to feel authentic and fulfilled in your life. You can heal from the past and grow into the person you want to be.  My mission is to help people discover their inner strength and wisdom. I would be honored to accompany you on your journey to create a life of balance, connection and purpose.

title: MSN, PMHNP
about: Are you struggling to balance your mental and physical health and in need of a more comprehensive approach? No problem!  I provide Telemedicine (Telepsychiatry) Services, so that you can conveniently be seen from your home for psychiatry appointments and medication management without the need to travel! I provide the same psychiatry services as an in-person office visit and I can also address other aspects that encompass your complete wellness. My aim is to help you to thrive at your best! You can easily self-schedule a Telepsychiatry video appointment now at: pwpsychiatry.com/CA Are you in need of evaluation and medication management from someone who will listen carefully to your concerns? I provide a holistic approach that takes into account your unique physical and mental health needs. You can conveniently book an appointment right now and typically be seen within one week. Telemedicine appointments are offered for flexibility! I have extensive experience providing medication management using a holistic approach. During visits, I will listen carefully to your specific concerns and collaboratively develop a treatment plan that balances your physical and mental health. With each patient, my aim is to help patients to actively reach their optimal state of wellness that they thrive in.

name: Elanna Panter Sherman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about:
I've been in private practice since 1987, working with  individuals and couples.  I work with men and women, ages 19 and above, who may be overwhelmed and confused by a life crisis or transition;  who may find themselves holding back in their lives, not knowing what they want or afraid to go after it;  repeating the same patterns in each of their unsatisfying relationships, leaving them feeling lonely and unseen.  I am honored to accompany each client on a journey toward wholeness and peace of mind.

name: Theresa Gagos
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I offer a flexible and collaborative working relationship with each client in therapy, including meeting an individual where they're at to facilitate awareness, relief, and support the process of change. The relationship between a therapist and a client is an important one and can often be one of the richest, transformative parts of the therapeutic work. My experience includes treating individuals, couples, and families and I work with children, adolescents, and adults. I have a particular interest in the areas of mood disorders, women's issues, reproductive trauma, relationship issues, divorce, and psychological development throughout the life span. I use a variety of techniques in therapy, but maintain a psychodynamic approach, including an interest in the role of the unconscious as well as the impact of early developmental experiences.

name: Kitty Wells
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Are you looking for personal growth, transformation and healing? Do you want to feel better and more effective? Are you dealing with stress, anxiety, depression, challenging relationships, distressing life events, or limiting beliefs about yourself? Do you have trouble managing your emotions or your moods?   You deserve to live the life you desire. I will meet you with respect, acceptance, and non-judgement and offer a safe space to explore your experiences, thoughts, feelings and hopes. Please give me a call to discuss your situation and questions. I  work with couples, children, youth and adults, including seniors and developmentally challenged.   If you are interested, in addition to talk therapy, we can use EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization Reprocessing), EFT (meridian tapping), ho'oponopono, and hypnosis, all effective in helping gently let go of negative thoughts and feelings. If trauma, anxiety or depression symptoms are the root cause of your problem, EMDR, EFT and, especially, Ho'oponopono  can help you move beyond  negative beliefs and mental barriers to a place of peace,confidence, and improved well being.  I have use EMDR since 1990 and EFT since 2008.

name: Robin J Krenek
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Are you looking for a supportive way to identify and resolve areas of stress, conflict, unhappiness, and find success with new challenges in your life? I have been helping individuals overcome obstacles and improve their lives and relationships for over 28 years. The therapy relationship can be a safe and empathic way to help you access and heal painful feelings, open up to new possibilities in your life, and experiment with new and healthier behaviors toward a more fulfilling experience. I respect each individual I work with as unique and work with you to evaluate your specific needs, strengths, goals and challenges. I believe that therapy is a fluid, interpersonal and collaborative process that is helpful in resolving many challenges that people struggle with in life. I support and assist people in understanding and improving their feelings of anxiety, depression, loss, work challenges, relationships and family struggles.
issues: ['Divorce', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', "Women's Issues"]

name: Anita Herrera-Hamilton
title: Psychologist, PhD, ABPP-CN
about: Dr. Anita Herrera-Hamilton is a board-certified neuropsychologist and Associate Professor at CHLA & USC Keck School of Medicine. She specializes in neuropsychological & psychoeducational evaluations of children, adolescents & adults, including seniors. Specialties include: concussion, traumatic brain injury, dementia  & medical conditions affecting brain functioning.  As a psychotherapist & certified yoga instructor, Dr. Herrera-Hamilton incorporates somatic & mindfulness strategies to assist athletes, coaches, parents and executives, in managing performance-related anxiety, performance enhancement and recovery management. Exam findings clarify neurocognitive and atypical learning profiles to assist with treatment and intervention planning, vocational/special education services and gifted learners. Dr. Herrera-Hamilton specializes in conditions related to concussion, traumatic brain injury, and other medical conditions affecting brain-behavior relationships.    While dealing with the impact of Covid-19, self-care is critically important. I will work with clients to make neuropsychological assessment, e-support and e-psychotherapy affordable and accessible. I also specialize in working with BIPOC athletes/ executives experiencing microaggressions and institutional bias impacting their mental health and careers.

name: Marcie B. Scranton
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: When life is out of balance, it's easy to become overwhelmed by sadness, anger, or anxiety. If you're experiencing a situation that is hard to manage, are involved in a difficult relationship, or need support in your recovery, please know that there is hope. In overcoming obstacles and resolving distressing issues, we can calm your anxiety, alleviate depression, and deepen your self-awareness. With your goals in mind, I work to heal wounds and make positive differences in your relationships, your career, and your ability to communicate in healthy, productive ways. I work most successfully with issues around recovery, major upheavals, partner conflicts, parenting, and life transitions.  My approach is integrative, using theories and techniques that are most appropriate to your unique situation. Additionally, I look to uncover and support your strengths - building on what works, and helping to change what doesn't. We can build a path toward a more hopeful future as we discover new facets of your individuality, and new ways of thinking, to bring about the change you desire.  Please contact me to take the first step toward a happier and more peaceful tomorrow.

name: Anh D Weber
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My particular expertise and interest is in working with survivors of trauma, abuse and victimization. Having survived trauma, abuse and victimization can lead to a variety of outcomes.  Some people survive trauma with no problems at all, while other people develop anxiety, depression, substance use, personality or relationship issues. Various traumatic events, such as parental divorce or substance abuse, are very common even in middle class populations and have often both physical and psychological effects many years after the experienced trauma. I like to work with clients from different backgrounds and presentations. One of my particular interests is working with high-functioning clients who have borderline personality disorder. In my practice, I employ different therapeutic evidence based modalities; from psychoanalytic to dialectical behavioral therapy, depending on the specific circumstances. I have been practicing psychotherapy for more 18 years, and I offer psychotherapy for adolescents, couples, and adults; both on a short and long-term basis. I would love to provide you with a free 20 min phone consultation to discuss your specific situation and questions.

name: Susan Ashley
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Ashley Children's Psychology Center specializes in childhood issues, including AD/HD, Asperger's, Oppositional Defiant Disorder, Learning Disorders, Social Issues, Anxiety and Depression, Trauma, Divorce and Behavior Problems. We focus on helping children and teens overcome problems of behavior, mood, self-esteem, trauma, divorce and socialization. Parents learn techniques to improve their child's functioning and put harmony back in family living.  Family sessions are used to improve communication, cooperation and foster closeness . Adults with ADHD are helped to function at their best while learning to manage the symptoms. Our initial consultation will help identify the areas you wish to address, provide diagnosis or determine if further evaluation or testing is needed, determine if therapy is indicated, and help to get you on the right track towards your goals for your child, family and self. Our website provides more details about our approach to evaluation and treatment.   Dr. Ashley is the author of three internationally recognized books,"The ADD and ADHD Answer Book" and "The Asperger's Answer Book" and "1000 Best Tips for ADHD."  She is the director of Ashley Children's Psychology Center, established in 1991

name: Erin Liiv
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: My clients over the past 20 years have found me to be warm, collaborative, authentic, active, non-judgmental, calm and grounding. I believe in the therapeutic value of our relationship, while using evidence-based treatment modalities such as CBT and CPT to reduce symptoms. My approach is trauma-informed and incorporates humanistic psychology and mindfulness to improve your relationship with yourself and others. In my practice I have treated a wide variety of challenges, including mood disorders, PTSD, gender and identity issues, postpartum depression, relationship issues, addictions, and the psychosocial impact of health problems. I received my MSW from UC Berkeley and have been in practice for over 20 years. I am a rostered CPT therapist specializing in PTSD treatment. I prioritize and enjoy working across cultures with a social justice orientation. In my personal life, I am a mother, weaver and farmer, raising Navajo-Churro sheep and various feathered friends.  I am also a breast cancer survivor. I am a California native and grew up in Berkeley. For the past year I have provided therapy to clients exclusively via telephone and video, and have found Telehealth to be effective and convenient for clients.

name: Victoria Le Beau
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about:
During my 20 years as a psychotherapist I have helped many people learn to cope with lives that have become overwhelming.
I help people develop success in work, family, and love. I have a  broad range of experience working with adults and couples. Their symptoms range from depression, panic/anxiety, life changes, traumatic events, grief, relationship problems, and unresolved childhood issues. My training is in psychodynamic therapy which focuses on understanding your past in order to transform your present behavior, beliefs, and responses to others. I provide assistance in turning those insights into action and change. I hold a Masters Degree from USC. In addition to working in private practice, I have worked in a number of community mental health settings, emergency rooms,  and at Cedars Sinai Medical center.

name: Sara Kolsin
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Now offering virtual and in person sessions! Everyone needs someone to hear them. I am here to lend an ear, be present when life gets tough, and be a support in finding solutions to your problems. Life can be confusing and stressful and we all need a helping hand in becoming the best version of ourselves. My practice consists of working with teenage and adult individuals that want to become stronger, feel better about themselves, and want to move past their past. I truly believe that our past holds us hostage and prevents us from being in, and enjoying, the present moments in life. The groups of people I have worked the most with, and have a passion working for, are veterans, addicts, sexual assault survivors, the LGBTQ+ community, and anyone that has known struggle in their life. I use a variety of tools to help people learn how to cope and move forward at their lowest with a focus on EMDR, CBT, and traditional talk therapy. If you find yourself being troubled by past or recent traumatic events, depression, anxiety, low self-esteem, or just need to have someone hear you out, then I can help you by finding ways to cope, to heal, and to move forward. Give me a call for a free 15 minute consultation to see if I can be of service to you. All the best!

name: Hazzel Angulo
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT, EMDR
about: Trauma, anxiety, and addiction can make you feel stuck. The most important step towards healing is to address the unresolved emotion inside you. Healing requires feelings. Acceptance slowly dissolves pain. When we function from the fear and scarring of our trauma, the cycles continue until we learn how to transmute that energy into love. I apply a Holistic approach that integrates physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual forms of well-being, addressing the “whole” self. Through a holistic framework tailored to your unique needs, the goal is to support you develop a deeper understanding of the self on all these levels. I am trained in EMDR therapy, which is designed to reduce the emotional intensity attached to the disturbing memories through the use of eye movements or tapping, resulting in a reduction of symptomology. I also assist in your healing process by utilizing CBT, mindfulness, and Solution Focused Therapy. Healing is POSSIBLE. I'm committed to providing actionable tools to help you take charge of your inner well-being, address unresolved emotions, improve relationships, and enrich your strengths to create a sense of empowerment. I also provide therapy in Spanish. Please book your free consultation.

name: Celeste Meza
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, PPSC
about: Welcome!  Do you have a particular life obstacle you are trying to overcome?  Perhaps you have been feeling down or anxious, maybe you feel “stuck” and overwhelmed with stress of life.  Seeking help from a clinician can help put things into perspective and learn new skills to manage these feelings.                                                                                                            Therapy is a process of growth and self-discovery.  We work collaboratively, to identify what you seek from therapy, develop a plan, and help you meet your goals.                            I am bilingual (English/Spanish) and bi-cultural.  I have worked extensively with culturally diverse individuals and helped many make positive life changes, experienced in treating varying severities of depression, anxiety, relational issues, and trauma. Using a strengths-based and eclectic approach to therapy, I tailor each session based on your needs. I provide a safe, caring, and nonjudgmental space, providing you the opportunity to freely explore and express yourself. Contact me for a free phone consultation. I look forward to hearing from you! ¡Bienvenido/a!  ¿Tienes un obstáculo de vida en particular que estás tratando de superar?  Tal vez te has sentido mal o ansioso/a, tal vez te sientas "atorado/a" y abrumado/ por el estrés de la vida.  Buscar la ayuda de un psicoterapeuta puede ayudar a poner las cosas en perspectiva y aprender nuevas habilidades para manejar estos sentimientos. La terapia es un proceso de crecimiento y autodescubrimiento.  Trabajamos en colaboración, para identificar lo que buscas de la terapia, desarrollamos un plan y te ayudaré a alcanzar tus metas.                                                                                                    Soy bilingüe.  He trabajado extensamente con individuos culturalmente diversos y he ayudado a muchos hacer cambios positivos en su vida, tengo experiencia tratando diferentes gravedades de depresión, ansiedad, problemas relacionales y traumas. Usando un enfoque ecléctico y basado en fortalezas de la terapia, adapto cada sesión a función de sus necesidades. Proporciono un espacio seguro, atento y servicios de una manera imparcial y diligente, proporcionándole la oportunidad de explorar y expresarse libremente. Póngase en contacto conmigo para una consulta telefónica gratuita. ¡Me daría mucho gusto oír de usted!

name: Sarai Rodriguez
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, AMFT
about: As an aspiring and budding therapist, Sarai has encountered many obstacles. The journey may have been daunting at times, but still Sarai persevered. Countless distractions and unexpected events could have caused permanent derailment. However, Sarai intrinsically knew that her purpose was to help others in distress, in particular children, teens, and families. I strive to create a safe, non-judgmental, and empathetic environment, where support and comfort are provided, to best assist the client in reaching their version of self-actualization. I present skills tailored to meet the client’s needs, in a fun and humorous manner. I empathetically support caregivers in scary moments of life specializing in families and children.

name: Randé Dorn
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MA, MFA
about: You are a thoughtful, BIPOC/Multicultural creative in a relationship crisis. Constant arguments, power struggles, and crossed boundaries, have become the norm. Whether it's your partner, kid, parent, or sibling, you feel on the brink of letting it all go. You want to give it one more chance, but are tired of bending and twisting to fit everyone else's needs. You want a solution, but no longer at the expense of your own power, freedom or joy. I get in the weeds with you. I help you to mourn what is gone and build something better or let go with kindness and dignity. Clients grow to trust, take risks, and embody love once again. I specialize in individuals and couples who are navigating a bi-cultural relationship, kids, and a demanding career. Clients are dedicated individuals who many have come from a difficult childhood, but want to do things differently for their families. They are committed to loving from a place of wholeness, consistency, safety, and warmth. I've devoted 30 years to the study of relationships and creativity. Personally, I've done it all. Marriage, divorce, co-parenting, career pivots, loss and reclaiming my joy. I have been there and can help guide you through the thicket. I happily facilitate clients out of "lost-ness" and into the life, love, and job of their dreams. It's my honor to support.

name: Bridgman Psychological Services
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Thank you for visiting our profile page.  You are searching, not just for someone who can assist you with the issue you are struggling with, but someone you can connect with; someone who can truly understand you.  The best way to find that person is to interview them on the phone.  Credentials are only the starting place for a therapy relationship.  Keep in mind you are choosing somebody with whom you can share pretty much everything about you; perhaps things you've never told any other person.  Make sure you pick somebody you like & trust. Dr. Laird Bridgman has worked in corporate America, consults with executives, and is an Assistant Professor of psychology at The Chicago School of Professional Psychology. Dr Laird Bridgman is a published author in professional journals, plus two step study guides for sexual addiction (Amazon).  Dr. Shari Bridgman is a public speaker and published author.  Her book for miscarriage (In Heavenly Arms) is available at Amazon.  Learn more about us on our website (www.bridgmandocs.com).

name: Kathleen Oravec
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Are you and your partner having trouble communicating without dissolving into conflict that seems to never get resolved? Are you tired of feeling anxious and walking on egeshells?  Do you have difficulty expressing yourself and getting your needs met? Do you often end up in the same relationship rut without being able to find a way out of an unsatisfying cycle of blame and regret? I do more than just listen and say "Uh huh". It is about the ability to help find the answers and chart a new course while figuring out who you are and what you want out of life.

name: Michelle Dabach
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Anxiety can be so hard to live with and sometimes a little help is needed. Couple anxiety with perinatal challenges it could be a whole other ballgame. I have extensively worked with anxiety disorders for many years and have found that individual work focusing on the exploration of personal areas for growth brings about a change that you didn't think was possible. I utilize CBT and Solution Focused Treatment to assist my clients in reaching their goals efficiently. Having similar experiences makes me confident when I meet with a client for the first time to  conceptualize a treatment plan congruent with the client's short term and longer term goals  Having tangible goals enables motivation for change. One of my greatest joys is meeting with a client who feels that there is no solution to what it is they are struggling with and then watching as week after week they see progress and change.
issues: ['Coping Skills', 'Life Coaching', 'Life Transitions', 'Parenting']

name: Ashleigh Virginie Johnston-barton
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Together we will identify and utilize methods to unlock the natural, innate ability and desire to heal. My clinical work is Somatic and Psychodynamic (supporting thorough resolution of body, mind and relational distress). You will learn how to orient, explore and engage what you wish to address. I work with the you as an individual and explore your experiences recognizing that many behaviors are symptoms not character.  Life events addressed but not limited to trauma, anxiety, depression, PTSD. co-occurring disorders, substance use disorders (SUD), bereavement/grief, identity and sexuality, insomnia, perfectionism and life purpose. I am a licensed therapist native to Santa Barbara and a Certified Somatic Experiencing Practitioner & EMDR trained with over 20 years of experience; I have witnessed people recover from unimaginable life experiences. Have you ever had a SUD, DUI, Possession or Domestic Violence charge? Trauma is often the underlying cause of many behaviors & challenges. You will be supported through the recovery process of building awareness & strengthening of self, developing insight, healthier communication & improving connection in order to achieve a higher level of life satisfaction. I offer the knowledge and experience and provide the safety and privacy to assist you to process, gain meaning and improve your life.

name: Stacy Ann C Aquipel
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: Take a breath – go ahead. The process of finding a therapist can feel daunting and overstimulating, much like the world in general. Bear in mind that you don’t have to commit to a particular person right away. What’s most important is that you feel safe, supported, and heard. It might take a bit to find someone with whom you resonate, so I invite you to take the time and space you need. Our society conditions us to feel a sense of urgency, and it’s helpful to remind ourselves that we are more than our productivity, and we are more than our labels. As a person and professional, I celebrate diversity and multiculturalism of all kinds. Although I borrow from many therapeutic orientations, including existential/humanistic, ACT, CBT, narrative therapy, and attachment theory, I prefer to tailor treatment to each individual based on their strengths, lived experiences, values, preferences, needs, and growing edges. I also have specialized training in geriatric and health psychology. In life, we face challenges, uncertainties, heartaches, and transitions, as well as opportunities to grow. It is my honor to bear witness to and assist individuals in taking ownership of their personal stories, find meaning and perspective, discover strength in vulnerability, make new choices, and cultivate curiosity with fresh eyes and an open heart.

about: There is no "one size fits all" therapy approach but my goal as a psychotherapist is to help each unique client strengthen relationships, gain resilience, heal from pain and create hope for their future. I love what I do and if you would like to learn more about therapy with me I encourage you to call or send me an email to determine if we might be a mutually good fit.

name: Chawntay A Mckinzie
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW, EMDR
about: Are you feeling drained, overwhelmed, anxious and depressed? Do you feel stuck after trying so many ways to feel better? I know you are sensitive, care deeply and are working overtime to take care of the ones you love.  Maybe it's old childhood wounds that have never been dealt with, or you haven't really gotten over a more recent event.  Old wounds and unresolved trauma can keep you from feeling good about yourself.  It's exhausting and difficult to continually battle negative thought patterns and old behaviors.   Image how good it would feel to have more confidence, energy and joy.  What would be possible if you removed all the internal barriers that have been blocking your ability to thrive and achieve your dreams?  It takes courage to begin the healing journey. I invite you to take the first step.  Contact me for a free consultation.   I specialize in EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization Reprocessing) Therapy, which goes beyond talk therapy to tap into your brain's ability to heal itself.  I also believe in the power of Nature to heal.  My office is located in a beautiful setting surrounded by nature.  I offer traditional hourly sessions as well as extended sessions and EMDR Intensives.
issues: ['Codependency', 'Divorce', 'Grief', 'Life Transitions', 'Self Esteem', 'Sexual Abuse', 'Spirituality', 'Stress', "Women's Issues"]

name: Jeshurun Joseph
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: My client-centered approach to therapy places my clients at the forefront of their own healing journey as I guide and support each one of them. I believe that individuals are the experts of their lives and that my role is to provide a safe and nurturing space for growth.  My goal is to assist in identifying strengths and inherent characteristics to fuel resiliency in each client.  Clients are coached to understand that decisions made, relationships entered into, and responses to triggers are integral in the healing process by recognizing that trauma in its many forms impacts engagement in repetitive and/or negative behaviors. My areas of expertise include working with diverse populations, such as people of color and marginalized genders and sexualities, to explore the complex intersections of race, gender, sexuality, and mental health. With this emphasis on identity exploration, I support and empower clients in making life-altering changes through insight and self-awareness.  It can often feel as though we are alone as we navigate life’s challenges; with no one to turn to. I welcome the opportunity to walk alongside you in achieving holistic emotional wellness through a culturally sensitive, client-centered, strengths-based, and trauma-focused framework.

name: Brenda Marie LeShay
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
about: Experiencing life’s vast and continuous challenges can sometimes seem overwhelming. It is in times like these when we need a little extra support. I am passionate about providing a safe space that is nonjudgmental and respectful, where I can help guide you on a path of self-reflection, to a place of self-understanding, growth, and healing. My approach is based on developing a strong therapeutic relationship, anchored in empathy and respect. Treatment is tailored to each individual and their unique circumstance. I draw mostly from Humanistic psychology and incorporate other theories such as Attachment Theory and Mindfulness based CBT. I understand it can be daunting to begin therapy. That is why I am dedicated to work collaboratively with you and at your pace. Please connect with me to see if we are a good fit!
issues: ['Alcohol Use', 'Anxiety', 'Behavioral Issues', 'Coping Skills', 'Grief', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress']

name: Lauren Cromer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Difficult conversations are my specialty. I offer a compassionate and accepting space for my clients to explore the stress and struggles that keep them from becoming who they want to be. The adolescents and young adults I work with often come to me feeling stuck and unsure what move to make next. By connecting to your desires, while coping with your fears, you can learn to put yourself first and to live your life for you. You can count on me to shine a light on even the littlest of wins while we explore new ways of navigating the world. I’m passionate about helping children, teens and young adults going through emotional difficulties resulting from life changes, strained relationships, grief, bullying, anxiety, OCD, phobias and trauma. Together, we can discover the best way for you to accept and cope with your emotions in a way that’s uniquely tailored to your experiences and strengths. As a queer bi-racial woman, I find it of the utmost importance to honor my client's experience, and to hold space for the impact each individual's intersectionality has on their lives. I have openings for new clients Tuesdays through Thursdays, as well as, availability to meet in-person on Tuesdays.

name: Danielle Brandys
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I provide evidence-based, compassionate, and supportive therapy treatment to individuals struggling with anxiety, dating, peer relationships, life transitions, and personal/career/school related development. My approaches include a mix of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), attachment-based therapy, coaching, and exposure therapy. I have a vast interest and experience in treating different areas and types of anxiety, assertiveness, panic, self-advocacy, dating, self esteem, and autism spectrum disorder. I have been described as having a ‘direct’ style, playing an active part in the therapeutic relationship. Therapy is a safe space to explore emotions, thoughts, behaviors, and patterns. I will be your ally, coach, and support in both creating and reaching goals together. It takes courage and strength to reach out and begin your therapy journey. Should you decide to take the next step, please contact me for a free 20 minute consultation to see how I can support you, and if we could be a good fit.

name: Lynne Thomson
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Reaching out for help is typically not easy to do. It takes courage and bravery to acknowledge your struggles and step outside of the familiar. My overall approach is based on my respect for your bravery in reaching out for help. I provide a respectful, caring, and warm environment that supports a sense of safety. I believe that a key building block of change and healing in therapy is the relationship between the client and the therapist. Developing and nurturing this relationship can support healing, regardless of the presenting problems or concerns. I work with adults. I have experience working with clients with a variety of struggles that contribute to problems in relationships and functioning across settings (work, personal life, family, friends, acquaintances). These struggles include depression, anxiety, anger, grief, trauma, domestic violence, sexual assault, chemical dependency, and codependency. I choose interventions from different therapeutic models in order to best match your needs and strengths. Some of the therapeutic modalities I use are: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy; Dialectical Behavior Therapy; Motivational Interviewing; Crisis Intervention; Psychoeducation, Solution-focused Therapy, and Interpersonal supportive therapies.

name: Denise Assad
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: I am a bicultural, bilingual Latina with eight years experience working with diverse populations. I am trained in Brainspotting phase 1 and 2. I believe that everyone has a story and courage to be the best version of themselves. I chose to become a licensed clinical social worker to help people learn and cope. I work with adults that have experienced trauma, anxiety, depression, and life issues because I know there is treatment. I treat my patients the same way I treat my family, with dignity and respect. I offer a judgment-free safe space for you to explore and learn. Www.heart2heartwellness.org Soy latina bicultural y bilingüe en español con ocho años de experiencia trabajando con comunidades diversas. Creo que todos tienen una historia y coraje para ser la mejor versión de sí mismos. Elegí convertirme en trabajadora social para ayudar a las personas a aprender y sobrellevar su situación. Trabajo con adultos que han vivido con trauma, ansiedad, depresión y problemas de la vida porque sé que hay tratamiento. Trato a mis pacientes de la misma manera que trato a mi familia, con dignidad y respeto. Te ofrezco un espacio seguro y libre de juicios para que explores y aprendas.

name: John C DeWig
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Intern
about: Hello and welcome! I counsel couples, families, and individuals while creating an environment that is compassionate, empathetic, and supportive. My areas of expertise include trauma, anxiety, depression, relationship issues, and most areas of mental health. Depending on the task at hand I utilize elements of Cognitive Behavioral, Mindfulness/Meditation, Postmodern, and Neurotherapy. At the NeuroField NeuroTherapy clinic, we are in the unique position of being able to synthesize the practices of neuroscience technology with the art of psychotherapy. These strategies & techniques have been adopted by clinicians worldwide because they have proven to be highly effective in maximizing a client’s time, effort, and results. What is NeuroTherapy? Neurotherapy, as it is performed at NeuroField, derives treatment protocols by combining the analysis and interpretation of the brain’s current functioning with the client’s presenting problems. This holistic approach leads to us to being able to deliver the best possible solution to our clients.

name: Connie Padera
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW
about: Are you struggling with substance use or disordered eating habits? Or maybe you need some guidance on self-esteem or relationship issues? It's okay to not be okay, and I'm here to help you through whatever life has brought your way. I believe in treating each these issues from a whole person perspective, and will work with you to enrich all areas of your well-being. Through openhearted and compassionate communication, we will create a safe space for you to mindfully explore your thoughts, feelings, and behaviors, and identify which among them no longer serve you. For many people, the destructive habits that we pick up originally developed as coping tools for trauma that was experienced early in life. Through therapeutic modalities such as Internal Family Systems, and Eye Movement Desensitization & Reprocessing, we can work together to process through these events and help you to move forward in life. Learning to understand & accept your emotions, and their accompanying behaviors, can assist you in handling all life situations from a place of inner peace. It is through this sense of awareness that I will help you to reduce negative emotions, increase the joy in your life, & remove any obstacles that are preventing you from reaching your highest potential.

name: Unity Therapy Services, Inc
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
about: Lori Reynolds is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. She has over 17 years of experience working with at-risk youth and their families within the Foster Care and Juvenile Probation systems. Lori has a passion for helping others and loves to empower her clients to build on the strengths they already possess by using evidenced based practices to enable lasting changes. Lori has experience working with individuals who have experienced many different types of trauma. She believes that educating her client’s on the effects of trauma as well as being present and working collaboratively with them to reach their goals is the ideal way to approach therapy. name: Stephanie Noble-King
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Nature loves repeating patterns, and while many are beautiful, others can be harmful.   Humans often find themselves stuck in unhelpful loops, preventing us from growing into the person we aspire to be and creating the life we desire. I will help you untangle yourself from these loops, providing a healing and supportive environment for you to explore your past, present, and potential future so that you may live with a greater sense of freedom and joy. We will explore the areas in your life causing you harm or distress from place of non-judgment, allowing you to grieve old stories and process the origins of these wounds. I understand the strain of the 'hustle' culture of Silicon Valley, so in order to find your balance, we may get creative - and we may laugh! As desired or indicated, I will incorporate creative modalities such as art, writing, creative problem solving, meditation and dreamwork into our sessions. I want to help you celebrate all that is you, including your creativity or passions you may have set aside. Our stories may shape us; but I believe we hold the tools for crafting our future. Let me help you find and strengthen these tools, help you exit your negative loops, and write a new story for your life.

name: Brett M Watts PhD, MFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, MFT
about: NOT ACCEPTING NEW CLIENTS AT THIS TIME Dr. Watts believes change happens through an ecological relationship between one's self and another. Therapy is a relationship that helps awaken you to yourself. As humans, we are deeply embedded within systems, from internal to cosmological. We are often unaware of how we are impacted by these systems. An effective approach to treatment must be able to bring this complex web of relationships to awareness.  Dr. Watts uses a trauma informed, systemic, integrated perspective, applying Jungian oriented therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, mindfulness/embodiment practices, family systems, an Dr. Watts is highly experienced with children, adolescents, adults, and family therapy. He works well with the LGBTQ population, professional adults, and particularly with other therapists. Dr. Watts is available for dream and depth oriented work. As the only AAMFT approved supervisor in the Central Valley, he is available for consultation and supervision. Please feel free to contact me for a free over the phone consultation. I look forward to speaking with you!

name: Ross Kellogg
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Are you noticing patterns in your feelings or relationships that you want to change? You might be able to pinpoint some past experiences that are influencing life today, or maybe you just know something is “off.”. You’re noticing the same arguments with your partner or the same feelings of anxiety or depression crop up, even though you’ve tried to change them on your own. You feel like you bend over backwards for others at home or work, sometimes at the expense of your own wants and needs. You want to get back to a place of connection and confidence in life and experience the freedom and peace that’s missing right now. I specialize in working with both individuals and couples to reconnect to themselves and one another. Whether you’re experiencing codependency, chronic shame, communication challenges, trauma responses, or something else, my somatic & mindfulness-based approach can support you in healing emotional pain and creating the life you want. Feeling stuck and stressed personally or in your relationship doesn't have to be your reality forever. Please reach out today to schedule an appointment. I look forward to starting this journey with you soon.

name: Hannah Warren
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: Big sigh...what a year.   I believe that, in one way or another, we are all striving to be our best and most authentic selves.   In a time like this, where the highs are high and the lows are low, managing the shifts can be really overwhelming.  Pain gets in the way.   Grief gets in the way.   We hit road blocks that we feel are too big to pass. You have tried changing others.   You have tried avoiding.   You have tried all the self help ideas.  You feel like you have lost control.   And now you are in this spot in your life, where you are asking a lot of questions and wondering if there is something more. I specialize in working with women and children, uncovering their truth and living out of their authentic selves.    I have an integrative healing approach, but most of the time end up using playful family approaches with children and teens and using EMDR with women.    I am also passionate about adoption and creating healing attachments within the family. Remember that you matter, your thoughts matter, and your perspective matters.   So don't stop striving to be your best and most authentic self.

name: Laura L. Filip, LCSW & Associates
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW, Emdr
about: I am a child & family specialist.  I worked 8 years in residential treatment working with severely emotionally disturbed children & their families.  I work with parents to help them handle their child's behavioral issues. I also have extensive experience working with adults suffering from depression, anxiety, stress  & mental health issues.   I am EMDR CERTIFIED by EMDRIA.  I am LGBTQIA2+.  I am a certified grief recovery specialist.  I have experience treating substance abuse issues.  I have extensive experience providing therapy to medical & nursing students due to my experience in medical social work. I tend to practice in a manner that lets the client drive the direction of treatment.  You and I will form a team to figure out what type of work would be the most beneficial for you.  I work from a strengths based perspective. I can accommodate new clients within a 2-3 day period.  I am able to work closely with attorneys and courts if families are going through divorce.  We are excited to announce that our practice has added two wonderful therapists to our team!  They accept MHN Medi-cal and are able to provide superbills for PPO insurance!

name: Clarice Stout
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Hello! I am Clarice Stout, a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. Sometimes the stress & anxieties of life in personal, relational, work, or school issues can become overbearing. My approach to therapy is honest & empathetic while working with individuals. I aim to explore different options that can help all clients with any of their stresses in life. I provide a reflective focus that is caring and understanding to help remove emotional blocks to lead clients to feel unstuck and reach their goals. My goal is to support all clients to move toward enduring growth. I enjoy working with clients at any stage of life and I love helping people find their power within themselves. My aim is for all clients to feel comfortable and supported during their time of healing and growth in therapy. Other areas I can explore and help clients with are: Alcohol Abuse· Anger Management· Behavioral Issues· Family Conflict· Grief/Loss· Education· Internet Addiction· Peer Relationships· Relationship Issues· Sexual Addiction· Sleep or Insomnia· Spirituality· Stress· Trauma and PTSD· Communication· Fears· Sense of Self· Sexuality· Chronic pain.

about: Making changes to ones life can be both uncomfortable and exciting. I am here to help you get through the toughest parts so that you may live a life that you feel good about. I strive to provide a safe and supportive space to help you heal past wounds, overcome difficulties, and cope more effectively with painful emotions. I help build confidence in my client’s ability to bounce back from challenges, alter negative beliefs that no longer serve you and your goals, and live a life that feels more fulfilling both personally and within your relationships.  I use different therapy styles to fit the needs of each person I treat. Please feel open to contacting me for a consultation to discuss what you're hoping to accomplish in therapy. I look forward to working with you and assisting in your personal growth.

name: Sheri L. Tripp
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I specialize in working with clients experiencing difficulties with stress/crisis and adjustment related problems. Have you experienced a crisis, loss, major change, or are feeling burned-out or overwhelmed?  Coping with stress & crisis is shown to have a significant impact on mood, energy, behavior, functioning, focus and overall sense of well-being.  Whether you are seeking therapy for the first time, or returning to therapy, I believe finding a therapist that you feel comfortable with is most important.  I offer a free phone consultation, for you to get to know me, ask questions, & see if you feel I would be a good fit for you. I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, with 15 years' experience working in private & group practice, community, residential, & juvenile justice programs. I specialize in working with those experiencing difficulties with stress/crisis, as well as issues with anxiety, mood/emotional disturbance, self-harm, trauma/abuse, & legal system involvement. I believe in working collaboratively with my clients on issues they would like to focus on. Therapy is strength-based, reflective, supportive,  and nonjudgmental.  My approach is humanistic/client centered, and I also use cognitive behavioral, skill building, mindfulness, motivational interviewing approaches, as well as spiritual/creative practices.

name: Carlos A Alcantara
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: You cannot change what you don't understand. It's the lack of knowledge and understanding that many times leads to subconscious self-sabotage or intentional poor choices. I can help you gain insight that will not only help you understand your circumstances, but transform them. What I do is help redefine who you are so that when you attain that transformation, the changes you seek come naturally. How? By discovering your true identity, showing you who God designed you to be, and teach you how to make that truth louder and stronger than the "truth" of your daily living. I have over 13 years working with children, adolescents, adults, couples, and families. I've worked in adult drug rehabs, school systems, and clinics. I have helped people be free from depression, anxiety, trauma, abuse, addiction, hopelessness, and worthlessness, and can help you be find your purpose and redefine truth. My heart is to help people who seek to change their life, not just behavior. Working with me will be an investment into that still small voice desiring more than the circumstance you are in. You deserve to live your passion because no one else was created like you. No puedes cambiar lo que no entiendes. Es la falta de conocimiento y comprensión lo que muchas veces conduce al auto sabotaje inconsciente o a las decisiones malas que son intencional. Puedo ayudarte a obtener una visión que no solo te ayudará a comprender tus circunstancias, sino a transformarlas. Lo que hago es ayudar a redefinir quién eres para que cuando llegues a esa transformación, los cambios que buscas son naturales. ¿Cómo? Al descubrir tu identidad verdadero, mostrándote a quién te diseñó Dios ser, y enseñarte cómo hacer que esa verdad sea más ruidoso y más fuerte que la "verdad" de tu vida diaria. Tengo más de 13 años trabajando con niños, adolescentes, adultos, parejas y familias. He trabajado en rehabilitaciones de adiccion para adultos, sistemas escolares y clínicas. Ayudé a las personas a liberarse de la depresión, la ansiedad, el trauma, el abuso, la adicción, la desesperanza y la inutilidad, y puedo ayudarlos a encontrar su propósito. Mi corazón es ayudar a las personas que buscan cambiar su vida, no solo el comportamiento. Trabajar conmigo será una inversión en esa voz aún pequeña que desea salir y sobresalir más que las circunstancias en las que te encuentras. Mereces vivir tu pasión porque nadie más fue creado como tú. Invierte en cambiar to vida de aqui en adelante. Dios te Bendiga!

name: Sacha Bollas
title: Psychologist, PsyD, MSc, MA, BA
about: What is it about yourself or your life that seems problematic? It may be that you are subject to anxiety or a depression that is too absorbing, it may be that you lack the sort of confidence in your abilities to find the right way to find direction: or it may be that you feel something is missing in your life, be it an intimate relation with another or the right sort of vocation. I will listen carefully to what you say, and we will map the patterns that form your way of thinking, and of being and relating. This process is vital to self-liberation. Self-defeating patterns can be abandoned and more creative ways of guiding oneself can be generated in this way of work. My background started in the arts, followed by an MSc in Psychoanalytical Studies, I have 13 years experience as a psychologist in settings as varied as hospitals, therapeutic treatment centers, and private practice. Psychotherapy offers access to your "stream of consciousness", a remarkable river of thought, which can be life changing.

name: Darryl's Counseling Services Inc
title: Drug & Alcohol Counselor, CADC II, CATC II, SAP
about: If you or a loved one are struggling with addiction, I know the challenges of this lifestyle. Being caught-up in the vicious cycle of addiction is hard--feelings of fear, failure, guilt, and shame. You may have tried stopping on your own, only to find yourself engaging in the same unhelpful behavior. Breaking this cycle alone is tough! Counseling may be more effective for you than rehab. I specialize in moderation & abstinence based approaches. My passion is helping people who want to overcome addiction and anger issues. I can help you learn and implement ways to cope with urges and the uncomfortable feelings that propel you to use. We will create a plan together based on your values and your definition of recovery. I am a Certified Addictions Counselor and also SAP Certified (Substance Abuse Professional). I have worked in a variety of settings with the focuses on the following; Anger Management, families, individual, dual-diagnosis, substance use, and other areas that include individuals in the criminal justice system.

name: Veronica Thomas
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: What's important to know about me is that I am a highly trained and experienced couples therapist. Most therapists have a course or two before and/or after graduate school. With over 40 years in practice, the last 16 years have been devoted to training and certification in Emotionally Focused Therapy for Couples. and Individuals. While couples therapy usually refers to romantic partners, EFT is effective in repairing hurts and conflicts between family members and friends as well. EFT is an exceptionally well researched and empirically validated treatment for distressed couples. The goals of EFT are to help couples identify the emotions that underly their negative patterns of interaction, learn new ways to communicate about these underlying emotions, learn to create a safe haven between them so that they can rely on each other's understanding to solve problems, become Accessible, Responsive, Engaged with each other. I have training in Attachment-Focused EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing) which speeds up the healing process of loss and other disturbing emotions which are the residue of the incomplete integration of painful experience. AF-EMDR also helps to release the grip of anxiety and depression.I

name: B Jane Wick
title: Psychologist, PhD, EAGALA
about: Feeling "blue",  anxious and too stressed? Relationship difficulties?  As an experienced, trusted therapist, I am here to help.  I can offer you both traditional "inside office" talk therapy and/or a unique "alternative" outdoors therapy- EQUINE ASSISTED PSYCHOTHERAPY.  Because horses are so attuned to their environment, they provide extremely accurate feedback or "mirrors" for our human feelings and relational dynamics. Horses facilitate "mindfulness" and help people to QUICKLY learn more about about themselves leading to substantial change and healing. I offer individual, couples, family, group therapy and/or EAP. VIDEO and TELETHERAPY available. EAP (no riding involved) helps patients understand themselves and heal deeply and profoundly-a more active, visual, outside therapy. EAP is accepted by AMERICAN PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION and has gained great respect as an effective psychotherapy modality. Patients may choose to participate all types of therapy. I have years of clinical experience in individual, couples, group and family psychotherapy. With my years of experience, I offer excellent therapeutic skills and a great deal of clinical wisdom!  All my training has occurred in American Psychological Association approved institutions.

name: Henna Cho
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, ASW
about: Are you feeling alone, unheard, or stuck? Are you experiencing anxiety, fatigue, and excessive worrying that impact your relationships and career? I’m glad you’re taking the time to notice these changes and to invest in yourself to become a better version of yourself. In sessions, I utilize Cognitive Behavioral Therapy to help identify ways to incorporate positive changes for your negative thought patterns. Thus, you will learn to become better equipped in maintaining your personal or professional goals. I am committed to helping my clients decrease anxiety and manage healthy relationships.  My goal as a therapist is to provide actionable guidance in order to help navigate you through difficult emotions due to your interpersonal issues. I pay attention to patterns throughout your life to understand the roof of the current challenges and to incorporate your personal strengths. Therefore, you can bring healing to your body and mind.  Growing up as an Asian American, I am familiar with the challenges encountered being raised by immigrant parents. The stigma correlated to mental health, language barriers, clashing values and beliefs which can cause low self-esteem and loss of identity are a few that impact one’s well being. I can help you find RELIEF. Book your free 20minute consultation.

title: Counselor, MS
about: You’re reading my profile for a reason. You’re tired of doing this alone. You deserve compassionate help.  I blend my passion for mental health and wellness with expertise in communication theory and practice. I am passionate about youth and emerging adults ages 15-25. What makes my approach and perspective unique is the empathy that can only come from lived experience. Also, having worked with people domestically and abroad I am witness to the fact that pain, the desire to heal and the need for connection and to feel understood are universal. One of my strengths is my ability to work well with clients from various backgrounds. My core belief is that people can change for the better if given the right support and tools. I counsel adolescents, adults, and families grappling with depression, anxiety, substance abuse and trauma. I am a strengths-based therapist who will help you mine for internal and external assets that you will use to change your life, with my support. I'm a California native who worked for a decade contracting as a communications specialist for a federal agency. I concurrently attended Georgia State University, located in beautiful downtown Atlanta, GA where I obtained a Master of Science in Professional Counseling. I’m now here to collaborate with you. Let’s chat to determine if I'm the best fit for you.

name: Cynthia Stava
title: LPCC, CSAT-C, EMDR
about: Are you struggling with porn, sex,  or chem/sex addiction, and telling yourself that you can stop whenever you want to?  Would you rather spend time on your device than be with friends, family, and loved ones? Have you tried to stop but become overwhelmed with anxiety or other negative emotions? There is help. Maybe your partner is looking at porn or acting out sexually? Are you constantly checking your partner's internet history, email accounts, and text message history? You might even be feeling crazy! Maybe your partner has said, "it's just porn. Why are you so upset?" or they are trying to shift the blame to you? There is help! The decision to reach out for help isn’t an easy one. But it is the most important one you will make for yourself and your relationships.  Are you tired of suffering and wondering when things will change?  Are you using pornography/sex/substances to cope? Are you ready to start healing and feeling more comfortable in your own skin?  You will be able to set boundaries with your partner, feel confident with your decisions, have decreased anxiety and sleep issues and you’ll begin to feel like there is light at the end of the tunnel.  I use proven techniques to guide you into a better understanding of yourself, increasing your self-confidence, and recreating intimacy with your partner.

Counseling is a journey in which you discover and uncover parts of yourself that might have been lost or covered up for a long time.

name: Caitlin Bergh
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Whether you are working on regulating emotions, improving relationships, making difficult decisions, changing patterns of behavior, and/or accepting yourself right where you are, our sessions will give you the space and perspective you need to determine the most effective next step. I primarily use Mindfulness, Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT) and Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), an evidence-based approach to regulating emotions, tolerating distress, being interpersonally effective and, ultimately, building a life worth living. I work with adults, adolescents, families and couples. Whether you are new to therapy or have been in therapy for years, showing up can be vulnerable. It is important for you to feel comfortable and for us to determine if we are a good fit before we get started. Please reach out to set up a free 15 minute phone call to find out more about me and what I do.

name: Jessa Sherman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: When I work with clients, we spend time understanding in a deep and connected way how you are experiencing your life.  With support and non-judgmental curiosity, we will look below the surface.  We may examine family of origin dynamics, core beliefs you hold about yourself and where you may have learned them, values you have and how your choices do or do not support them, and when and how you limit yourself or get in your own way. In our busy lives, we tend to avoid or not even notice our feelings until they suddenly demand our attention.  I will encourage you to mindfully move into these (sometimes uncomfortable) feelings as, when honored and released, they can be fantastic guides. It is paramount that the relationship between us feels supportive and serves as a container in which you can explore honestly, freely and bravely.   It is my first priority to make therapy a space where you feel seen and understood.  Meeting this priority factors prominently into the work.

name: Renee Burgard
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about:
I offer mindfulness-based psychotherapy, with a warm and non-judging approach, for people who are experiencing anxiety, panic, depression, post-traumatic stress, infertility, seizure disorders (including atypical seizures) and people with pain and other chronic medical conditions. Sessions involve mostly talking therapy, and may also include (depending on your needs and interests): breathing & body sensation awareness practices; emotional regulation & distress tolerance training; simple yoga & meditation; and compassion, acceptance, gratitude, and loving-kindness practices; and interactive guided imagery. Psychotherapy, consultation, and/or classes are available, depending on your preferences and needs. Sessions last 55 - 65 minutes.

Supervision for clinical LCSW and MFT interns, and mentoring for MBSR instructors are also available, on a limited basis. Academic:

Extensive academic training in psychology & neuropsychology, neuroanatomy & neurophysiology, physical & psychological diagnosis; psychological testing training, the psychology of learning; and interdisciplinary studies.

Training & Experience:

Mindfulness-based psychotherapy/cognitive therapy, integrative and behavioral medicine, brain & spinal cord injury/disability rehabilitation; training trainers; and facilitating educational programs, retreats, and workshops.

name: Alex Melkumian
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PsyD, LMFT
about: Welcome! Thank you for visiting my page. I know that choosing a therapist can be a daunting task. Selecting someone who has experience working with your concerns, to whom you can connect is essential. You're looking for someone who gets YOU. You want someone who understands, who can help you overcome your unique struggles and help you transform into the person you have always wanted to be. My goal is to provide a home for you to be authentically who you are, without judgment. By understanding how your past relationships shape your current experience, you can gain awareness and understanding of how your perspective is affecting YOU. Clients describe me as a skillful, caring, and nonjudgmental therapist who is responsive to their needs and dedicated to their improvement. I work actively in the present, helping individuals to see new perspectives and find practical solutions, while exploring the deeper factors and earlier experiences that contribute to their current struggles. I specialize in treatment of financial disorders, helping clients and couples explore the emotional roots of their relationship with money. Finances are a deeply personal issue, with each individual holding a set of values that is incumbent on their upbringing, career trajectory and the culture in which they were raised. FT is where money and emotion meet.

name: Asuka M Garcia
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Hello! I’m Asuka and I am here to help you create the life that you’ve always wanted for yourself. I grew up in an environment where mental health struggles were part of the daily environment, and this allows me to lend a unique compassion and empathy for each of my clients. We will work together to create a safe and healthy environment that allows you to process your emotions and feelings in a way that feels most comfortable for you. If you are looking for a therapist who can help you overcome trauma, anxiety, and depression, reach out to me for a free 15 minutes consultation. As a person of color and first generation Asian immigrant myself, I’m committed to supporting first generation immigrants including international students and working professionals learning how to navigate daily stress, anxiety, and trauma while living away from your home country. My approaches include self-compassion, mindfulness, and Brainspotting. ようこそ！あなたの心がすっと軽くなるお手伝いをさせていただきます。 臨床ソーシャルワーカーのガルシア明日香です。 アメリカ生活でのストレス、パートナーとの文化の違いへの悩み、日々の生活でのうつ病、不安症…ひとりで抱えていませんか？心に悩みや不安を抱えたまま生活していると気づかないうちに色々な生活場面で影響が出てくるものです。私のカウンセリングセッションでは、まずクライアントの方が安心して悩みを相談できる環境を提供し、悩みに寄り添いながらも解決策を一緒に探ることを目指しています。 心の悩みに耳を傾け、苦しみのもとにある原因を探るお手伝いをしながら、あなたに合った心と付き合っていく方法や日々の生活での対処法を一緒に探していきます。 ご興味のある方は一度お問い合わせくださいね。 ようこそ！臨床ソーシャルワーカーのガルシア明日香です。あなたの心がすっと軽くなるお手伝いをさせていただきます。アメリカ生活でのストレス、パートナーとの文化の違いへの悩み、日々の生活でのうつ病、不安症…ひとりで抱えていませんか？心に悩みや不安を抱えたまま生活していると気づかないうちに色々な生活場面で影響が出てくるものです。ましてや母国から遠く離れたアメリカでの生活は、知らないうちに心身共に負担がかかっているものです。私のセッションでは、そういった心の悩みに耳を傾け苦しみのもとにある原因を探るお手伝いをしながら、あなたに合った心と付き合っていく方法や日々の生活での対処法を一緒に探していきます。 カウンセリングセッションに興味のある方はぜひ一度お問い合わせくださいね。

name: Meuy Koll
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: We all go through life transitions and sometimes those changes may be too difficult to cope with leaving us feeling alone and anxious. Whether you’ve been experiencing emotional distress for a long time or currently at a place where you feel stuck, I am here to help you work through that. In our work together, I hope to help you harness your strengths and build a foundation towards a greater sense of well-being.  I have extensive experience working in community mental health providing services for individuals with severe mental illness, homelessness, and substance use. I specialize in depression, anxiety, co-occurring disorders, and coping skills.  I utilize an eclectic approach that includes: cognitive behavioral therapy, dialectical behavior therapy, motivational interviewing, harm reduction, and solution focused therapy.

name: Dianna Stark
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, CAMS, CAMF
about: I am a psychotherapist with 20 years experience. I am licensed to practice in 3 states, CA, NY and NJ. I provide in person therapy in beautiful San Juan Capistrano. Online therapy services are also available for some clients. I hold numerous specialty certifications and I have extensive training in, cognitive behavioral therapy and psychodynamic (insight oriented) psychotherapy. I provide short and long term treatment, depending on a client's needs and wishes.  Some of my specialties include: Anxiety disorders and stress management, physician burnout, eating disorders, substance abuse, anger management, depression, communication issues, relationship/marital issues, special education advocacy and learning disabilities Whether you are in crisis, or just feeling like you need a change in direction, the right therapist can help. The right professional can accompany you on your journey and  help you find your way to your best, most empowered, and powerful self. Please visit my website: www.diannastark.com for more information. I look forward to hearing from you.  Be well...

name: A-Lisa Miles
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: I provide psychological treatment and services to address the difficulties associated with a variety of challenges and transitions. My approach to treatment is tailored to meet the unique needs of each individual client and I aim to create an atmosphere where people feel comfortable discussing and exploring their life. I view therapy as a collaboration and partnership between the client and myself. I provide support and guidance to help you identify areas of your life that need improvement or change and help you to set goals and create an action plan that will allow you to grow, shift, and live the life you want for yourself. I specialize in helping individuals cope with chronic illness and chronic pain and have many years of experience in working with this population and helping them to develop improved coping skills. I use treatment approaches that are supported by scientific research. I also coordinate care with physicians to help clients get the most out of their treatment.   I have a background in health and fitness and use this to help motivate individuals to improve both their psychological and a physical health. I also have experience with yoga, meditation, and mindfulness and incorporate mindfulness into much of my work with clients.
