name: Carol Marie Seigler
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: Have you experienced a traumatic event that you feel holds you back from the life you so desperately want to live? Do unwanted thoughts and memories prevent you from feeling like you can live a normal and happy life? If you are living with traumatic events from your past, ranging from insult, abuse, humiliation, violence, attachment wounds, or even subtle disappointments, therapy could be a safe space to address these injuries. Through a collaborative approach and taking into account the mind & body, I join my clients on a journey of exploration, growth, and healing. I work from a mindfulness-based practice of "being with what is," while teaching clients how to utilize their body as an ally in their healing journey. My specialties include working with trauma (emotional, sexual, physical, neglect, incest, rape, etc.), attachment issues, dissociation, general relationship issues, anxiety and depression. I am a warm, compassionate therapist and strive to create a safe, nonjudgmental caring space for my clients to heal and grow. Healing is always possible in any situation with the right support and guidance. I look forward to speaking with you and answering any of your questions about therapy.
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Depression', 'Domestic Abuse', 'Grief', 'Life Transitions', 'Relationship Issues', 'Self Esteem', 'Stress', "Women's Issues"]

name: Dora Byrne
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I believe that healing, growth, and change are available to all people, regardless of their present circumstances or their past misfortune. I utilize a collaborative approach to therapy to work with clients to understand both their challenges and their goals, and to find viable ways to help each client make changes for the better along the psychological, social, and biological axes of life.  I believe that no one is an island, and that there is no shame in reaching out for help.  I seek to provide an empathetic and intellectually engaged environment to cultivate insights and promote growth. I operate from a trauma-informed perspective: I understand that a history of trauma can severely undermine mental health in many different ways. However, I firmly believe that trauma can be understood, addressed, and overcome.   I understand also that mental health may be severely affected by systemic barriers related to identity in all its intersections. I am here to help, regardless of diagnosis or your particular circumstances.  I take a collaborative approach to therapy, which means I will follow your lead regarding what outcomes you want to pursue.  I know it can be very intimidating to reach out, especially if you are new to therapy, but I encourage you to at least call me for a free phone consultation.

name: Maury T Carlin
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My background includes a B.A. with Honors in Psychology from the University of Michigan and a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology from Stanford University.  I specialize in the treatment  and assessment of children, but my practice extends as well to to the evaluation and psychotherapy of teens. adults,couples and geriatric populations.  I practice in a setting with four psychiatrists (analysts and psychopharmacologists) who provide me with consultation if medical issues regarding medication arise.  My psychological orientation in my practice is basically psychodynamic, relational, and social learning with an emphasis on one or more of those theoretical leanings depending on the presenting issues. I value flexibility.  Background includes a Clinical Assistant Professorship at the Neuropsychiatric Institute at the UCLA Medical Center in Medical Psychology where I have supervised Fellows in Clinical Psychology on their way to obtaining their Ph.D. I have done similar training at the H,E,L,P, Group , Los Angeles, as well as at the Psychology Clinic at Cal Lutheran College.

name: Norma J Moore
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: We all get "stuck" sometimes ~ whether through an unexpected event, an expectation that wasn't met, or the inability to move forward in life.  It could affect one aspect of your life, or many, and manifest as procrastination, overwhelm, the inability to make a decision, moodiness, etc.  However it shows up, it's costly in time, energy, and relationships. It's like a car in mud.  The more you press the gas pedal, the more stuck you get.  Unless you get the right tools, or learn the right techniques, it may stay there for a very long time.  Understanding how you got there and how to do something different is essential in moving forward. I would be honored to help you with that "stuck-ness" in order for you to lead to a more fulfilling, purposeful, happy life.  I work with people who have decided to embrace their strengths and acknowledge their weaknesses in order to increase their confidence in themselves and the world around them.
issues: ['Coping Skills', 'Peer Relationships', 'Relationship Issues', "Women's Issues"]

name: Jessica Byrd-Olmstead
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: Psychotherapy can be helpful addressing coping with loss, chronic stress from work in a demanding industry, or wanting to explore the relationship patterns in your life and how they have led you to where you are now. You may be ready to let go of old habits and patterns that hold you back from living a life filled with purpose and joy.  I work collaboratively with clients to target underlying issues as well as the external behaviors that may be keeping oneself feel stuck.  I work with a wide variety areas including addiction, career concerns, stress, gender identity, and other life transitions. I also offer training and organizational consultation.  Topics often explored in therapy include relationship dynamics, loss, identity changes, coping with shame, past traumas, parenting, habits, addiction, and codependency.

name: Caroline Scippa
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I believe therapy should feel like a deep and rich conversation. I am not the type of therapist who only sits and listens. The stories we tell ourselves about our experiences, both past and present, shape who we are and how we view and interact with the world around us. Therapy is a rare opportunity to tell our stories to a deeply supportive audience. Through the telling, therapy helps us to explore our thoughts and feelings about, and the meaning we ascribe to, our experiences, bringing increased awareness to how we live our lives. From this newfound place of awareness, we’re able create the change we want and need. As a therapist, I employ warmth, validation, compassion, empathy, and humor. I nurture my clients’ strengths and support their inherent knowing and resilience. I have studied multiple healing modalities, spiritual practices, and therapy treatment approaches, and bring this experience and knowledge to my sessions, which are integrative in nature. I tailor my therapeutic approach to a client’s need, preference, and comfort level. Your therapy, just like your story, will be unique to you.
issues: ['Codependency', 'Coping Skills', 'Depression', 'Family Conflict', 'Grief', 'Marital and Premarital', 'Parenting', 'Self Esteem', 'Spirituality', 'Stress', "Women's Issues"]

name: Veronica Waters
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Do you feel like past wounds are preventing you from moving forward? Perhaps you have a difficult time understanding why you continue to repeat unhealthy behaviors or feel ashamed for not living up to your own or others' expectations.  You probably feel a mixture of emotions: motivated to change, but afraid of feeling uncomfortable and vulnerable. Maybe you doubt your ability to change or question if talking about painful issues can actually help you feel better.  Having these thoughts and feelings is a normal part of the growth process. My goal is to provide a safe, nurturing environment for my clients to work through challenges and gain skills to enhance their lives. I have over fifteen years of experience working with the following: self-defeating behavior, unhealthy relationship patterns, addiction, difficulty with setting boundaries, body image issues, trauma and grief. There is HOPE for you to feel authentic and fulfilled in your life. You can heal from the past and grow into the person you want to be.  I am committed to supporting the therapeutic needs of Black, Indigenous, & Persons of Color (BIPOC) as well as Marginalized Genders (MaGes). Whoever you are, and whatever you’re struggling with, you are welcome here.

name: Robert Scott
title: Psychologist, PhD, CTS
about: Dr. Scott is a licensed psychologist in private practice as well as a Certified Trauma Specialist (CTS). A nationally recognized teacher, trainer, and consultant in the field of trauma/disaster psychology, Dr. Scott has lectured throughout the United States as well as the Middle East (Kuwait), Europe and British Columbia. Dr. Scott utilizes a Cognitive Behavioral Therapy approach and applies innovative treatment methods such as EMDR and Trauma-focused therapy. Dr. Scott enjoys the challenges of working with couples and families and finds it rewarding to help heal the wounds caused by miscommunication and dysfunctional behavior patterns. Dr. Scott is the retired director of the Behavioral Health Program for the LA Fire Department (1989-2015). Dr. Scott has also served in the academic field as a Professor of Psychology as well an Assistant Dean at LAVC. Dr. Scott continues to stay connected to the fire service.

name: Andy Truong
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Seeking therapy takes courage and strength. Are you experiencing feeling stuck due to childhood trauma? I am here to provide you with unconditional support to process through your anxiety, depression, and other unresolved feelings at your pace. Sometimes we may need someone who is there for us and there are no problems in life that are too big or small. You have taken the first step to seek help, I can help you discover your inner strength to bounce back and deep inside you may be wishing for peace and equilibrium. As a therapist, I aim to help you reach those goals together to bring about inner peace. The resources we need are embedded within us and sometimes we need help by "talking it out" to be reminded on how to access these inner-tools.  I specialize in client-centered practices and solution-focused approaches. I have worked with individuals, families, and veterans on trauma-related issues such as anxiety, depression, and life transitions. I am sensitive to issues with family and relationships. Let's practice self-worth, develop a positive self-image, and build self-esteem. I would be honored to work with you in this capacity as you learn to love yourself. I am accepting new clients so please reach out to connect! Please book your free consultation!

name: Steve Garman
title: Psychologist, PsyD
about: I have been practicing psychotherapy and counseling for more than twenty years. I am a licensed clinical psychologist and certified Jungian Analyst. My experience includes working with individuals, couples, and families who might be struggling with emotional and relationship difficulties, including depression, anxiety, panic attacks, and parent-child conflicts. I am available to conduct online/video sessions. I work in collaboration with my clients to arrive at an approach that is best suited for their situation. Some people find more benefit from individual therapy, while others are more likely to benefit from a couple's or family therapy approach. As a certified Jungian Analyst, my practice is specially oriented for those who want to work in a depth-psychological orientation in which dreams, symbols, and other expressions of the unconscious are explored for their meaning and dynamic value.

name: Theresa 'terry' Goldstein
title: Associate Professional Clinical Counselor, MA, APCC
about: Do you struggling with anxiety, depression, or life transitions? Let's tackle it together! Perhaps you might fear asking for help or letting others know how you feel in fear of being judged or misunderstood. I am passionate about supporting and building trust with clients as it translates to outside of therapy and helps foster positive long lasting relationships. I use an arts-based approaches to help clients gain a deeper understanding of themselves and also provide evidence-based practices, such as Exposure and Response Prevention. Clients have said that I am warm, compassionate, soft-spoken, willing to get messy and creative in session. Therapy is about creating a safe nonjudgmental space and relationship where you can truly access and explore your feelings with the help of a professional. Feel free to reach out to see if we are a good match.

name: Ellen Radha Katz
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Because I've been blessed with life-changing mentors in my life, I can pass the sum of their wisdom on to you, along with my own. Therapy is a healing process that happens  through our shared connection and your expanding awareness. It requires a safe place, where truth is expressed and pain is transformed. Typically we meet suffering with distractions, intoxication or denial. When we find a way to experience emotional sobriety, our relationships with ourselves and others can heal.  Loss, trauma, emotional intoxication and shame are common issues that breed secondary problems. We’ll approach them with skill, compassion and courage. I use a hybrid of approaches that include integrative body-mind-energy ideologies and methods.  I am trained in Internal Family Systems, Holographic Memory Resolution, Eriksonian Hypnotherapy, Somatic Experience, Reiki, Ayurveda and Yoga, Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction, Buddhist Psychology, Meditation and traditional psychotherapeutic approaches. I specialize in the nuances of communication.  Gently uncovering how we may  unconsciously contribute to sabotaging or damaging relationships, we can build  respectful, clear and mindful connections - with ourselves and others. Mindfulness and  self-regulation (self-soothing) are keys to healing mood swings, agitation, anxiety, trauma and relationships.

name: Leila Zwelling
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW, PMH-C
about: Specializing in women's mental health across the lifespan, with a focus on the reproductive years, relationships, and trauma. Focus areas include infertility & loss; single women childless not by choice; LGBT family building; pregnancy & postpartum. I also work with clients who are experiencing depression, anxiety and healing from trauma. While I specialize in women's mental health, I welcome clients who identify throughout the gender identity spectrum. My more than 20+ years of experience includes: Director of Women's Mental Health Program at SFVA Medical Center; National Trainer for VA Interpersonal Psychotherapy Training Program; UCSF Associate Clinical Professor; Certified Perinatal Mental Health Provider (PMH-C) with Postpartum Support International; teaching psychotherapy to UCSF psychiatry residents. You don't have to do this alone. If you want to feel better, I’d love to help you get there. Contact me to schedule your free 15 minute phone consultation. For more information, please visit www.leilazwelling.com

title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, LMFT, LCSW
about: Our practice offers a unique and diverse range of providers with a full scope of expertise, experience and perspective to provide a truly tailored approach to the clients individual needs. At A Place To Turn, we focus on healing the Whole Self, which generates an overall state of wellness. We know life is complex and everyone has a unique story, and incorporate the Whole Self; mentally, emotionally, physically and spiritually. Our diverse range of providers offer a unique set of tools suited for each individual, relationship and families' needs. We work in a proactive way encouraging personal growth, positive change and paving the way toward taking action.

name: Maira Horta
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about: Welcome, Bem Vindo, Bienvenido! Thanks for stopping by my page.  I'm a native Brazilian and can offer sessions in English, Portuguese, or Spanish. I live and work in University Heights but have been enjoying life in beautiful San Diego since 1996. If we work together, I am thrilled to share my culturally sensitive and unique therapeutic approach with you. I will be an active participant in our sessions. And yes, that means, together, we will likely laugh, cry, discuss relationships, worries, fears, and/or self sabotaging but all in an effort to help you move forward into the person you know that you know you can be. I enjoy working with adults and teens; specializing in anxiety, panic attacks, and cultural id. I have experience helping navigate work, family, and intimate (including LGBT) relationships. We can work on adjusting to unexpected life-changes, PTSD, depression, and/or grief. My background includes EMDR, EFT for couples, CBT, and 4 years as a career coach. If this sounds like the right partnership for you. Please contact me via the information on this page. I look forward to to talking with you and helping achieve your goals.

name: Souraya Matar
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: A few years ago I read a joke: "Fish don't know they're in the water". The scenario is that Fish Number One asks Fish Number Two, "How's the water?" Fish Number Two responds, "What the hell is water?". The fish who is "in" the situation (hence the water) does not even realize its surrounding. Second what surrounds you is only normal because it's what you know. I got another one that I recently came across: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are."  This references to dream analysis but it basically mean that our preconceptions can dramatically alter the way we perceive the world. (Quote is by writer Anais Nin). I am interested in indvidual's best hopes for themselves. I also care about diversity and cultural factors embodied in living your best life. We tend to ignore cultural factors and let negativity invade our interactions. I have a special interest in working with people from different backgrounds, including nationalities, age groups, and/or ethnicity. I offer evidence-based treatment for mental health issues and real-world problems that one may experience. I also require of myself to be very client-oriented as an eclectic psychotherapist, I use the best professional judgment when it comes to helping my clients heal, grow, cope, and/or understand themselves better.

name: Francisco de la Serna
title: Marriage & Family Therapist
about: Francisco graduated from California State University, Fullerton with a Masters in Science degree in Counseling and he has been practicing psychotherapy since 2013. Francisco is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and a diplomate member of the Academy of Cognitive Therapy. Francisco works to develop a collaborative relationship with his clients and relies on person-centered, cognitive-behavioral, and mindfulness-based strategies to work with issues such as anxiety, depression, relationships, and adjustment to life changes. Francisco is a proficient Spanish speaker and has experience working with clients in both English and Spanish.

name: Kathy J Gilbert
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about:
Over the last 30+ years I have worked with individuals and couples, children, adolescents, adults, and the geriatric population.  My life experience as both a partner and parent enable me to work with people with an array of problems, challenges and cultural diversity. 

With motivation, commitment, and hard work, most people are able to  improve their mood and  gain greater satisfaction in their relationships and their lives. After my initial assessment, I collaborate with my clients to develop a treatment plan that addresses their unique goals. I am certified as an EMDR therapist with advanced training. In many cases EMDR dramatically decreases the time needed to help people reach their goals.I also have an interest in working with families whose loved ones are suffering from dementia.  I also have facilitated a bi-monthly Memory Matters (previously Memory Cafe) group for the last 3 1/2 years. There are always fresh flowers in my Mission Valley Office.  It is easily reached by freeway and bus, and parking is free.

My hours are Monday-Thursday. I am available for appointments as early as 8:00 AM and have late afternoon appointments available. My fee is $130-50 minute session.

name: Lauren Ogren
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: *evening/after school is currently full*Life is relentless and overwhelming, as a parent, teen and as a partner.  You may feel that you are at a breaking point, constantly reacting rather than responding, and your own inner critic will not let up. Maybe you are a new mom, a teen, or you are sick and tired of your relational patterns leaving you drained and feeling un-seen and needs are left unmet. You are looking for guidance and tools that can help you navigate life, and make each day a bucket filler rather than a drain. I can help you find the tools to manage the overwhelming emotions in the moment and to prevent the burnout. I can help rewire your inner critic to help put your best self forward and truly show-up for your family, work, and for YOURSELF! I specialize in teens, peri-partum support and relational codependency - you can have the healthy connections you crave! It is time to make a change and engage fully in your life. Be the person you want to be and start by making a free 20-minute consult with me at my website: LaurenOgrenTherapy.com

name: Hana Esfandiari
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, MA, LMFT, CSAT-C
about: "Life is not what it's supposed to be. It's what it is. The way you cope with it is what makes the difference." I am a Licensed Marriage and Family therapist specializing in relationship and intimacy issues, sex therapy, infidelity, betrayal trauma and sex and porn addiction . I work collaboratively with my clients to facilitate recognition of their strengths so they can actualize self-growth, meet therapy goals, find peace and develop healthy relationships. Among my favorite interventions are Cognitive Behavioral Therapy to modify destructive thoughts; Solution Focused Therapy to maximize what already works in your life and Acceptance therapy and mindfulness to relieve anxiety and stress. For many of my clients commitment to 12 step recovery has proven to be a wonderful conjunctive tool. My clients value my empathic approach in therapy. Sex/porn addiction and sexually acting out are often fueled by secrets and isolation. Our work together provides a safe space to unload and express concerns without being judged or shamed. My clients feel supported, hopeful and motivated as I strongly believe in their inner strengths.

name: David Brown
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA MFT, AMFT
about: Life can feel uncertain and mixed emotions can make it difficult to know what to do. As your therapist, I want you to leave feeling heard, understood, accepted, and empowered. Sessions are centered around you and your experiences. Using a narrative approach, we work together to create a life narrative that highlights your strengths, history, and how you have worked to thrive.  My role is to support you and walk alongside you through this time in life. I specialize in working with teens, couples,  and adults of all ages. My clients come to me looking to work through anxiety, depression, trauma, and life transitions. Using Narrative therapy, I use language to increase the power and sense of growth throughout your narrative. Therapy for me is more than just what happens in sessions. My joy is watching my clients learn how they can flourish. I would enjoy the opportunity of getting to work together and creating a relationship centered around you learning to be your best self. Come write your story!

name: Linda Marie Snell
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MSW, LCSW, CATCIV
about: Stuck, overwhelmed, isolated?  Struggling to see your value?  Feeling weighed down by feelings of blame, guilt, and shame?  Have an intense need to please everyone?  Substance use, anxiety, trauma, parenting issues, depression, emotional challenges, and/or interpersonal conflict can all lead to personal suffering and interfere with your ability to engage in daily life.  Allow me to provide you with a safe space to begin your journey of developing strength, trust, worth, wisdom, and freedom.   I will work collaboratively with you.  My goal is to help you transform your life into a life that is meaningful to you.   I am a Licensed Clinical Social Worker & Certified Drug and Alcohol Counselor.  My clinical approach is client centered.  My treatment methods are determined by the individual's presenting issues/needs, assessment data, and are evidenced-based practices. I have an interactive style, creating a comfortable space for free expression and acceptance. Finding the right therapist is important. I welcome the opportunity to consult with you by phone, at no charge, about your specific situation.   "Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it."  Helen Keller

name: Telehealth with Sheila O'Connor PhD, LMFT
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, PhD, (c), LMFT
about: Telephone Therapy and Counseling only. For over 20 years, I've been doing Telephone Counseling. $65. fee per hour. For any adult California resident. The number one reason success is attained in counseling & therapy is when you and your therapist/ counselor have good rapport and trust. A "good fit" is very important where you feel comfortable sharing your innermost feelings and thoughts without feeling judged. Would you like HIGH-QUALITY & EXPERIENCED COUNSELING and/or psychotherapy at a reasonable cost? What I want from you is a commitment to do the work the best that you can to allow changes to happen in your life.  It is helpful to talk about your worries about the COVID-19 Corona Virus and how it is affecting you and your loved ones. Together, we explore ways to manage your life despite losses or other difficulties you may be facing.  I bring empathy, honesty, encouragement and humor into the process while you are learning positive coping tools. We will work as a team. You want homework?  I will give you tools to hasten the process, if you wish.

name: Sarah Wright
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MA, LCSW
about: We all have been a child once and know the impact those small (and big) experiences have on the person we grow into, which is a lot of pressure and stress for parents. I love to work with children and families to support with decreasing this stress and increasing positive loving moments between you and your child. Children and parents both need love, boundaries, and to feel confident and competent, but how can that happen in the busy and chaotic world we live in? I want to help you and your child feel these things and get each of your needs met as well as heal from traumas and ruptured attachments. Join me in starting your healing. Experienced in working with couples, children and families, teens and young adults, as well as new mothers. I often treat those with childhood traumas, anxiety, postpartum, relationship conflict, parenting stress, co-parenting issues, and depression. Skilled in parenting consulting and coaching. I believe in connection being the biggest indicator of success. I understand that often the world feels unsafe as a child, parent, and adult and I am here to acknowledge that and support you in creating safety. I became a therapist due to the passion I have to connect and support others in their healing process, just as I had as a child and young adult. Reach out to discover if we are a therapeutic fit for your needs.

about: I am taking new adult patients and have openings this week for evening and weekend telehealth appointments. I am a firm believer that my clients are the experts in themselves,  and I can use my knowledge to collaboratively help them see the strengths they already have. name: Danielle Seybold
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Life can be hard, whether dealing with unexpected setbacks, longstanding problems, or just working hard to build a life of purpose and meaning. Some clients are dealing with stress, grief, and loss. Some clients are stressed by balancing a life that could best be described as “All Good Things, Just Too Many.” I believe our work is about more than treating dis-ease. It is about living fully, with ease, vitality, and wellness. Sometimes this starts with learning to deal with hard thoughts and feelings that can get in the way.  It always involves getting clear about who you want to be and what matters most. T.E.A.M-CBT and ACT are powerful training programs to clarify your goals, build your internal motivation and learn skills to help you think and act more intentionally. Mindfulness-based skills support clients in finding greater contentment, ease, and connection in life. IFS is a useful tool to navigate areas of internal conflict and develop self-kindness. If you would like to feel more at ease, more satisfied in your relationships, energized by your work, or more inspired in your life in general, I'd love to talk to you about how I can support you in this journey. Schedule a free consultation at: danielle-seybold.clientsecure.me

name: Nirmala Gratton
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: As you think, so you become ...Our busy minds are forever jumping to conclusions, manufacturing and interpreting signs that aren't there. (Arrian). My approach is one that helps you to calm your busy mind and create space to reconsider and recreate yourself.  Our thoughts and feelings can both help and hinder us in presenting our best and authentic self. Are yours serving you? You are not anxiety, depression, and substance abuse. You are not your past trauma and your current confusion. I would like to work with you on creating the life that brings you happiness, peace and joy. Unlike other licensed marriage and family therapists, I am a former registered mental health nurse in England, UK . I have extensive experience in mental health, substance abuse, relational and cultural issues. I am certified in EMDR, for  trauma and adverse life events. Additionally, I am a certified Grief Counselor and trained in CBT, and DBT. I am warm and approachable and wholeheartedly believe in the power of the therapeutic relationship. I encourage open communication and feedback to ensure that your unique needs are met with the highest degree of professionalism. I would like to teach you skills to regulate your emotions so that your actions serve to effectively express your truth.

name: Alexa Levine - Mood Health
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, MS
about: Alexa believes that mental health care is a vital piece of one's overall health. Specializing in depression, anxiety, postpartum depression, and postpartum anxiety, she’s seen firsthand the dramatic positive impact therapy can have on someone's life and the power of telling one’s story. “This motivates me to work with clients and assist them using empathy, compassion and support.” For anyone who’s considering starting therapy, Alexa wants you to know that she’s excited for you to take this step and invest in yourself and improve your well being. Being human is hard. Finding help shouldn’t be. Mood is a team of top mental health professionals who are devoted to helping you escape the funk. We believe in simple, personal, high-quality mental health care for everyone, from anywhere. Effective care. No nonsense. Mood’s clinicians offer accessible and affordable mental health support without the pitfalls of other providers. Reach out to me and Mood via our website (www.moodhealth.com) to learn more and schedule an appointment.

name: Thomas Blake
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, AMFT
about: Thomas Blake (he/him/his) is a registered associate marriage and family therapist working with adolescents and adults of all ages.  Thomas is trained in EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization Reprocessing) and somatic based therapy which he integrates into his process as a psychotherapist practicing through a Humanistic-Existential lens.  In addition to his work in private practice, Thomas received his clinical training from The LGBTQ Center in Orange County, California and worked at The Trevor Project, a national suicide prevention service supporting LGBTQ+ youth ages 13 to 24 years old. You matter and your mental health is the most valuable thing you can and should prioritize in life.  In my practice you can expect an empathetic and understanding approach to the work we will do together to unlock your potential and help achieve true happiness through mindfulness and intention.  When you're ready, please reach out to set up a free consult!

I would like to provide a safe non-judgmental space where people feel comfortable discussing what they would like to work on. name: Lizzet Monroy
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I strive to help individuals achieve their life goals and address personal life challenges, at their own pace. I am passionate about helping clients become their true authentic selves by healing from past traumas and current life challenges, so they can enjoy their life to the fullest.  I believe therapy can be a powerful tool in developing deeper self-awareness and truly value the power of creating a trusting therapeutic relationship in order for the client to feel free to explore deeper aspects of themselves, discover their strengths, and create meaningful lives. I enjoy practicing mind-body techniques such as mindfulness meditations, biodynamic breath work and further increasing my knowledge in self-healing practices. My therapeutic specialties include EMDR, Mindfulness, Narrative, mind-body awareness techniques, and have experience utilizing CBT, DBT among others. I've worked with client's experiencing depression, anxiety, PTSD and Trauma (childhood, complex, one time event etc) and other types of mental health conditions. I am a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and received my Masters in Clinical Psychology from Antioch University. I have 5 years of experience working with individual, couples, and families.

name: Jacqueline K Stewart
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: I help individuals and couples get through difficult life transitions.  I also help adults recover from traumatic experiences, primarily through the use of EMDR therapy.  Trauma can trigger overwhelming stress, anxiety, grief, fear, confusion, depression, irritation, nightmares, and other sleep problems.  Intrusive thoughts of traumatic experiences (including flashbacks) can greatly interfere with a person's ability to function in relationships, at home, and at work. I help people get over these lingering effects of trauma to resume or renew a sense of their own life's purpose and direction. EMDR is an effective form of therapy for treating trauma, including Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, and the dissociative spectrum.  EMDR is approved by the Department of Defense and Veterans Administration.  EMDR can also be used to assist people in managing chronic pain, as well as for treatment of psychological suffering. I am a TriCare Provider.  I am a Certified EMDR Therapist and an Approved Consultant in EMDR Therapy.  I am also a Christian counselor.  My office is conveniently located near the I-15 freeway in Temecula.  Please see my website for more detailed information, affiliations, and links.

name: Ari Daphne Vinion
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MFTA, PCCA
about: I want to support my clients in feeling whole. This can mean learning how to safely unmask your Autism or ADHD, healing traumas old & new, setting healthy boundaries, strengthening communication with partners, learning new ways to approach challenges without shame, or bringing compassion to chronically ill bodyminds. I specialize in working with neurodivergant people and couples. My young clients enjoy my playful interventions that help them feel confident and proud of being uniquely themselves. My adult clients are relived to tackle challenges without shame and ableism. As a nurodivergant, disabled, queer, and chronically ill person myself, I work from a stance of lived as well as professional experience. I know how hard it can be to find a therapist who is interested in the full experience of living in your bodymind as opposed to trying to diagnose and fit you into interventions that 'should' work. Finding a therapist who is a good match is hard! Please don't hesitate to reach out for a free consult where we can discuss what you are looking for, if I'm the right person for you and/or your loved one, fees (therapy should be affordable not a luxury!), and any other questions :)

name: John Paul Gray
title: Psychologist, PhD
about: My mission, in this profession, is to assist people in living more satisfying, authentic lives as individuals and in their relationships.  The objective of therapy is to aid people in coming to terms with the issues that are inhibiting their growth, whether those be external influences or self-sabotaging.  The goal, in individual therapy, is self-acceptance, more personal power, and simply, a more positive, happy life with a diminishment of anxiety and an increase in self-definition.  Couples' Therapy tends to be focused, short-term, and goal-oriented. Dr. Gray has a long-standing reputation within Orange County.  He is a Past-President and prior Ethics Chairman for the local psychological association.  In addition to previous Lecturer positions at Pepperdine and Chapman Universities, Dr. Gray has extensive experience in training psychologists.  He holds national memberships in the APA and the National Register. The result of Dr. Gray's 35 years of experience with psychotherapy, psychological testing, and teaching is a direct and incisive approach to short-term consultations as well as growthful long-term therapy.

I am committed to supporting underserved and vulnerable communities including foster youth, neurodiverse and LGBTQ+ individuals.

name: Lourdes Vargas-Bogardus
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: Perhaps you are going through a life transition and need support sorting things out. Maybe you are feeling anxious or depressed and this is bogging you down. Are you having difficulty visualizing a better life for yourself? Is your sense of self worth suffering? Maybe you are experiencing strained relationships with family or friends; or you may have a nagging feeling that major changes are needed. Let's talk; you don't have to go through this alone.  My approach is experiential, rooted in mindfulness and incorporates your personal history involving your important relationships and the current choices you make. I utilize the Emotional Focused Therapy (EFT) approach to Couples' Therapy. I am bilingual (Spanish) and bicultural.  You deserve a therapist who gets you and who is committed to helping you. I listen to your story intuitively. In doing so, together we can arrive at new understandings that will benefit you. I enjoy assisting people to explore themselves and break through personal believes that keep them from living life fully.

name: Sharon Vaughn
title: MPH, RN, Coach
about: I love helping people realize how good they really are rather than staying stuck in their low self-esteem. To be blunt, I’m a smart, deeply experienced, super kind, caregiving Coach. What I really love to do is help women and men solve their anxieties and recover their joy. My goal is to help you uncover your true potential and lead a life that is worth celebrating. If you're looking for extra support and help through a challenging situation or you are just ready to move in a new direction in your life, I look forward to working with you to achieve your goals. l have coached over 500 couples as they became a family with their newborn child. I watched with pride and awe as all the goals, practice, efforts and team work of the parents and myself resulted in a positive birth experience. These experiences have enabled me to understand your needs. Together we can reach your personal goals. For the past 19 years I have coached Cabrillo nursing students during their classroom and clinical challenges throughout their four semester program to become RNs. I have had the fortunate experience to coach over 600 nursing students on their journey to becoming RNs. These experiences have enabled me to understand your needs and help you set goals.

name: Tisha Rene Aronsen
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT, CDVF, NCIP
about: ******Please EMAIL at tishaaronsen@tishaaronsenlmft.com******** or reply on here.                                                                             Do you wonder if you are alone with the problems you are experiencing? I can tell you that you are not alone and that many come to see me wondering the same thing. No, you are not weird, unusual or "crazy". I am here to help you with whatever struggle you may be experiencing. I remember beginning therapy myself and being uneasy about telling my "secrets" to a stranger. I began to look forward to therapy and was able to use those sessions to improve my life. YOU CAN TOO! I am currently using Telehealth OR in person for sessions. Most say leaving a therapy session they feel lighter and can breathe again. My goal would be to encourage deep reflection of yourself and your purpose and how together we can achieve both of those. Let's have fun, offer humor, self disclosure as well as brutal honesty.   I would love for you to reach out so we can move you towards your best life. Today is the day. NOTHING CHANGES IF NOTHING CHANGES. I also have five Therapists in my practice who are available for Telehealth as well as my caseload can often be full.

name: David Mendelmar
title: Pre-Licensed Professional
about: My approach to therapy is based on compassion for every part of yourself and your experience. If you have ever felt judged, ashamed, frustrated, or afraid of aspects of yourself you wish were different– impulsive or addictive behaviors, anger, low-self esteem, mood swings, anxiety and panic, depression– I am here to offer you an alternate experience. No matter how severe your pain or how extreme your behaviors seem to you or others, I will lend you my confidence in your capacity to grow and change for the better. I am committed to helping clients find the unique inner strength and wisdom that each of us holds inside. I am an Internal Family Systems therapist with Level 3-training from the Internal Family Systems Institute. I am passionate about this powerful modality, and it would be an honor for me to facilitate your journey of healing with IFS.

name: Donna Goodman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MFT
about:
I have practiced psychotherapy for thirty years.  As clients share their life struggles, I offer support, respect, and practical information on coping strategies.  Together, we explore such issues as patterns of attachment and relating, internal self talk, cognitive structures, unresolved traumas and one's personal life narrative. 

I individualize my approach and use a variety of modalities to help clients develop strengths and achieve their life goals.  

When working with couples, I facilitate development of healthy communication techniques, conflict resolution skills, and awareness of defenses. I promote attunement to emotional needs so couples can experience intimacy and growth. As a play therapist, I offer children an opportunity to gain mastery of their dilemmas through the manipulation of art materials, toys and sand tray figurines. Children emerge feeling empowered.  I am able to evaluate a child's perspective from their play theme.  Concurrently, I conference with parents and offer guidance. I offer adolescents a safe place to voice their stuggles and concerns.  Often, their issues are about identity, self-esteem, individuation, sexual identity, relationships, divorce, belonging and peer pressure. 

I utilize art therapy, EMDR, hypnosis, gestalt therapy, sand tray, transactional analysis, imago, object relations and systematic training in effective parenting techniques
issues: ['ADHD', 'Anxiety', 'Depression', 'Divorce', 'Play Therapy']

street: 20212 Redwood Rd #104 (in The Back Of Green Bldg)

While she doesn't claim to know every particular circumstance, she has a reputation for respecting, honoring, and supporting people from a wide variety of life experiences. Joy has the ability to not just understand but FEEL your struggle without judgment.   Joy works from her heart and mind – utilizing both her heartfelt experience as a mother and her educational and professional knowledge gleaned from over 15 years of study and practice in this field. She gets it!  We PLAY. We HEAL. We GROW. Together.

name: Dana Schlick
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT
about: I want to reflect your wholeness right now, even with patterns and feelings of stuckness and pain- the resolutions and answers are held within you. I am passionate about being a helper to guide you to connect with this wisdom within.                                         Through supporting the wisdom of your body-mind-spirit, it is possible to move beyond "managing" painful symptoms and stuck patterns that often emerge from past overwhelming life experiences and trauma, to true healing, authentic vitality and engagement with life.  Healing is possible. I believe talking is often not enough to deeply shift and support the change and healing that is longing to happen within.                    I offer a safe space using a wholistic body-centered healing modality as the guide towards freedom.  I specialize in trauma resolution, honoring and transforming grief, and cultivating intimacy & authentic connection. With compassionate support and skillful guidance it is possible to tap into your wholeness, and vital energy to heal, grow and live into the unique being and gift that you are to this world.                                                                                                If this possiblity of inner freedom rings true, we could be a match.

name: Rita Baer
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: Finding a therapist you connect with is extremely important. I have worked extensively with individuals, couples, and, families, to improve, or repair, their relationships and their lives. I specialize in relationship issues, traumas (including victims of crimes), separation, divorce, and mid-life changes. I believe everyone has the ability within, to enhance their lives, their relationships, and to stop the pain that has become unbearable by depression,  anxiety, grief, and/or loss. Please call for a free consultation to see if I may be the therapist you feel comfortable with. We all suffer losses, from the time we are born, some, very severe and damaging. We also bring with us the pains, traumas, and dysfunctions, from our childhood, and past relationships. Learning how those influence our choices today is extremely important in improving our currant relationships and our life today. I believe that relief from pain, and healing, are possible once individuals, couples, and/or, families, become aware of how and why, their relationships became so dysfunctional and chaotic. As they acquire constructive tools to help enhance healthier patterns, relationships improve, and all around functioning becomes calmer and happier.

name: Kierra Gordon- Smith
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, AMFT
about: My greatest reward as a therapist is helping others on their journey of becoming their best self, help heal unhealed wounds, & validate other's experiences with undeniable acceptance & warmth.  As a therapist, I am passionate about helping you gain more insight into your problems or past, & learn the necessary skills to overcome & achieve more peace in life. I consider it a privilege to walk alongside you at your pace & support you in navigating your way through life & toward a greater since of healing & wellness. I specialize in working with individuals who struggle with depression, anxiety, stress management, family conflicts, coping with life changes, career difficulties, relationship issues, self-esteem and confidence, body image, or trauma. My approach to therapy is client-centered, non-judgmental, relational & honors mind, body & spirit connection. If you choose to work with me, I want you to understand that our sessions are all about you, & creating space to express yourself, cry, laugh, feel supported & understood, & explore your concerns or past hurts with more compassion, so that you can heal. I want to help you find balance in your life . Want to learn more? Please reach out to me today. I'm here.

name: Lori B Bloustein
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: It has been said that all sickness is home-sickness. Your one true life is calling and therapy is a pathway home.  Having a trusted companion on the journey is invaluable in the unfolding. A good therapist is a sounding board, a guide, a coach, a compassionate ear and an excellent compass. Someone who not only creates a safe space for exploration but joins you in the weeds, helps comb through the confusions, and acts, at the same time, as a referee, an archivist and a witness. A good therapist stands out of the way when the work is moving along & gently encourages when the work is stuck or sidelined. Every 21st century human hits speed bumps. We're all works in progress and most of us can use some assistance sorting virtual shrapnel from that which is authentic and true and nourishing. We are all miners for a heart of gold and that heart is yours. Give yourself the gift of homecoming. Bring your traumas and joys, your sexual conundrums and relationship challenges; bring your depressions and resentments, your goals and creative longings. I have many trainings but I'm mostly an authority on being human. I am a photographer, musician, and writer with special interests including mindfulness, addictions, body image, emotional literacy.
issues: ['Relationship Issues', 'Trauma and PTSD']

name: David H. Bowman
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, LMFT
about: I came to be a therapist late in life. After successful careers in publishing, education, the arts, and the law, I returned to graduate school to study clinical psychology, wanting to do for others what my own therapist had done for me. He helped me to put myself back together when I had fallen apart. I decided then I wanted to help people self-actualize, to become the best version of themselves they could be. Watching and actively helping a client blossom has turned out to be the most rewarding work I have ever done. Like many of you, I have experienced depression, anxiety, substance abuse, issues of aging and illness, problem relationships, career confusion, sexual ambivalence, questions of identity and meaning, and a form of creeping, low-level PTSD that results from growing up feeling very different from everyone else. My years of life-experience, study of psychology and mental health, and thousands of hours of psychotherapy, counseling, and coaching clients of all kinds has taught me a very humanistic and compassionate form of therapy, and one I hope you will find both nurturing and empowering.

name: Holly Dellaganna
title: Marriage & Family Therapist Associate, MA, LMFT
about: I view therapy as collaborative and am humbled to be a part of your healing process. I believe in meeting my clients where they are, supporting them to identify and create their own therapuetic goals and together, develop an effective plan to support them. I also believe that out of vulnerability comes healing and strive to create a safe, trusting and compassionate space for you to do this courageous work. My experience is in treating anxiety and depression, healing from trauma, navigating relationships and building resiliency to life's ups and downs. Additionally, I am passionately working towards a specialty in perinatal mental health. I utilize Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Mindfulness and view my work through a trauma informed, individual lens. I admire anyone striving to be a better version of themselves. We all have unique experiences and I'm here to be your gentle mirror, to help you navigate and process your experiences, gain an understanding of how they manifest for you, and to support you in developing skills that promote healing and self growth.

name: Jessica Guillen
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist
about: Do you struggle to understand or name your feelings, needs, and desires? Do you find it difficult to communicate freely and feel disconnected, unheard, or unsafe? Perhaps anxiety or past trauma is burdening you from living a full life. It is my mission to create a safe space for my clients to heal and grow, affirm what works for them, and encourage personal freedom. As a licensed Clinical Social Worker, I am committed to helping individuals, couples, and families build and maintain healthier relationships, as well as supporting and encouraging growth and confidence. My therapeutic approach draws from cognitive behavioral therapy, gender-affirming therapy, and I have worked in community mental health for over 8 years. I have specialized training in trauma practice, particularly around experiences of abuse, violence, and intergenerational trauma. I see adults, couples, and families in our practice. Identifying as a Queer Latina Woman and being a First Generation American of immigrant parents, I deeply understand the importance of finding a therapist who recognizes the intersectionality of the diverse populations of Los Angeles. I'm passionate about assisting my clients to find their inner strength through client-led sessions and cultural exploration.

name: Josh Kirsch
title: Clinical Social Work/Therapist, LCSW
about: Being up in the middle of the night is lonely and grueling. You know sleep is important so you make it a big priority, and still can’t make it happen. It is affecting your work, and others can see the fatigue. You have tried supplements, meds, and Head Space and still struggle. I have extensive experience and training in CBT for Insomnia and will be able to help you to overcome your problem and be able to improve your sleep. CBT for Insomnia works because it is customized to your particular pattern and needs. It is considered the gold standard for insomnia treatment. I have been practicing in the field for over 20 years, and together we will be able to get your sleep back on track Please E-Mail me below and let me know some good times to chat.
issues: ['Anxiety', 'Sleep or Insomnia', 'Stress']

name: Kate T Donohue
title: Psychologist, PhD, REAT
about: In my forty years years in private practice as a licensed psychologist and registered expressive arts therapist, I offer therapy sessions, which weaves together expressive Arts Therapy and Jungian Psychology to individuals, adolescents and couples.This approach allows each client to understand their internal world, trauma, and obsolete styles that hinder their growth and happiness as it opens up new possibilities, resources and creativity to address life issues.As a result of this approach, clients also define what is meaningful to maintain their healing and growth. . With this foundation, my clients and I work to create an environment of safety and freedom, where all fears, emotions and desires are allowed, a place of support and deep trust. My work is helpful with many issues.  It is particularly effective for treating sexual abuse, food and body issues, identity, anxiety, depression, and post traumatic stress syndrome.

name: Stephanie Domek
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT
about: I meet with parents who are struggling with a variety of challenges including transitioning into parenthood, co-parenting, managing a child's challenging behavioral or emotional issues, balancing caregiving responsibilities with other aspects of life, foster/adoption, or relating to and caring for a child with special needs. I help to develop strength and confidence for the challenges of parenthood by partnering with the caregiver at any stage of parenthood. I help improve the quality of relationships between parents and their children. Experiencing traumas can often bring about problems including anxiety, post-traumatic stress, anger, and depression. I help to empower people to find the courage to address the impact of these experiences on their view of self, relationships, and general functioning. I provide a safe space for people to disclose their experiences and begin to heal. I meet with individuals who are struggling for a variety of reasons. I partner with people to help move beyond stories that no longer serve them. Together we can create a plan to add more happiness and peace in your life.

name: Alice Elizabeth Kevork
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA
about: Is life too much to handle and it's triggering anger? Sometimes it feels that way...  Would you like to reach the goals you once set? Are you ready to know more about yourself and do thing and solve problems like you once did but somehow it feels overwhelming now? Are you ready to thrive? You are in the right place. Call the number above for a free phone consultation.  I offer premarital counseling which prepares you to the marriage and helps you grow and thrive in that marriage. I also work with couples who are facing difficulties with communication and other relational issues. I am a certified anger management specialist who understands anger and the underlying issues. I help parents to thrive rather then survive. I understand how challenging parenting could be at times and I am here to listen and provide support and guidance. Parents of adult children are also welcomed to build and rebuild their relationship. Are you angry at life, at someone or at yourself? I understand, because anger is a normal emotion that needs tending to and I am here to hear it from you.

name: Carey Cloyd
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MA, MFT
about: There are a lot of possible ways you could have arrived at this moment. You may be hoping to live a life that is more integrated and true to your values. You may have had some previous therapy experiences that didn’t quite suit you and your concerns. You may have or wish for a spiritual practice like meditation to help you become more grounded and centered in your life, and you hope to find a healing path that incorporates these aspects of yourself. As a therapist, I help navigate and guide you toward your goals so that, in time, you are able to navigate and guide yourself.  Working together collaboratively, we explore ways to heal your body, heart, and mind. These investigations can include current issues as well as core, long-standing concerns in your life. As we take a look at your limiting patterns, we can discover new ways of being that invite more spaciousness and options into your life and your experience.  It takes courage to reach out for help. You are welcome to reach out in whatever way is most comfortable for you. Feel free to email or call me to set up a complimentary 20 minute initial consultation.

name: Lindsey Stewart
title: Marriage & Family Therapist, MS, LMFT, LPCC
about: I work with clients who have experienced trauma, loss or attachment issues. I use interventions that work with the mind & body so clients can learn to feel safer & more in control of how they respond to the world around them & interact in relationships. These interventions help people soothe difficult emotions, feel more comfortable in their bodies & reclaim their lives. My goal is to help you reduce negative symptoms & have the healthiest, happiest life possible. Whether you want to do a deep dive into your past or need some solutions for right now. I love helping clients heal pain & learn new strategies to thrive body mind & soul. I am EMDR certified & licensed as both a LMFT and LPCC. I have extensive experience in many different EMDR protocols so clients who did not respond to EMDR in the past may find relief with some of the protocols I offer, and I can provide EMDR online. I have completed coursework as a Certified Mental Health Integrative Medicine Provider.  I work with: depression, trauma (PTSD), CPTSD, anxiety, healing after narcissistic abuse, chronic pain/illness, birth trauma, crime survivors, high conflict divorce, domestic violence, betrayal trauma, life transitions, child loss & grief. Email me today so we can begin your healing journey.
